zh: 戈登在去世前不久被确认为罗马天主教徒时,继承了莱奥波德的额外的基督教名字。

en: Gordon was brought up and remained a lifelong Roman Catholic , at a time when the Church was being persecuted in Scotland , which had become Calvinist .
zh: 戈登在苏格兰被迫害的那个时候一直是一个终身天主教徒,当时苏格兰已经成为加尔文教徒。

en: After an education at the parish schools of Cruden and Ellon , at age of fifteen he entered the Jesuit college at Braunsberg , East Prussia , then part of Poland ; however , his character did not tolerate well the strict and sombre way of life at the school , and he soon decided to return home .
zh: 在他15岁时,他进入东普鲁士布劳恩斯堡的耶稣会学院,后来成为波兰的一部分。

en: He changed his mind , however , before re-embarking on the journey back to Scotland , and after journeying on foot in several parts of what is today Germany , in 1655 he enlisted at Hamburg into the military service of Sweden .
zh: 他改变了主意,然而,在返回苏格兰的旅程上重新登船之前,并在今天德国的一些地区步行旅行后,在1655年他在汉堡加入瑞典的军事服务。

en: In the course of the next five years he served alternately for Poland and Sweden and was taken prisoner by both .
zh: 在接下来的五年里,他先后为波兰和瑞典服务,并被这两个国家俘虏。

en: At the Battle of Chudnov in 1660 , Gordon was wounded .
zh: 在1660年的楚德诺夫战役中,戈登受伤。

en: Upon hearing of the Stuart restoration , Gordon left the Polish service , but found himself unable to obtain military employment in Scotland or England .
zh: 在得知苏格兰的恢复后,戈登离开了波兰军队,但发现自己无法在苏格兰或英格兰获得军职。

en: In 1661 , after further experiences as a soldier of fortune , he joined the Russian army under Tsar Aleksei I , and in 1665 was sent on a special mission to England .
zh: 在1661年,他作为一名幸运兵的进一步经历后,加入了亚历山大一世领导的俄罗斯军队,并在1665年被派往英国的特派团。

en: After his return he distinguished himself in several wars against the Turks and Tatars in southern Russia .
zh: 在返回后,他在南俄罗斯的几个战争中对土耳其人和塔塔尔人进行了突出的贡献。

en: Gordon disliked the Russian service , complaining of the corruption and venality of Russian officials , which left him , in his own words , " almost at wit s end with vexation " .
zh: 戈登不喜欢俄罗斯的官员,他抱怨俄罗斯官员的腐败和残忍,这使他,他自己的话说, “ 几乎满怀厌恶 ” 。

en: However , in recognition of his service he was promoted to major - general in 1678 , was appointed to the high command at Kiev in 1679 , and in 1683 was made lieutenant - general .
zh: 1678年他被提升为少将,1679年被任命为基辅高级指挥官,1683年被任命为少将。

en: He was not the only Scottish soldier in the Tsar 's service ; his fellow - Scots Paul Menzies and Alexander Livingston also found themselves in Russia fleeing religious intolerance or seeking adventure .
zh: 他不是唯一苏格兰士兵在沙皇的服役;他的同僚苏格兰人保罗·门齐斯和亚历山大·利文斯顿也在俄罗斯逃离宗教不容忍或寻求冒险。

en: Gordon visited England and Scotland in 1686 .
zh: 1686年,戈登访问了英格兰和苏格兰。

en: In 1687 and 1689 he took part in expeditions against the Tatars in the Crimea , being made a full general .
zh: 1687年和1689年,他参加了反对克里米亚的塔塔尔的远征,成为一名全军将军。

en: Later in 1689 a revolution broke out in Moscow , and with the troops under his command Gordon virtually decided events in favour of Peter the Great ,  and against the Regent , Tsarevna Sophia Alekseyevna .
zh: 后来在1689年,莫斯科爆发了一场革命,戈登指挥的军队几乎决定了对彼得大帝的行动,以及对 regent 的行动, Tsarevna Sophia Alekseyevna。

en: Consequently , he was for the remainder of his life in high favour with the Tsar , who confided to him the command of his capital during his absence from Russia .
zh: 因此,他一生的剩余时间都与沙皇高度赞同,沙皇在他离开俄罗斯期间把首都的指挥权交给他。

en: One of Gordon 's greatest achievements was securing permission from the Tsars to establish the first Roman Catholic church and school in Muscovy , of which he remained the main benefactor , and headed the Catholic community in Russia until his death .
zh: 戈登最大的成就之一是从沙皇那里获得批准在莫斯科建立第一个罗马天主教教堂和学校,其中他仍然是主要的捐助者,并领导了俄罗斯的天主教社区直到他去世。

en: For his services his second son James , brigadier of the Russian army , was created Count of the Holy Roman Empire in 1701 .
zh: 他的第二个儿子詹姆斯,俄军旅长,于1701年成为圣罗马帝国伯爵。

en: The Tsar employed him in organizing his army according to the West European system ; and raised him to the rank of full general .
zh: 沙皇雇佣他根据西欧制度组织他的军队,并把他提升到全军。

en: At the end of his life the Tsar , who had visited Gordon frequently during his illness , was with him when he died , and with his own hands closed his eyes .
zh: 在他生命的末期,沙皇曾经常访问戈登在他生病期间,在他去世时同他在一起,并用自己的手闭上眼睛。

en: Originally buried in the Foreign Quarter , his remains were reinterred at Azov in 1877 , with an inscription in German which mistakenly gives his rank as Oberst , Colonel .
zh: 他的遗骸最初被埋葬在外围区,1877年被重新埋葬在阿佐夫,上面有德国文的标记,错误地记载他为上校,上校。

en: General Gordon left behind him a uniquely detailed diary of his life and times , written in English .
zh: 戈登将军留下了他一生和时代独特的详细的日记,写成英文。

en: This is preserved in manuscript in the Russian State Military Archive in Moscow .
zh: 它被保存在莫斯科的俄罗斯国家军事档案中。

en: An incomplete and faulty German translation , edited by Dr Moritz Posselt  was published , the first volume at Moscow in 1849 , the second at St Petersburg in 1851 , and the third at St Petersburg in 1853 ; and Passages from the Diary of General Patrick Gordon of Auchleuchries  , was printed , under the editorship of Joseph Robertson , for the Spalding Club , at Aberdeen , Scotland , 1859 .
zh: 一个不完整的和错误的德语翻译,由莫里茨·波斯塞尔特博士编辑出版,第一卷在1849年莫斯科,第二卷在1851年圣彼得堡,第三卷在1853年圣彼得堡;和从奥奇鲁切里亚的帕特里克·戈登将军的日记的行踪,由约瑟夫·罗伯逊的编辑下,为斯普林俱乐部,在苏格兰阿伯丁,1859年出版。

en: A new full scholarly edition of Gordon 's Diary in English was published by the Centre for Irish and Scottish Studies in Aberdeen  , as well as its translation into Russian .
zh: 戈登的英语日记由阿伯丁的爱尔兰和苏格兰研究中心出版,并将其翻译成俄语。

en: His daughter was married firstly to the German - Russian Colonel Rudolf Strasburgh , and then from 1699 or 1700 to his kinsman in the Russian service Alexander Gordon of Auchintoul , author of " The History of Peter the Great , Emperor of Russia " .
zh: 他的女儿首先与德国 - 俄国上校鲁道夫·斯特拉斯堡结婚,然后从1699年或 1700年到他的亲属在俄国服役亚历山大·戈登·奥奇丁托尔,“俄罗斯皇帝彼得大帝历史”的作者。

en: She lived until 1739 .
zh: 直到1739年才去世。

en: She received the UK 's most prestigious architectural award , the Stirling Prize , in 2010 and 2011 .
zh: 她在2010年和2011年获得英国最 prestigious 的建筑奖——斯特林奖。

en: In 2012 , she was made a Dame by Elizabeth II for services to architecture , and in 2015 she became the first and only woman to be awarded the Royal Gold Medal from the Royal Institute of British Architects .
zh: 2012年,她被伊丽莎白二世为建筑服务的 Dame, 2015年,她成为英国皇家建筑师协会颁发的皇家金奖的第一位和唯一的女性。

en: She was described by The Guardian of London as the ' Queen of the curve ' , who " liberated architectural geometry , giving it a whole new expressive identity . "
zh: 她被《伦敦卫报》描述为“曲线的女王”,她“解放了建筑几何,赋予了它一种全新的表现性特征”。

en: Her major works include the aquatic centre for the London 2012 Olympics , Michigan State University 's Broad Art Museum in the US , and the Guangzhou Opera House in China .
zh: 她的主要作品包括2012年伦敦奥运会的水族中心、美国密歇根州立大学的广阔艺术博物馆和中国广州歌剧院。

en: Some of her designs have been presented posthumously , including the statuette for the 2017 Brit Awards , and many of her buildings are still under construction , including the Al Wakrah Stadium in Qatar , a venue for the 2022 FIFA World Cup .
zh: 她的一些设计已经在去世后展出,包括2017年英国奖的雕像,许多她的建筑仍在建设中,包括卡塔尔的Al Wakrah体育场,是2022年国际足联世界杯的场地。

en: Her father Mohammed Hadid Muhammad al - Hajj Husayn Hadid was a wealthy industrialist from Mosul .
zh: 她的父亲穆罕默德·哈迪德 穆罕默德·哈吉·侯赛因·哈迪德是来自摩苏尔的富有的工业家.

en: He co-founded the left - liberal al - Ahali group in 1932 , a significant political organisation in the 1930s and 1940s .
zh: 他于1932年共同创立了左翼自由党阿哈利集团, 是1930年代和1940年代的重要政治组织.

en: He served as minister of finance after the overthrow of the monarch after the 1958 Iraqi coup d'état for the government of General Abd al - Karim Qasim .
zh: 他在1958年伊拉克政变后推翻君主后为阿卜杜勒·卡里姆·卡西姆将军的政府担任财政部长。

en: Her mother Wajiha al - Sabunji was an artist from Mosul .
zh: 她的母亲Wajiha al - Sabunji是来自摩苏尔的艺术家.

en: In the 1960s Hadid attended boarding schools in England and Switzerland .
zh: 在1960年代,哈迪德进入英国和瑞士的寄宿学校。

en: Hadid studied mathematics at the American University of Beirut before moving , in 1972 , to London to study at the Architectural Association School of Architecture .
zh: 哈迪德在贝鲁特美国大学学习数学,然后于1972年搬到伦敦学习建筑协会建筑学院。

en: There she studied with Rem Koolhaas , Elia Zenghelis and Bernard Tschumi .
zh: 在那里,她与雷姆·库尔哈斯 、 埃利亚·泽格利斯和伯纳德·舒米一起学习.

en: Her former professor , Koolhaas , described her at graduation as " a planet in her own orbit . "
zh: 她的前教授库尔哈斯在毕业时将她描述为“ 一个在自己的轨道上的行星 ”.

en: Zenghelis described her as the most outstanding pupil he ever taught .
zh: 泽格利斯形容她是他所教过的最出色的学生。

en: " We called her the inventor of the 89 degrees .
zh: 我们称她为89度的发明家。

en: Nothing was ever at 90 degrees .
zh: 任何东西都没有达到90度。

en: She had spectacular vision .
zh: 她的眼睛很壮观。

en: All the buildings were exploding into tiny little pieces . "
zh: 所有的建筑都爆炸成碎片。

en: He recalled that she was less interested in details , such as staircases .
zh: 他回忆说,她不太感兴趣于细节,比如楼梯。

en: " The way she drew a staircase you would smash your head against the ceiling , and the space was reducing and reducing , and you would end up in the upper corner of the ceiling .
zh: 她画了一个楼梯的方式,你将把你的头撞到天花板上,空间不断缩小,你将最终落到天花板的上角。

en: She could n’t care about tiny details .
zh: 她一点也不关心细微的细节。

en: Her mind was on the broader pictures —
zh: 她脑子里是那些更宽阔的图片 —

en: when it came to the joinery she knew we could fix that later .
zh: 说到合金厂,她知道我们以后可以解决。

en: Her fourth - year student project was a painting of a hotel in the form of a bridge , inspired by the works of the Russian suprematist artist Kazimir Malevich
zh: 她的四年级学生项目是一幅以一座桥的形式绘制的旅馆的画,灵感来自俄罗斯极权主义艺术家卡齐米尔·马列维奇的作品

en: Ichiyō Higuchi  was a pen name of Japanese author Natsu Higuchi  , also known as Natsuko Higuchi  .
zh: 希古奇一世(Ichiyō Higuchi)是日本作家希古奇納津(Natsu Higuchi)的筆名,也稱為希古奇納津子(Natsuko Higuchi)。

en: She wrote relatively little as a result of living a brief life — she died at 24 — but her stories had a large impact on Japanese literature and she is still appreciated by the Japanese public today .
zh: 她的短命中写的书很少 — — 她24岁去世 — — 但她的故事对日本文学产生了巨大的影响,至今仍受到日本公众的赞赏。

en: She , her mother , and younger sister made ends meet by doing needlework , washing , and other jobs .
zh: 她,她的母亲和妹妹通过做针织工、洗衣服和其他工作来谋生。

en: In 1892 , after seeing the success of a classmate , Kaho Tanabe , who wrote a novel , Higuchi decided to become a novelist to support her family .
zh: 在1892年,看到一位同学,写小说的Kaho Tanabe的成功后,Higuchi决定成为一名小说家,以支持她的家庭。

en: Nevertheless , her initial efforts at writing fiction were in the form of a short story , a form to which she would remain true .
zh: 尽管如此,她最初的创作小说的努力都是以短篇小说的形式进行的,这种形式她仍然是真实的。

en: In 1891 she met her future advisor who would help , she assumed , this poet - turned - fiction - writer and connect her with editors : Tosui Nakarai .
zh: 1891年,她遇到了她未来的顾问,他将帮助她,她假定,这位诗人转为小说作家,并与编辑:中瑞敏。

en: She fell in love with him right away , not knowing that , at 31 , he had a reputation as a womanizer .
zh: 她立刻爱上了他,不知道在31岁时,他是个女权主义者。

en: Nor did she realize that he wrote popular literature which aimed to please the general public and in no way wished to be associated with serious literature .
zh: 她也没有意识到他写的是旨在使大众满意的大众文学,并绝不希望与严肃文学联系起来的。

en: Her mentor did not return her passionate , if discreet , love for him , and instead treated her as a younger sister .
zh: 她的导师没有回报她热情的,如果谨慎的,对他的爱,而是把她当作一个年轻的妹妹。

en: This failed relationship would become a recurrent theme in Higuchi 's fiction .
zh: 这一失败的关系将成为日吉小说中经常出现的主题。

en: Eventually , she got the break she was so eager for :
zh: 最后,她得到了她非常渴望的休息:

en: her first stories were published in a minor newspaper under her pen name , Ichiyo Higuchi .
zh: 她的第一篇小说在小报上以她的笔名《红口一世》出版。

en: The stories from this first period  suffered from the excessive influence of Heian poetry .
zh: 这一时期的故事受到平安诗歌的过度影响。

en: Higuchi felt compelled to demonstrate her classical literary training .
zh: 希古奇感到被迫展示她的古典文学训练。

en: The plots were thin , there was little development of character and they were loaded down by excessive sentiment , especially when compared to what she was writing concurrently in her diary .
zh: 情节薄薄,性格发展较差,情绪过多,特别是与她在日记中同时写的相比,这些情节都显得十分乏味。

en: But she was developing rapidly .
zh: 但是她发展得很快。

en: Several of her trademark themes appear ; for example , the triangular relationship among a lonely , beautiful , young woman who has lost her parents , a handsome man who has abandoned her  , and a lonely and desperate ragamuffin who falls in love with her .
zh: 她的一些商标主题出现;例如,一个孤独、美丽、失去父母的年轻女人,一个抛弃了她的帅哥,一个孤独、绝望的拉格穆芬,爱上了她之间的三角关系。

en: Another theme Higuchi repeated was the ambition and cruelty of the Meiji middle class .
zh: 另一主题是明治中产阶级的野心和残酷。

en: The story " Umoregi "  signaled Higuchi 's arrival as a professional writer .
zh: 小说“ 乌莫里吉 ” 标志着秀吉成为一名专业作家的来临.

en: It was published in the prestigious journal Miyako no Hana in 1892 , only nine months after she had started writing in earnest .
zh: 它于1892年在她开始认真写作的九个月后,在名誉的《宮子之花》杂志上发表。

en: Her work was noticed and she was recognized as a promising new author .
zh: 她的作品被注意到,并被认为是一个有前途的新作家。

en: In 1893 , Higuchi , her mother and her sister abandoned their middle class house and , with a grim determination to survive , moved to a poor neighborhood where they opened a stationery store that before long failed .
zh: 1893年,她母亲和妹妹希古奇放弃了他们的中产阶级家庭,带着悲惨的决心生存,搬到一个贫穷的社区,在那里他们开了一家文具店,不久就破产了。

en: Their new dwelling was a five - minute walk from Tokyo 's ill - famed red - light district , the Yoshiwara .
zh: 他们的新住处离东京臭名昭著的红灯区约什瓦拉步行五分钟.

en: Her experience living in this neighborhood would provide material for several of her later stories , especially " Takekurabe " ,
zh: 她的住在这个社区的经验将为她后来的一些故事提供材料,特别是“竹倉部 ”,

en: The stories of her mature period  were not only marked by her experience living near the red - light district and greater concern over the plight of women , but also by the influence of Ihara Saikaku , a 17th - century writer , whose stories she had recently discovered .
zh: 她的成熟时期的故事不仅由她生活在红灯区附近的经历和对妇女的困境的更大关注,而且也由17世纪的作家伊哈拉·西卡库的影响,她的小说她最近发现。

en: His distinctiveness lay in great part in his acceptance of low - life characters as worthwhile literary subjects .
zh: 他的独特之处在于他把低品位人物当作有价值的文学主题。

en: What Higuchi added was a special awareness of suffering and sensitivity .
zh: 希古奇补充说,他特别意识到痛苦和敏感性。

en: To this period belong " Ōtsugomori "  , " Nigorie "  , " Wakare - Michi "  , " Jūsan'ya "  and " Takekurabe "  .
zh: 该时期包括“ 大树 ” 、 “ 尼戈里 ” 、 “ 若家 - 米奇 ” 、 “ 若安屋 ” 和 “ 竹倉贝 ” 。

en: The last two are considered her best work .
zh: 最后两个被认为是她最好的作品。

en: With these last stories her fame spread throughout the Tokyo literary establishment .
zh: 这些最后的故事使她的名声遍及东京的文学界。

en: In her humble home she was visited by other writers , students of poetry , admirers , the curious , critics , and editors requesting her collaboration .
zh: 在她谦虚的家里,她被其他作家、诗人、崇拜者、好奇者、评论家和编辑们拜访,要求她的合作。

en: But between constant interruptions and frequent headaches , Higuchi stopped writing .
zh: 但是,在不断打断和频繁的头痛之间,希古奇停止写作。

en: As her father and one of her brothers had before her , she had caught tuberculosis .
zh: 像她的父亲和一个哥哥以前一样,她得了结核病。

en: She died on November 23 , 1896 , at the age of twenty - four .
zh: 她于1896年11月23日24岁去世.

en: Higuchi 's likeness adorns the Japanese 5000 yen banknote as of fall 2004 , becoming the third woman to appear on a Japanese banknote , after Empress Jingū in 1881 and Murasaki Shikibu in 2000 .
zh: 自2004年秋天起,希古奇的肖像装饰了日本5000日元钞票,成为日本钞票上出现的第三位女性,继1881年金剛皇后和2000年村崎式武之后。

en: While primarily used as an infielder , he has started in and played at every position for the Red Sox , except for pitcher and catcher .
zh: 尽管他主要被当作外野手,但他一直在红袜的每一个位置上打球,除了投手和捕手。

en: He first played in MLB for the Pittsburgh Pirates in 2012 , but has played for the Red Sox every season since .
zh: 他在2012年首次为匹兹堡海盗效力于MLB,但自那时起一直为红袜队效力。

en: Holt graduated in 2006 from Stephenville High School in Texas .
zh: 霍尔特于2006年从德克萨斯州斯蒂芬维尔高中毕业。

en: In 2003 , his freshman year , he made the District 8 - 4A All - District baseball team despite batting just .227 , and shared the league 's Newcomer of the Year award .
zh: 在2003年, 他的新生年, 尽管打得只有.227球, 他还是入选了地区8-4A全区棒球队,并分享了联盟年度新秀奖.

en: In 2005 , Holt was named defensive player of the year in District 6 - 4A ,  and he earned all - district honors in 2006 , his senior year .
zh: 2005年, 霍尔特在第6-4A区被评为年度防守球员, 2006年他获得全区荣誉.

en: Holt attended Navarro College in 2007 and 2008 .
zh: 霍尔特在2007年和2008年就读于纳瓦罗学院。

en: After transferring to Rice University in 2009 , he posted a .348 batting average with 12 home runs and 43 RBIs in 59 games for the Rice Owls .
zh: 在2009年轉會到萊斯大學後,他在59場比賽中平均打得0.348次,共打12場主場和43場RBI。

en: He also led the Owls with 67 runs scored and shared the team lead with 11 stolen bases .
zh: 他也以67次入球率领牛队,并以11次盗球率领球队。

en: In the same season , he was named both to the All - NCAA Regional Team and the All - Silver Glove Trophy Series team .
zh: 同年, 他被任命为全美NBA地区队和全美银手套奖杯系列队.

en: Holt was drafted by the Pittsburgh Pirates with the club 's ninth round selection in the 2009 Major League Baseball Draft , one pick before his Rice teammate Ryan Berry .
zh: 霍尔特在2009年大联盟棒球大选中被匹兹堡海盗队选出第九轮选秀。

en: Holt began his professional career with the Pittsburgh Pirates ' short season , Class - A affiliate , the State College Spikes , before advancing to the High - A Bradenton Marauders in 2010 .
zh: 霍尔特开始他的职业生涯是在匹兹堡海盗短赛季 、 甲级联队 、 州立学院 Spikes 上, 然后在2010年晋级到布拉登顿马拉德斯.

en: His 2010 season was cut short due to injury to his medial collateral ligament , which required surgery .
zh: 他的2010年赛季由于他的中侧韧带受伤而缩短,因此需要手术。

en: He began the 2011 season with the Pirates ' Double - A affiliate , the Altoona Curve .
zh: 他开始了2011年赛季的海盗 双 A 联盟, 阿尔托纳曲线.

en: On July 13 , 2011 , Holt was named the MVP of the Eastern League All - Star Game after hitting a two - run homer in the ninth inning .
zh: 2011年7月13日, 霍尔特在第9局中打进两场入球后被评为东亚联盟全明星赛的VP.

en: He was promoted to the Pittsburgh Pirates from the minors as the major league rosters expanded on September 1 .
zh: 9月1日,他从小队升级到匹兹堡海盗队(Pittsburgh Pirates)。

en: Holt made his Major League debut on September 1 , 2012 .
zh: 霍尔特于2012年9月1日首次亮相。

en: At the time of his promotion , he had hit a .322 average in 102 games with Altoona and .432 in 24 games for Indianapolis .
zh: 在他升任时,他与阿尔托纳队在102场比赛中平均得分0.322,而印第安纳波利斯队在24场比赛中平均得分0.432。

en: On December 26 , 2012 he was traded to the Boston Red Sox  for Jerry Sands , Stolmy Pimentel , Mark Melancon , and Iván DeJesús , Jr. .
zh: 2012年12月26日,他被交易到波士顿红袜以换取杰里·桑德斯、斯托米·皮门特尔、马克·梅兰康和伊凡·德杰苏斯。

en: He debuted for Boston after getting called up on July 6 in Anaheim .
zh: 他在7月6日在阿纳海姆被调到波士顿后首次出场。

en: Holt received his first championship ring when the Red Sox won the World Series over the St. Louis Cardinals in six games , despite not playing in the postseason .
zh: 霍尔特第一次获得冠军戒指是在红袜队在六场比赛中击败圣路易斯卡尔迪纳尔队赢得世界系列赛,尽管在赛季后没有参加比赛。

en: On June 8 , 2014 , in order to allow Xander Bogaerts to play 3rd base , Holt moved to left field .
zh: 2014年6月8日,为了让桑德尔·博加尔茨在第三垒打,霍尔特搬到左场。

en: He immediately impressed , making a sensational catch on the warning track to rob Ian Kinsler of a hit .
zh: 他立刻令人印象深刻, 在警告轨道上抢劫了伊恩·金斯勒的命中。

en: On July 9 , 2014 , against the Chicago White Sox , Holt drove in Daniel Nava in the bottom of the 9th inning for the first walk - off hit of his career .
zh: 2014年7月9日, 在对阵芝加哥白袜的比赛中, 霍尔特在第9局的底部射入丹尼尔·纳瓦,这是他职业生涯的首场 walk - off 射击.

en: By the end of the season , Holt had started games at every position except pitcher and catcher .
zh: 赛季结束时, 霍尔特除了投手和捕手以外,在每个位置都开始了比赛.

en: He was born at Stridon , a village near Emona on the border of Dalmatia and Pannonia .
zh: 他出生在达尔马提亚和潘诺尼亚边境的埃莫纳附近的斯特里顿村。

en: He is best known for his translation of most of the Bible into Latin  , and his commentaries on the Gospels .
zh: 他最著名的是把大部分圣经翻译成拉丁语,以及关于福音的评论。

en: His list of writings is extensive .
zh: 他写的书目很丰富。

en: The protégé of Pope Damasus I , who died in December of 384 , Jerome was known for his teachings on Christian moral life , especially to those living in cosmopolitan centers such as Rome .
zh: 教皇达马修斯一世的保护人,他于384年12月去世,杰罗米因教导基督教道德生活而闻名,特别是在罗马等国际中心居住的人。

en: In many cases , he focused his attention on the lives of women and identified how a woman devoted to Jesus should live her life .
zh: 在许多情况下,他把注意力集中在妇女的生活上,并指出一个致力于耶稣的妇女应该如何生活。

en: This focus stemmed from his close patron relationships with several prominent female ascetics who were members of affluent senatorial families .
zh: 这个重点源于他与几个著名女性修道士的亲密的赞助关系,这些女性修道士是富裕的参议员家庭成员。

en: Jerome is recognised as a saint and Doctor of the Church by the Catholic Church , the Eastern Orthodox Church , the Lutheran Church , and the Anglican Communion .
zh: 耶路撒冷是天主教、东正教、路德教和盎格鲁教共同体承认的圣人和教会的医生。

en: His feast day is 30 September .
zh: 他的节日是9月30日。

en: Eusebius Sophronius Hieronymus was born at Stridon around 347 AD .
zh: 尤西比乌斯·索普罗尼乌斯·希罗尼乌斯(Eusebius Sophronius Hieronymus)于347年左右出生于斯特里顿。

en: He was of Illyrian ancestry ,  although his ability to speak the Illyrian languages causes controversy .
zh: 他的祖先是伊利里亚人,尽管他能够说伊利里亚语引起争议。

en: He was not baptized until about 360 - 366 , when he had gone to Rome with his friend Bonosus of Sardica  to pursue rhetorical and philosophical studies .
zh: 他直到360年至366年左右才受洗,当时他和他的朋友萨尔迪卡的博诺斯(Bonosus of Sardica)去罗马进行辩论和哲学研究。

en: He studied under the grammarian Aelius Donatus .
zh: 他学习于语法学家艾利乌斯·多纳特斯(Aelius Donatus)。

en: There Jerome learned Latin and at least some Greek ,  though probably not the familiarity with Greek literature he would later claim to have acquired as a schoolboy .
zh: 在那里,杰罗姆学了拉丁语,至少学了一些希腊语,虽然他可能并不熟悉希腊文学,但后来他声称他作为一名学生学过。

en: As a student in Rome , Jerome engaged in the superficial escapades and sexual experimentation of students there , which he indulged in quite casually but for which he suffered terrible bouts of guilt afterwards .
zh: 作为一名罗马学生,杰罗姆参与了学生表面的逃跑和性实验,他非常随意地进行这些实验,但后来他遭受了可怕的罪恶打击。

en: To appease his conscience , he would visit on Sundays the sepulchres of the martyrs and the Apostles in the catacombs .
zh: 为了安抚他的良心,他星期天会参观烈士和使徒的坟墓。

en: This experience would remind him of the terrors of hell :
zh: 这种经历会使他想起地狱的恐怖:

en: Often I would find myself entering those crypts , deep dug in the earth , with their walls on either side lined with the bodies of the dead , where everything was so dark that almost it seemed as though the Psalmist 's words were fulfilled , Let them go down quick into Hell .
zh: 我常常发现自己走进那些深处在地上挖的坟墓,两边的墙上挂着死者的尸体,那里的一切都太黑暗了,几乎似乎是赞美诗人的话已经完成了,让他们快下地狱。

en: Here and there the light , not entering in through windows , but filtering down from above through shafts , relieved the horror of the darkness .
zh: 在这儿和那儿的灯光,不是通过窗户进入,而是从上空通过轴向下过滤,缓解了黑暗的恐怖。

en: But again , as soon as you found yourself cautiously moving forward , the black night closed around and there came to my mind the line of Vergil , " Horror ubique animos , simul ipsa silentia terrent " .
zh: 可是又一次,一旦你发现自己小心翼翼地向前迈进,黑夜闭幕了,我就想起了维尔格尔的诗歌,“ 恐怖无处不在的仇恨,  simulographia silentia terrent ”。

en: Jerome used a quote from Virgil — " On all sides round horror spread wide ; the very silence breathed a terror on my soul "  — to describe the horror of hell .
zh: 杰罗姆引用了维尔吉尔的话:“ 四面四周的恐怖蔓延; 整个寂静使我魂中充满了恐怖 ” — — 以描述地狱的恐怖。

en: Jerome initially used classical authors to describe Christian concepts such as hell that indicated both his classical education and his deep shame of their associated practices , such as pederasty which was found in Rome .
zh: 耶路撒冷最初使用古典作家来描述基督教的概念,如地狱,这表明他对古典教育的深感羞愧和与其相关的习俗,如在罗马发现的pederasty。

en: Although initially skeptical of Christianity , he was eventually converted .
zh: 尽管他最初对基督教持怀疑态度, 但他最终改道了.

en: After several years in Rome , he travelled with Bonosus to Gaul and settled in Trier where he seems to have first taken up theological studies , and where , for his friend Tyrannius Rufinus , he copied Hilary of Poitiers ' commentary on the Psalms and the treatise De synodis .
zh: 在罗马的几年后,他与博诺斯一起前往高卢,并定居于特里亚,他似乎首先开始了神学研究,在那里,他为他的朋友提拉尼乌斯·鲁菲努斯(Tyrannius Rufinus)复制了波蒂埃尔的希拉里(Hilari of Poitiers)对《圣经》和《德西诺迪斯》(De synodis)的评论。

en: Next came a stay of at least several months , or possibly years , with Rufinus at Aquileia , where he made many Christian friends .
zh: 接下来,他与鲁菲努斯在阿奎莱亚逗留了几个月,或者甚至几年,在那里他结识了许多基督徒朋友。

en: Some of these accompanied Jerome when about 373 , he set out on a journey through Thrace and Asia Minor into northern Syria .
zh: 约在373年,他开始通过特拉西亚和亚细亚进入叙利亚北部的旅行。

en: At Antioch , where he stayed the longest , two of his companions died and he himself was seriously ill more than once .
zh: 在安提奥克,他住得最久,他的两个同伴死去,他本人重病不止一次。

en: During one of these illnesses  , he had a vision that led him to lay aside his secular studies and devote himself to God .
zh: 在这些疾病中,他有一个幻觉,使他放弃了世俗研究,献身于上帝。

en: He seems to have abstained for a considerable time from the study of the classics and to have plunged deeply into that of the Bible , under the impulse of Apollinaris of Laodicea , then teaching in Antioch and not yet suspected of heresy .
zh: 他似乎在相当长的一段时间内弃权了古典研究,并且在拉奥迪西亚的阿波林纳斯的冲动下深入了圣经研究,然后在安提奥克教导,并还没有怀疑异教。

en: Seized with a desire for a life of ascetic penance , Jerome went for a time to the desert of Chalcis , to the southeast of Antioch , known as the " Syrian Thebaid " , from the number of eremites inhabiting it .
zh: 耶路撒冷被抓住了,他渴望有教徒的悔改生活,于是他暂时去了查尔西斯的沙漠,在安提奥克的东南部,被称为“ 叙利亚神卫 ”, 从那里居住的异教徒的数目来看。

en: During this period , he seems to have found time for studying and writing .
zh: 在这期间,他似乎找到了学习和写作的时间。

en: He made his first attempt to learn Hebrew under the guidance of a converted Jew ; and he seems to have been in correspondence with Jewish Christians in Antioch .
zh: 他第一次尝试学习希伯来语,由一个皈依的犹太人指导,他似乎与犹太基督徒在安提奥克进行交流。

en: Around this time he had copied for him a Hebrew Gospel , of which fragments are preserved in his notes , and is known today as the Gospel of the Hebrews , and which the Nazarenes considered to be the true Gospel of Matthew .
zh: 大约这时,他为他写了一本希伯来福音,其中 fragments are preserved in his notes, and is known today as the Gospel of the Hebrews, and which the Nazarenes considered to be the true Gospel of Matthew 。

en: Jerome translated parts of this Hebrew Gospel into Greek .
zh: 耶路撒冷把这部分希伯来福音译成希腊语。

en: Jens Otto Harry Jespersen or Otto Jespersen  was a Danish linguist who specialized in the grammar of the English language .
zh: 詹斯·奥托·哈里·杰普森(英语:Jens Otto Harry Jespersen)是一位丹麦语言学家,专门研究英语语法。

en: Otto Jespersen was born in Randers in Jutland .
zh: 奥托·杰普森出生于尤特兰的兰登斯。

en: He was inspired by the work of Danish philologist Rasmus Rask as a boy , and with the help of Rask 's grammars taught himself some Icelandic , Italian , and Spanish .
zh: 他在童年时受到丹麦哲学家Rasmus Rask的启发,并通过Rask的语法帮助自己学了一些冰岛语、意大利语和西班牙语。

en: He entered the University of Copenhagen in 1877 when he was 17 , initially studying law but not forgetting his language studies .
zh: 1877年,他17岁时进入哥本哈根大学,开始学习法律,但没有忘记语言学。

en: In 1881 he shifted his focus completely to languages , and in 1887 earned his master 's degree in French , with English and Latin as his secondary languages .
zh: 1881年,他把注意力完全转移到语言上,1887年获得法语硕士学位,以英语和拉丁语为其二级语言。

en: He supported himself during his studies through part - time work as a schoolteacher and as a shorthand reporter in the Danish parliament .
zh: 他在学习期间通过 兼职工作作为学校教师和在丹麦议会的短语记者来支持自己.

en: In 1887 – 1888 , he traveled to England , Germany and France , meeting linguists like Henry Sweet and Paul Passy and attending lectures at institutions like Oxford University .
zh: 1887年至1888年,他前往英格兰、德国和法国,与亨利·斯威特(Henry Sweet)和保罗·帕西(Paul Passy)等语言学家会面,并出席牛津大学等机构的讲座。

en: Following the advice of his mentor Vilhelm Thomsen , he returned to Copenhagen in August 1888 and began work on his doctoral dissertation on the English case system .
zh: 在他的导师威廉姆斯·汤姆森的建议下,他于1888年8月返回哥本哈根,开始对英语案例体系的博士论文进行研究。

en: Jespersen was a professor of English at the University of Copenhagen from 1893 to 1925 , and served as Rector of the university in 1920 – 21 .
zh: 1893年至1925年,杰普森在哥本哈根大学担任英语教授,1920年至21年担任大学校长。

en: His early work focused primarily on language teaching reform and on phonetics , but he is best known for his later work on syntax and on language development .
zh: 他的早期工作主要集中在语言教学改革和语音学上,但他最著名的是后来的语法和语言发展工作。

en: He advanced the theories of Rank and Nexus in Danish in two papers : Sprogets logik  and De to hovedarter af grammatiske forbindelser  .
zh: 他提出了在丹麦语中的 Rank 和 Nexus 的理论: Sprogets logic 和 De to hovedarter af grammatiske shekullr 。

en: Jespersen in this theory of ranks removes the parts of speech from the syntax , and differentiates between primaries , secondaries , and tertiaries ; e.g. in " well honed phrase , " " phrase " is a primary , this being defined by a secondary , " honed " , which again is defined by a tertiary " well " .
zh: 在这一等级理论中,杰普森从语法中删除了言语的部分,并区分了初级、次级和第三级;例如,在“精细的句子”中,“句子”是初级的,这是由第二级定义的,“精细”又由第三级定义的。

en: The term Nexus is applied to sentences , structures similar to sentences and sentences in formation , in which two concepts are expressed in one unit ; e.g. , it rained , he ran indoors .
zh: 语法 Nexus 适用于句子,结构类似句子和句子在形成中,其中两个概念在单元中表达;例如,它下雨,他跑进屋里。

en: This term is qualified by a further concept called a junction which represents one idea , expressed by means of two or more elements , whereas a nexus combines two ideas .
zh: 这个术语被进一步定义为一个称为连接的概念,它代表一个思想,通过两个或多个元素表达,而一个连结结合两个思想。

en: He was most widely recognized for some of his books .
zh: 他在一些书中得到广泛的认可。

en: Language : Its Nature , Development and Origin  is considered by many to be his masterpiece .
zh: 语言: 它的自然 、 发展和起源被许多人认为是他的杰作.

en: Modern English Grammar on Historical Principles  , concentrated on morphology and syntax , and Growth and Structure of the English Language  is a comprehensive view of English by someone with another native language , and still in print , over 70 years after his death and more than 100 years after publication .
zh: 现代英语语法的历史原则,集中于形态和语法,以及英语语言的增长和结构,是他死后70年和出版后100多年,他对英语的全面看法。

en: Late in his life he published Analytic Syntax  , in which he presents his views on syntactic structure using an idiosyncratic shorthand notation .
zh: 晚些时候,他出版了《分析语法》(Analytical Syntax), 其中他提出了他对语法结构的见解,用一种独特的短语注释。

en: In The Philosophy of Grammar  he challenged the accepted views of common concepts in Grammar and proposed corrections to the basic definitions of grammatical case , pronoun , object , voice etc. , and developed further his notions of Rank and Nexus .
zh: 在《 Grammar Philosophy 》 中,他挑战了 Grammar 中共同概念的接受观点,并提出对语法例 、 代词 、 对象 、 声音等基本定义的修正,并进一步发展了 Rank 和 Nexus 的观念。

en: In the 21st century this book is still used as one of the basic texts in modern Structural linguistics .
zh: 在21世纪,该书仍然被用作现代结构语言学的基本文本之一。

en: Mankind , Nation and Individual : from a linguistic point of view  is one of the pioneering works on Sociolinguistics .
zh: 人类 、 民族和个人: 从语言角度看,是社会语言学的先驱作品之一。

en: he lectured at the Congress of Arts and Sciences in St. Louis in 1904 , and in 1909 – 1910 he visited both the University of California and Columbia University .
zh: 他在1904年在圣路易斯的艺术和科学大会上讲课,在1909-1910年他访问了加利福尼亚大学和哥伦比亚大学。

en: While in the U.S. , he took occasion to study the country 's educational system .
zh: 在美国期间, 他利用机会研究美国教育制度.

en: His autobiography  was published in English translation as recently as 1995 .
zh: 他自传于1995年以英语翻译出版。

en: Jespersen was a proponent of phonosemanticism and wrote :
zh: 杰斯佩尔森是phonesemanticism的拥护者,并写道:

en: “ Is there really much more logic in the opposite extreme which denies any kind of sound symbolism  and sees in our words only a collection of accidental and irrational associations of sound and meaning ? ...
zh: “在相反的极端里,真的有更多的逻辑吗,它否认任何声音的象征性,并且只看到我们的话里声音和意义的偶然和不合理的关联?...

en: There is no denying that there are words which we feel instinctively to be adequate to express the ideas they stand for . ”
zh: 毫无疑问,我们本能地认为某些词语足以表达它们所代表的观点。 ”

en: After his retirement in 1925 , Jespersen remained active in the international linguistic community .
zh: 1925年退休后,杰普森仍活跃于国际语言社会。

en: In addition to continuing to write , he convened and chaired the first International Meeting on Linguistic Research in Geneva in 1930 , and acted as president of the Fourth International Congress of Linguists in Copenhagen in 1936 .
zh: 除了继续写作,他于1930年在日内瓦召开了第一次国际语言研究会议,并担任了1936年在哥本哈根举行的第四届国际语言学家大会主席。

en: He was an early supporter of the Esperanto offshoot Ido and in 1927 published his own project Novial .
zh: 他在1927年出版了自己的项目《诺维亚尔》。

en: He also worked with the International Auxiliary Language Association .
zh: 他还与国际辅助语言协会(英语:International Auxiliary Language Association)合作。

en: Jespersen received honorary degrees from Columbia University in New York  , St. Andrews University in Scotland  , and the Sorbonne in Paris  .
zh: 杰普森从纽约哥伦比亚大学、苏格兰圣安德鲁大学和巴黎索尔本大学获得荣誉学位。

en: He was one of the first six international scholars to be elected as honorary members of the Linguistic Society of America .
zh: 他是第一个当选为美国语言学会荣誉会员的六名国际学者之一。

en: Jenna Nicole Mourey  , better known by her pseudonym Jenna Marbles , is an American YouTube personality , vlogger , comedian and actress .
zh: 简娜·尼科尔·莫雷(英语:Jenna Nicole Mourey),更名简娜·马布尔斯(英语:Jenna Marbles),是美国YouTube名人、 vlogger、喜剧演员和演员。

en: As of March 2019 , her channel has approximately 3.1 billion video views and 19.5 million subscribers ,  and is the 86th most subscribed channel on YouTube and the eighth - most - popular channel operated by a woman .
zh: 截至2019年3月,她的频道大约有3.1亿的视频浏览量和19.5亿的订阅者,是YouTube上第86位最订阅的频道,也是由一名女性运营的第八位最受欢迎的频道。

en: Marbles is the first social media star to have a wax figure displayed in Madame Tussauds Museum , located in New York City .
zh: Marbles是第一个在纽约市的 Madame Tussauds Museum展出蜡像的社交媒体明星。

en: Marbles was born and raised in Rochester , New York , where she graduated from Brighton High School in 2004 .
zh: 马布尔生于纽约罗切斯特,2004年毕业于布莱顿高中。

en: Her father is a chemist who holds several patents and she has one older brother .
zh: 她的父亲是一名化学家,拥有多项专利,她有一个哥哥。

en: She then moved to Boston , where she attended Suffolk University .
zh: 然后她搬到波士顿, 在那里她参加了苏福克大学.

en: At Suffolk she obtained a Bachelor of Science in Psychology , and later attended Boston University for a Master of Education in Sport Psychology and Counseling .
zh: 在萨福克大学,她获得了心理学的科学学士学位,后来在波士顿大学获得体育心理学和咨询教育硕士学位。

en: She paid $ 800 rent by working various jobs , like bartending , working at a tanning salon , blogging , and go - go dancing at nightclubs .
zh: 她花了800美元的房租, 通过做各种工作, 比如打芭蕾舞, 在一个理发店工作, 写博客, 在夜总会跳舞.

en: That year , Marbles started her career with Barstool Sports , where she wrote for their female - oriented site StoolLaLa .
zh: 同年, 玛伯尔斯开始了她的职业生涯,在Barstool Sports上, 在那里她写了她们面向女性的网站StoolLaLa.

en: She left Barstool Sports in 2011 .
zh: 她於2011年離開Barstool Sports。

en: Marbles uploads a new video to her YouTube channel every Wednesday / Thursday .
zh: 每星期三/星期四,玛伯斯向她的YouTube频道上传一个新视频。

en: One video , released in 2010 and entitled " How To Trick People Into Thinking You 're Good Looking " was viewed over 5.3 million times in its first week .
zh: 该片于2010年发行,题为“ 如何让人们以为你看起来很好 ”,在第一周中被看了超过5.3亿次。

en: Her video " How To Avoid Talking To People You Do n't Want To Talk To " was featured in articles by The New York Times and ABC News in August 2011 .
zh: 她的视频 “ 如何避免与你不想交谈的人交谈 ” 在2011年8月被《纽约时报》和ABC新闻报道。

en: In the video , she stated , " I 'm sick and tired of guys thinking that just because I showed up at a club or a dance or a bar , that I want to have their genitalia touching my backside " ;   the video had approximately 36.2 million views as of March 2018 .
zh: 在视频中,她表示,“我厌倦和厌倦男人认为我只是在俱乐部或舞会或酒吧出现,我想要他们的生殖器接触我的背部”;截至2018年3月,视频的浏览量约为36.2百万。

en: Jenna 's mother was unemployed at the time that Jenna 's first video went viral , and was concerned that their content might put off potential employers .
zh: 珍妮的母亲当时失业,珍妮的第一张视频传开了,她担心他们的内容可能会让潜在的雇主失望。

en: The name " Marbles " comes from her dog " Mr. Marbles " .
zh: 马布尔的名字来自她的狗马布尔先生.

en: As of January 2019 , Marbles 's YouTube channel had about 19 million subscribers and 2.9 billion video views .
zh: 截至2019年1月,马布尔斯的YouTube频道有约19亿用户和2.9亿视频观看。

en: She played a banana in The Annoying Orange episode " Fake n' Bacon " .
zh: 她在《令人讨厌的橙子》集“ 假面包 ”中扮演了一个香蕉.

en: She played Miley Cyrus in a " Wrecking Ball " - inspired segment of YouTube Rewind 2013 .
zh: 她在YouTubeRewind2013的“ Wrecking Ball ”中扮演迈莉·赛鲁斯.

en: On January 30 , 2014 , she appeared in season four of Ridiculousness .
zh: 2014年1月30日,她出现在第四季的 Ridiculousness中。

en: Marbles appeared as herself in Smosh : The Movie .
zh: 马布尔斯在《斯莫什:电影》中饰演自己。

en: In 2015 , Marbles unveiled a wax figure of herself at Madame Tussauds New York .
zh: 2015年,马布尔斯在纽约的杜萨德夫人(Madame Tussauds New York)展出了她的蜡像。

en: She was the first ever YouTube star to be immortalized at Madame Tussauds New York and her figure is the first selfie - taking wax figure at this location .
zh: 她是第一个在纽约杜萨德夫人的YouTube明星被永恒化,她的形象是在这个地点的第一个自撮り蜡像。

en: Marbles has also professionalized her business affairs by expanding her business and bringing in people to help , including , a personal assistant , a business manager , and her mother  .
zh: 马布尔斯还通过扩大自己的业务和引进帮助的人来专业化自己的业务,包括一名私人助理、一名业务经理和她的母亲。

en: Marbles does a weekly podcast with her boyfriend Julien Solomita called " The Jenna Julien Podcast "  .
zh: 玛布尔斯与她的男朋友朱利安·索尔米塔每周进行 Podcast,名为 “ 珍娜·朱利安 Podcast ”.

en: Topics include stories of growing up , conspiracy theories , YouTubers and other general topics .
zh: 主题包括成长的故事、阴谋理论、YouTubers和其他一般话题。

en: They sometimes feature other YouTubers as guests on their podcast , including Shane Dawson .
zh: 他们有时将其他YouTubers作为他们的 podcast的客人,包括Shane Dawson。

en: Marbles released a brand of dog toys called Kermie Worm & Mr. Marbles .
zh: 马伯尔公司发行了一种叫克里·沃姆&马伯尔先生的狗玩具品牌。

en: The toys ' appearances are based upon her real dogs .
zh: 玩具的外观是基于她的真正的狗。

en: She has also created items with some of her most memorable quotes printed on them  .
zh: 她还创作了一些物品,上面印有她最难忘的引用。

en: Marbles also hosts a weekly pop countdown on SiriusXM Hits 1 called " YouTube 15 " .
zh: Marbles还举办一个每周的PopCountdown在SiriusXM Hits 1题为“ YouTube 15 ”.

en: In 2016 , Marbles became an executive producer for Maximum Ride , a film based on the series of novels of the same name by James Patterson .
zh: 2016年,马布尔斯成为詹姆斯·帕特森(James Patterson)的同名小说系列电影《 Maximum Ride (英语:Maximum Ride)》的执行制作人。

en: Marbles has been in a relationship with fellow YouTuber Julien Solomita since 2013 , and the two live together in California with their four dogs , Marbles , Kermit , Peach and Bunny , who regularly appear in her videos .
zh: 自2013年起,马布尔斯与YouTube的同事朱利安·索尔米塔(Julien Solomita)建立了关系,两人与他们四个狗,马布尔斯(Marbles)、克里米特(Kermit)、桃子和兔(Peach and Bunny)一起生活,他们经常出现在她的视频中。

en: Resting place Montmartre Cemetery , Paris , France
zh: 蒙特马特墓地,巴黎,法国

en: Spouse Jean - Louis Richard  William Friedkin
zh: 妻子Jean-Louis Richard William Friedkin

en: She won the Cannes Film Festival Award for Best Actress for Seven Days ... Seven Nights  , the BAFTA Award for Best Foreign Actress for Viva Maria !  , and the César Award for Best Actress for The Old Lady Who Walked in the Sea  .
zh: 她赢得了坎城电影节最佳女演员奖七天...七夜,最佳外国女演员 BAFTA奖Viva Maria!,最佳女演员 César奖The Old Lady Who Walked in the Sea。

en: She was also the recipient of several lifetime awards , including a BAFTA Fellowship in 1996 , Cannes Golden Palm in 2003 and César Award in 2008 .
zh: 她曾多次获得终身奖项,包括1996年的BAFTA奖,2003年的金棕榈奖和2008年的塞萨尔奖。

en: Moreau made her theatrical debut in 1947 , and established herself as one of the leading actresses of the Comédie - Française .
zh: 莫罗在1947年首次演戏, 并成为《法国喜剧》的女演员之一.

en: She began playing small roles in films in 1949 , with impressive performances in the Fernandel vehicle Meurtres ?  and alongside Jean Gabin as a showgirl / gangster 's moll in the film Touchez pas au grisbi  .
zh: 1949年,她开始在电影中扮演小角色,在费南德尔汽车《屠杀》中演出了令人印象深刻的表演,并在电影《 Touchez pas au grisbi 》中饰演吉恩·加宾(英语:Jean Gabin)的表演女郎/黑帮人。

en: She achieved prominence as the star of Elevator to the Gallows  , directed by Louis Malle , and Jules et Jim  , directed by François Truffaut .
zh: 她在路易斯·马勒执导的《通往谷仓的电梯》和弗朗索瓦·特鲁法特执导的《朱尔斯与吉姆》中获得了突出地位。

en: Most prolific during the 1960s , Moreau continued to appear in films into her 80s .
zh: 在20世纪60年代,莫罗继续在80年代的电影中露面。

en: Moreau 's father was French ; her mother was English , a native of Oldham , Lancashire , England  and of part Irish descent .
zh: 莫罗的父亲是法国人,母亲是英国兰卡郡奥尔德汉姆(英语:Oldham)的英国人,部分来自爱尔兰。

en: Moreau 's father was Catholic and her mother , originally a Protestant , converted to Catholicism upon marriage .
zh: 莫罗的父亲是天主教徒,母亲原是新教徒,在结婚后 converted to Catholicism.

en: When a young girl , " the family moved south to Vichy , spending vacations at the paternal ancestral village of Mazirat , a town of 30 houses in a valley in the Allier .
zh: 当一个年轻的女孩,“家庭搬到南方的维奇,在父亲的祖先的村庄马齐拉特,一个位于阿利耶山谷的村庄,有30个房子。

en: " Every tombstone in the cemetery was for a Moreau " .
zh: “ 墓地里的每一个坟墓都是莫罗的. ”

en: During the World War II , the family was split , and Moreau lived with her mother in Paris .
zh: 第二次世界大战期间,家庭分裂,莫罗与母亲住在巴黎。

en: Moreau ultimately lost interest in school at age 16 , and after attending a performance of Jean Anouilh 's Antigone , found her calling as an actor .
zh: 莫罗最终在16岁时失去了对学校的兴趣,并在参加让·安努伊尔的《圣诞老人》演出后,找到了她作为一名演员的召唤。

en: She later studied at the Conservatoire de Paris .
zh: 她后来在巴黎音乐学院学习。

en: Her parents separated permanently while Moreau was at the conservatory and her mother , " after 24 difficult years in France , returned to England with Jeanne 's  sister , Michelle . "
zh: 她的父母长期分离,莫罗在教养院和她的母亲,“在法国的24年困难之后,带着珍妮的妹妹米歇尔回到英国。

en: In 1947 , Moreau made her theatrical debut at the Avignon Festival .
zh: 1947年,莫雷奥在阿维尼翁音乐节上首次演出。

en: She debuted at the Comédie - Française in Ivan Turgenev 's A Month in the Country  and , by her 20s , was already one of leading actresses in the theatre 's troupe .
zh: 她在伊万·图尔格涅夫的《乡村的一个月》中首次在法国喜剧剧院演出,20岁时,她已经是剧院的女演员之一。

en: After 1949 , she began appearing in films with small parts but continued primarily active in the theatre for several years — a year at the Théâtre National Populaire opposite among others Gérard Philipe and Robert Hirsch , then a breakout two years in dual roles in The Dazzling Hour by Anna Bonacci , then Jean Cocteau 's La Machine Infernale and others before another two - year run , this time in Shaw 's Pygmalion .
zh: 1949年后,她开始出演一些小部电影,但主要在剧院继续活跃了几年 — — 一年在国家人口剧院对面的其他Gérard Philipe和Robert Hirsch,然后在安娜·波纳奇的《魅力时刻》的双重角色中爆发两年,然后让科托的La Machine Infernale和其他在另外两年的演出之前,这次在肖的Pygmalion。

en: From the late 1950s , after appearing in several successful films , she began to work with the emerging generation of French film - makers .
zh: 从1950年代末起, 在几部成功的电影中出现后, 她开始与新兴的法国电影制作人一起工作.

en: Elevator to the Gallows  with first - time director Louis Malle was followed by Malle 's The Lovers  .
zh: 第一次导演路易斯·马勒的电梯到格洛兹之后,马勒的《爱人》。

en: Moreau went on to work with many of the best known New Wave and avant - garde directors .
zh: 莫罗继续与许多著名的新浪潮和前卫导演合作.

en: François Truffaut 's New Wave film Jules et Jim  , her biggest success internationally , is centered on her magnetic starring role .
zh: 弗朗索瓦·特鲁法特的新浪潮电影《朱利斯与吉姆》是她在国际上最大的成功, 其中心是她的魅力的主演角色.

en: She also worked with a number of other notable directors such as Michelangelo Antonioni  , Orson Welles  , Luis Buñuel  , Elia Kazan  , Rainer Werner Fassbinder  , Wim Wenders  , Carl Foreman  , and Manoel de Oliveira  .
zh: 她还与许多其他著名导演合作,如米开朗哥拉·安东尼奥尼、奥尔森·威尔斯、路易斯·布努埃尔、埃利亚·卡桑、雷纳·韦尔纳·法斯拜登、温德斯、卡尔·福尔曼和曼诺埃尔·德·奥利维亚。

en: In 1983 , she was head of the jury at the 33rd Berlin International Film Festival .
zh: 1983年,她担任第33届柏林国际电影节陪审团主席。

en: In 2005 , she was awarded with the Stanislavsky Award at the 27th Moscow International Film Festival .
zh: 2005年,她在第27届莫斯科国际电影节获得斯坦尼斯瓦夫斯基奖。

en: She released several albums and once performed with Frank Sinatra at Carnegie Hall in 1984 .
zh: 她在1984年与弗兰克·西纳特拉(Frank Sinatra)一起在卡内基大厅演出。

en: In addition to acting , Moreau worked behind the camera as a writer , director and producer .
zh: 除了演出外,莫雷奥还担任编剧、导演和制片人。

en: Her accomplishments were the subject of the film Calling the Shots  by Janis Cole and Holly Dale .
zh: 她的成就是詹妮斯·科尔和霍莉·戴尔(英语:Holly Dale)拍摄的电影《枪声呼唤》的主题。

en: Eugene A. Nida  was a linguist who developed the dynamic - equivalence Bible - translation theory and one of the founders of the modern discipline of Translation Studies .
zh: 尤金·尼达(Eugene A. Nida)是一个语言学家,他开发了动态等价的圣经翻译理论,也是现代翻译研究的创始人之一。

en: Nida was born in Oklahoma City , Oklahoma on November 11 , 1914 .
zh: 尼达于1914年11月11日在俄克拉荷马州俄克拉荷马市出生。

en: He became a Christian at a young age , when he responded to the altar call at his church " to accept Christ as my Saviour . "
zh: 他年轻时就成了基督徒,当他响应他的教堂的祭坛召唤“ 接受基督为我的救主 ”时。

en: He graduated summa cum laude from the University of California in 1936 .
zh: 1936年,他从加利福尼亚大学毕业。

en: After graduating he attended Camp Wycliffe , where Bible translation theory was taught .
zh: 毕业后,他参加了怀克利夫营,在那里教导了圣经翻译理论。

en: He ministered for a short time among the Tarahumara Indians in Chihuahua , Mexico , until health problems due to an inadequate diet and the high altitude forced him to leave .
zh: 他在墨西哥Chihuahua的塔拉胡马拉印第安人中担任了短暂的职务,直到由于缺乏营养和高海拔导致健康问题迫使他离开。

en: Sometime in this period , Nida became a founding charter member of Wycliffe Bible Translators , a related organization to the Summer Institute of Linguistics .
zh: 在此期间,尼达成为怀克利夫圣经翻译协会(Wycliffe Bible Translators)的创始成员。

en: In 1937 , Nida undertook studies at the University of Southern California , where he obtained a master 's degree in New Testament Greek in 1939 .
zh: 1937年,尼达在南加利福尼亚大学学习,1939年获得新约希腊语硕士学位。

en: In that same year he became interim pastor of Calvary Church of Santa Ana , California following the resignation of its founding pastor .
zh: 同年,他成为加利福尼亚州圣安纳的卡尔瓦里教堂的临时牧师。

en: Despite his conservative background , in later years Nida became increasingly ecumenical and New Evangelical  in his approach .
zh: 尽管他具有保守的背景,但在后来的几年里,尼达在其方法上变得越来越世俗和新福音主义。

en: In 1943 , Nida received his Ph.D. in Linguistics from the University of Michigan .
zh: 1943年,尼达从密歇根大学获得语言学博士学位。

en: He was ordained as a Baptist minister .
zh: 他被任命为浸信者牧师。

en: He married Althea Lucille Sprague , who died in 1993 .
zh: 他与1993年去世的阿尔塔·卢西尔·斯普拉格结婚。

en: In 1997 , he married María Elena Fernandez - Miranda , a lawyer and diplomatic attache .
zh: 1997年, 他 与 María Elena Fernandez - Miranda 结婚, 她 是 律师 和 外交官 。

en: Nida retired in the early 1980s , although he continued to give lectures in universities all around the world , and lived in Alpine , Arizona , USA ; Madrid , Spain and Brussels , Belgium .
zh: 尼达在1980年代早期退休,尽管他继续在世界各地的大学教授,并且住在阿利桑那州阿尔卑斯,美国;马德里,西班牙和比利时布鲁塞尔。

en: He died in Madrid on August 25 , 2011 aged 96 .
zh: 他于2011年8月25日在马德里去世,享年96岁。

en: Nida has been a pioneer in the fields of translation theory and linguistics .
zh: 尼达是翻译理论和语言学领域的先驱。

en: His Ph.D. dissertation , A Synopsis of English Syntax , was the first full - scale analysis of a major language according to the " immediate - constituent " theory .
zh: 他的博士论文, A Synopsis of English Syntax, 是根据“ 即时组成 ” 理论对一个主要语言的第一次全尺度分析.

en: His textbook Morphology : The Descriptive Analysis of Words was one of the major works of American Structuralism .
zh: 他的课本《 Morphology : The Descriptive Analysis of Words 》是美国结构主义的主要著作之一。

en: It remained the only thorough introduction to the field for decades and is still valuable for its many examples and exercises .
zh: 它仍然是数十年来唯一深入的介绍到这一领域,并且仍为其许多实例和练习而有价值。

en: His most notable contribution to translation theory is Dynamic Equivalence , also known as Functional Equivalence .
zh: 他对翻译理论的最显著贡献是动态等价,也被称为功能等价。

en: Nida also developed the componential analysis technique , which split words into their components to help determine equivalence in translation  .
zh: 尼达还开发了分词组分析技术,将词组分成分词组来帮助确定翻译中的等价性。

en: This is , perhaps , not the best example of the technique , though it is the most well - known .
zh: 这是, 也许, 不是技术最好的例子, 尽管它是最有名的.

en: Nida 's dynamic - equivalence theory is often held in opposition to the views of philologists who maintain that an understanding of the source text  can be achieved by assessing the inter-animation of words on the page , and that meaning is self - contained within the text  .
zh: 尼达的动态等价理论经常与哲学家的观点相反,他们认为,通过评价页上的词汇的相互动画来实现源文本的理解,而这个意义是自含于文本中。

en: This theory , along with other theories of correspondence in translating , are elaborated in his essay Principles of Correspondence , where Nida begins by asserting that given that " no two languages are identical , either in the meanings given to corresponding symbols or in the ways in which symbols are arranged in phrases and sentences , it stands to reason that there can be no absolute correspondence between languages .
zh: 这一理论与翻译中的其他通信理论一起,在其论文《通信原则》中详细阐述,尼达首先宣称“没有两个语言是相同的,无论是对相应的符号的含义还是在符号在句子和句子中安排的方式,因此可以推断语言之间不存在绝对的通信。

en: While the impact of a translation may be close to the original , there can be no identity in detail .
zh: 虽然翻译的影响可能与原文很接近,但不能详细说明身份。

en: Nida then sets forth the differences in translation , as he would account for it , within three basic factors :
zh: 然后,尼达指出了翻译方面的差异,他将考虑到这三个基本因素:

en: 1. The nature of the message : in some messages the content is of primary consideration , and in others the form must be given a higher priority .
zh: 1.信息的性质:在某些信息中,内容是首要考虑的,在其他信息中,格式必须给予更高的优先权。

en: 2. The purpose of the author and of the translator : to give information on both form and content ; to aim at full intelligibility of the reader so he / she may understand the full implications of the message ; for imperative purposes that aim at not just understanding the translation but also at ensuring no misunderstanding of the translation .
zh: 2.作者和译者的目的:提供形式和内容的资料;以达到读者的全面理解,以便他/她能够理解信息的全部含义;以绝对的目的,目的不仅在于理解译文,而且是为了确保译文的误解。

en: 3. The type of audience : prospective audiences differ both in decoding ability and in potential interest .
zh: 3.听众类型:潜在的听众在解码能力和潜在的兴趣上都不同。

en: Nida brings in the reminder that while there are no such things as " identical equivalents " in translating , what one must in translating seek to do is find the " closest natural equivalent " .
zh: 尼达指出,虽然在翻译中没有“ 同等 的 ” 东西,但一个人必须在翻译中寻找“ 最接近的自然 同等 ” 。

en: Here he identifies two basic orientations in translating based on two different types of equivalence :
zh: 在此,他确定了基于两种不同类型的等价性的翻译的基本方向:

en: Such translations then would be concerned with such correspondences as poetry to poetry , sentence to sentence , and concept to concept .
zh: 这种翻译将涉及诸如诗歌到诗歌、句子到句子、概念到概念等交流。

en: Such a formal orientation that typifies this type of structural equivalence is called a " gloss translation " in which the translator aims at reproducing as literally and meaningfully as possible the form and content of the original .
zh: 这种典型的结构等价性形式被称为“ 光滑翻译 ”,翻译者的目标是尽可能准确地再现原文的形式和内容。

en: The principles governing an F - E translation would then be : reproduction of grammatical units ; consistency in word usage ; and meanings in terms of the source context .
zh: 语法翻译的准则是: 语法单元的再现; 词汇使用的一致性; 词汇的含义在源文上下文中.

en: He grew up in Texas and rose to fame in the early 2000s after appearing on the television series Gilmore Girls as well as the films New York Minute and House of Wax .
zh: 他出生于德克萨斯州,在2000年代初,出演了电视剧《吉尔摩女孩》以及电影《纽约时刻》和《蜡 House》。

en: Padalecki was born in San Antonio , Texas , to Gerald and Sherri Padalecki .
zh: 帕达莱克基出生于德克萨斯州圣安东尼奥,父亲是杰拉尔德和谢里·帕达莱克基。

en: His father is of Polish descent , while his mother has German , Scottish , French , and English ancestry .
zh: 他的父亲是波兰血统的,而他的母亲是德国、苏格兰、法国和英国血统的。

en: He was a 2000 candidate for the Presidential Scholars Program .
zh: 他是2000年总统奖学金计划的候选人。

en: In 1998 , Padalecki and his partner Chris Cardenas won the National Forensic League national championship in Duo Interpretation .
zh: 1998年,帕达莱克基和他的搭档克里斯·卡德纳斯赢得了国家法医学联盟的双重解释国家冠军。

en: Although he had originally planned to attend the University of Texas after graduating from high school in 2000 , Jared decided to move Los Angeles , California instead to pursue an acting career .
zh: 尽管他原本计划在2000年高中毕业后进入德克萨斯大学,但贾雷德决定搬到加利福尼亚州洛杉矶去从事表演。

en: Padalecki won Fox Broadcasting 's 1999 " Claim to Fame Contest " ; he subsequently appeared at the Teen Choice Awards , where he met an agent .
zh: 帕达莱克基在1999年的福克斯广播公司“ 声望名人竞赛 ” 中获胜; 随后他出现在青少年选择奖中, 在那里他遇到了一个代理人.

en: In 2000 , he was cast as Dean Forester on the television series Gilmore Girls , a role he played until 2005 .
zh: 在2000年,他出演了电视剧《吉尔摩女孩》的迪恩·福斯特尔(Dean Forester),他直到2005年才扮演这个角色。

en: Throughout the early 2000s he appeared in several made - for - television films , including Silent Witness , Close to Home , and the Disney Channel Original Movie A Ring of Endless Light .
zh: 在二十世纪初,他出演了数部为电视制作的电影, 包括《沉默的见证人 》 、 《离家不远 》和《迪士尼频道原版电影 无穷的光环 》 。

en: Padalecki had an uncredited role as a high school bully in 2003 's comedy Cheaper by the Dozen , which he played after being asked by fellow actor and friend Tom Welling , who played Charlie Baker , and the director of the movie , who wanted someone larger than Charlie to pick on him .
zh: 帕达列克基在2003年的喜剧《数十人买钱》中扮演了一个学校的暴徒的角色,他是在被其他演员和朋友汤姆·韦灵(Tom Welling)要求扮演查理·贝克(Charlie Baker)和电影导演(Director of the movie)的邀请后扮演的。

en: Padalecki originally auditioned for Welling 's role , but gave it up in order to film a pilot titled Young MacGyver which was never picked up .
zh: 帕达列克基最初接受了威尔инг的试镜,但放弃了试镜,以便拍摄一个名为《年轻的麦克吉弗》的试镜。

en: In 2004 , he appeared in the Mary - Kate and Ashley Olsen comedy New York Minute as Trey Lipton , a cute boy to whom the Olsens ' characters are attracted .
zh: 在2004年, 他出现在玛丽·凯特和阿什利·奥尔森的喜剧《纽约时刻》中饰演特里·利普顿, 这个可爱的男孩被奥尔森的人物所吸引.

en: He also landed a short role in the thriller Flight of the Phoenix alongside Dennis Quaid and Hugh Laurie .
zh: 他与丹尼斯·奎德(Dennis Quaid)和休·劳里(Hugh Laurie)一起在恐怖片《鳳凰之飞(英语:Flight of the Phoenix)》中扮演了短暂的角色。

en: In 2005 , Padalecki starred opposite Elisha Cuthbert , Chad Michael Murray , and Paris Hilton in House of Wax as Wade .
zh: 在2005年,帕达莱克基在《 Wax House 》中饰演艾丽莎·库特伯特、查德·迈克尔·莫雷和巴黎·希尔顿。

en: In 2005 , he appeared in Cry Wolf , another horror film , as Tom .
zh: 2005年, 他出演了另一部恐怖电影《 Cry Wolf 》, 作为汤姆.

en: That same year , Padalecki was cast as Sam Winchester on the WB series , Supernatural .
zh: 同年,帕达莱克基在WB系列《超自然》中饰演萨姆·温彻斯特。

en: Sam and his brother Dean  drive throughout the United States hunting paranormal predators , fighting demons and angels , and dealing with all manner of fantasy & sci - fi genre .
zh: 萨姆和他的弟弟迪恩在整个美国追赶超常的掠食者, 与恶魔和天使战斗, 并处理各种幻想和科幻类别.

en: The show is currently in its fourteenth season on the CW .
zh: 该剧目前在CW的第十季中播出。

en: It owns the title of the longest - running North American sci - fi series in history .
zh: 它拥有历史上最长的北美科幻系列的头衔.

en: In 2007 , Jared served as the host of MTV 's horror reality series , Room 401 , which was discontinued after only eight episodes due to poor ratings .
zh: 在2007年,Jared担任MTV恐怖现实系列的主持人,房间401,该系列仅在8集之后因糟糕的评级而停播。

en: He had the lead role in 2008 's The Christmas Cottage as Thomas Kinkade , alongside acclaimed actor Peter O'Toole .
zh: 他在2008年的《圣诞小屋》中饰演托马斯·金卡德, 与著名演员彼得·奥·图尔(Peter O'Toole)一起主演.

en: He also had the lead role in the 2009 version of Friday the 13th as Clay Miller , a character who heads out to Camp Crystal Lake in search of his sister who has gone missing .
zh: 他也是2009年版本的13日星期五的主角克莱·米勒(Clay Miller),一个前往水晶湖营寻找失踪的妹妹的角色。

en: Padalecki 's engagement to his Supernatural co-star Genevieve Cortese was announced in January 2010 .
zh: 2010年1月,帕达列克基与他的超自然搭档珍妮维夫·科特塞(Genevieve Cortese)结婚。

en: They met when Cortese guest starred as Ruby on the show 's fourth season .
zh: 在节目第四季,柯特斯客串扮演鲁比时,他们相遇了。

en: The pair married on February 27 , 2010 , in Cortese 's hometown of Sun Valley , Idaho .
zh: 两人于2010年2月27日结婚, 在科特塞的家乡爱达荷州太阳谷.

en: On October 10 , 2011 , the couple announced that they were expecting their first child together .
zh: 2011年10月10日,这对夫妇宣布他们正在一起期待他们的第一个孩子。

en: Their son , Thomas Colton Padalecki , was born on March 19 , 2012 .
zh: 他们的儿子托马斯·科尔顿·帕达莱克基于2012年3月19日出生。

en: Their daughter , Odette Elliott Padalecki , was born on March 17 , 2017 .
zh: 他们的女儿,Odette Elliott Padalecki,于2017年3月17日出生。

en: The couple resides in Austin , Texas with their three children .
zh: 这对夫妇住在德克萨斯州奥斯汀,他们三个孩子。

en: Padalecki and Supernatural co-stars Jensen Ackles and Misha Collins supported Beto O'Rourke for the 2018 Senate election in Texas .
zh: 在2018年德克萨斯州参议院选举中,帕达莱克基和超级自然的搭档詹森·阿克尔斯和米沙·柯林斯支持贝托·奥罗克。

en: In March 2015 , Padalecki launched his Always Keep Fighting campaign through Represent.com .
zh: 2015年3月,帕达莱克基通过Represent.com发起了他的“永远保持战斗”运动。

en: His first campaign raised funds for To Write Love On Her Arms , which supports people struggling with depression , addiction , self - injury , and suicide .
zh: 他的第一个竞选活动筹集资金为《写爱在她的手臂上》, 它支持那些与抑郁症 、 吸毒 、 自伤和自杀挣扎的人.

en: The cause is particularly close to Padalecki , who has been candid about his own struggles with depression .
zh: 这个原因特别接近帕达列克基,他对自己的抑郁斗争很坦率。

en: For the second campaign in the Always Keep Fighting series in April 2015 , Padalecki partnered with co-star Jensen Ackles to release a shirt featuring both of their faces , to benefit their newly formed joint charitable fund .
zh: 在2015年4月的Always Keep Fighting系列的第二次竞选中,帕达莱克与联合明星詹森·阿克尔斯合作发行了一张带他们两个面孔的衬衫,以受益于他们新成立的联合慈善基金。

en: Over 70,000 shirts were sold .
zh: 售出超过70万张衬衫。

en: Most recently , Padalecki launched a third campaign selling a further 40,000 shirts .
zh: 最近,帕达莱克基发起了第三个销售40万张衬衫的运动。

en: During San Diego Comic - Con 2015 , more than 6,000 fans surprised Padalecki at the Supernatural panel by holding up candles for him , after having revealed his battle with depression earlier in the year .
zh: 在2015年圣地亚哥漫画节期间,超过6000名粉丝在超级自然小组中为帕达列克奇展示了自己与抑郁的斗争,并为他展示了蜡烛。

en: Theodorus of Tabennese  , also known as Abba Theodorus and Theodore the Sanctified was the spiritual successor to Pachomius and played a crucial role in preventing the first Christian cenobitic monastic federation from collapsing after the death of its founder .
zh: 塔本尼斯的西奥多拉斯(Theodorus of Tabennese),又称阿巴·西奥多拉斯(Abba Theodorus)和圣徒西奥多拉斯(Theodorus the Sanctified),是帕乔米斯的后继者,在防止第一个基督教修道院联合会在其创始人去世后崩溃方面发挥了关键作用。

en: According to hagiography , Theodorus was born into a wealthy Christian family and was well educated from a young age .
zh: 据传记,西奥多拉斯出生在富裕的基督教家庭,从幼年就受过良好教育。

en: Early in life he denied the excesses of his parents , and at the age of fourteen joined a monastery in the diocese of Sne , near the modern town of Esna , Egypt .
zh: 早年,他否认父母的过分行为,14岁时加入了埃及苏尼教区的一座修道院,靠近现代的埃斯纳镇。

en: A brother from Theodorus ’ monastery stayed with Pachomius in Tabennese while traveling and preached of the virtues of the Koinonia upon his return to Sne .
zh: 一个来自西奥多拉修道院的兄弟在旅行时与帕乔米斯在塔本内斯停留,并在他返回斯尼时传教科伊诺尼亚的美德。

en: Praying and weeping , Theodorus became determined that his destiny lay with Pachomius .
zh: 在祈祷和哭泣时,西奥多拉斯确信他的命运在于帕乔米斯。

en: Although initially denied passage to Tabennese by a Pachomian monk due to his wealthy background , Theodorus opted to follow the visiting monk , and his persistence  paid off .
zh: 尽管最初由于他的富裕背景而被帕乔米亚修道士拒绝进入塔本尼西亚,但西奥多拉斯选择跟随访问的修道士,他的坚持得到了回报。

en: He was welcomed by Pachomius upon his arrival , and quickly integrated into the community at Tabennese around 328 .
zh: 他到达后被帕乔米乌斯欢迎,并在328年左右迅速融入塔本内斯的社区。

en: Quickly becoming a favorite of Pachomius , Theodorus lived an enviably ascetic life in the monastery , and took on the title of the " brothers ’ comforter " .
zh: 狄奥多禄很快成为帕丘米乌斯的宠儿,在修道院里过着令人羡慕的牧师生活,并获得了“兄弟的安慰者 ” 的称号。

en: Theodorus asserted his influence openly  and generally maintained himself as a prominent figure at Tabennese for several years , despite never being given a position of power in the monastic hierarchy .
zh: 西奥多拉斯公开宣称他的影响力,并一直保持自己作为塔本内斯的著名人物数年,尽管从未在修道院等级制度中获得权力。

en: Finally , Pachomius called on him to preach to the brothers despite his youth , and eventually appointed him steward of Tabennese after several new monasteries had been built .
zh: 最后,帕乔米乌斯要求他尽管年轻,向弟兄传道,并在修建了几座新修道院后,最终任命他为塔本尼斯的牧师。

en: Retiring to the monastery of Phbow , Pachomius gave Theodorus complete control over Tabennese , though recalled him from the position after witnessing several monks under Theodorus ’ watch violating the monastic rules without reprimand .
zh: 帕丘米乌斯退休到普布修道院后,他让西奥多拉斯完全控制塔本尼斯,尽管在西奥多拉斯的监视下看到几个修道士无拘无束地违反修道士的规则之后,他把他从这个职位上召回。

en: Having failed to prove his governing ability and once more in a position no higher than when he had entered the monastery , Theodorus became a personal assistant to Pachomius and remained relatively quiet for some years .
zh: 由于未能证明他的统治能力,并且再次处于一个地位比他进入修道院时的最高,西奥多拉斯成为帕丘米乌斯的私人助理,并保持了相对平静的几年。

en: Despite his clear potential and popularity , Pachomius refused to grant Theodorus any kind of authority ; though the old man 's failing health soon changed things forever .
zh: 尽管帕乔米乌斯有明显的潜力和声望,但他拒绝给予西奥多拉斯任何权力,尽管这位老人的衰弱健康很快改变了一切。

en: After Theodorus had been assisting Pachomius at Tabennese for several years following his demotion , Pachomius became very ill and seemed to be on the verge of death .
zh: 西奥多拉斯在撤离后在塔本尼西斯协助帕古米乌斯的几年后,帕古米乌斯病得很重,似乎在临死的边缘。

en: Pachomius had not named a successor , and several brothers pleaded with Theodorus to assert himself as head of the Koinonia when the sickly man died .
zh: 帕乔米乌斯没有指定继任者,几个兄弟向西奥多拉斯请求当病死时担任科尼奥尼亚的首领。

en: Despite the assertion that Theodorus apparently did not want the rank of a father or this world 's glory , he consented .
zh: 尽管提奥多斯声称他显然不希望父亲的称号或这个世界的荣耀,但他还是同意了。

en: Unfortunately for the would - be leader , Pachomius recovered , and upon hearing of Theodorus ’ decision , exiled the ambitious young man .
zh: 不幸的是, 帕乔米斯恢复了领导地位, 听见西奥多拉斯的决定, 驱逐了这个雄心勃勃的年轻人.

en: After living a life of constant weeping and prayer in solitude , Pachomius forgave Theodorus and allowed him to live among the brothers once more .
zh: 帕哥米乌斯在孤独的一生中不断哭泣和祈祷之后,他原谅了西奥多拉斯,并允许他再次在兄弟间生活。

en: Normalcy returned , though never again would Pachomius fully trust his former protégé .
zh: 恢复正常, 尽管帕乔米乌斯再也不会完全相信他的前 protégé.

en: In 348 Pachomius died , naming the brother Petronios as his successor rather than the clearly qualified Theodorus .
zh: 在348年帕丘米乌斯去世,他将弟弟彼得罗尼奥斯称为他的继任者,而不是明确的德奥多拉斯。

en: The death of Petronios later that year would leave Apa Horsiesios in charge , and the popular Theodorus would retreat to the distant monastery of Phnoum .
zh: 彼得罗尼奥斯去世后,阿帕·霍尔西西奥斯(Apa Horsiesios)掌权,而著名的西奥多拉斯(Theodorus)则撤退到远处的普努姆修道院。

en: Although it seems Theodorus practiced complete submission to the new leader of the Koinonia , problems soon arose in several Pachomian monasteries that viewed Horsiesios as a weak leader .
zh: 尽管西奥多拉斯似乎完全服从了科伊诺尼亚的新领袖,但在一些帕乔米亚修道院中很快就出现了问题,他们认为霍尔西西奥斯是一个弱势的领袖。

en: Refusing to work or communicate and demanding a new leader , many of the elder monks completely abandoned any notion of obedience to Horsiesios .
zh: 许多老修道士拒绝工作或交际,并要求新领袖,完全放弃了服从霍尔西亚斯的任何概念。

en: The federation of monasteries was falling apart , and Theodorus rushed to Tabennese to placate the rebels .
zh: 修道院联盟正在瓦解,西奥多拉斯急忙赶到塔本内斯镇压叛乱者。

en: Soon after his arrival , Theodorus was the new de facto leader , though he claimed to be only acting on behalf of Horsiesios .
zh: 在他到达后不久,西奥多拉斯成为新的事实领袖,尽管他声称只是代表霍尔西西奥斯。

en: For eighteen years Theodorus administered from Pachomius ’ old headquarters in Phbow , using techniques far more assertive than his predecessors , such as constantly shuffling the offices and locations of the most ambitious monks .
zh: 18年,西奥多拉斯从帕丘米乌斯的旧总部在普博(Phbow)管理,使用比他的前任更强硬的技巧,比如不断操纵最雄心勃勃的修道士的办公室和地点。

en: Yet in spite of this somewhat unstable shifting , the Koinonia was ruled peacefully for nearly two decades , at which point Theodorus predicted he would soon die .
zh: 然而,尽管这一变化有点不稳定,科伊诺尼亚被和平统治了近二十年,这时西奥多拉斯预言他很快就会死。

en: Within a few months his prediction came true , and Apa Horsiesios once more took his place as the head of the communities in both title and authority .
zh: 在几个月内,他的预言实现了,阿帕·霍尔西亚斯再次担任社区的头衔和权力。

en: By now I 'm sure you 're wondering about the different things that I have on the table here , but first , I would like to talk to you about these three items .
zh: 到目前为止,我确信你对我摆在桌上的种种不同事情感到疑惑,但首先,我想和你谈谈这三个问题。

en: I have here , some ice in a pan , water in this glass , and steam rising from this pot .
zh: 我这里有,在锅里有一些冰,在杯子里有水,从锅里冒出蒸汽。

en: Now , I would like to ask you , how these three things .
zh: 现在,我想问你,这些三个事情如何。

en: This water in this glass , and the steam rising from this pot , just yell it out , we are informal here , yes .
zh: 这杯水,从锅里冒出来的蒸汽,就喊出来,我们在这里是非正式的,是的。

en: They are all forms of water .
zh: 它们都是水的形态。

en: This ice here of course is water , I told you there was water in this glass , and you have all seen water boil at home , so you are familiar with steam .
zh: 这块冰当然是水,我告诉过你们这杯玻璃里有水,你们都看见水在家里沸腾了,所以你们都熟悉蒸汽。

en: But now let 's try to figure out how they 're different , we 'll look at temperature , first .
zh: 但是现在让我们设法找出它们的区别,我们先看看温度。

en: And the temperature of this water here , the ice , is , about uh twenty - four – woo- nineteen degrees .
zh: 这里的水温, 冰, 大约是二十四度.

en: The temperature of this w- water here , is sixty - four degrees , the temperature of this steam , is , I know it 's hotter than that .
zh: 这里的W-水的温度是64度,这个蒸汽的温度是,我知道比那还要热。

en: Oh , and by the way guys , what do we call something that 's hard , like this ice here , or a table , or a rock ?
zh: 哦, 顺便问一下, 我们怎么称硬的东西, 比如这块冰, 或者桌子, 或者石头?

en: You should go out on the road there , like , yeah .
zh: 你应该在路上出去,像,是的。

en: Y- — oh well , I 'm glad to meet you .
zh: 哦,很高兴见到你。

en: Please give me your itinerary after the show .
zh: 演出结束后请告诉我你的行程。

en: Of course we call it a sholids .
zh: 当然,我们称它为沙利德。

en: And a solid has one shape .
zh: 一个固体有一个形状。

en: The shape that it starts out with .
zh: 它开始的形状是 。

en: And what do we call something that you — that you can splish splash ?
zh: 我们叫什么东西,你可以喷洒?

en: Take a bath in .
zh: 去洗澡吧。

en: You 're not gon na let me finish , are you ?
zh: 你不肯让我完成, 对 吗?

en: And a liquid can change its shape , to f- completely fill the bottom of whatever container you put it in .
zh: 液体可以改变形状,以完全填满任何容器的底部。

en: And finally , what do we call something that 's loose , and floating around like this steam here ?
zh: 最后, 我们叫什么东西是松弛的, 漂浮着的, 像这儿的蒸汽?

en: And a gas completely fills whatever shape container you put it in .
zh: 一个气体完全填满了你所放的任何形状的容器。

en: Add energy .
zh: 增加能量。

en: I like the way he expressed that .
zh: 我喜欢他的表达方式。

en: Never before have I heard it , add or subtract energy , or , heat , change the temperature , basically .
zh: 我从来没听说过,加或减能量,或者加热,改变温度,基本上就是这样。

en: Well folks , now I 'm going to show you something else that happens when you change the temperature , and that 's where these balloons come in .
zh: 伙计们, 现在我要向你们展示一下你改变温度时发生的事情,那就是这些气球进来的地方.

en: I have here a number of balloons , but , l- let 's see how many of these balloons , I can fit , into this little itty - bitty container here .
zh: 我这里有几个气球,但是,让我们看看这些气球有多少,我能装进这个小巧的容器里。

en: Well , everybody count together .
zh: 好吧,大家一起计数。

en: There 's a- in there .
zh: 里面有个。

en: You think , well , okay , w- th- th- , I 'm glad I never saw d- Citizen Kane with you .
zh: 你以为,好吧,我很高兴我没见过你跟大公民凯恩在一起。

en: One balloon going into the little container here .
zh: 一个气球进入这个小容器。

en: Very good counting there .
zh: 那里的计数很好。

en: Two balloons going into the little container here .
zh: 两个气球进入这个小容器。

en: Ah , they 're not fitting in so easily .
zh: 啊, 他们没那么容易适应.

en: So hopefully I can fit all balloons into this little container here .
zh: 希望我能把所有的气球都装进这个小容器里。

en: Oh stop guessing at what this is .
zh: 别猜这是什么。

en: Come on .
zh: 来吧。

en: Three balloons going onto the the little container there .
zh: 三个气球飞进那个小容器里。

en: At first he was confused , but then he figured it out .
zh: 起初他很困惑,但后来他明白了。

en: Everybody tell him what this is , it 's ...
zh: 每个人都告诉他这是什么,这是...

en: Boy you people did n't watch enough Sesame Street as a child .
zh: 伙计们,小时候你没看太多的西萨米街。

en: Ah , ah .
zh: 啊,啊。

en: And let 's do this uh , let 's add some complexities to this here , let 's do it in another language .
zh: 让我们这样做吧,让我们在这儿加一些复杂性,让我们用另一种语言去做。

en: I 'm afraid for our nation .
zh: 我担心我们的国家。

en: Thank you .
zh: 谢谢你。

en: I thought you were telling me your breakfast .
zh: 我以为你正在告诉我你的早餐。

en: Oh my gosh , eight balloons into this little container here , I bet you 're wondering r- how that happened .
zh: 哦,我的天啊,8个气球进这个小容器里,我敢打赌你想知道怎么了。

en: You popped two .
zh: 你拍了两个。

en: There 's a hole in it .
zh: 里面有个洞。

en: Well , there 's a hole , no , if you 're thinking there 's a hole , think again .
zh: 嗯, 有洞, 不, 如果你想有洞, 再想想.

en: Because , there 's no hole in the counter at all .

en: So Erasmus laid the the — laid the egg , which Luther hatched .
zh: 因此,埃拉斯穆斯就撒了—撒了蛋,路德就撒了。

en: And um , when you come then , to , uh , however this debate .
zh: 嗯, 当你来的时候, 到, 嗯, 不管这场辩论如何.

en: Um , I think uh , let me read you a page from Brendler .
zh: 嗯, 我想, 让我给你看布伦德勒的一页.

en: Because it sets the sa- stage very nicely .
zh: 因为这很好地设置了赛场。

en: This is in the Luther book some of you are reading , and um , if you , this evening when you go home , if you wan na meditate it on more , on – on it more , it 's on page three eleven .
zh: 这是在路德书里,你们的一些人正在读,um,如果你今晚回家时,如果你想更深入地思考它,就--更深入地思考它,这是在第3页11页。

en: But , let me just read you the – , cause this gives us the setting very nicely , and then we can uh , Erasmus entitled his anti-Luther pamphlet , Diatribe Concerning Free Will .
zh: 但是,让我给你读一下--因为这给了我们一个非常好的背景,然后我们可以嗯,埃拉斯马斯题为他的反卢瑟宣传册,关于自由意志的偏见。

en: Once again , the first and fundamental questions , disputed in fifteen sixteen , and fifteen seventeen , and again in Heidelberg , in April of fifteen eighteen , with which Luther had opened the assault on scholastic theology , were debated .
zh: 再次,第一和根本问题,在十五十六年争论,十五十七年,又在海德堡,在十五十八年4月,与路德开始对学校神学的攻击,进行了辩论。

en: Luther was glad to take up the theme of this debate .
zh: 路德很高兴地讨论了这次辩论的主题。

en: You alone , among all the others , have recognized the key question .
zh: 你一个人, 除其他人外, 已经认识到了关键问题.

en: You , and you alone , have identified that on which all else hinges .
zh: 你,你一个人,已经确定了所有其它的轴承。

en: And you have put the razor to the throat .
zh: 你把剃刀放在喉咙上。

en: And for that I thank you heartily .
zh: 为此,我衷心感谢你。

en: Um , thus Luther evalu- uh evaluated the subject .
zh: 因此,路德评价了这个题目。

en: And Erasmus commented on the significance of their engagement , in battle , in his own style .
zh: 埃拉斯穆斯在他的风格中,对他们参与战斗的意义作了评论。

en: And he wrote to Luther .
zh: 他写信给路德。

en: Perhaps an Erasmus who writes against you , will do more for the Gospel , than certain dunderheads who support you .
zh: 也许一个反对你写信的伊拉斯穆会为福音做更多的事,而不是那些支持你的人。

en: This is Brendler now , obs- – uh on this uh , but this sets the stage for what we 're gon na talk about .
zh: 这是布伦德勒现在, obs--对这个,但是这为我们正在谈论的事情设置了舞台。

en: Humanistic thinking will never consent to the doctrine of original sin .
zh: 人道主义思想永远不会同意原罪的教义。

en: Pico de la Mirandela would not have consented to the doctrine of original sin .
zh: 皮科·德·拉·米兰德拉(Pico de la Mirandela)不同意原罪的教义。

en: I am the master of my fate ,
zh: 我是命运的主人,

en: I am the captain of my soul .
zh: 我是我的灵魂的船长。

en: I do n't think that he would acknowledge original sin .
zh: 我认为他不会承认原罪。

en: Is based uh , alright , what is it , it 's based , as it is , on the concept , that human nature is totally depraved , and of itself not capable of any good will .
zh: 是基于的,是的,是的,是基于的,是的,是基于这个概念,人类的本性是完全堕落的,并且本身是无能的任何善意。

en: And that apart from grace alone , free will is nothing , can do nothing , does nothing , except depraved deeds .
zh: 除了恩典之外,自由意志是没有的,不能做任何事,除了毁坏的行为。

en: Even though these pronouncements are Biblically based , and may be acceptable within an exclusively theological system , they do not appear reconcilable with the dignity of man- – dignity of man .
zh: 尽管这些说法是以圣经为基础的,并且可能只是在神学体系中接受的,但它们似乎与人类的尊严不相容————人类的尊严。

en: Catholic , and semi-pelagianism , with all of its emphasis on on the role of prevenient grace , finally views free will as the decisive factor in attaining salvation , thereby conceptualizing free will , as similar to a healthy man- – healthy human understanding .
zh: 天主教,半群岛主义,强调预防性恩典的作用,最终认为自由意志是实现救赎的决定因素,从而将自由意志概念化,类似于健康人的--健康人的理解。

en: For how can a person , be responsible for his deeds , if he possesses no free will ?
zh: 如果一个人没有自由意志,他怎么能为自己的行为负责呢?

en: How can he decide between good and evil ?
zh: 他怎么能决定善恶呢?

en: So reasoned Erasmus .
zh: 这就是Erasmus的理由。

en: Such arguments , long known to Luther , and many times presented to him , impressed him not in the least .
zh: 这样的论点,长期被路德所知,并多次向他提出,对他留下了深刻的印象。

en: He alone condemns .
zh: 只有他才能谴责。

en: He alone grants grace .
zh: 只有他才能给予恩典。

en: Man can do nothing against the divine prerogative .
zh: 人类对上帝的特权无能为力。

en: Man can only accept the divine judgment .
zh: 人只能接受上帝的审判。

en: And if by — and — and it is by the divine prerogative , that man will — uh , that man is well provided for .
zh: 而且如果通过 — — 而且是通过神圣的特权,那人会 — — 啊,那人得到了充分的保障。

en: For God alone is infallible , and his being is grace and mercy .
zh: 因为 只有 神 是 不可 错的, 他的 存在 是 恩典 和 慈悲 。

en: This concept , that man is divinely elected to salvation , or to damnation , is the center of the predestination dogma , that later , the Geneva reformer Calvin , made the center of his teaching , and that subsequently , under other historical preconditions and circumstances , could be linked closely with a prosperous middle class , in the Netherlands , and in England .
zh: 这一概念,即人类被上帝所选为拯救,或被诅咒,是先知论的中心,后来,日内瓦改革者卡尔文,成为他的教学的中心,随后,在其他历史先决条件和环境下,可以与富裕的中产阶级紧密联系,在荷兰和英格兰。

en: Um , uh , skip this paragraph .
zh: 嗯,省掉这个段落。

en: Therefore , Luther did not accept rational arguments against predestination doctrine .
zh: 因此, 路德不接受对先知论的理性论点.

en: Such arguments , on the contrary , necessarily appeared to Luther , given his theological orientation , as suspicious , from the very start , because they originated from human nature , which exalted itself against God .
zh: 相反,这样的论点必然出现在路德身上,因为路德的神学倾向,从一开始就令人怀疑,因为这些论点源于人类的本性,它自高自烈地反对上帝。

en: The whore reason prefers to submit to the Devil , adjusts to all situations , and proves everything , that is demanded of her .
zh: 女人的理性倾向于屈服于魔鬼,适应所有情况,证明一切,要求她。

en: Human nature , does not possess free will .
zh: 人的本性, 不具有自由意志.

en: Now , number one , we have to admit first – v- first off , that there seem to be passages , there are passages in the Scriptures .
zh: 现在,第一,我们必须首先承认--第一,似乎有段落,有段落在圣经中。

en: Which seem to teach , that man is responsible for his deeds , and that he may act , and has a free will to respond to the invitation of God .
zh: 这似乎是教导人,人为自己的行为负责,他可以行动,并有自由的意愿应付上帝的邀请。

en: Whosoever will may come .
zh: 任何人都可以来。

en: Um , Jesus turned to his disciples , you remember , when some deserted him , and seemed , because they were disappointed in some of his sayings , and they were offended by some of the things he said , and they walked no longer with him it said .
zh: 嗯,耶稣转向他的门徒,你们记得,当有人离开他的时候,他们似乎,因为他们对他的一些话感到失望,他所说的一些话也使他们生气,他们不再跟他说的那样走。

en: And then he turned to those who remained , and he said , will ye also go away ?
zh: 然后他转向那些留下的人,说, 你们还要走 吗?

en: They had a choice .
zh: 他们有选择。

en: Will you go away ?
zh: 你会走吗?

en: What do you will ?
zh: 你会做什么?

en: And the will , apparently was , re- resided in in these disciples .
zh: 显然,意志在这些门徒中重新存在。

en: And so Erasmus is going to say , so obviously , in Scripture we have paradox .
zh: 因此,厄拉斯姆将说,很明显,在圣经中我们有悖论。

en: We have clear passages of Scripture , which seem to indicate that man has a free will , and that he can exercise that will , to follow , or not to follow .
zh: 我们有明确的圣经段落,似乎表明人有自由意志,并且他可以行使这种意志,去追随,或不去追随。

en: To respond or not to respond .
zh: 回答或不回答。

en: On the other hand , we have passages of Scripture , which seem to indicate , that the will is not free , and that the – , and that man i- th- is – man is predestined by a an omnipotent sovereign will of God .
zh: 另一方面,我们有圣经的段落,这些段落似乎表明,意志不是自由的,而且--和那个人--是--人类是由上帝的万能主意决定的。
