en: But as people in the study aged , they placed more emphasis on the quality - not quantity - of sexual encounters .
zh: 但随着研究对象年龄的增长, 他们更加强调性接触的质量而不是数量.

en: For example , frequency of sex became less important with age , and the amount of thought and effort invested in sex became more important .
zh: 例如,随着年龄的增长,性行为的频率越来越小,对性行为投入的思考和努力量也越来越重要。

en: These changing priorities were key predictors of sexual quality of life for older adults , and appeared to buffer its decline .
zh: 这些变化的优先次序是老年人性生活质量的关键预测因素,并且似乎缓和了其下降。

en: When we matched older and younger adults on key characteristics of their sex lives - along with sociodemographic characteristics , and mental and physical health - older adults actually had better sexual quality of life .
zh: 通过对老年人和年轻人的性生活关键特征--以及社会人口特征、心理健康和身体健康--进行比较,发现老年人的性生活质量 actually better 。

en: For example , if we compared a 40 - year - old man and a 50 - year - old man with the same levels of perceived control over their sex life , who invest the same amount of thought and effort in their sex life , have sex with the same frequency and had the same number of sexual partners in the past year , we would expect the 50 - year - old to report better sexual quality of life .
zh: 例如,如果我们比较一个40 岁男性和一个50 岁男性,他们对性生活有同样的感知控制水平,他们对性生活投入同样的思考和努力,性生活频率相同,并且在过去的一年里有同样的性伴侣,我们预计50 岁男性的性生活质量会更好。

en: This is consistent with the improvement we see in other life domains with age , and highlights the benefits of life experience for sexuality as people learn more about their sexual preferences and their partners ' likes and dislikes .
zh: 这与我们看到其他生活领域随着年龄的进步相一致,并突出了生活经验对性行为的好处,因为人们更多地了解他们的性爱偏好和他们的伴侣"喜欢和不喜欢。

en: The positive relationship between sexual quality of life and aging was strongest in the context of good - quality romantic relationships , where sexual exploration and a focus on partners ' pleasure is more likely to take place .
zh: 性生活质量与老龄化之间的积极关系最为强烈,在高质量的浪漫关系中,性探索和对伴侣“ 快乐”的关注更有可能发生。

en: Together these findings suggest that as we age , our sexual priorities change and we develop knowledge , skills and preferences that protect against aging - related declines in sexual quality of life .
zh: 这些发现表明,随着年龄的增长,我们的性优先次序发生了变化,我们发展了知识、技能和偏好,从而防止性生活质量与年龄有关的下降。

en: Since wisdom is " the quality of having experience , knowledge and good judgment , " our study suggests that life experience is fostering sexual wisdom .
zh: 由于智慧是“ 有经验 、 知识和判断力的品质 ”, 我们的研究表明, 生活经验是促进性智慧的.

en: This is great news , as a satisfying sex life has been found to be important for health and well - being , regardless of age .
zh: 这是好消息, 因为令人满意的性生活已经被发现对健康和福祉至关重要, 不论年龄.

en: For older adults in particular , being sexually active predicts a longer and healthier life .
zh: 对老年人而言,性行为的积极性预示了更长更健康的生活。

en: We now know that age - related declines in sexual quality of life are largely related to modifiable factors , so we can target sexual skills , beliefs and attitudes in clinical interventions .
zh: 我们现在知道,与年龄有关的性生活质量下降主要与可变因素有关,因此我们可以在临床干预中针对性技能、信仰和态度。

en: Given that our life expectancy continues to grow , this research highlights the opportunity to facilitate positive sexual experiences across the lifespan .
zh: 鉴于我们的预期寿命持续增长,这项研究突出了促进终身积极性体验的机会。

en: Their article first appeared in The Conversation .
zh: 他们的文章首次出现在《对话》中。

en: It was spring , the barren time in March when you can not be sure if it is really warmer , but you are so desperate for change that you tell yourself the mud at the edge of the sidewalk is different from winter mud and you are sure that the smell of wet soil has suddenly a bit of the scent of summer rains , of grass and drowned earthworms .
zh: 那是春天,三月份的荒凉时间,你不能确定是否真的暖和,但你对变化如此绝望,你自言自语地说,路边的泥土与冬天的泥土不同,你确信湿土的气味突然有夏雨、草木和溺水的土虫的香味。

en: I was wearing a yellow linen dress which my mother had picked out and which I therefore disliked although I knew it flattered me .
zh: 我穿着一件我母亲挑选的黄色衬衣,因此我不喜欢,虽然我知道这使我很满意。

en: My shoes were white and I was concentrating on keeping them out of the mud .
zh: 我的鞋子是白色的,我正集中精力把它们远离泥土。

en: My father and I were going to mass — my mother did not go ; she was Protestant .
zh: 我父亲和我要去弥撒 — — 我母亲没有去,她是新教徒。

en: My father put his hand on top of my hair , his palm on my head , and I could feel the bone of my skull and my skin and his hot palm , so dry and strong .
zh: 我父亲把手放在我的头发上,他的手放在我的头上,我能感觉到我的骨头和皮肤以及他的热的手掌,如此干燥而强壮。

en: When I was a little girl , he did that often , and called me Muscles .
zh: 我小的时候,他经常这样,叫我肌肉。

en: I could not help arching my back a little , I wanted to push against his hand like a cat but the instinct that comes with being thirteen , the half - understood caution that makes a girl timid , or wild , the shyness told me to just walk .
zh: 我不能不把背拱起来一点,我想要像猫一样向他伸出手来,但与13岁时带来的本能,半明白的谨慎,使一个女孩胆怯,或野蛮,羞怯告诉我要走。

en: I wanted to feel the rough edge of the pocket of his coat against my cheek , but I was too tall .
zh: 我想摸摸他的外套口袋的粗糙边缘,可是我太高了。

en: But I still wanted to push against his hand and put my hand in his pocket and steal the leather palmed glove , that secret animal .
zh: 但我还是想向他伸出手,把手放在他的口袋里,偷走那件皮手套,那只秘密的动物。

en: Instead I went into the church , took a Bulletin , dipped my finger in Holy Water and genuflected .
zh: 相反,我走进教堂,拿了一份通讯,把手指插进圣水里,转过身来。

en: The inside of the church smelled like damp wood and furniture polish , not alive at all .
zh: 教堂的内部 smelled like damp wood and furniture polish, not alive at all。

en: My father took off his coat and draped it over the edge of the pew and when I came back from communion I stole his glove .
zh: 我父亲脱下他的外套,把它 draped over the edge of the pew,当我从公会回来时,我偷了他的手套。

en: The paper taste of the wafer was still in my mouth and I took a deep breath of the leather .
zh: 面包的纸味还在我的嘴里,我深深地吸了一口气。

en: It smelled like March .
zh: 它闻起来像三月。

en: We walked back through the school because it was drizzling , my father tall in his navy suit and my shoes going click on the linoleum .
zh: 我们穿过学校,因为雨水滴着,我父亲身着海军服高高,我的鞋子正踩着毛毯。

en: There were two classes of each grade , starting at the sixth and going down to the first .
zh: 每个班级都有两个班级,从第六班开始到第一班。

en: The hall ended in a T and we went left through the gym , walked underneath the bleachers and stood next to the side door , waiting for the rain to stop .
zh: 体育馆在T字段结束,我们走到左边,穿过体育馆,走到漂白剂下面,站在侧门旁边,等待雨停。

en: My father was a young man , thirty - five , younger because he liked to be outside , to play softball on Saturday and to take my mother and me camping on vacation .
zh: 我父亲是个年轻人, 35 岁, 更年轻,因为他喜欢在户外, 星期六玩软球,并带我妈妈和我去野营度假.

en: He stood rocked back on his heels with his coat thrown over his shoulders and his hands in his pockets .
zh: 他背着脚跟摇摇晃晃地站着,他的外套丢在肩上,双手插在口袋里。

en: I thought of bacon and eggs , toast with peach jam out of the jar .
zh: 我想到了面包和鸡蛋,用桃酱烤 out of the jar。

en: There were things in the shadows ; a metal pail , a mop , rags .
zh: 阴影里有东西: 金属桶 、 毛布 、 毛布.

en: Next to the door was a tall wrought - iron candle holder — the kind that stood at either end of the altar .
zh: 门边有一个高高的铁烛台 — — 像祭坛两端的那种。

en: There was no holder and the end was jagged .
zh: 没有扣子,末端被夹住。

en: On the floor was a wrapper from a French Chew .
zh: 地板上有一只法国奶酪的包装。

en: They were sold at eighth - grade basketball games on Friday nights .
zh: 他们在周五晚上的八年级篮球比赛上被卖掉.

en: The light from the door made the shadows under the bleachers darker , the long space stretched far away .
zh: 门上的灯光使漂白剂下面的阴影变得更暗,长长的空间延伸了很远。

en: I heard the rain and the faint rustle of paper and smelled damp concrete .
zh: 我听到了雨声和纸张的微弱响声,还有湿的混凝土的气味。

en: I did not go near my father but kept my hand in my pocket , feeling the soft leather glove .
zh: 我没有靠近父亲,而是把手放在口袋里,感受着柔软的皮手套。

en: There was a rustling on the concrete and the drizzle of soft rain .
zh: 混凝土上响起了 rustling 和轻微的雨滴。

en: I wondered if anyone ever went back under the bleachers , if there were crickets or mice there .
zh: 我想知道有没有人回到漂白机里,有没有 crickets 或 mice 。

en: I wished the rain would stop .
zh: 我希望雨停下来。

en: I wanted to go home .
zh: 我想回家。

en: I made noises with my heels but they were too loud so I stopped .
zh: 我用脚跟发出声音,但声音太大了,所以我停下来。

en: Something else clicked and I tried to see what it was but could n’t see anything .
zh: 其他东西点击了,我试着看它是什么,但什么也看不见。

en: It was n’t as loud as my heels .
zh: 它不像我的脚跟那么响亮。

en: My father cleared his throat , looking out the door .
zh: 我父亲把喉咙清开,看着门外。

en: I imagined a man down there in the dark , an escaped convict or a madman .
zh: 我在黑暗中想象了一个男人,一个逃亡的囚犯或一个疯子。

en: It had nearly stopped raining .
zh: 雨几乎停止了。

en: In fifteen minutes we would be home and my mother would fry eggs .
zh: 十五分钟后,我们就会回家,妈妈会煎蛋。

en: My father heard it , too , but he pretended not to , at least he did n’t turn his head .
zh: 我父亲也听到了,但他假装没有,至少他没转过头。

en: And there was a heavier sound , a rasp , like a box pulled over concrete .
zh: 还有一个更重的声音,像一个被拉过混凝土的盒子一样。

en: I looked at my father but he did n’t turn his head .
zh: 我看着我父亲,但他没有转过头。

en: I wished he would turn his head .
zh: 我希望他能转头。

en: There was a click again and the rustle , and I could not think of what it could be .
zh: 又一次敲响了一声,响起了响声,我无法想象它会是什么。

en: I had no explanation for the particular combination of sounds .
zh: 我对这种特殊的声音的组合没有解释。

en: No doubt there was , some two things that happened to be making noises at the same time .
zh: 毫无疑问,有两个事情发生了同时发出声音。

en: Once in a fever I heard thousands of birds outside my window and I was terrified that they would fling themselves through the glass and attack me , but it was only the rain on the eaves .
zh: 有一次发烧时,我听到窗外有成千上万的鸟儿,我担心它们会从玻璃中跳出来攻击我,但只是在树枝上下雨了。

en: She leaned against the kitchen counter , picking dried glaze from the wrinkles in the back of her hand .
zh: 她靠着厨房柜台,从手背上的皱纹中取出干玻璃。

en: From the wireless headset that dangled from her neck , her old marine buddies called to her with joyous profanity and the bass of digital gunfire .
zh: 从她脖子上的无线耳机里,她的老海员朋友用欢快的狂言和数字枪声呼唤她。

en: The Xbox was upstairs .
zh: Xbox在楼上。

en: Her buddies were in San Diego and Cleveland .
zh: 她的朋友在圣地亚哥和克利夫兰。

en: Satellite coverage in Santa ’s Village was just another Christmas miracle , like faster - than - light travel and stuffing oneself through gas fireplaces with neither explosions nor lawsuits nipping at your heels .
zh: 圣诞老人村的卫星覆盖只是另一个圣诞奇迹, 像快于光的旅行和通过燃气暖炉填补自己,没有爆炸和诉讼在你的脚跟上.

en: Santa had said he needed to leave at eight .
zh: 圣诞老人说他必须在八点钟离开。

en: She ’d garlic - salted the yams to the tune of Gomez unloading his Glock into a drug dealer .
zh: 她把洋葱加盐,听得像戈梅斯把他的吉克放进毒品贩子里一样。

en: She ’d painted the ham with maple glaze while Williams punctuated Patty Smyth ’s “ Goodbye to You ” with bursts from his assault rifle .
zh: 威廉姆斯用他的攻击步枪射击帕蒂·史密斯的“ 再见 ” 。

en: “ Her boys , ” as she called them , did n’t take a lot of eggnog in their rum .
zh: 她叫他们“ 她的男孩 ”, 他们不把蛋蜜多喝在酒里.

en: Santa had spent his day opening envelopes from North American children and falling asleep watching the Pittsburgh - Cleveland game in the media room .
zh: 圣诞老人花了一整天在媒体厅里看匹兹堡 - 克利夫兰的比赛,打开了北美洲儿童的信封,睡着了。

en: Now he was in the kitchen , awake and on his way out the door , because suddenly spending fifteen minutes eating dinner with his wife had become too much of a burden on this most wonderful night of the year .
zh: 现在他正在厨房里,醒来,正要走出门,因为突然,他和妻子一起吃晚饭十五分钟就成了一年中最美好的夜晚的重担。

en: His white V - neck undershirt was tucked into his pants in front , pulled taught over his belly .
zh: 他的白色V - 颈下衬衫被塞在前面的裤子里, 背在腹部上.

en: It stretched the neckhole halfway down to his happy trail .
zh: 它沿着半路伸到他的幸福小径上。

en: His hands were finding their way through the armholes of his robe .
zh: 他的双手正穿过他的礼服的胳膊孔。

en: Santa ’s first wife had died centuries ago , but he always just dismissed the question of his own mortality .
zh: 圣诞老人的第一个妻子已经去世了几百年了,但他总是不理会自己的死亡问题。

en: Betty never knew how naughty she should feel about wanting to strangle him sometimes .
zh: 贝蒂从来没知道她为什么会想窒息他。

en: “ You ’re seriously going to let me eat alone again on Christmas Eve ? ”
zh: “ 你真打算让我在圣诞节前夕再一个人吃饭 吗? ”

en: He slung his belt around his back , and gave it a quick tug .
zh: 他把腰带裹在背上, 然后快速拉动.

en: His waist shrunk from dangerously obese to barely jolly .
zh: 他的腰部从危险的肥胖变为几乎没有快乐的。

en: A few crumpled bills in American currency fell out of his pocket .
zh: 他口袋里掉了几张美国货币的碎纸。

en: Distorted shouting erupted from Betty ’s headset .
zh: 贝蒂的耳机发出歪曲的声音。

en: She imagined red and yellow mosaic bursts lighting up the sunless snowscape outside , as if there was an HDTV behind the blinds instead of their kitchen window .
zh: 她想象着红色和黄色的 mosaic 爆炸点亮了外面的无阳光的雪景,仿佛在窗帘后面没有厨房的窗户,而是有一台HDTV。

en: One of her boys probably stepped on a landmine .
zh: 她的一个男孩可能踩到了地雷。

en: Williams , she guessed .
zh: 她猜想,威廉姆斯。

en: She thought she could hear Gomez laughing .
zh: 她以为她能听到戈梅斯笑。

en: She picked up the pans in which she ’d made the potatoes and maple glaze .
zh: 她拿起她做的土豆和枫叶玻璃的盘子。

en: She put them in the sink to soak .
zh: 她把它们放在水槽里浸泡。

en: The gingerbread batter bowl could wait a day , even though it would take longer to clean tomorrow .
zh: 姜饼打 bowl可以等一天, 尽管明天要更长时间才能打扫.

en: For now , she appreciated its fight to cover the ham - stink that coated the room .
zh: 到目前为止, 她赞赏了它为掩盖屋子里弥漫的咸味而作的斗争.

en: The jingle bell chimed on Santa ’s cell .
zh: 圣诞老人的房间里响起了响亮的铃声。

en: “ Nutcrackers , ” he said .
zh: ”他说。

en: Would you be a doll ? ”
zh: 你会做娃娃 吗? ”

en: “ Your secretary ’s calling , and you need me to answer it ?
zh: “ 你的秘书正在打电话, 你需要我来回答吗?

en: She lifted her headset ’s microphone to her mouth .
zh: 她把耳机的麦克风举到嘴边。

en: “ Moroz out .
zh: ”摩洛兹说。

en: “ Copy that , ” Gomez said on the other end .
zh: “ Copy that, ” 戈梅斯在另一边说.

en: Betty switched off her headset mic .
zh: 贝蒂关掉她的耳机麦克风。

en: She unclipped the cell phone from the back of Santa ’s girdle , and pushed the button with the green arrow , serrated to look like a double - edged diving knife .
zh: 她把手机从圣诞老人的腰带上拆开,用绿色箭头按一下按钮,使它看起来像一把双边的潜水刀。

en: Or a Christmas tree , if that was more your thing .
zh: 或者圣诞树,如果你更喜欢的话。

en: “ On his way , ” Betty said .
zh: ”贝蒂说。

en: When Tyler was very young , his grandmother was his favorite person in the world because , unlike his parents , who believed that children should always be told the truth as adults understood it , she would fill in the gaps in his knowledge — Santa Claus , the Easter Bunny , God .
zh: 当泰勒很小的时候,他的祖母是世界上最喜欢的人,因为,与他的父母不同,他们相信孩子们应该永远被告知真相,因为成年人明白这一点,她会填补他的知识的空白 — — 圣诞老人,复活节 Bunny,上帝。

en: His parents were always too busy and often a little too serious , but his grandmother had a sense of peace about her , a lightness that lifted his spirit .
zh: 他的父母总是太忙,而且常常有点太严肃,但是他的祖母对她有一种平静的感觉,一种轻松,使他振奋起来。

en: A few times , when Tyler ’s parents were away , she took him with her to church .
zh: 数次,当泰勒的父母不在时,她带他去教堂。

en: He remembered liking the singing and the colorful windows , and how safe he felt there , in that large , empty space , sitting on a hard bench next to her warmth .
zh: 他记得喜欢歌声和色彩鲜艳的窗子,在那个大空的空间里,坐在她温暖的旁边的一张硬凳上,他觉得多么安全。

en: When she died , grief overwhelmed Tyler .
zh: 当她去世时, 泰勒的悲伤被压倒了.

en: But like most adults , when he grew older he could only recall the intensity of that love in childhood in an abstract way .
zh: 但像大多数成年人一样,当他长大成人时,他只能抽象地回忆起童年的那种爱。

en: He made the common error of identifying maturity with worth , and assumed that the love he had for her as a young child must have been lacking in strength and depth .
zh: 他常犯的错误是把成熟与价值区分开来,并假定他对她年轻时的爱一定是缺乏力量和深度。

en: For many years after her death , however , Tyler was tortured by the memory of a certain visit from her .
zh: 然而,她死后多年,泰勒被她某次访问的记忆所折磨。

en: He was five or so , and they were playing some board game at the kitchen table .
zh: 他大概五岁,他们正在厨房桌边玩板游戏。

en: As he swung his legs in his excitement , he kicked her repeatedly in the shins .
zh: 当他兴奋地挥舞着腿的时候,他反复踢着她的 shins。

en: She asked him to stop , and he refused , giggling .
zh: 她叫他停下来, 但他拒绝了, 笑了笑.

en: When she finally frowned at him and threatened to stop playing if he did n’t stop he told her to go to Hell .
zh: 最后,她吓了一跳他,威胁说如果他不停下来,他就要送她去地狱。

en: In Tyler ’s mind he could see her face grow taut , lose color , and then , for the only time he could remember , she began to cry .
zh: 在泰勒的脑子里,他看见她的脸变得变色了,失去色泽,然后,他唯一能记住的时候,她开始哭泣。

en: He also remembered his own utter confusion .
zh: 他还想起自己的完全混乱。

en: His parents did not have much use for religion and so for him Hell was a word without much mystery or power .
zh: 他的父母对宗教没有多用,所以对他来说,“地狱”是一个没有 mystery 或 power 的词。

en: At that time he knew only vaguely that Hell was a place you did not want to go , like the dark basement or the even darker attic .
zh: 那时,他只是模糊地知道地狱是你不想去的地方,就像黑暗的地下室或更黑暗的阁楼。

en: He remembered feeling resentful that she was crying and he did not even understand why .
zh: 他记得她哭得很生气,他甚至不明白为什么。

en: Tyler felt the guilt of this memory even in his teenage years .
zh: 泰勒甚至在十几岁时也感到这种记忆的愧疚。

en: For him it summed up all his insecurities and fears about his own cruelty , ignorance , and the possibility that he was , in reality , not a good person .
zh: 对于他来说,这总结了他对自己的残忍、无知以及他实际上不是个好人的可能性的所有不安全感和恐惧。

en: The fact that he had caused someone who loved him such pain with so little effort and understanding troubled him deeply .
zh: 由于他用很少的努力和理解来伤害了爱他的人,这使他感到非常不安。

en: One day Tyler looked through an old family photo album , and in it was a picture of the kitchen in the house they used to live in .
zh: 一天,泰勒看了看一张旧的家族照片,里面有一张他们过去住的房子里的厨房的照片。

en: He was surprised to discover that the small kitchen contained a central island , and had no space for the table in his memory at all .
zh: 他惊奇地发现这个小厨房里有一个中心岛,他的记忆里没有桌子的空间。

en: With the discovery of that single error in his memory came a cascade of other revelations .
zh: 在他记忆中发现了那个单一的错误后,又出现了一系列的其他启示。

en: Now he remembered that they always ate in the dining room , and when they did play board games , it was always on the coffee table in the living room .
zh: 现在他想起他们总是在餐厅吃饭,当他们玩板游戏时,它总是在客厅的咖啡桌上。

en: The memory that had caused him such pain over the years could not possibly have occurred .
zh: 多年来他所遭受的那种痛苦是不可能发生的。

en: Somehow , he must have manufactured the whole scene in his imagination .
zh: 他一定在想象中制造了整个场景。

en: It was not very hard to explain what really happened , he thought .
zh: 解释到底发生了什么并不难,他想。

en: The death of his grandmother had probably caused in him feelings of abandonment and guilt .
zh: 他的祖母去世可能使他感到放弃和罪恶。

en: In his confusion he had taken elements from storybooks and imagined out of nothing this memory to punish himself .
zh: 在混乱中,他从故事书中拿了些元素,从空想中想象出这个记忆来惩罚自己。

en: This was the sort of fantasy that could have occurred to any young child who lost an important relative .
zh: 这是可能发生在失去一个重要的亲戚的任何小孩身上的幻想。

en: With that realization , the image of his grandmother crying faded in his memory and became less and less believable .
zh: 有了这种认识,他的祖母哭泣的形象在记忆中消失了,变得越来越难以置信。

en: Tyler thought he was very lucky to have discovered the single error in his false memory , which enabled him to reason his way into distinguishing between reality and fantasy .
zh: 泰勒认为他非常幸运地发现了他的虚构记忆中的一个错误,这使他能够辨别现实与幻想的方法。

en: He felt that it was a coming - of - age moment .
zh: 他觉得这是一个即将成年 的时刻.

en: Nonetheless , he admitted to himself that he was a little sad also at the discovery .
zh: 尽管如此,他还是承认自己对这一发现有些悲伤。

en: For however imaginary that memory was , it was also a part of his love for his grandmother .
zh: 不管记忆多么虚构,它也是他对祖母的爱的一部分。

en: When that memory lost its compelling aura of truth , it was like another part of her died with it .
zh: 当那个记忆失去其令人难以置信的真理的光辉时,就像她另一部分同它一起死去一样。

en: He had no name for the emptiness that remained .
zh: 他没有留下的空虚的名字。

en: You ’re on the 236th - level Kaiserstrasse moving sidewalk when you see her .
zh: 当你看到她时,你正站在236级凯撒街的行走道上。

en: You ’re leaning on the railing , waiting to ask Derya about a job , watching the glittering stream of mites that arc over half the sky — flying up to rewind their nanosprings in the stratospheric sunlight , flying down to make Frankfurt run .
zh: 你正靠在栏杆上,等待去问德里亚关于工作,看着闪烁的光线在天空的一半上旋转 — — 它们在 stratospheric阳光下飞来回旋转它们的纳米弹簧,飞下来让法兰克福跑。

en: You never get tired of watching them .
zh: 你从不厌倦看着他们。

en: She ’s on the Holbeinsteg bridge .
zh: 她在霍尔宾斯泰格桥上。

en: Someone ’s hung it up here — a hundred meters of clean gray and green twentieth - century modernism , plucked up from the river Main and suspended in the chilly air 2,360 meters up , between a lump of wooded parkland and a cluster of antique subway cars .
zh: 在这儿有人把它挂起来 — 100米的清澈的灰色和绿色的20世纪现代主义,从Main河上拔出来,悬挂在寒冷的空气中,高2,360米,在一片树木的公园和一团古老地铁车之间。

en: She ’s wearing a 1950s sundress and a broad - brimmed hat , and it ’s like an essay on the last century — the austere steel bridge , the bright blobs of subway graffiti , and her yellow dress , flapping against her legs as she climbs over the bridge ’s rail .
zh: 她穿着1950年代的太阳衣和宽阔的帽子,这就像一篇关于上个世纪的论文 — — 坚硬的钢桥,地铁的壁画的明亮的斑点,和她的黄色的裙子,当她爬过桥的铁轨时,拍拍脚。

en: She ’s a strawberry blonde , slim , her skin blank and virginal as new butter .
zh: 她是一个草莓的金发, 瘦身, 皮肤白白,像新黄油一样纯洁.

en: She ’s beyond the rail now , hanging out over the mountain - high drop .
zh: 她现在离铁轨远了, 悬挂在山顶上的悬崖上.

en: Thin translucent shadows move across her — the shadows of the neosilk - and - nanotube filaments that hang the city from the hundreds of five - kilometer - high towers that encircle it .
zh: 薄透明的影子在她身上移动 — — 那些环绕城市的五千米高的塔楼的纳米管和纳米管线的影子。

en: ( A civic agent notices you noticing , and attaches itself to your infospace , whispering statistics —
zh: (一个公民代理人注意到你注意到,并把自己锁定在你的信息空间上,低声说出统计数字 —

en: “ Each object ’s suspension must weather a class 5 hurricane and the destruction of 80 % of the towers ” —
zh: “ 每个物体的悬挂必须经受5级飓风和80%的塔楼的破坏 ” —

en: until you brush it away . )
zh: 直到你把它擦掉为止。

en: You ’re watching her lean out .
zh: 你看着她向外倾斜。

en: The wind whips her hair , ruffles the skirt around her knees .
zh: 风刮着她的头发, 把裙子缠绕在膝盖上.

en: You remember your first trip to the upper levels : leaning over the edge into the angry swarm of mites , whirring and buzzing warnings and shoving you back like a million mosquito chaperones .
zh: 你记得你第一次到上层的旅行:倾斜在边缘进入愤怒的虫群,旋转和响亮的警告和击退你像一百万蚊子。

en: Everyone tries it once — Except that there are n’t any mites around her .
zh: 每个人都试一次 — 只是她周围没有虫子。

en: You clutch the railing .
zh: 你抓住栏杆。

en: Hot , animal fear surges in your chest .
zh: 热, 动物恐惧涌入你的胸前.

en: She looks up at you and , across the gap of forty meters , smiles a brilliant , heartbreaking smile .
zh: 她抬头看着你,穿过四十米的空隙,露出一副灿烂的、伤心的微笑。

en: Then she lets go and falls .
zh: 然后她就走了,摔倒了。

en: “ Fucking airsurfers , ” says Derya .
zh: 德里亚说, “ 这些混蛋是空中冲浪者. ”

en: He steps off the moving sidewalk near you : tall , hook - nosed , the fashionable whorls of pox and acne making constellations of his cheeks and chest ; the glowing , formal tattoos of his committees and lifebrands adorning his massive triceps .
zh: 他从你身边那条行走的马路上走出来: 高高 、 有钩鼻 、 流行的麻疹和 acne的胡子,他的脸颊和胸部的星座; 闪耀的, 正式的他的委员会的纹身和生活品牌装饰他的巨大胸膛.

en: You swallow on a dry throat .
zh: 你在干喉咙里吞下去。

en: He gives you a hooded look .
zh: 他给你一个头戴帽子的眼光。

en: “ They infect themselves with some designer virus -
zh: “他们感染了某种设计病毒——

en: it lets them hack the city ’s person - recognition systems .
zh: 它允许他们入侵城市的个人识别系统。

en: So the mites do n’t see them when they jump .
zh: 因此它们跳起来时不会看到它们。

en: She ’s swept past the whalelike oval of the public pool on the 202nd , past the sloping mandala of the Google of offices on the 164th .
zh: 她在202号公共游泳池的鲸鱼形椭圆形上扫过,164号办公室的谷歌的斜坡曼达拉上扫过。

en: Now the mites are finally closing in .
zh: 现在虫子终于到了。

en: A silver swarm coalesces around the 164th , and she vanishes into it , like a snip of scallion into cloudy miso soup .
zh: 一个银团在1664年左右聚合起来,她消失在里面,像头皮被剥成了云雾的味噌汤一样。

en: When the cloud disperses , she ’s standing on one of the Stock Exchange ’s upside - down overhangs .
zh: 当云散布时, 她站在股票交易所的顶顶上.

en: She waves , antlike , then crawls through a dormer window .
zh: 她像蚂蚁般摇摆,然后爬过一个卧室的窗子。

en: “ It ’s not funny , ” Derya says .
zh: 德里亚说:“ 这可不是有趣的。

en: “ They ’re a huge drain on emergency preparedness .
zh: 他们对紧急准备工作造成了巨大的损失。

en: “ Freeloaders drive systemic evolution , ” you find yourself saying .
zh: “自由载荷驱动系统进化, ”你发现自己说。

en: “ Do n’t you quote the founders at me , ” Derya snaps .
zh: “ 别把我的创始者引用了, ” 德里亚说.

en: He stares until you meet his eye .
zh: 他凝视着你直到你看见他的眼睛。

en: “ You even talk to those people -
zh: “ 你甚至跟那些人说话——

en: are you paying attention ? —
zh: 你在注意吗?

en: you even talk to them , your rep will be trashed on all the major servers .
zh: 你甚至和他们说话,你的代理人将被丢弃在所有主要服务器上。

en: You wo n’t work , you wo n’t party , you ’ll be defriended by every one of your tribes .
zh: 你不能工作,你不能参加聚会,你的每一个部落都会把你解为朋友。

en: Her broad - brimmed hat is still sailing on the wind .
zh: 她那宽阔的帽子仍然在风上航行.

en: The mites missed it .
zh: 虫子错过了。

en: It cuts between the towers of the 50th .
zh: 它切断了50世纪的塔。

en: There are heaps of yellowed euros and deutschmarks dumped here , like snowdrifts .
zh: 这里堆满了黄色的欧元和德国马克,像雪漂着一样。

en: You realize : no mites .
zh: 你会意识到:没有虫子。

en: The city has no eyes or ears here .
zh: 这个城市没有眼睛或耳朵。

en: You walk through empty , miteless rooms , stepping around light fixtures .
zh: 你穿过空虚无味的房间,穿过灯具。

en: Then she ’s there , in a doorway .
zh: 然后她就在门口。

en: She comes to you .
zh: 她来找你。

en: “ You want it ? ” she says .
zh: 她说:“ 你要 吗? ”

en: “ You want to be infected ?
zh: “ 你想感染 吗?

en: You want to fly ? ”
zh: 你想飞吗? ”

en: You nod .
zh: 你点点头。

en: Eyes closing , she leans in for the kiss .
zh: 她闭上眼睛, 向对方倾斜去接吻.

en: Everyone ’s just watching the weird retarded girl except this one chubby guy who ’s trying to get her to put down the lights but who ’s afraid to touch her .
zh: 大家都只是看着这个奇怪的迟钝女孩,除了这个笨拙的家伙,他想让她关掉灯,但怕碰她。

en: “ Not supposed to touch those , ” he says .
zh: 他说:“ 不应该碰那些. ”

en: “ Where ’s your mom ?
zh: “ 你的妈妈在哪儿?

en: The chubby guy frowns at me .
zh: 那个胖子对我皱眉头。

en: “ Cara , ” I say .
zh: “ 卡拉 ” 我说道。

en: Cara looks at me , looks at the lights .
zh: 卡拉看着我,看着灯光。

en: I gently try to take them .
zh: 我小心翼翼地试着带走他们。

en: “ No ! ” she wails .
zh: “ 不! ” 她叫道。

en: “ I ’m sorry , ” I say , “ I ’m her brother .
zh: “ 对不起, ” 我说, “ 我是她的兄弟.

en: She ’s developmentally delayed .
zh: 她发育迟钝。

en: She wails , but lets me disentangle her hands .
zh: 她哭着, 但让我解开她的手.

en: “ I ’m sorry , ” I say again , the concerned big brother .
zh: “ 对不起, ” 我再说, 那个关心的哥哥.

en: “ I was just looking around and thought she was right with me , you know ?
zh: “ 我只是到处看看,以为她和我是对的,你知道吗?

en: Our mom ’s down at Dillard ’s . ”
zh: 我们的妈妈在迪拉德家。 ”

en: Chubby guy kind of hovers until I get the lights away from Cara and as soon as I put them on the shelf he grabs them and starts straightening them out and draping them back over the display .
zh: 我把灯从卡拉身上拿走,我把灯放在架子上,他抓住了灯,开始把灯伸开,把灯挂在屏幕上。

en: I herd Cara towards the front of the store , mouthing sorry at the front cashier .
zh: 我把卡拉赶到商店前去, 对柜台的收银员说抱歉.

en: She smiles at me .
zh: 她向我微笑。

en: Back out in the mall , Cara is wailing , which could start an asthma attack , so to distract her I say , “ You want a cookie ? ”
zh: 回到商场里,卡拉正在哭泣,这可能引发哮喘的袭击,所以为了分散注意力,我说, “ 你想吃饼干 吗? ”

en: Mom has Cara on a diet , so of course she wants a cookie .
zh: 妈妈有卡拉节食,所以她当然想吃点饼干。

en: She perks up the way Shelby , our Shetland Sheepdog does , when you say ‘ treat . ’
zh: 她比谢尔比(英语:Shelby)的方式,就是我们的湿地羊狗(英语:Shetland Sheepdog)那样,当你说“对待”时,她会使你感到高兴。

en: I take her to the food court and buy her an M&M cookie and buy myself a Mountain Dew and then while she ’s eating her cookie , I pull the deck of cards out of my pocket and unwrap it .
zh: 我带她到饭店,给她买一个M&M饼干,然后自己买 Mountain Dew,然后她正在吃她的饼干时,我从口袋里拿出一张卡片,然后把它展开。

en: We ’ve got another fifteen minutes before we have to meet my mom .
zh: 我们还要等15分钟再见我妈妈。

en: The idea is to play fish except every time you get a match you ’re supposed to do what it says .
zh: 这个想法是玩鱼,除非每次你得到一个匹配你应该做它所说的。

en: Kiss anywhere you like and see how long your partner can keep from moving or making any noise .
zh: 亲吻你喜欢的任何地方,看看你的伴侣能保持移动或制造任何噪音多久。

en: The one who lasts the longest gets to draw an extra card .
zh: 最长持牌的人得到额外的牌。

en: I ca n’t wait to show Toph and Len .
zh: 我等不及展示汤普和伦。

en: Cara has chocolate smeared on her mouth , but she lets me wipe her face off .
zh: 卡拉嘴上涂了巧克力,但她让我擦掉脸。

en: “ You ready to go back to see Mom ? ” I say .
zh: “ 你准备回去见妈妈 吗? ” 我回答。

en: When we pass Spencer ’s again , she stops .
zh: 当我们再过斯宾塞的时候,她就停下来。

en: “ Uhhh , ” she says , pointing to the store .
zh: 她说, “ 啊! ” 指向商店.

en: Mom always tries to get her to say what she wants , but I know what she wants and I do n’t want to fight with her .
zh: 妈妈总是想让她说她想要什么,但我知道她想要什么,我不想和她打架。

en: “ No , ” I say .
zh: “ 不, ” 我回答。

en: Cara ’s face crumples up and she hunches her thick shoulders .
zh: 卡拉的脸皱起来,她抓住了她的厚肩。

en: “ Uhhh , ” she says , mad .
zh: 她发疯地说: “ 啊!

en: She swings at me .
zh: 她向我摇摆。

en: I grab her hand and pull her behind me .
zh: 我抓住她的手,把她拖到我后面。

en: She tries to sit down , but I just keep on tugging and she follows me , gulping and wailing .
zh: 她想坐下来,我只是继续拉着,她跟着我,吞咽着,哭泣着。

en: My mom had to buy stuff , like gym shorts for me and underwear for herself , so I told her that I ’d take Cara with me while she bought her stuff .
zh: 我妈妈不得不买一些东西,比如我买的健身裤和她自己买的下衣,所以我告诉她,她买东西的时候我会带卡拉。

en: She ’s holding a Dillard ’s bag .
zh: 她拿着迪拉德的袋子。

en: “ She wanted to go in Spencer ’s , ” I say .
zh: “ 她想去斯宾塞的, ” 我说.

en: “ We went in but she kept grabbing stuff and I had to take her out and now she ’s upset . ”
zh: “ 我们进去,但她一直抓着东西,我只好带她出去,现在她很生气。 ”

en: She crouches down .
zh: 她气喘吁吁。

en: We trail out of the store , Cara holding Mom ’s hand and sniffling .
zh: 我们走出商店,卡拉握着妈妈的手,嗅着。

en: By the time we get to the car , though , Cara ’s wheezing .
zh: 到我们到达汽车时,卡拉正在喘息。

en: Mom digs out Cara ’s inhaler and Cara dutifully takes a hit .
zh: 妈妈挖出卡拉的吸气器,卡拉负责任地打了一个球。

en: It felt really weird , trying to get that stuff in my lungs , and it made me feel a little buzzy but it did n’t even feel good , so it ’s pretty amazing that Cara will do it .
zh: 我觉得很奇怪,想把这些东西进肺里,这使我感到有点晕头转向,但甚至感觉不好,所以很惊奇卡拉会这么做。

en: Cara sits in her booster seat in the back of the car , wheezing all the way home , getting worse and worse , and by the time we pull in the driveway , she ’s got that white look around her mouth .
zh: 卡拉坐在车后部的推车座上,在回家的路上喘息着,情况越来越糟,到了我们驶进车道时,她嘴里有那张白脸。

en: “ You want to call your dad ? ” Mom asks .
zh: “ 你想打电话给你爸爸 吗? ” 妈妈问.

en: “ I do n’t know how long we ’ll be . ”
zh: “ 我不知道我们还要多久. ”

en: Mom checks her watch .
zh: 妈妈检查她的表。

en: I do n’t want to call my dad who is probably with Joyce , his girlfriend , anyway .
zh: 我不想打电话给我爸爸,他可能和乔伊斯在一起,他的女朋友,不管怎样。

en: Joyce is always trying to be likable and it gets on my nerves after a while — she tries way too hard .
zh: 乔伊斯老是想讨人喜欢,过了一会儿我才觉得很紧张——她太努力了。

en: “ I can just make a sandwich , ” I say .
zh: 我说, “ 我可以做一份三明治. ”

en: “ I want you to stay at home , then , ” she says .
zh: 她说: “ 那么,我要你呆在家里. ”

en: “ I ’ve got my cell phone if you need to call . ”
zh: “ 如果你需要打电话的话,我有我的手机. ”

en: She sighs .
zh: 她叹息。

en: Remember you have school tomorrow . ”
zh: 记住明天你上学了. ”

en: She opens the garage door so I can get in .
zh: 她打开车库门,让我进去。

en: I stand there and watch her back down the driveway .
zh: 我站在那儿,看着她下车道。

en: She turns back , watching where she ’s going , and she needs to get her hair done again because I can really see the gray roots .
zh: 她转过身来,看着她要去哪里,她需要再修一下头发,因为我能真正看见那根灰色的根。

en: Cara is watching me through the watery glass , her mouth a little open .
zh: 卡拉正透过水玻璃看着我,她的嘴有点开着。

en: I wave good - bye .
zh: 我挥手告别.

en: I ’m glad they ’re gone .
zh: 我很高兴他们走了。

en: The first drops of rain fell onto the parched stones from a cloudless blue sky .
zh: 从一片无云的蓝天上,雨水开始降落在磨碎的石头上。

en: They disappeared immediately , drunk down into the mineral silence .
zh: 他们立刻消失了,醉在矿物的寂静中。

en: The garden paused , and everything held its breath and waited .
zh: 花园停了下来,一切都保持着呼吸,等待着。

en: More rain would come .
zh: 更多的雨会降临。

en: Everyone knew , beyond belief or necessity that the time had come .
zh: 每个人都知道, beyond belief or necessity that the time had come 。

en: Heavy oily drops bounced from leaf to grass to dusty ground , gathering in stems and folds on the way .
zh: 沉重的油滴从叶子到草地到尘土,聚集在树干和折叠的路上。

en: Still the garden held its breath .
zh: 花园仍保持着呼吸。

en: A spattering of drops plucked memories from deep in the roots , shivering through shoots and tendrils , humus and stone .
zh: 滴滴的散射从根深处抽出记忆,闪烁在树枝和树枝、树枝和石头中。

en: Wispy vapour trails marbled the blue surface above .
zh: 湿润的蒸汽迹迹在上面的蓝色表面上铺满了大理石。

en: And then it rained for good .
zh: 然后又下雨了。

en: We sat on the porch watching , no longer daring to dart out and leap around in the downfall as drops turned to torrents and the staccato tapping on the roof climaxed to a thunderous roar .
zh: 我们坐在门廊里看着,不再敢跳出去跳在下落中,滴水变为洪水,屋顶上敲响的敲响声达到雷声的高潮。

en: Pools erupted and overflowed along the edges of the lawn , cascading around the raspberry canes and over the flower beds .
zh: 池塘在草坪边上喷发并溢出,在 raspberry canes 周围和花 beds 上 cascading 。

en: Earthworms rose up from the water - laden earth where they could no longer breath and wriggled and struggled fro air on the surface , writhing and swimming for a safe haven .
zh: 地球虫从水满的大地上爬起来,它们再也无法呼吸,在地面上挣扎着爬上空气,爬上水,游到安全的地方去。

en: Water burst over the barrels and cans standing under the eaves and gutters , flooding the pathways , carrying away all that was n’t fixed solid and licking at the stairs to the back porch before climbing each step and lapping against the planks we were sitting on , a wooden raft surrounded by angry water and martial beat drum , drum , drumming on the roof above .
zh: 水冲过桶和罐子,站在风窗和沟渠下面,淹没了通道,把所有没有固定的固体搬走,然后在爬到后廊的楼梯上lick,然后爬到每个台阶上,然后向我们坐着的板凳上跳,一个木筏被愤怒的水和武力打鼓包围,鼓,在上面的屋顶上打鼓。

en: We slipped out feet over the sides and when we felt the fish , some as big as logs , some as small as leaves , nibble at our feet , we leant over to watch them fraying and frolicking under the choppy surface .
zh: 我们滑过两边的脚,当我们感觉到鱼,有些像树木一样大,有些像叶子一样小,在我们的脚上摇摇晃晃晃的时候,我们跳过身来,看着它们在泥泞的地面下颤抖。

en: Waves lapped at the porch , washing away the boxes , and bowls , and the dog ’s basket .
zh: 波浪在廊下横扫,洗掉箱子、碗和狗的篮子。

en: The rocking chair , the watering can , boxes of cuttings , and tied - up newspapers , all floated away as we slammed the kitchen door shut and retreated to the front room we gazed out at the river that the street had become .
zh: 摇椅 、 水罐 、 切片盒 、 捆绑的报纸, 随我们把厨房的门关起来,往前厅退去,我们凝视着河流,这条街已经变了.

en: The sky was pewter smeared with charcoal now , and pressed down hard on the rooftops , slowly dissolving everything below .
zh: 现在,天空被焦炭烧得粉碎了,在屋顶上压得很厉害,慢慢地把下面的一切都溶解了。

en: When the water rippled into the hallway , we splashed our way to the staircase and then up as it nipped at our heels .
zh: 当水冲进走廊时,我们冲向楼梯,然后爬上楼梯,当水冲到我们脚跟上时。

en: Outside the other houses were rocks surrounded by sea with mermaids swimming all around , flapping their scaly tails and hauling themselves up , to fall backwards into the crest of the oncoming waves .
zh: 其他屋子外面是海边的岩石,海女们四处游荡着,摇晃着皮毛的尾巴,拉着身子往上,倒进即将来临的波浪的山顶。

en: And as they swam they sang , their voices born on the winds and the salt and the rain , and we could hear them singing , He is coming , He is coming .
zh: 当他们游泳时,他们唱着,他们的声音在风和盐和雨中诞生,我们听见他们唱着,他来了,他来了。

en: And they combed their long hair in preparation .
zh: 他们准备梳着长发。

en: We waved and called , and they laughed and played , tantalising , their seaweed locks just out of reach .
zh: 我们挥手致电,他们笑了笑,玩耍,在游荡着,他们的海藻锁在遥不可及。

en: With a flick of the tail they were off , still singing , He is coming , He is coming , until their voices were lost in the noise of the rain and the water .
zh: 他来了,他来了,直到他们的声音在雨水的喧闹中消失。

en: We pulled off wet socks and shoes , letting them float away on the tide , before the great worm turned and the wake engulfed the creaking , cracking house .
zh: 我们脱下湿袜子和鞋子,让它们在潮汐上漂流,然后大虫转过身来,醒来吞噬了摇摇晃晃晃的房子。

en: We clambered up onto the roof , sliding on the tiles and clinging to chimney stacks , sheltering our eyes from the driving downpour .
zh: 我们爬到屋顶上,滑在瓦板上,紧紧地靠着烟囱堆,躲避着暴风雨。

en: The sky was black , and the stormy sea all the deepest , darkest blues and greens and greys and flecked with white where the sea - horses galloped .
zh: 天空是黑的, 暴风雨的海是最深的, 最黑暗的蓝色, 绿色和灰色,到处都是白的,海马在游荡的地方.

en: The waters broke making way for the gnarled head of a whale , spouting water high against the clouds before opening its whiskered maw and in a looming , booming voice called : He is coming , He is coming .
zh: 水断裂了,为鲸鱼的刺伤头铺路,向云层上喷洒水,然后打开了鲸鱼的嘴,发出一个迫在眉睫的呼声:他来了,他来了。

en: The chimneys washed away , so we scrambled onto the blue - black back encrusted with barnacles and cockles like stars in a night sky and held on tight as he rode the waves , dipping and blowing , dipping and blowing .
zh: 烟囱被洗掉了, 于是我们爬上了蓝黑的背面,上面有 barnacles 和 cockles 像夜空中的星星一样,他骑着波浪紧紧地抓住, 潜着吹着, 潜着吹着.

en: The wind and the rain tugged at our hair .
zh: 风和雨缠住我们的头发。

en: And still it rained .
zh: 还是下雨了。

en: We heard a fearsome creaking and cracking and before our eyes a great patch of sky peeled away , deeping down in the troughs and riding the crests with torn sails set against the wind .
zh: 我们听到一个可怕的皱纹和裂纹,在我们的眼前,一片巨大的天空被剥落了,在树丛中深入,在悬崖上骑着被风刮伤的帆船。

en: It was a galleon with masts like a dead man ’s fingers , tarred timbers groaning and a mermaid sat on the bow as he ship dipped and passed .
zh: 那艘帆船的桅杆像死人的手指一样,瓦砾的木头颤抖着,船上一只海豚坐在船上,船上潜过。

en: He is coming , He is coming , she sang out .
zh: 他来了,他来了,她唱起来。

en: And just as the wash hit us , prising us from the whale ’s speckled back and down into the sea , someone threw down a knotted rope and we hung on for dear life .
zh: 就在洗手冲到我们身上时,从鲸鱼的光斑中夺走了我们,然后把绳子扔下来,我们紧紧地抓住了生命。

en: The singing sailors hauled us aboard chanting , He ’s a coming - ha ! He ’s a coming - ha !
zh: 歌唱的船员把我们拖到船上,唱着, 他来了! 他来了!

en: The Captain stood above us dressed in jewels and finery from a thousand pillagings .
zh: 船长站在我们上方,穿着一万件抢劫品的宝石和装饰品。

en: I had buried my parents in their gray marble mausoleum at the heart of the city .
zh: 我埋葬了我的父母在城市中心的灰色大理石陵墓里。

en: I had buried my husband in a lead box sunk into the mud of the bottom of the river , where all the riverboatmen lie .
zh: 我把我的丈夫埋在一个铅箱里,埋在河底的泥土里,河上所有的船员都躺着。

en: And after the war , I had buried my children , all four , in white linen shrouds in the new graveyards plowed into what used to be our farmland : all the land stretching from the river delta to the hills .
zh: 战争结束后,我把我的四个孩子都埋在新墓地里,用白色的毛毯遮掩,埋在原来是我们的农田里:从河三角洲到山丘的土地上。

en: I had one granddaughter who survived the war .
zh: 我有一个曾幸存于战争的孙女。

en: I saw her sometimes : in a bright pink dress , a sparkling drink in her hand , on the arm of some foreign officer with brocade on his shoulders , at the edge of a marble patio .
zh: 我有时看见她:穿着鲜艳的粉红色裙子,手里拿着点燃的饮料,在某个外国军官的手臂上,肩上戴着布洛卡德,在一块大理石的阳台边。

en: She never looked back at me — poverty and failure and political disrepute being all , these days , contagious and synonymous .
zh: 她从不回头看我——贫穷、失败和政治耻辱这些日子都是传染性的同义词。

en: The young were mostly dead , and the old men had been taken away , they told us , to learn important new things and to come back when they were ready to contribute fully .
zh: 他们告诉我们,年轻人大多已经死了,而老人已经被带走了,他们告诉我们,要学一些重要的新东西,然后回到他们准备充分贡献的时候。

en: So it was a city of grandmothers .
zh: 那是个老奶奶的城市。

en: We all laughed at the idea , except for a chemist with a crooked nose and rouge caked in the creases of her face , who was incensed .
zh: 我们都笑了笑这个想法,除了一个脸部皱纹的化学家,她鼻子弯曲,脸部皱纹都红了,她很生气。

en: “ We live in the modern era ! ” she cried .
zh: 她喊道: “ 我们生活在现代时代! ”

en: “ You should be ashamed of yourself ! "
zh: “ 你应该为自己感到羞愧! ”

en: The traveler stood up from the table .
zh: 旅行者从桌子上站起来。

en: She was bony and rough - skinned and bent like an old crow , with a blue silk scarf and hanks of hair as black as soot .
zh: 她身材瘦长,皮肤粗糙,弯曲如一只老乌鸦,穿着蓝色的丝绸围巾,头发黑得像沙子。

en: Her eyes were veined with red .
zh: 她的眼睛是红的。

en: “ Nonetheless , ” the traveler said , and she walked out .
zh: “ 尽管如此, ” 旅行者说, 她走了出来.

en: They were laughing at the chemist as well as at the traveler .
zh: 他们对化学家和旅行者都笑了笑。

en: To find anyone still proud , anyone who believed in giants or shame , was hilarious .
zh: 找到任何仍然骄傲的人,任何相信巨人或羞耻的人,都是可笑的。

en: The air of the bar was acrid with triumph .
zh: 酒吧的气氛充满了胜利。

en: Finding someone even more vulnerable and foolish than we were , after everything had been taken from us — that was a delight .
zh: 找到比我们更易受伤害和愚蠢的人,在所有东西被我们夺走之后 — — 这真是高兴。

en: But I followed the traveler , into the wet streets .
zh: 但我跟着旅行者, 穿过湿润的街道.

en: The smell of fish oozed from the docks .
zh: 从码头里弥漫着鱼的味道。

en: Here and there were bits of charred debris in the gutters .
zh: 这里还有一些烧焦的废物在排水道里。

en: I caught her at her door .
zh: 我抓住她的门。

en: She invited me in for tea and massage .
zh: 她邀请我来喝茶和按摩。

en: Her limbs were weathered and ringed , like the branches of trees in the dry country .
zh: 她的肢体像干旱的田园里的树枝一样被晒伤和缠绕。

en: She smelled like honey that has been kept a while in a dark room , a little fermented .
zh: 她闻起来像在黑暗的房间里留着的蜂蜜,有点发酵。

en: In the morning , brilliant sunlight scoured the walls and the floor , and the traveler and her pack were gone .
zh: 早晨, 灿烂的阳光照耀着墙壁和地板, 旅行者和她的行李都不见了.

en: I hurried home .
zh: 我急忙回家。

en: My house had survived the war with all its brown clay walls intact , though the garden and the courtyard were a heap of blackened rubble .
zh: 我的房子在战争中幸存下来,所有的棕色粘土墙都保持完整,尽管花园和院子是一片乌黑的废墟。

en: My house was empty and cold .
zh: 我的房子空冷。

en: I packed six loaves of flatbread , some olives , a hard cheese , one nice dress , walking clothes , my pills and glasses , a jug of wine , a can-teen of water , and a kitchen knife .
zh: 我收拾了六个面包,一些橄榄,一块硬奶酪,一件漂亮的裙子,走路的衣服,我的药片和眼镜,一罐酒,一罐水,一个厨房刀。

en: I sat in the shadow in my living room for a while , looking at the amorphous mass of the blanket I had been crocheting .
zh: 我在客厅的阴影里坐了一会,看着我在编织的毛毯的无形质量。

en: That granddaughter : her parents both worked in the vineyards , and when she was a child , she would play in my courtyard in the after - noons .
zh: 那个孙女: 她的父母都在葡萄园里工作, 当她是个孩子时, 她会在午后在我的院子里玩耍.

en: When she scraped her knees bloody on the stones , she refused to cry .
zh: 当她用血 scraped她的膝盖在石头上时, 她拒绝哭泣。

en: She would cry from frustration when the older children could do something that she could n't — like tie knots , or catch a chicken .
zh: 当年纪大的孩子们能做她不能做的事,比如领带或捕鸡时,她会因为沮丧而哭泣。

en: It had taken only a matter of hours for the Kethlan system to become a tumbling sea of debris ; the twisted and burnt - out remnants of a once glorious Imperial nation .
zh: 凯特兰制度只花了几个小时才变为一片崩塌的废墟; 一个曾经光荣的帝国国家的扭曲和烧毁的残骸.

en: An empire whose costly mistakes would for many years to come echo into every corner of the known galaxy .
zh: 一个帝国,其昂贵的错误将在未来的许多年中回响到已知的星系的每一个角落。

en: And with those mistakes would come death to billions of innocent , unsuspecting lives .
zh: 这些错误将导致数十亿无辜、无疑的生命死亡。

en: A starfighter hurtled through the scattered metal , the pilot desperate to find a way to stop himself from joining the ever growing population of this interstellar graveyard .
zh: 一个星际战斗员穿过分散的金属,飞行员绝望地想找到办法阻止自己加入这个星际墓地的不断增长的人口。

en: Jacques Chalmers was not alone in his frustration with the current situation , but he was doubtless one of the most panicked .
zh: 查克·查默斯对当前局势的沮丧并不是唯一的原因,但他无疑是最惊慌的人之一。

en: He tried to steady himself as he began cycling once again through the available display options for his starfighter 's radar system .
zh: 他试图稳定自己,他又开始骑自行车,通过他的战斗机雷达系统可用的显示选项。

en: His anxiety continued to grow with each passing second , every change of the screen doing nothing to abate it .
zh: 他的焦虑随着每一秒的流逝而不断增加,屏幕的每一个变化都无助于减轻它。

en: He stopped midway through the calibration and glanced out of his cockpit .
zh: 他在校正途中停下来,从驾驶舱里看了看。

en: The scene was the same as it had been a few moments ago and it brought him no comfort .
zh: 那场景象和几分钟前一样,他没有得到安慰。

en: He could n't count the number of capital ships that dominated the Enemy 's frontline .
zh: 他不能数到那些控制敌人前线的资本舰只的数量。

en: In his years of service to the Imperial Naval Forces he had never seen anything like it , not even in archive war footage .
zh: 在服役期间,他从未见过类似的东西,甚至在战争档案中也没有。

en: The enormous forms of the battleships loomed like giants atop a hill , staring down upon a tiny village below .
zh: 巨型战列舰像巨人般出现在山顶上,凝视着下面的一个小村庄。

en: Then there were the Enemy starfighters themselves : hundreds at least , swarming about like a huge wall of locusts .
zh: 然后是敌人的斗星人自己:至少有数百人,像一大堆蝗虫的墙一样蜂拥。

en: Knowing that he had already been flying straight for longer than was advisable , Chalmers altered his course to attempt to throw off any pursuers .
zh: 查尔默斯知道他已经飞得更远了,因此改变了航线,试图赶走任何追随者。

en: Not long before he had been standing on the flight deck of his deployment carrier , amongst the other pilots , his heart pumping in his ears , his hands sweating as he awaited the order to board his fighter .
zh: 不久前,他站在他的部署飞机甲板上,和其他飞行员中间,他的心在耳朵里跳动,他的双手在等待他的战斗机上班的命令时流汗。

en: Chalmers saw his friends run forward as their names were called out , scrambling into cockpits , pulling on helmets and performing last - minute safety checks .
zh: 查尔默斯看见他的朋友们在呼叫他们的名字时向前跑, 冲进驾驶舱, 戴上头盔,最后一刻进行安全检查.

en: Though most hid it well , he was convinced they were all as nervous and scared as he was - knowing they could well be speeding only to their own deaths .
zh: 尽管大多数人掩盖了这件事,但他确信他们都像他一样紧张而害怕,知道他们可能只是快到自己的死去。

en: As he watched his friends ' fighters hurtle down the catapult , his commanding officer had addressed the last remaining pilots still standing on the flight deck .
zh: 当他看着他的朋友们的战斗机冲下大炮时,他的指挥官已经对最后的ကျန်的飞行员讲话了。

en: “ Right , listen up , ” he started .
zh: “ 对, 听着, ” 他开始说.

en: The Enemy can not be allowed to advance any further .
zh: 敌人不能再向前推进。

en: Tonight we fight the battle for Kethlan and for the Imperium ; the battle for our survival .
zh: 今晚我们为凯特兰和帝国作战,为我们的生存作战。

en: Hundreds of millions of lives are depending on our actions here .
zh: 数百万人的生命取决于我们的行动。

en: Make them proud ! ”
zh: 让他们感到骄傲! ”

en: This day had crept ever closer as cities , planets and then entire star systems had fallen to the Enemy ; to those damned Pandorans ; to the Senate 's mistake .
zh: 这个日子随着城市、行星和整个恒星系统都落入敌人的手中,落入那些被诅咒的潘多兰人的手中,落入参议院的错误之中,变得越来越接近了。

en: How many of his friends had he lost over these last few terrible months ?
zh: 在过去几个月里他失去了多少朋友?

en: Had they died fast or were they now suffering a fate far worse . . ?
zh: 他们快死了,或者他们现在受了更糟糕的命运呢?

en: As his CO continued to pump them up for the critical battle , Chalmers ' head was filled with visions of row upon row of black - clad soldiers .
zh: 查尔默斯的头上充满了一排一排的黑人士兵的幻象。

en: A white emblem resided on their right arms and left breast , an all - encompassing full black helmet upon their heads , its smooth form negating all facial features .
zh: 他们的右臂和左胸上挂着白色的徽章,头上戴着全套黑色的头盔,其平滑的形状否定了所有面部特征。

en: Two bright red oval spheres were set into an eye - level groove that ran all around , the “ eyes ” themselves slanted into a menacing and intimidating scowl .
zh: 两个明亮的红色的椭圆球被设置成一个眼睛水平的沟槽,它到处跑, “ 眼睛 ” 本身被卷入一个威胁和恐吓的扫荡.

en: One of the soldiers turned to face him , the ruby - like eyes seeming to pierce his very soul .
zh: 其中一个士兵转过身来面对他, 那棕色的眼睛似乎刺穿了他的灵魂.

en: He felt his hand tighten on the flight helmet he held , swallowing hard .
zh: 他感到手紧握着他的飞行头盔, 紧紧地吞下去.

en: Feet moved and Chalmers felt his stomach lurch .
zh: 他的脚动了,查尔默斯觉得他的胃里藏着。

en: His name would be called soon .
zh: 他的名字不久就会被称作。

en: He felt a sense of doom .
zh: 他感到一种命运的感觉。

en: If the Empire could not stop the Enemy before , what hope did they have now ?
zh: 如果帝国以前不能阻止敌人, 他们现在有什么希望 呢?

en: The Enemy 's power had grown exponentially and they had crushed everything in their path with harrowing little effort .
zh: 敌人的实力增长了 exponentially,他们用极少的痛苦的努力摧毁了他们所走的一切。

en: Chalmers was feeling forced to accept the truth : they were all that was left of the Imperial Naval Forces .
zh: 查默斯感到被迫接受事实:他们是帝国海军的剩余者。

en: At the sound of his name , Chalmers felt himself move robotically , his mind screaming in protest against what his legs were doing .
zh: 查尔默斯听到他的名字,就觉得自己是机器人,他的脑子尖叫起来抗议他的腿在做什么。

en: He ran over to the waiting starfighter , threw on his helmet and begun ascending the ladder into the cockpit .
zh: 他跑过去等待的星际战士,戴上他的头盔,开始爬上梯子进入驾驶舱。

en: Zombie - like he sank down into the seat , watching as if from outside his body as his hands buckled him in , his fingers flip switches , press buttons , acknowledge questions and confirmations on the screens before him .
zh: 像他沉没在座位上一样,仿佛从他的身体外看,他的双手把他锁在里面,他的手指翻开开开关,按按钮,承认他面前的屏幕上的问题和确认。

en: Moments later , his craft was taxied to the catapult and before long he 'd found himself out in space and into the thick of battle .
zh: 几分钟后,他的船被拖到触发机上,不久他就发现自己已经在太空中进入战斗的泥潭。

en: At that moment , his worst fears had not only been altogether realised , but far exceeded .
zh: 这时,他最可怕的恐惧不仅已经完全实现,而且远远超过了。

en: My father ’s actions were largely incomprehensible to me , guided by his own secret and labyrinthine calculations .
zh: 我父亲的行动对我来说基本上是无法理解的,由他自己的秘密和迷宫的计算来指导。

en: He dwelt in another world , a world of intrigue , bargains , contracts and clandestine purchases of land all over the island .
zh: 他居住在另一个世界,一个充满阴谋 、 交易 、 合同和秘密购买土地的世界,遍及整个岛屿.

en: No doubt his decisions were perfectly logical in his own eyes — even the one that prompted him , a patriotic islander , to bring me a tutor from Bain : Master Lunre , an Olondrian .
zh: 毫无疑问,他的决定在他自己的眼里是完全合理的 — — 甚至连那个促使他,一个爱国的岛民,带我一个来自拜恩的导师:一个奥朗德里亚的卢恩雷大师。

en: The day began as it usually did when my father was expected home from his travels , the house festooned with flowers and stocked with coconut liquor .
zh: 一天从我父亲从旅行回来的那天开始。 房子里满是花朵,满是椰子酒。

en: We stood by the gate , washed and perfumed and arrayed in our brightest clothes , my mother twisting her hands in her skirt , my father ’s wife with red eyes .
zh: 我们在门口站着,洗了衣服,洗了香水,穿着最亮的衣服,母亲用裙子扭动了双手,我父亲的妻子带着红眼睛。

en: Jom , grown taller and broad in the shoulders , moaned gently to himself , while I stood nervously rubbing the heel of one sandal on the flagstones .
zh: 乔姆,肩上长得高又宽,轻轻地向自己叹息,我 nervously站在旗石上 rubbing一双鞋跟。

en: We scanned the deep blue valley for the first sign of the company , but before we saw them we heard the children shouting : “ A yellow man ! ”
zh: 我们在深蓝色的山谷里寻找团伙的第一个迹象,但在我们看到他们之前,我们听到孩子们喊道: “ 一个黄色的人! ”

en: We glanced at one another in confusion .
zh: 我们困惑地互相看了看。

en: My mother bit her lower lip ; Jom gave a groan of alarm .
zh: 我妈妈咬了她的下唇, 约姆发出惊慌的叫声.

en: At first I thought the children meant my father , whose golden skin , the color of the night - monkey ’s pelt , was a rarity in the islands ; but certainly the children of Tyom were familiar with my father , and would never have greeted a council - member with such ill - mannered yells .
zh: 起初我以为孩子们是指我父亲, 他的金皮, 黑猴皮的颜色,在岛上是罕见的;但泰奥姆的孩子们当然熟悉我父亲, 他们决不会用这种不礼貌的叫声欢迎一个议员.

en: Then I remembered the only “ yellow man ” I had ever seen , an Olondrian wizard and doctor who had visited Tyom in my childhood , who wore two pieces of glass on his eyes , attached to his ears with wires , and roamed the hills of Tinimavet , cutting bits off the trees .
zh: 然后,我想起我见过的唯一“黄色人”,一个奥朗德利亚的巫师和医生,他曾在我童年时访问过泰奥姆,戴上两块玻璃片,用线连接他的耳朵, roamed the hills of Tinimavet, cutting bits off the trees.

en: I have since learned that that doctor wrote a well - received treatise , On the Medicinal Properties of the Juice of the Young Coconut , and died a respected man in his native city of Deinivel ; but at the time I felt certain he had returned with his sack of tree - cuttings .
zh: 从那时起,我听说那个医生写了一本受人欢迎的著作,《年轻椰子果汁的药理特性》,在家乡的戴尼维尔去世了一位受人尊敬的人;但当时我确信他带着他的树枝袋回来了。

en: “ There they are , ” said Pavit , the head house - servant , in a strained voice .
zh: 房主帕维特紧张地说, “ 他们来了. ”

en: And there they were : a chain of riders weaving among the trees .
zh: 在那儿,有一群骑马人在树丛中织着绳子。

en: My father ’s plaited umbrella appeared , his still , imposing figure , and beside him another man , tall and lean , astride an island mule .
zh: 我父亲的长着的伞出现了,他那静静的、壮观的形象,他旁边还有另一个高瘦的男子,在一条小岛上漫步。

en: The hectic screams of the children preceded the company into the village , so that they advanced like a festival , drawing people out of their houses .
zh: 孩子们的狂热的喊叫,使公司进入村庄,他们像节日一样向前迈进,把人们赶出家园。

en: As they approached I saw that my father ’s face was shining with pride , and his bearing had in it a new hauteur , like that of the old island kings .
zh: 他们走近时,我看见我父亲的脸上带着骄傲的神色,他的姿态像古老的岛屿国王一样高高。

en: The man who rode beside him , looking uncomfortable with his long legs , kept his gaze lowered and fixed between the ears of his plodding mule .
zh: 坐在他旁边的那个人,长腿 look uncomfortable, 一直低头望着他,把目光固定在他的耕作马耳之间。

en: He was not yellow , but very pale brown , the color of raw cashews ; he had silver hair , worn cropped close to the skull so that it resembled a cap .
zh: 他不是黄色的,而是非常苍白的棕色,是生胡萝卜的颜色;他的头发是银色的,戴着紧贴着头颅的 cropped,使头顶看起来像帽子。

en: As he dismounted in front of the house I heard my mother whispering : “ Protect us , God with the Black - and - White Tail , from that which is not of this earth . ”
zh: 当他从房子前面爬下来时,我听到母亲低声说: “ 黑白尾巴的上帝, 保护我们, 免于这地上没有的东西. ”

en: My father dismounted from his mule and strutted toward us , grinning .
zh: 我父亲从马车上爬下来,向我们走来,微笑着。

en: I thought I caught an odor off him , of fish , sea - sickness and sweat .
zh: 我以为他身上有一股鱼味 、 海病和汗味.

en: We knelt and stared down at the bald ground , murmuring ritual greetings , until he touched the tops of our heads with the palm of his fleshy hand .
zh: 我们跪下来,凝视着那秃顶的地面,在欢呼着仪式上的问候,直到他用他那柔软的手掌摸到我们头顶。

en: Then we stood , unable to keep from staring at the stranger , who faced us awkwardly , half - smiling , taller than any man there .
zh: 然后我们站起来, 不能不盯着那个陌生人, 他面朝我们, 面朝我们, 半笑半笑, 高得比那儿的任何人都高.

en: I hate the moon - I am afraid of it - for when it shines on certain scenes familiar and loved it sometimes makes them unfamiliar and hideous .
zh: 我讨厌月亮--我怕它--因为当它在某些熟悉的场景上照亮时,它有时会使它们变得不熟悉的和可怕。

en: It was in the spectral summer when the moon shone down on the old garden where I wandered ; the spectral summer of narcotic flowers and humid seas of foliage that bring wild and many - coloured dreams .
zh: 那是在幽暗的夏天,月亮在我漫游的旧花园上照耀着;幽暗的夏天是麻醉植物的幽暗的夏天,湿润的海是树叶的幽暗的夏天,它们带来野生多彩的梦想。

en: And as I walked by the shallow crystal stream I saw unwonted ripples tipped with yellow light , as if those placid waters were drawn on in resistless currents to strange oceans that are not in the world .
zh: 当我走过浅水的水晶河流时,我看见带有黄色光闪烁的波浪,仿佛那些平静的水流在无阻的电流中引向世界之外的奇怪的海洋。

en: Silent and sparkling , bright and baleful , those moon - cursed waters hurried I knew not whither ; whilst from the embowered banks white lotos - blossoms fluttered one by one in the opiate night - wind and dropped despairingly into the stream , swirling away horribly under the arched , carven bridge , and staring back with the sinister resignation of calm , dead faces .
zh: 静静的,闪烁的,明亮的,痛苦的, 那些月球的诅咒的水,我不知去哪里跑了,而从悬挂着的岸边,白莲花一朵一朵在鸦片夜风中 fluttered and dropped despairingly into the stream, swirling away horribly under the arched, carven bridge, and staring back with the sinister resignation of calm, dead faces.

en: And as I ran along the shore , crushing sleeping flowers with heedless feet and maddened ever by the fear of unknown things and the lure of the dead faces , I saw that the garden had no end under that moon ; for where by day the walls were , there stretched now only new vistas of trees and paths , flowers and shrubs , stone idols and pagodas , and bendings of the yellow - litten stream past grassy banks and under grotesque bridges of marble .
zh: 当我沿着海岸奔跑时,用无知的脚踩着睡着的花粉碎了它们,被未知事物的恐惧和死面的诱饵弄得发疯了,我看见花园在那个月球下没有结束,因为白天的墙上,现在只有新的树木和路径,鲜花和灌木,石头的偶像和塔顶,以及黄沙流的弯曲,穿过草丛的岸边和Marble的古怪桥下。

en: And the lips of the dead lotos - faces whispered sadly , and bade me follow , nor did I cease my steps till the stream became a river , and joined amidst marshes of swaying reeds and beaches of gleaming sand the shore of a vast and nameless sea .
zh: 死人的脸的嘴唇悲伤地低语着,命令我跟着,我也没有停止脚步,直到河流变成一条河,在游动的芦苇沼泽中和闪烁的沙滩中加入了一片广阔无名的海滨。

en: Upon that sea the hateful moon shone , and over its unvocal waves weird perfumes breeded .
zh: 那海上闪耀着憎恨的月亮, 它无声的波浪上滋生着怪异的香水.

en: And as I saw therein the lotos - faces vanish , I longed for nets that I might capture them and learn from them the secrets which the moon had brought upon the night .
zh: 当我看到那儿的黄蜂的脸消失的时候,我渴望着网,以便抓住它们,从它们中学习月亮在夜间带来的秘密。

en: But when that moon went over to the west and the still tide ebbed from the sullen shore , I saw in that light old spires that the waves almost uncovered , and white columns gay with festoons of green seaweed .
zh: 但当那个月球向西飞过时,静静的潮水从沉闷的海岸上飘落,我看见那光亮的古老 spires 里,波浪几乎被揭开,白柱子和绿色海藻的花束相伴。

en: And knowing that to this sunken place all the dead had come , I trembled and did not wish again to speak with the lotos - faces .
zh: 知道所有死者都来到了这个沉寂的地方,我颤抖起来,不再想再和那些猫头鹰的面孔说话。

en: Yet when I saw afar out in the sea a black condor descend from the sky to seek rest on a vast reef , I would fain have questioned him , and asked him of those whom I had known when they were alive .
zh: 可是,当我看见远处的海中,一只黑色的海豹从天空下下来,在巨大的礁石上寻求安息时,我倒想问他,问他那些我曾认识的那些在活着的时候的人。

en: This I would have asked him had he not been so far away , but he was very far , and could not be seen at all when he drew nigh that gigantic reef .
zh: 要是他没那么远,我就问他了,可是他很远,他靠近那座巨大的礁石时,就看不见了。

en: So I watched the tide go out under that sinking moon , and saw gleaming the spires , the towers , and the roofs of that dead , dripping city .
zh: 因此,我看着潮水从沉着的月球下流出,看见山 spires 、 塔楼和那死的城市屋顶闪烁着。

en: And as I watched , my nostrils tried to close against the perfume - conquering stench of the world 's dead ; for truly , in this unplaced and forgotten spot had all the flesh of the churchyards gathered for puffy sea - worms to gnaw and glut upon .
zh: 我看着, 我的鼻孔试着对着世界死者的气味作封锁, 因为真的, 在这个空虚而被遗忘的地方,教堂的全部肉都聚集起来,供潮湿的海蠕虫吞噬和吞噬.

en: Over these horrors the evil moon now hung very low , but the puffy worms of the sea need no moon to feed by .
zh: 由于这些恐怖,邪恶的月亮现在悬挂得很低,但海里的烟雾虫不需要月亮来喂养。

en: And as I watched the ripples that told of the writhing of worms beneath , I felt a new chill from afar out whither the condor had flown , as if my flesh had caught a horror before my eyes had seen it .
zh: 当我看着那波浪,它讲述了下面的蠕虫的旋转时,我从远处感到一股新的寒气,那儿的康多尔流过,仿佛我的肉体在眼前看到了恐怖。

en: Nor had my flesh trembled without cause , for when I raised my eyes I saw that the waters had ebbed very low , shewing much of the vast reef whose rim I had seen before .
zh: 我的肉体也无缘无故地颤抖了,因为当我睁开眼睛的时候,我看见水已经很低了,露出我以前见过的边缘的巨大礁石的大部分。

en: And when I saw that the reef was but the black basalt crown of a shocking eikon whose monstrous forehead now shown in the dim moonlight and whose vile hooves must paw the hellish ooze miles below , I shrieked and shrieked lest the hidden face rise above the waters , and lest the hidden eyes look at me after the slinking away of that leering and treacherous yellow moon .
zh: 当我看到礁石只是一个令人震惊的黑玄武岩王冠,它的可怕的额头现在在暗淡的月光中显现,而它的丑陋的胡子必须在数英里下面铺满地狱的污泥,我尖叫起来,尖叫起来,以免隐藏的面孔上升到水面上,以免隐藏的眼神在那个滑稽的背叛的黄色月球离去之后看着我。

en: And to escape this relentless thing I plunged gladly and unhesitantly into the stinking shallows where amidst weedy walls and sunken streets fat sea - worms feast upon the world 's dead .
zh: 为了逃避这种无情的事情,我高兴地毫不犹豫地跳进那臭的浅海里,在贫瘠的墙壁和荒凉的街道中,脂肪的海蠕虫会对世上死者的宴会。

en: My sixteen - year - old daughter pulls up her T - shirt sleeve to show her bare arm , the skin summer brown and the muscle swelling slightly into smooth biceps , flawless .
zh: 我16 岁 的女儿拉起她的T恤袖子,展示她的裸臂, 皮肤夏色褐色,肌肉略有肿胀到平滑的双ceps, 完美无缺.

en: “ I had it done when I was little and see , you ca n’t even tell . ”
zh: “ 我小时候就这么做了,你甚至不能说。 ”

en: My mother is sitting in the little examining room at the assisted living .
zh: 我母亲坐在辅助住处的那个小检查室里。

en: Everything is white and hospital - like but there ’s no examining couch .
zh: 一切都是白色的,像医院一样,但没有检查的沙发。

en: There ’s just a desk , a little white table with two chairs and a scale .
zh: 只有一张桌子,一个白色的小桌子,两张椅子和一个尺子。

en: The doctor , a woman I do n’t know , is sitting in the other chair .
zh: 医生,一个我不知道的女人,坐在另一张椅子上。

en: My mother is bewildered , her face turned up towards me .
zh: 我母亲惊慌失措, 她的脸朝我走来。

en: She ’s got Alzheimer ’s .
zh: 她得了阿尔茨海默病。

en: She wants to understand , I can see that .
zh: 她想明白,我看得出来。

en: So I explain again .
zh: 我再解释一遍。

en: “ It ’s an implant that will let them know where you are , and how you are .
zh: “ 这是一种植入物,它会让他们知道你在哪里,以及你如何。

en: It wo n’t hurt . ”
zh: 不会伤害的。 ”

en: Her eyes water constantly , now .
zh: 她的眼睛不停地注水, 现在.

en: In the time it takes me to explain she grasps and loses the words , grasps and loses phrases as they go past .
zh: 在我解释的时间里,她抓住了和丢失了词,抓住了和丢失了过去时的短语。

en: She looks at me and then at Renata , who is smiling , and finally submits uncomprehendingly .
zh: 她看着我,然后看着瑞娜塔,她微笑着,最后不知所措地屈服了。

en: We have worn her down .
zh: 我们已经厌倦了她。

en: The doctor bares my mother ’s arm , where the crepey flesh hangs loosely on the bones .
zh: 医生把我的母亲的胳膊脱下来,那块粘土肉松松地挂在骨头上。

en: To me the doctor says in her normal voice , “ It ’s just a little lidocaine . ”
zh: 对我来说,医生用她的正常的声音说, “ 这只是少量的 lidocaine. ”

en: I do n’t like the doctor , but I do n’t know why .
zh: 我不喜欢医生,但我不知道为什么。

en: She is no - nonsense .
zh: 她是无意义的.

en: She has professional hair , lightly streaked .
zh: 她有专业发型,略带条纹。

en: My mother winces at the injection and is surprised again .
zh: 我的母亲在注射后眨眼,又惊奇了。

en: She looks up at me , at Renata .
zh: 她仰望着我,仰望着雷纳塔。

en: We are smiling , both of us .
zh: 我们都微笑着。

en: I have no idea .
zh: 我不知道。

en: We wait for a few minutes .
zh: 我们等了几分钟。

en: “ They ’re going to give you an injection . ”
zh: “ 他们要给你注射药. ”

en: “ They ’re going to implant a chip .
zh: “ 他们打算植入一个芯片。

en: It will help them take care of you . ”
zh: 这会帮助他们照顾你。 ”

en: I try to say it every time as if it was the first time I said it .
zh: 我总是想说它,好像这是我第一次说它。

en: I do n’t want to embarrass her .
zh: 我不想使她尴尬。

en: Her head swings around , from Renata to me to the doctor and then back to Renata .
zh: 她的头在旋转,从雷纳塔到我到医生,然后回到雷纳塔。

en: “ Renata , ” my mother says .
zh: “ 丽娜塔 ” 妈妈说。

en: The doctor has an injection gun and while my mother is focused on my daughter , she puts it firmly against my mother ’s arm and puts the chip in .
zh: 医生有注射枪,而我母亲正注视我女儿,她把枪紧紧地放在母亲的手臂上,然后把芯片插进去。

en: It ’s another low - grade moment of horror , but I think about that particular time with my mother because Renata was there and we were united , she and I .
zh: 这是另一个低级的恐怖时刻,但我想的是我和母亲的那个特殊时刻,因为雷纳塔在那里,我们都团结在一起,她和我。

en: I come back to it a lot .
zh: 我经常来回。

en: The last two nights I have dreamed of dogs in trouble .
zh: 在过去的两个晚上,我梦见有麻烦的狗。

en: I do n’t dream about Renata , although when the dreams wake me up , it ’s thinking about Renata that keeps me awake .
zh: 我并不梦想雷纳塔,虽然梦醒醒我时,正是想到雷纳塔让我清醒。

en: That was the first night Renata did n’t come home and it does n’t take Freud to figure out what that meant .
zh: 那是第一个晚上,雷纳塔没有回家,弗洛伊德也无法理解这是什么意思。

en: Or Renata might be sleeping in her car .
zh: 或者莱纳塔可能正在她的车里睡觉。

en: The second night I dreamed that I was on a desert island and Sonia , our golden retriever , was with me .
zh: 第二天晚上,我梦见我在沙漠岛上,我们的金猎人索尼亚和我在一起。

en: There was some horrible fate impending for Sonia and I had to kill her before something worse happened .
zh: 索尼亚的命运很可怕,我不得不杀她,否则会发生更糟的事情。

en: I laid her down on some sticks .
zh: 我把她放在一些棍子上。

en: She trusts me , she ’s more my dog than anyone ’s , and she did n’t like it but for me she lay there .
zh: 她信任我,她比任何人更是我的狗,她不喜欢,但对我来说,她躺在那儿。

en: In my dream I told her , “ Stay , Sonia . Stay . ”
zh: 我在梦中告诉她, “ 住住, 索尼亚. 住住. ”

en: She stayed because I held her there by looking at her , the way you can sometimes will a dog into submission .
zh: 她留下是因为我把她抱在那里,看着她,这样你有时会让一只狗屈服。

en: And then the horror of it all hit me and I said , “ Sonia , up ! ”
zh: 然后,这一切的恐怖袭击我,我说, “ 索尼娅, 快点! ”

en: And I woke up .
zh: 我醒来。

en: " Try to touch the past .
zh: 试着触摸过去。

en: Try to deal with the past .
zh: 试着处理过去。

en: Most people would say it started with the Fireflies , but they 'd be wrong .
zh: 大多数人会说它从火花开始,但他们会错了。

en: It ended with all those things .
zh: 所有这些事情都结束了。

en: For me , it began with Robert Paglino .
zh: 对我来说,它从罗伯特·帕格林诺开始。

en: His was genetic : an uncontrolled genotype that left him predisposed to nearsightedness , acne , and  a susceptibility to narcotics .
zh: 他的基因是:一个无法控制的基因型,使他倾向于近视 、 痤疮和对麻醉品的敏感性.

en: His parents had never had him optimized .
zh: 他的父母从来没有把他优化过。

en: Those few TwenCen relics who still believed in God also held that one should n't try to improve upon His handiwork .
zh: 那些仍信奉上帝的少数十二门遗物也认为人们不应该尝试改进他的手艺。

en: So although both of us could have been repaired , only one of us had been .
zh: 因此,虽然我们两个都能够得到修理,但只有我们一个人已经得到修理。

en: I arrived at the playground to find Pag the center of attention for some half - dozen kids , those lucky few in front punching him in the head , the others making do with taunts of mongrel and polly while waiting their turn .
zh: 我到操场上去寻找帕格的注意力中心,有半个十几个孩子,那些幸运的几个在前面把他打在头上,其他人在等候轮到的时候,用小狗和小猫的嘲笑来做。

en: I watched him raise his arms , almost hesitantly , to ward off the worst of the blows .
zh: 我看着他几乎犹豫不决地举起胳膊,避开最坏的打击。

en: I could see into his head better than I could see into my own ; he was scared that his attackers might think those hands were coming up to hit back , that they 'd read it as an act of defiance and hurt him even more .
zh: 我能比我能看得更清楚地看到他的脑子,他担心他的攻击者会以为那些手来攻击他,他们会把它看作是反抗行为,伤害他甚至更多。

en: Even then , at the tender age of eight and with half my mind gone , I was becoming a superlative observer .
zh: 即使那时,我八岁时,我的心已半衰,我还是成为一名超凡的观察家。

en: But I did n't know what to do .
zh: 但我不知道该怎么办。

en: I had n't seen much of Pag lately .
zh: 我最近没看到过帕格的很多东西。

en: I was pretty sure he 'd been avoiding me .
zh: 我确信他一直在躲避我。

en: Even if the odds are impossible — and how many eight - year - olds would go up against six bigger kids for a sandbox buddy ? — at least you call for backup .
zh: 即使这些可能性是不可能的 — — 还有多少八 岁 的小孩会为了一个 sandbox 朋友而与六 岁 大的小孩打架? — — — 至少你需要备份。

en: I just stood there .
zh: 我只是站在那儿。

en: I did n't even especially want to help him .
zh: 我甚至不想特别帮助他。

en: That did n't make sense .
zh: 那没道理。

en: Even if he had n't been my best friend , I should at least have empathized .
zh: 即使他不是我最好的朋友,我至少应该同情他。

en: I 'd suffered less than Pag in the way of overt violence ; my seizures tended to keep the other kids at a distance , scared them even as they incapacitated me .
zh: 我比帕格少受过公开暴力的折磨;我发作的发作往往使其他孩子离我远,甚至使他们害怕,甚至使我无法行动。

en: I was no stranger to the taunts and insults , or the foot that appears from nowhere to trip you up en route from A to B .
zh: 我对那些嘲笑和侮辱,或者从没有地方出现的脚,使你从A到B的路上爬上去,并不陌生。

en: I knew how that felt .
zh: 我知道那是什么感觉。

en: Or I had , once .
zh: 或者我曾经有过。

en: But that part of me had been cut out along with the bad wiring .
zh: 但我的那个部位已经被切断了,连坏的电线也断了。

en: I was still working up the algorithms to get it back , still learning by observation .
zh: 我还在编写算法来恢复它,还是通过观察学习。

en: Every child knows that much instinctively .
zh: 每个孩子本能地知道这一点。

en: Maybe I should just let that process unfold , maybe I should n't try to mess with nature .
zh: 也许我应该让这个过程展开,也许我不应该尝试与自然混淆。

en: Then again , Pag 's parents had n't messed with nature , and look what it got them : a son curled up in the dirt while a bunch of engineered superboys kicked in his ribs .
zh: 然后又一次, 帕格的父母没有搞乱自然, 看看它给他们带来了什么:一个儿子卷在泥土里,而一群工程师的超级男孩踢了他的肋骨.

en: Back then I did n't so much think as observe , did n't deduce so much as remember — and what I remembered was a thousand inspirational stories lauding anyone who ever stuck up for the underdog .
zh: 那时我并不多思考,也不多推断,也不多记住 — — 而我记得的是千篇启发性的故事,赞扬那些曾经坚持为弱者而奋斗的人。

en: So I picked up a rock the size of my fist and hit two of Pag 's assailants across the backs of their heads before anyone even knew I was in the game .
zh: 于是,我拿起一个像我的拳头大小的石头,把帕格的两个袭击者打在他们头部的背面上,甚至没有人知道我参与了游戏。

en: A third , turning to face the new threat , took a blow to the face that audibly crunched the bones of his cheek .
zh: 第三人转过身来面对新的威胁,对脸部打了一拳,他的脸颊的骨头听起来就碎了。

en: I remember wondering why I did n't take any satisfaction from that sound , why it meant nothing beyond the fact I had one less opponent to worry about .
zh: 我记得我在想为什么我没有从那声音中得到任何满足,为什么它除了我有一个较少的对手之外没有意义。

en: The rest of them ran at the sight of blood .
zh: 其余的人看到血迹就跑了。

en: One of the braver promised me I was dead , shouted " Fucking zombie ! " over his shoulder as he disappeared around the corner .
zh: 一个勇敢的人向我保证我死了, 在拐角处消失的时候,他用肩膀喊道“ 妈的僵尸! ”

en: Three decades it took , to see the irony in that remark .
zh: 花了三十年的时间,才看到那段话的讽刺之处。

en: Two of the enemy twitched at my feet .
zh: 两个敌人在我脚边颤抖。

en: I kicked one in the head until it stopped moving , turned to the other .
zh: 我把一只踢到头上,直到它停止移动,然后转向另一只。

en: Something grabbed my arm and I swung without thinking , without looking until Pag yelped and ducked out of reach .
zh: 什么东西抓住了我的手臂,我没有思考,没有看,直到帕格大喊大叫地从我身边溜走。

en: " Oh , " I said .
zh: “ 哦, ” 我说道。

en: The other moaned and held its head and curled up in a ball .
zh: 另一个叫喊着,抓住了头,把球卷起来。

en: Blood coursed unheeded from his nose and splattered down his shirt .
zh: 血从他鼻子里流出,洒在衬衫上。

en: His cheek was turning blue and yellow .
zh: 他的脸色变为蓝色和黄色。

en: " Oh shit oh shit oh shit ... "
zh: 哦,妈的,妈的,妈的...

en: I thought of something to say .
zh: 我想说点话。

en: " You all right ? "
zh: “ 你没事 吗? ”

en: He wiped his mouth .
zh: 他擦了擦嘴。

en: Blood smeared the back of his hand .
zh: 他的手背上沾了血。

en: " They started it . "
zh: “ 他们开始了. ”

en: The moaning thing was crawling away on all fours .
zh: 那哭泣的家伙四肢都爬走了。

en: I wondered how long it would be before it found reinforcements .
zh: 我想知道它需要多长时间才能找到援军。

en: I wondered if I should kill it before then .
zh: 我想知道我该早点杀掉它吗。

en: " You 'd a never done that before , " Pag said .
zh: “ 你以前从未做过那样的事情, ” 帕格说.

en: Before the operation , he meant .
zh: 在手术前,他的意思是。

en: I actually did feel something then — faint , distant , but unmistakable .
zh: 我当时确实感觉到了某种 — 微弱, 遥远, 但不可误解的.

en: I felt angry .
zh: 我感到生气。

en: " They started — "
zh: “ 他们开始 — ”

en: Pag backed away , eyes wide .
zh: 帕格向后退,眼睛睁大。

en: " What are you doing ?
zh: “ 你在干什么?

en: I 'd raised my fists .
zh: 我举起拳头。

en: I did n't remember doing that .
zh: 我记不起这么做。

en: I unclenched them .
zh: 我把它们弄干净了。

en: It took a while .
zh: 花了很长时间。

en: I had to look at my hands very hard for a long , long time .
zh: 我不得不非常努力地看着我的手,很长时间。

en: I did n't understand why he could n't see that .
zh: 我不明白为什么他不能看见。

en: " They cut out your brain ! "
zh: “ 他们把你的大脑切断了! ”

en: " I know for the epilepsy !
zh: “ 我知道这种癫痫了!

en: You think I do n't know ?
zh: 你以为我不知道?

en: But you were in that half — or , like , part of you was ... "
zh: 可是你当时是那个半数 — 或者,你的一部分是..."

en: He struggled with the words , with the concept behind them .
zh: 他挣扎着用那些话,用背后的概念。

en: " And now you 're different .
zh: 现在你变了。

en: It 's like , your mom and dad murdered you — "
zh: 就像, 你的妈妈和爸爸杀了你 — ”

en: " My mom and dad , " I said , suddenly quiet , " saved my life .
zh: “ 我妈妈和爸爸, ” 我说, 突然安静, “ 救了我的命.

en: I would have died . "
zh: 我会死的。 ”

en: " I think you did die , " said my best and only friend .
zh: “ 我想你死了, ” 我唯一的好朋友说。

en: " I think Siri died , they scooped him out and threw him away and you 're some whole other kid that just , just grew back out of what was left .
zh: 我想西里死了,他们把他抓出来扔掉了,你只是个完全不同的孩子,只是从剩下的东西中长大了。

en: Jenna was in the tub , and I was doing the Times crossword , listening to the clang of the radiators and the swish of the taxis on the slush outside , when my coffee - scented reverie was broken by a loud squawk from the bathroom , and a splash , and a flesh - upon - cold - tile sort of thump .
zh: 珍娜在浴缸里,我正在做《时代报》的横字,听着热线器的响声和外面的沙滩上出租车的摇摆声,当我喝咖啡时,咖啡的香味被从浴室里传来的一声尖叫声打破了,还有一滴水,还有一滴冷板上的肉。

en: Get out of my bathroom ! ”
zh: 离开我的浴室吧! ”

en: I threw down my pen and dashed down the hall .
zh: 我把钢笔扔下来,冲下大厅。

en: Jenna was picking herself up off the floor of the bathroom .
zh: 珍娜正在从浴室的地板上爬上。

en: In the bathtub , a bar of soap was gaily chasing a nylon scrubby thing around the surface of the water .
zh: 在浴槽里,一桶肥皂正狂热地追逐一个尼龙的脏东西在水面上。

en: “ Damned pixies ! ” Jenna said , smacking the bathtub ’s drain lever .
zh: 珍娜说, 击中了浴槽的排水杠杆.

en: I am so tired of these things ! ”
zh: 我太厌倦了这些事了! ”

en: A piteous squeak came from the scrubby thing as the water began to swirl down the drain .
zh: 当水开始向下排水道旋转时,那破烂的东西发出了哀伤的尖叫。

en: A translucent little head poked out from behind a pot of organic - sugarcane exfoliating body polish , and looked at me with exaggerated puppy eyes and a trembling lower lip .
zh: 一只透明的小头从罐子后面抽出来,那罐子里放着有机甘蔗的肉体抛光剂,用夸张的小狗的眼睛和颤抖的下唇看着我。

en: “ Sorry , kids , ” I said to the bathtub .
zh: “ 对不起, 孩子们, ” 我对浴室说。

en: “ Do n’t humor them , dammit , ” Jenna said , and stomped , still naked , still wet , toward the phone in the kitchen .
zh: “ 别开玩笑, 天哪, ” 珍娜说, 站着, 仍然裸体, 仍然潮湿, 朝厨房里的电话走.

en: She ’d be irritated by her own wet footprints on the battered wood of the hallway floor later , but right now she had blood on her mind .
zh: 后来,她会因为在走廊地板上的树木上留下的潮湿的脚印感到恼火,但现在她心里有血迹。

en: I could n’t say I blamed her .
zh: 我不能说我责备她。

en: She got the brunt of the pixies ’ odd sense of humor much more than I did , because she ’s the one who likes to take baths .
zh: 她比我更喜欢这些pixies的奇怪幽默感,因为她就是喜欢洗澡的人。

en: Although I will say that a pixie hiding in the sink among the dirty soup bowls makes doing the dishes an adventure .
zh: 尽管我会说,在脏汤碗里藏着一只狐狸使做菜成为一场冒险。

en: It ’s Jenna McMasters in 5C .
zh: 这是5C的珍娜·麦克马斯特斯。

en: Ramon , the pixies are out of control .
zh: 雷蒙,这些pixies已经失去控制了。

en: You ’ve got to do something about —
zh: 你必须做一些事情...

en: Really , we need you to do something sooner ...
zh: 真的,我们需要你早点做点事情...

en: We may have to try something on our own , then .
zh: 我们可能得自己尝试一下,然后。

en: She hung up the phone .
zh: 她把电话挂起来。

en: “ Man , he ’s useless , ” she said .
zh: 她说:“ 伙计, 他没用. ”

en: “ On the other hand , ” I said , “ he ’s the first super we ’ve had who keeps the boiler , the door buzzers , and the electrical system in perfect working order . ”
zh: “ 另一方面, ” 我说道, “ 他是我们拥有的第一个超级人,他把锅炉 、 门铃和电系统保持在完美的工作秩序. ”

en: I took the robe I ’d brought from the bathroom and wrapped it around her shoulders .
zh: 我把从浴室里拿来的礼服带到她肩上。

en: “ What is it they say in yoga class ?
zh: “ 他们在瑜伽课上怎么说?

en: Spiral out from your navel center , and stuff . ”
zh: 把你的鼻孔中心螺旋出来, 还有其它东西. ”

en: “ Robert , this sort of thing never happened in San Francisco . ”
zh: “ 罗伯特, 这种事在旧金山从未发生过. ”

en: “ No , ” I said .
zh: “ 不, ” 我说道。

en: “ In San Francisco we got earthquakes , and there were wood sprites in Golden Gate Park .
zh: “ 在旧金山,我们发生了地震,还有金门公园的树枝。

en: But then they come at me on a Sunday morning , when I have no work to do and I ’m trying to relax and I ’m naked , and I just lose it ... . ”
zh: 但在星期天早上,他们来找我,我没有工作要做,我正试图放松,我裸体,我只是失去它...... ”

en: “ And you take it out on the super , ” I said .
zh: “ 然后你把它拿出来, ” 我说道。

en: “ And now I ’m gon na have a bruise on my butt , too , ” she said .
zh: 她说: “ 现在我又觉得腿上有个伤痕了. ”

en: “ Well , that ’s karma for you .
zh: “ 嗯, 那是你的业余.

en: Jenna smiled .
zh: 珍娜微笑着。

en: “ Just make sure there are no pixies in the coffee pot , is all I ask . ”
zh: “ 只要确保咖啡壶里没有画素, 就够我问了. ”

en: That was our previous Sunday morning adventure : most unpleasant , and marked by the death of a new French - press pot .
zh: 那是我们以前的星期天早上的冒险: 最不愉快, 和一个新法国 - 压罐的死亡标志着.

en: I realized that I , too , hated the pixies .
zh: 我意识到,我也讨厌pixies。

en: “ We need a plan , ” I said .
zh: “ 我们需要一个计划, ” 我说道。

en: Rachel Rook took Carroll home to meet her parents two months after she first slept with him .
zh: 瑞秋·罗克带着卡罗尔回家,在她与他第一次睡过两个月后,见到她的父母。

en: For a generous girl , a girl who took off her clothes with abandon , she was remarkably close - mouthed about some things .
zh: 对一个慷慨的女孩来说, 一个带着遗弃地脱衣服的女孩, 她对某些事情非常亲切.

en: In two months Carroll had learned that her parents lived on a farm several miles outside of town ; that they sold strawberries in summer , and Christmas trees in the winter .
zh: 在两个月内,卡罗尔得知她的父母住在镇外几英里的农场里;他们夏天卖草莓,冬天卖圣诞树。

en: He knew that they never left the farm ; instead , the world came to them in the shape of weekend picnickers and driveby tourists .
zh: 他知道他们从不离开农场;相反,世界来到他们身边以周末野餐和开车的游客的形式。

en: Do you think your parents will like me ? " he said .
zh: 你认为你父母会喜欢我吗? ”他说。

en: He had spent the afternoon preparing for this visit as carefully as if he were preparing for an exam .
zh: 他花了整个下午来准备这次访问,好像正在准备考试一样小心。

en: He had gotten his hair cut , trimmed his nails , washed his neck and behind his ears .
zh: 他剪了头发,修了指甲,洗了脖子和耳后。

en: The outfit he had chosen , khaki pants and a blue button - down shirt -- no tie -- lay neatly folded on the bed .
zh: 他所选择的服装,  khaki裤子和蓝色的扣子下衬衫--没有领带--均匀地叠在床上.

en: He stood before Rachel in his plain white underwear and white socks , gazing at her as if she were a mirror .
zh: 他穿着白色的裤子和白色的袜子站在瑞秋面前,看着她,仿佛她是个镜子。

en: " No , " she said .
zh: “ 不, ” 她说。

en: It was the first time she had been to his apartment , and she stood square in the center of his bedroom , her arms folded against her body as if she was afraid to sit down , to touch something .
zh: 这是她第一次到他的公寓,她站在他的卧室中央的广场上,她的胳膊按着她的身体,好像她害怕坐下来,碰什么东西。

en: " My father will like you , " she said .
zh: “ 我父亲会喜欢你, ” 她说道。

en: " But he likes everyone .
zh: 但是他喜欢每个人都。

en: she thinks that you lack a serious nature . "
zh: 她认为你缺乏严肃的性格。

en: " So you 've talked to her about me . "
zh: “ 那么你跟她谈过我的事了。 ”

en: " But you have n't talked about her to me . "
zh: “ 可是你没跟我谈过她. ”

en: " Are you ashamed of her ? "
zh: “ 你为她感到羞耻 吗? ”

en: Then she sighed in a way that seemed to suggest she was regretting her decision to take him home .
zh: 然后她叹了口气,似乎表示她后悔决定带他回家。

en: " You 're ashamed of me , " he guessed , and Rachel kissed him and smiled and did n't say anything .
zh: “ 你为我感到羞愧, ” 他猜想, 瑞秋亲吻他,微笑,什么也没说.

en: Rachel still lived on her parents ' farm , which made it all the more remarkable that she had kept Carroll and her parents apart for so long .
zh: 雷切尔仍然住在她的父母的农场,这使得她把卡罗尔和她的父母隔离得如此久。

en: It suggested a talent for daily organization that filled Carroll 's heart with admiration and lust .
zh: 它暗示了卡罗尔的内心充满钦佩和欲望的日常组织才能。

en: He sat at the checkout desk , stamping books and reading Tristram Shandy for a graduate class ; he was almost asleep when someone said , " Excuse me . "
zh: 他坐在柜台上, 印书和读毕业班的《三思山迪》; 有人说, “ 对不起, ” 他几乎睡着了.

en: He looked up .
zh: 他抬起头来。

en: The girl who stood before the tall desk was red - headed .
zh: 站在那张高高的桌子前面的那个女孩脸色红.

en: Sunlight streaming in through a high window opposite her lit up the fine hairs on her arm , the embroidered flowers on the collar of her white shirt .
zh: 阳光透过她对面的高窗射进来,照亮了她的胳膊上的细发,她的白衬衫的领带上绣花。

en: The sunlight turned her hair to fire and Carroll found it difficult to look directly at her .
zh: 阳光把她的头发照亮了,卡罗尔很难直接看着她。

en: " Can I help you ? " he said .
zh: “ 我能帮你 吗? ” 他说道。

en: She placed a shredded rectangle on the desk , and Carroll picked it up between his thumb and forefinger .
zh: 她把一块碎 rectangle放在桌上,卡罗尔把它放在他的拇指和前指之间。

en: Pages hung in tatters from the sodden blue spine .
zh: Pages hung in tatters from the sodden blue spine 。

en: " I need to pay for a damaged book , " she said .
zh: “ 我需要支付损坏的书, ” 她说道。

en: " What happened ? Did your dog eat it ? " he said , making a joke .
zh: “ 怎么了? 你的狗吃了 吗? ” 他开玩笑地说.

en: " What 's your name ? " Carroll said .
zh: “ 你叫什么名字? ” 卡罗尔说.

en: Already , he thought he might be in love .
zh: 他已经以为他可能爱上了。

en: Does n’t it make you just want to sneeze ?
zh: 难道它不让你只是想喷嚏吗?

en: Pete was leaning against the wall , watching the street go by .
zh: 皮特靠在墙上,看着街道经过。

en: I pulled the bike to a halt , the front wheel pointing in his direction .
zh: 我把自行车停了下来,前轮指向他。

en: “ I think I ’ve got a fairy stuck up my nose . ”
zh: “ 我想我鼻子上有个仙女. ”

en: “ S’ not true ! ” came a voice from inside the nose in question .
zh: “ 不是真的! ” 一个声音从那个问题鼻子里传来.

en: “ I did n’t see your lips move at all . ”
zh: “ 我根本没看见你的嘴唇动动. ”

en: The itching was getting worse .
zh: 痒得越来越厉害。

en: I pulled out a paper tissue .
zh: 我拿出一张纸质。

en: “ S’ not my fault .
zh: “ 这不是我的错。

en: You make me want to sneeze ! ”
zh: 你让我想喷嚏! ”

en: And I did .
zh: 我做了。

en: I inspected the crumpled paper .
zh: 我检查了碎纸。

en: Pete looked at me with mild disgust as I eyed the handkerchief more closely .
zh: 皮特带着轻微的厌恶地看着我,我凝视着那把手帕。

en: “ You know that ’s pretty gross … ” he said .
zh: “ 你知道,这太糟了... ” 他说道。

en: “ Got any other brilliant remarks ? ” I said .
zh: “ 还有其他好点 吗? ” 我说.

en: I held a finger up to my lips , and waved a hand to silence Pete ’s reply .
zh: 我把手指伸到嘴唇上,挥手沉默皮特的回答。

en: “ Are you still there ? ” I called .
zh: “ 你还在吗? ”我叫。

en: “ No thanks to you ! ” came the little voice .
zh: “ 谢谢你! ” 小声说道。

en: Pete looked at me sort of sideways .
zh: 皮特看着我。

en: I ’ve really got something stuck up there .
zh: 我确实有些东西在那儿挂着。
