en: I was riding on me bike and I thought I ’d swallowed an insect or something .
zh: 我骑着我的自行车,以为我吞了虫子或者什么东西。

en: And then it started insulting me . ”
zh: 然后它开始侮辱我。 ”

en: “ You ’re having me on , right ? ”
zh: “ 你把我带上, 对 吗? ”

en: Look at me .
zh: 看着我。

en: If it ’s a trick , how do I do it then ? ”
zh: 如果这是个骗局, 那么我怎么做呢? ”

en: Pete thought for a moment .
zh: 皮特想了一会儿。

en: “ If it ’s real … Are n’t they supposed to have a pot of gold or something ?
zh: “ 如果是真的... 难道他们不应该有一只金罐或者什么东西 吗?

en: And they have to tell you where it is if you catch them ? ”
zh: 如果你抓到它们,他们就得告诉你它们在哪里? ”

en: “ That ’s leprechauns , idiot ! ” said the voice from my noise .
zh: “ 那个家伙, 傻瓜! ” 我的声响声说.

en: “ So what ’s the difference ?
zh: “ 那么,有什么区别?

en: Just give us the gold and we ’ll let you go … ”
zh: 只要给我们金子,我们就会让你走... ”

en: “ We — ? ” I started .
zh: ”我开始说。

en: He winked at me .
zh: 他向我眨眼。

en: Suddenly I felt a violent pain in my nose , my eyes watered .
zh: 我突然在鼻子里感到一阵猛烈的疼痛, 眼睛里流了水.

en: “ Owwww ! ” I howled .
zh: “ 哇! ” 我叫道。

en: “ See what I mean ? ” the voice shouted over my moans .
zh: “ 看我的意思 吗? ” 声音在我哭泣时喊道.

en: “ Perhaps you can use it in exams … ” Pete said , scratching his head .
zh: “ 也许你可以在考试中使用它... ” 皮特说,  scratching his head.

en: “ You know , it could tell us all the answers . ”
zh: “ 你知道, 它可以告诉我们所有答案. ”

en: If it yacks on like that in an exam , I ’ll get thrown out .
zh: 如果它在考试中像那样发抖,我就会被扔掉。

en: “ Perhaps I do n’t know the answers anyway ? ” said the voice .
zh: “ 也许我根本不知道答案 呢? ” 声音说。

en: “ Have you thought of that ? ”
zh: “ 你想过 吗? ”

en: “ Anyway , I do n’t want it in exams .
zh: “ 不管怎样,我不想在考试中考试。

en: Out of my nose . ”
zh: 从我的鼻子里出来. ”

en: “ Ca n’t you just poke it out ? ”
zh: “ 难道你没把它弄出来 吗? ”

en: “ S’pose you ’ve already tried your finger … ”
zh: “ 假设你已经试过你的手指... ”

en: “ And it was n’t pleasant I can tell you . ”
zh: “ 我能告诉你,这并不愉快。 ”

en: “ You see what it ’s like .
zh: “ 你看,这是什么样子。

en: He ’s already making sarcastic remarks like that … ”
zh: 他已经做出那样的讽刺的评论... ”

en: “ What if we put something in your nose to catch it , then ?
zh: “ 要是我们把东西放在你的鼻子里来抓它, 那怎么办?

en: I do n’t know … A spider ? ”
zh: 我不知道...蜘蛛? ”

en: “ You both said the same thing at the same time , you ’ve got to make a — ” He hit his forehead with his palm .
zh: “ 你们俩同时说同样的话, 你得做 — ” 他用手掌打在额头.

en: When you catch a fairy , you get three wishes .
zh: 当你抓到一个仙女时,你得到三个愿望。

en: Hey you in there !
zh: 嘿,你在这儿!

en: “ You could see things like that … ” said the voice with resignation .
zh: 那声音带着辞职声说, “ 你可以看到那样的东西... ”

en: “ I wish you ’d get out of my nose , then ! ” I cried .
zh: “ 我希望你能从我鼻子里出来! ” 我喊道。

en: In a flash the fairy was out of my nose and gone .
zh: 就在一瞬间,仙女从我鼻子里消失了。

en: And I ’m still waiting for my two other wishes .
zh: 我还等着我的另外两个愿望。

en: Something a little lighter this week , I hope you enjoy it .
zh: 这个星期有点轻一些,我希望你喜欢它。

en: Once it got started , I realised that the idea must have been inspired by the title of Justine Larbalestier ’s How to Ditch Your Fairy , although it has nothing at all to do with that story at all .
zh: 一旦开始了,我意识到这个想法一定是被贾斯汀·拉巴莱斯特的《如何抛弃你的仙女》的标题所激发的,尽管它与那个故事无关。

en: All in all , my story feels very light .
zh: 总之,我的故事很轻松。

en: But I think I needed something a little less dark , and there are some quite sombre tales coming up in the coming weeks .
zh: 但我想我需要一些更黑暗的东西,而且在接下来的几个星期里会有一些相当悲惨的故事。

en: See you then .
zh: 再见。

en: Steven wanted to be a dentist .
zh: 史蒂文想当牙医。

en: It was pretty much the first thing he told us when , as first years , we were all bunched together in the unfamiliar dusty classroom .
zh: 这是他第一次告诉我们的事情,在最初的几年里,我们都聚集在陌生的尘土的教室里。

en: When , a couple of weeks later we were invited over to his house we saw that this was not an idle remark .
zh: 几周后,我们被邀请到他的家里,我们发现这不是闲事。

en: Where our bedroom walls were decorated with posters of pop stars and footballers , Steven had diagrams setting out tooth implementations , anatomical drawings of the jaw with brightly coloured nerves , muscle , blood vessels , bones , and , of course , teeth .
zh: 在我们的卧室墙上装饰着流行歌星和足球运动员的海报,史蒂文的图表显示了牙齿的实现,有明亮的神经、肌肉、血管、骨骼和牙齿的解剖图。

en: Where we had shelves of plastic dinosaurs and superhero figurines from cornflake boxes , Steven had plaster casts of jawbones , gums and teeth grinning down at us .
zh: 我们有塑料恐龙和超级英雄的架子从玉米片盒里,史蒂文的牙龈和牙齿 grinning down at us。

en: The instruments were locked away in glass cabinets and only his parents had the key .
zh: 这些仪器被锁在玻璃柜里,只有他的父母有钥匙。

en: “ They do n’t exactly encourage my interest , ” he shrugged .
zh: 他耸耸肩说: “ 他们并不鼓励我感兴趣. ”

en: “ They sort of tolerate it .
zh: “ 他们有点容忍。

en: But Dad says they ’re a sort of collection , and too expensive for me to play with . ”
zh: 可是爸爸说,它们是一种收藏品,我玩起来太贵了。 ”

en: Of course , we tried to pick the locks , but the spikes and saws and drillheads remained — tantalisingly — out of reach .
zh: 当然,我们试着选取锁子,但螺钉、锯子和钻头仍然 — — 令人兴奋 — — 无法触及。

en: We did n’t see Steven ’s interest as strange , well , not that much .
zh: 我们没有看到史蒂文的兴趣是奇怪的,嗯,不是那么多。

en: We all had our own interests — drawing , electronics , collecting beer caps — that each appeared obscure to anyone else .
zh: 我们都有自己的兴趣 — — 绘画 、 电子 、 收集啤酒盖子 — — 每一个都显得对别人很模糊。

en: DIY Dentistry was just something that had never crossed our horizon before .
zh: DIY牙科只是以前从未跨越我们的地平线的东西。

en: And if Steven did n’t see it as weird , or no weirder than Andy showing us his Eastern - Block beer caps all laid out neatly on cork boards with little hand - written labels , why should it bother us ?
zh: 如果史蒂文不觉得这很奇怪, 或者比安迪更奇怪,他给我们展示了他的东区啤酒帽,它们都贴在皮纸板上,上面有小手写的标签, 那为什么会困扰我们呢?

en: I suppose that , in our own way , we were all collectively strange .
zh: 我猜想, 在我们自己的方式上, 我们都是集体的怪人.

en: Besides , Steven had some really good stuff : sweets that stained your teeth bright red — well , technically , not your teeth , just the plaque , but the result was often the same .
zh: 除此之外,史蒂文还有一些非常好的东西:糖果使你的牙齿变红 — — 嗯,从技术上讲,不是你的牙齿,只是斑点,但结果往往是一样的。

en: It took a few days good brushing to get it off .
zh: 刷好几天才把它脱下来。

en: He had effervescent tablets that turned the canteen drinking water into that exact same pink mixture that the dentist gave you to rinse your mouth out after scraping around inside , and guaranteed to make the other kids splutter and spit it out when the taste slowly percolated through and met the memory of their last checkup .
zh: 他拿了药片,把食堂的饮水变成牙医给你的那种粉红色的混合物,用它把你的嘴冲出来,然后再把里面的东西擦掉,再保证让其他孩子发抖,然后吐出来,因为味道慢慢地渗入了里面,和他们上次检查的记忆相吻合。

en: Then there was the event that became the rite of passage into our group of misfits and outcasts : making a mould of your teeth .
zh: 然后发生了一个事件,成为进入我们群体的fitsfits和排斥者的过渡仪式:做你的牙齿的模板。

en: It was inevitable that one of us , seeing the plaster casts on the shelf by Steven ’s bed would ask how they were done .
zh: 当我们看到史蒂文的床边架子上的瓦片时,必然会问他们是怎么做的。

en: It was just as inevitable that a few minutes later , Steven would be mixing up various powders and liquids , and pouring them into a horse - shoe shaped contraption .
zh: 几分钟后,史蒂文将混合各种粉末和液体,然后倒入马鞋形的器皿里,这同样是不可避免的。

en: It was vaguely uncomfortable , and appeared sufficiently disturbing that we all volunteered each other in turn until , at last , Andy said he was game .
zh: 这是很不舒适的,而且看起来十分令人不安,我们都互相自愿,直到最后,安迪说他玩得很好。

en: And we were off .
zh: 我们走了。

en: The hardest part was probably to overcome the gagging reflex that set in when you bit down into the acrid resin jelly and it flowed out and up and around , over teeth , gums and tongue .
zh: 最难的部分可能是克服你咬进酸性树脂 Jelly 时所产生的阻塞反射,然后它从牙齿 、 牙龈和舌头上流出。

en: Your nose filled with what you imagined were fumes from the warm paste .
zh: 你的鼻子里充斥着你想象中的热糊中的烟雾。

en: And you seemed to be suddenly drowning in your own saliva .
zh: 你似乎突然在自己的唾液中淹没了。

en: Things generally got better when Steven reminded you that you could actually breathe , and swallow , normally .
zh: 当史蒂文提醒你你实际上可以呼吸和吞咽的时候,情况总算好起来了。

en: He watched the second hand trotting round the dial of his watch mouthing the quarters , before poking the setting goo to check its consistency .
zh: 他看着另一只手绕着手表的拨号环绕四周,然后点了点灯来检查它的一致性。

en: Then , when he gave you the nod , you tried to prise your jaws apart .
zh: 然后,当他向你点头时,你试着把牙齿撕开。

en: As the seal around your gums and teeth was pretty solid , you thought it would never come off , as the others giggled at your expressions and grimaces .
zh: 因为你的牙龈和牙齿的密封很牢固,你以为它永远不会掉下来,而其他人则嘲笑你的表情和脸色。

en: Steven jiggled the handle that stuck out beyond your front teeth like some metallic duck ’s bill , turning and twisting it most professionally and murmuring encouragements .
zh: 史蒂文摇摇晃晃晃地握着你的前牙,就像一只金属鸭的嘴一样,用最专业的方式转动和扭动它,发出尖叫的鼓励。

en: The initiated then revelled in retelling the gross sensation of having this evil - smelling plastic slug invade your mouth , while the others waited their turn with mixed trepidation and excitement .
zh: 开始的人们高兴地讲述了这种恶臭的塑料臭虫的可怕感觉,而其他人则带着混合的恐惧和兴奋等着轮到。

en: Raucous laughter greeted the suggestions of the other body parts that could receive the same treatment .
zh: 高声的笑声欢迎能接受同样治疗的其他身体部位的建议。

en: The next part of the proceedings was less thrilling .
zh: 诉讼的下一个部分不太令人兴奋。

en: Steven measured and mixed the plaster of Paris and prepared for the cast by using a bright blue putty to build up the form of the jaw , and shoring up gaps and holes .
zh: 史蒂文测量和混合了巴黎的瓦片,并用明亮的蓝色布料做铸造准备,以建立牙齿的形状,并填补缺口和洞穴。

en: It get even less exciting when he said we ’d have to wait an hour while the plaster set real solid .
zh: 当他说我们得等一小时, plaster真的 solid 就变得更不兴奋了。

en: But the next time we visited his room we got to marvel at our toothy grins labelled and lined up on the shelf .
zh: 可是下次我们参观他的房间时,我们惊奇地看到我们那张贴有标签的、排在架子上的粗糙的笑脸。

en: We were all perfectly happy with the result , even wanting one as a trophy until Steven passed an expert eye over them , pointing out here a gap , here a filling , and there a completely misaligned incisor .
zh: 我们都对结果非常满意,甚至想要一个奖杯,直到史蒂文通过专家的眼睛,指出这里有一个空隙,这里一个填充,还有一个完全错位的切口。

en: We were , he told us , mediocre specimens for his collection .
zh: 他告诉我们,我们是他的收藏中等的样品。

en: It did n’t matter .
zh: 没关系。

en: “ I have already told you of the sickness and confusion that comes with time travelling .
zh: “ 我已经告诉过你,时间旅行带来的疾病和混乱。

en: And this time I was not seated properly in the saddle , but sideways and in an unstable fashion .
zh: 这次我不是坐在鞍上,而是靠在侧边,不稳定。

en: For an indefinite time I clung to the machine as it swayed and vibrated , quite unheeding how I went , and when I brought myself to look at the dials again I was amazed to find where I had arrived .
zh: 不知不觉地,我紧紧地抓住了机器,它在旋转和振动着,我完全没有注意到我怎么走,当我把身子带回来再看一下手表时,我惊奇地发现我到哪里去了。

en: One dial records days , and another thousands of days , another millions of days , and another thousands of millions .
zh: 一个拨号记录了几天,还有数千天,还有数百万天,还有数千百万天。

en: Now , instead of reversing the levers , I had pulled them over so as to go forward with them , and when I came to look at these indicators I found that the thousands hand was sweeping round as fast as the seconds hand of a watch — into futurity .
zh: 现在,我没有把杠杆倒转,而是把它们拉过来,以便跟它们一起向前走,当我来看这些指标时,我发现数千个手像手表的秒钟一样快地旋转 — — 进入未来。

en: “ As I drove on , a peculiar change crept over the appearance of things .
zh: 当我开车时, 一种奇怪的变化在事物的外表上涌现.

en: The palpitating greyness grew darker ; then — though I was still travelling with prodigious velocity — the blinking succession of day and night , which was usually indicative of a slower pace , returned , and grew more and more marked .
zh: palpitating 的灰色变得更暗了;然后 — — 虽然我仍以惊人的速度旅行 — — 白天和夜晚的闪烁的连续,这通常表示慢的步伐, 又回来了,并且变得越来越明显。

en: This puzzled me very much at first .
zh: 这在一开始就使我非常困惑。

en: The alternations of night and day grew slower and slower , and so did the passage of the sun across the sky , until they seemed to stretch through centuries .
zh: 白天和夜晚的交替日渐缓慢,太阳越过天空越过天空,直到它们似乎跨越了几个世纪。

en: At last a steady twilight brooded over the earth , a twilight only broken now and then when a comet glared across the darkling sky .
zh: 终于,一个稳步的黄昏笼罩着地球, 黄昏只是偶尔的破裂,当一个彗星在黑暗的天空中闪烁时.

en: The band of light that had indicated the sun had long since disappeared ; for the sun had ceased to set — it simply rose and fell in the west , and grew ever broader and more red .
zh: 那条光线已经表明太阳已经很久不见了,因为太阳已经停止了落下 — 它只是在西面上升下来,变得越来越宽,越来越红了。

en: All trace of the moon had vanished .
zh: 月亮的所有痕迹都消失了。

en: The circling of the stars , growing slower and slower , had given place to creeping points of light .
zh: 星团的旋转,越来越缓慢, 给光点的蠕动提供了空间.

en: At last , some time before I stopped , the sun , red and very large , halted motionless upon the horizon , a vast dome glowing with a dull heat , and now and then suffering a momentary extinction .
zh: 最后,在我停下来之前,太阳,红又大,停在地平线上无动,巨大的圆顶在昏暗的热中闪耀着,有时会经历短暂的灭绝。

en: At one time it had for a little while glowed more brilliantly again , but it speedily reverted to its sullen red heat .
zh: 有一次,它又闪烁了点亮点,但很快又回到了那令人厌倦的红热之中。

en: I perceived by this slowing down of its rising and setting that the work of the tidal drag was done .
zh: 我觉察到它的上升和沉降的减速使得潮汐拖拉的工作已经完成。

en: Very cautiously , for I remembered my former headlong fall , I began to reverse my motion .
zh: 非常小心,因为我记得我以前的头晕倒下,我开始扭转我的动作。

en: Slower and slower went the circling hands until the thousands one seemed motionless and the daily one was no longer a mere mist upon its scale .
zh: 四周四周的双手走得越来越慢,直到数千人似乎无动,而每日不再只是在其规模上的雾气。

en: Still slower , until the dim outlines of a desolate beach grew visible .
zh: 还是慢一点,直到一片荒凉的海滩的暗淡的轮廓显而易见。

en: “ I stopped very gently and sat upon the Time Machine , looking round .
zh: 我轻轻地停下来,坐在时间机器上,环顾四周。

en: North - eastward it was inky black , and out of the blackness shone brightly and steadily the pale white stars .
zh: 朝东北看,是漆黑的,从黑暗中闪烁着明亮而稳步的淡白的星星。

en: Overhead it was a deep Indian red and starless , and south - eastward it grew brighter to a glowing scarlet where , cut by the horizon , lay the huge hull of the sun , red and motionless .
zh: 头上是深红无星的印第安人,向东南转,它变得更明亮,变成一个闪亮的红宝石,在那儿,被地平线遮住,躺着太阳的巨大船体,红色无动。

en: The rocks about me were of a harsh reddish colour , and all the trace of life that I could see at first was the intensely green vegetation that covered every projecting point on their south - eastern face .
zh: 我周围的岩石颜色是刺红的,我最初看到的一切生命迹象都是深绿色的植被,它们的东南面的每一个映射点都覆盖着。

en: It was the same rich green that one sees on forest moss or on the lichen in caves : plants which like these grow in a perpetual twilight .
zh: 它与人们在森林的苔藓或洞穴中的叶片上看到的一样丰富绿色:像这些植物在永恒的黄昏中生长。

en: “ The machine was standing on a sloping beach .
zh: “机器站在斜坡的海滩上。

en: There were no breakers and no waves , for not a breath of wind was stirring .
zh: 没有断裂器,没有波浪,因为没有一阵风的呼吸。

en: Only a slight oily swell rose and fell like a gentle breathing , and showed that the eternal sea was still moving and living .
zh: 只有轻微的油气浮升而下,像轻微的呼吸一样,显示了永恒的大海依然动荡而生。

en: And along the margin where the water sometimes broke was a thick incrustation of salt — pink under the lurid sky .
zh: 水有时破裂的边缘有一层厚厚的盐 — — 在阴暗的天空下是粉红色的。

en: There was a sense of oppression in my head , and I noticed that I was breathing very fast .
zh: 我脑子里有一种压迫的感觉,我注意到我呼吸得非常快。

en: The sensation reminded me of my only experience of mountaineering , and from that I judged the air to be more rarefied than it is now .
zh: 这种感觉使我想起我唯一的登山经历,从那里我判断空气比现在更稀少。

en: “ Far away up the desolate slope I heard a harsh scream , and saw a thing like a huge white butterfly go slanting and fluttering up into the sky and , circling , disappear over some low hillocks beyond .
zh: 远处的荒凉斜坡上,我听见一声尖叫,看见像一只巨大的白蝴蝶那样飞向天空飘荡,环绕着天空,消失在远处的低山上。

en: The sound of its voice was so dismal that I shivered and seated myself more firmly upon the machine .
zh: 它的声音太悲惨了,我颤抖着,更坚定地坐在机器上。

en: Looking round me again , I saw that , quite near , what I had taken to be a reddish mass of rock was moving slowly towards me .
zh: 我又看了四周,我看见,很近,我以为是红色的岩石,慢慢地朝我走来。

en: Then I saw the thing was really a monstrous crab - like creature .
zh: 然后我看见这东西真是个可怕的蟹类生物.

en: Can you imagine a crab as large as yonder table , with its many legs moving slowly and uncertainly , its big claws swaying , its long antennæ , like carters ’ whips , waving and feeling , and its stalked eyes gleaming at you on either side of its metallic front ?
zh: 你能想象一个像那张桌子那样大的蟹,它的许多腿在缓慢而不确定地移动,它的大爪子在游动,它的长 antennæ,像卡特的鞭子,在摇动和感觉,它的追踪的眼睛在它的金属前边向你闪烁?

en: Its back was corrugated and ornamented with ungainly bosses , and a greenish incrustation blotched it here and there .
zh: 它的背部是卷的,装饰着无情的老板,一个绿色的斑点在这儿和那儿涂抹了。

en: I could see the many palps of its complicated mouth flickering and feeling as it moved .
zh: 我能看见它那复杂的嘴里的许多触手在移动时闪烁着,感觉起来。

en: Veronique stayed with me that night , lying next to me in my blankets and furs .
zh: 那个晚上,弗罗妮克和我在一起,躺在我的毛毯和毛毯旁边。

en: She did n't sleep , I do n't think .
zh: 她睡不着,我想不睡。

en: I was listening to her breath .
zh: 我正在听她呼吸。

en: I felt as if I should help her sleep .
zh: 我觉得我应该帮助她睡觉。

en: I lay there and tried to think if I should put my arm around her , but I did n't know .
zh: 我躺在那儿,想是不是应该把手放在她身边,但我不知道。

en: Maybe she did n't want to be touched .
zh: 也许她不想受到触摸。

en: She lay tense in the dark .
zh: 她在黑暗中紧张地躺着。

en: " Are you going to be a teacher ? " I asked .
zh: “ 你打算当老师 吗? ” 我问。

en: She laughed .
zh: 她笑了。

en: " If I get out of here . "
zh: “ 如果我离开这里. ”

en: I waited for her to say more , but she did n't .
zh: 我等着她再说一遍,但她没有。

en: Maybe she meant if she made herself .
zh: 也许她的意思是如果她自作自足。

en: To get her to talk , although I was tired of lingua and I did n't really want to think about anything .
zh: 要让她说话,虽然我厌倦了语言,我实在不想再想什么了。

en: " My family came here from Earth , " she said .
zh: “ 我的家人从地球来到这里, ” 她说道。

en: " My father , he 's an anthropologist , " she said .
zh: 她说:“ 我父亲是个人类学家。

en: " Do you know anthropologist ? "
zh: “ 你知道人类学家 吗? ”

en: " No , " I said .
zh: “ 不, ” 我说道。

en: " He is a person who studies the way people live .
zh: 他是一个研究人们生活的方式的人。

en: All the offworlders I had ever met were teachers .
zh: 我见过的那些无世界的人都是教师。

en: I wondered who did all the work on Earth .
zh: 我想知道谁在地球上做了所有的工作。

en: " Because Earth had lost touch with your world , the people here are very interesting to my father , " she said .
zh: “ 因为地球与你的世界失去了联系, 这里的人对我父亲来说很有趣, ” 她说道.

en: Her voice was listless in the dark and she was even harder to understand when I could n't see her properly .
zh: 在黑暗中,她的声音无声无语,当我看不见她的时候,她甚至更难以理解。

en: I did n't understand so I did n't say anything .
zh: 我不明白,所以我什么也没说。

en: I was sorry I 'd started her talking .
zh: 我很抱歉,我让她开始说话。

en: " History , do you know the word ' history ' ? " she asked .
zh: “ 历史, 你知道‘历史’这个词吗? ”她问。

en: Of course I knew the word " history . "
zh: 当然, 我知道“ 历史 ”这个词.

en: " I study history in school , " I said .
zh: “ 我在学校学习历史, ” 我说道。

en: Anneal and Kumar taught it .
zh: 安妮尔和库马尔教过它。

en: " Do you know the history of this world ? "
zh: “ 你知道这个世界的历史 吗? ”

en: It took my tired head a long time to sort that out .
zh: 我费了很长时间才解决这个问题。

en: " Yes , " I said .
zh: “ 是的, ” 我说道。

en: People from Earth come here to live .
zh: 来自地球的人来这里生活。

en: Then there is a big problem on Earth , and the people of Earth forget we are here .
zh: 然后,地球上有一个大问题,地球上的人们忘记了我们在这里。

en: We forget we are from Earth .
zh: 我们忘记我们来自地球。

en: Then Earth finds us again . "
zh: 然后地球又发现我们了。 ”

en: " Some people have stories about coming from the Earth , " Veronique said .
zh: “ 有些人有关于从地球来的故事, ” 弗罗尼克说.

en: " My father is collecting those stories from different peoples .
zh: 我父亲正在收集不同民族的故事。

en: The clans did n't have any stories about coming from Earth .
zh: 这些部落没有关于从地球来的故事。

en: We said the first people came out of the sun .
zh: 我们说第一批人从太阳里出来。

en: This somehow seemed embarrassing .
zh: 这听起来很尴尬。

en: I did n't understand what kind of student she was .
zh: 我不明白她是个什么样的学生。

en: " No , " she said .
zh: “ 不, ” 她说。

en: " Ian is old friends with your teacher , from back when they were both with the survey .
zh: 伊恩与你的老师是老朋友, 从他们俩参加调查时起。

en: I did n't understand what she 'd said except that they were visiting .
zh: 我不明白她说什么,只是他们正在拜访。

en: I pretended to sleep .
zh: 我假装睡着了。

en: Sometimes there was gunfire outside and we jumped , even Mam on the bed .
zh: 有时外面有枪声,我们跳起来,甚至妈妈躺在床上。

en: Once Bet was asleep it was impossible to wake her up .
zh: 贝特一睡,就不可能叫醒她。

en: I fell asleep thinking about how I wished that the Scathalos outrunners were gone .
zh: 我睡着了,想着我多么希望斯卡塔洛斯的追随者不见了。

en: I dreamed that I was at the offworlder 's home , where it was summer but no one was taking care of the stabros , and they were all glad , and so I was a hero - and I was startled awake by gunfire .
zh: 我梦见我在外星人家里,那里是夏天,但没有人照顾刺客,他们都很高兴,因此我是个英雄,我被枪火惊醒了。

en: I wished my da would come home .
zh: 我希望爸爸能回家。

en: It did n't seem fair that we should lie here and be afraid while the men were getting drunk and singing .
zh: 当那些男人喝醉,唱歌的时候,我们应该躺在这儿害怕,这似乎不公平。

en: The Chemical Wedding by Christian Rosencreutz is the way I ’ve decided to present the title of this book .
zh: 克里斯蒂安·罗森克鲁茨(Christian Rosencreutz)的《化学婚礼》是我决定介绍这本书的题目的。

en: Most versions in English are called The Chemical Wedding of Christian Rosencreutz , which suggests  that the wedding is Christian ’s .
zh: 大部分英文版本称为克里斯蒂安·罗森克鲁茨的化学婚礼,这表明婚礼是克里斯蒂安的。

en: It ’s not ; Christian Rosencreutz is the purported author of a book called The Chemical Wedding .
zh: 不是,克里斯蒂安·罗森克鲁茨(Christian Rosencreutz)是所谓的“化学婚礼”一书的作者。

en: The actual author is Johann Valentin Andreae , whose name did n’t appear on the book originally , thus ensuring the confusion .
zh: 原作者是约翰·瓦伦丁·安德烈亚(Johann Valentin Andreae),其名字最初没有出现在书上,从而确保了混乱。

en: I ’ll call it herein  simply The Chemical Wedding .
zh: 我会在这里简单地称它为化学婚礼。

en: Though its original readers would have had a certain amount of context for the truly bizarre and surprising events it tells of , it ’s possible that The Chemical Wedding is now more enjoyable without knowing that context , and experiencing the book unmediated .
zh: 尽管最初的读者会对它所讲述的真正奇怪和惊人的事件有一定数量的背景,但有可能《化学婚礼》现在更令人愉快,而不了解这个背景,并无间接地体验这本书。

en: You might therefore wish to start right in on the first page of text that follows and only then return to this introduction .
zh: 因此,您可能希望在接下来的文本的第一页开始,然后再回到这个介绍。

en: It was just before Easter Sunday , 1 and I was sitting at my table .
zh: 正值复活节前夕,我正坐在桌旁。

en: I ’d said my prayers , talking a long time as usual with my Maker and thinking about some of the great mysteries the Father of Lights had revealed to me .
zh: 我做了我的祷告,与我的造物者如往常一样长时间交谈,并思考了光明之父向我揭示的一些伟大神秘。

en: Now I was ready to make and to bake – only in my heart , actually – a small , perfect unleavened wafer to eat with my beloved Paschal Lamb .
zh: 现在我准备好做和烤 — — 实际上,只有在我心里 — — 一个小,完美的无酵面包,与我所爱的巴沙尔羔羊一起吃。

en: All of a sudden a terrible wind blew up , so strong that I thought the hill my little house was built on would be blown apart – but I ’d seen the Devil do things as bad as this before  , so I took heart and went on meditating .
zh: 突然,一股可怕的风吹起来,如此猛烈,我以为我的小房子修建的山顶会被吹碎 — — 可是,我以前见过魔鬼做同样的坏事,因此,我开始心动,继续冥想。

en: Till I felt somebody touch me on the back .
zh: 直到我感觉到有人在背后摸我。

en: This frightened me so that I did n’t dare turn .
zh: 这使我吓得不敢转过头来。

en: I tried to stay as brave and calm as a human being could under the circumstances .
zh: 在这种情况下,我尽量保持镇定和勇敢。

en: I felt my coat tugged at , and tugged again , and at last I looked around .
zh: 我感觉到我的外套紧了,又紧了,最后我环顾四周。

en: 1 Christian ’s story begins just before Easter , like Dante ’s Divine Comedy .
zh: 1 基督教的故事开始就在复活节前,就像丹特的神话喜剧一样。

en: It can be seen as an allegory of Christ ’s death and resurrection , though this idea produces some puzzles .
zh: 它可以被看作是基督的死亡和复活的寓言,尽管这个想法产生了一些谜题。

en: The birds sang so beautifully , the young deer skipped so happily , that it gladdened my old heart , and I could n't help singing too ...
zh: 鸟儿唱得那么美妙,小鹿跳得那么高兴,它使我的老心高兴,我唱得也难过......

en: I was awake and lying in bed next morning , looking idly at the wonderful images and inscriptions all around my room , when suddenly I heard the sound of trumpets , as if a procession were already underway .
zh: 第二天早晨我醒来,躺在床上,无动于衷地看着我房间四周的美丽图画和铭文,这时我突然听到 trumpets的响声,仿佛一场游行已经在进行。

en: My page jumped out of bed as if crazed , looking more dead than alive , and you can imagine how I felt when he cried , “ They 're already being presented to the king ! "
zh: 我的页面从床上跳出来,好像疯了,看上去比活着还死,你可以想象他喊道: “ 他们已经向国王展示了! ”

en: I could only groan in frustration and curse my lazy bones .
zh: 我只能在沮丧中哭泣,诅咒我的懒惰。

en: I got dressed , but my page was quicker than I was and ran out of the chamber to see what was what .
zh: 我穿了衣服,但是我的页面比我快了,跑出了房间去看看那是什么。

en: He soon came back and gave me the good news that I actually had n’t overslept ; all I ’d done was miss breakfast : they had n’t wanted to wake an old man who needed his rest .
zh: 不久,他回来,向我讲了一个好消息:我实际上没有睡过头了;我做的只是错过早餐:他们不想吵醒一个需要休息的老人。

en: But now I had to get ready to go with him to the lion fountain , where most of the others were gathered .
zh: 但是现在我必须准备好和他一起去狮子喷泉,那里的其他大部分人都聚集了。

en: My spirits recovered , and as soon as I had got into my habit , I followed him to the garden I have already told about .
zh: 我的情绪恢复了,我一养成习惯,就跟随他到我已经说过的花园去了。

en: I found that the lion , in place of his sword , now held a rather large plaque .
zh: 我发现这只狮子, 代替他的剑, 现在持有了一个相当大的牌子.

en: Examining this , I could tell that it had been taken from those ancient monuments I ’d seen and put here for some special reason .
zh: 仔细检查一下,我发现它是从我见过的那些古迹中取下来,并把它放在这儿,这是出什么特殊原因的。

en: The inscription on it was fading away , so I should set it down here as it was then , and ask my readers to ponder it :
zh: 上面的标记已经消失了,所以我应该把它放在这里,像当时那样,并请我的读者思考一下:

en: Prince Hermes : Now after humankind has suffered so much harm here I flow having by god ’s counsel and with the help of art become a healing balm .
zh: 赫梅斯王子: 现在,人类遭受了这么多的伤害之后,我通过上帝的劝告,在艺术的帮助下成为一个疗愈的药剂。

en: Drink from me if you can ; wash , if you like ; trouble my waters if you dare .
zh: 如果你能从我身上喝,如果你愿意洗,如果你敢麻烦我的水。

en: Biologist Nick Bos tells Wikinews about ' self - medicating ' ants
zh: 生物学家尼克·博斯对维基新闻报道了“ 自给药”的蚂蚁

en: Nick Bos , of the University of Helsinki , studies " the amazing adaptations social insects have evolved in order to fight the extreme parasite pressure they experience " .
zh: 赫尔辛基大学的尼克·博斯(Nick Bos)研究了“ 社会昆虫为了对抗它们所经历的极端寄生虫压力而演化出惊人的适应 ” 。

en: In a recently - accepted Evolution paper Bos and colleagues describe ants appearing to self - medicate .
zh: 在最近接受的进化论文中,博斯和同事描述的蚂蚁似乎自给药.

en: " I have no doubt that as time goes on , there will be more and more cases documented "
zh: 毫无疑问,随着时间的推移, 将有越来越多的案件被记录下来.

en: The team used Formica fusca , an ant species that can form thousand - strong colonies .
zh: 这个团队使用了一种能够形成数千强种群的蚂蚁, Formica fusca.

en: This common black ant eats other insects , and also aphid honeydew .
zh: 这种常用的黑蚂蚁吃其他昆虫, 也吃蜂蜜露.

en: It often nests in tree stumps or under rocks and foraging workers can sometimes be spotted climbing trees .
zh: 它经常栖息在树枝或岩石下,有时在爬树时会发现猎物工人。

en: Some ants were infected with Beauveria bassiana , a fungus .
zh: 一些蚂蚁感染了一种真菌,Beauveria bassiana。

en: Infected ants chose food laced with toxic hydrogen peroxide , whereas healthy ants avoided it .
zh: 感染的蚂蚁选择用有毒氢过氧化物的食品,而健康的蚂蚁则避免了。

en: Hydrogen peroxide reduced infected ant fatalities by 15 % , and the ants varied their intake depending upon how high the peroxide concentration was .
zh: 氢过氧化物减少了感染的蚂蚁死亡率15%,而这些蚂蚁的摄入量取决于过氧化物浓度的多少。

en: In the wild , Formica fusca can encounter similar chemicals in aphids and dead ants .
zh: 在野生动物中, 福尔米卡·福斯卡(Formica fusca)会遇到类似的化学物质,如乌鸦和死亡的蚂蚁.

en: Bos obtained his doctorate from the University of Copenhagen .
zh: 博斯从哥本哈根大学获得博士学位。

en: He began postdoctoral research at Helsinki in 2012 .
zh: 2012年,他在赫尔辛基开始博士后研究。

en: He also runs the AntyScience blog .
zh: 他还主持了AntyScience博客。

en: The blog aims to help address " a gap between scientists and ' the general public ' . "
zh: 该博客旨在帮助解决“ 科学家和“ 大众 ”之间的差距 ”.

en: The name is a pun referencing ants , its primary topic , science , and " non-scientific " jargon - free communication .
zh: 这个名字是关于蚂蚁的短语, 其主要主题, 科学, 和 “ 非科学 ” 的术语 - 自由交流.

en: He now discusses his work with Wikinews .
zh: 他现在与维基新闻讨论他的工作。

en: What first attracted you to researching ants ?
zh: 首先是什么吸引你去研究蚂蚁?

en: Me and a studymate were keeping a lot of animals during our studies , from beetles , to butterflies and mantids , to ants .
zh: 我和一个同学在研究期间养了很多动物,从虫子到蝴蝶和虫子,到蚂蚁。

en: We had the ants in an observation nest , and I could just look at them for hours , watching them go about .
zh: 我们有这些蚂蚁在观察巢里,我只能看它们几个小时,看着它们四处走动。

en: After a while I needed to start thinking about an internship for my M.Sc. studies , and decided to write a couple of professors .
zh: 过了一段时间,我需要开始考虑我的硕士学习实习,并决定写几位教授。

en: I ended up going to the Centre for Social Evolution at the University of Copenhagen where I did a project on learning in Ants under supervision of Prof. Patrizia d'Ettorre .
zh: 最后我去了哥本哈根大学的社会进化中心,在那里我在帕特里西亚·德·埃托雷教授的指导下做了一个关于蚂蚁学习的项目。

en: I liked it so much there I ended up doing a PhD and I 've been working on social insects ever since .
zh: 我在那里非常喜欢,最后我做了博士学位,从那时起我就一直在研究社会昆虫。

en: What methods and equipment were used for this investigation ?
zh: 这项调查采用了什么方法和设备?

en: I try to work on a very low budget , and like to build most of the experimental setups myself  .
zh: 我努力在很低的预算上工作,并且喜欢自己制造大多数实验装置。

en: There 's not that much money in fundamental science at the moment , so I try to cut the costs wherever possible .
zh: 目前基础科学领域没有那么多钱,所以我尽量尽可能削减成本。

en: We collected wild colonies of Formica fusca by searching through old tree - trunks in old logging sites in southern Finland .
zh: 我们通过在芬兰南部的旧伐木地点搜寻古树干,搜集了福尔米卡森林的野生种群。

en: We then housed the ants in nests I made using Y - tong  .
zh: 然后我们把蚂蚁安置在我用Y - tong做的窝里.

en: It 's very soft stone that you can easily carve .
zh: 它是非常柔软的石头,你可以很容易雕刻。

en: We carved out little squares for the ants to live in  .
zh: 我们雕出一些小广场,让蚂蚁居住。

en: We then drilled a tunnel to a pot  , where the ants got the choice between the food with medicine and the food without .
zh: 然后我们钻了一个隧道到一个罐子里,在那里蚂蚁可以选择用药的食物和没有药的食物。

en: We infected the ants by preparing a solution of the fungus Beauveria bassiana .
zh: 我们通过制备一种溶液的真菌Beauveria bassiana感染了蚂蚁。

en: Afterwards , each ant was dipped in the solution for a couple of seconds , dried on a cloth and put in the nest .
zh: 然后,每个蚂蚁在溶液中浸泡了几秒,然后在布上干掉,放在巢里。

en: After exposing the ants to the fungus , we took pictures of each foraging arena three times per day , and counted how many ants were present on each food - source .
zh: 把蚂蚁暴露在真菌中后, 我们每天三次拍摄了每个捕食场的图片, 并计算了在每个食物来源上有多少蚂蚁.

en: This gave us the data that ants choose more medicine after they have been infected .
zh: 这给了我们数据,蚂蚁在感染后选择更多的药物。

en: The result that healthy ants die sooner when ingesting ROS  but infected ants die less was obtained in another way
zh: 通过另一种方法,得出健康蚂蚁在摄入ROS时死亡较早,而感染的蚂蚁死亡较少的结果

en: For this we basically put colonies on a diet of either food with medicine or without for a while .
zh: 为此,我们基本上把 kolonies放在一种食物的饮食中,要么用药,要么不用药。

en: And afterwards either infected them or not .
zh: 然后要么感染他们,要么不感染。

en: Then for about two weeks we count every day how many ants died .
zh: 然后大约两个星期,我们每天计算有多少蚂蚁死亡。

en: This gives us the data to do a so - called survival analysis .
zh: 这给了我们进行所谓的生存分析的数据.

en: We measured the ROS - concentration in the bodies of ants after they ingested the food with the medicine using a spectrophotometer .
zh: 我们用光谱仪测定了蚂蚁体内的ROS浓度。

en: By adding certain chemicals , the ROS can be measured using the emission of light of a certain wave - length .
zh: 通过添加某些化学物质, 可利用一定波长光的发射来测量ROS.

en: The detrimental effect of ROS on spores was easy to measure .
zh: 研究了ROS对孢子的影响。

en: We mixed different concentrations of ROS with the spores , plated them out on petri dishes with an agar - solution where fungus can grow on .
zh: 我们把不同浓度的ROS和孢子混合在一起,用一种 Agar - 溶液将它们涂在 Petri 盘上,让真菌在上面生长。

en: A day after , we counted how many spores were still alive .
zh: 一天后,我们数了多少孢子还活着。

en: How reliable do you consider your results to be ?
zh: 你认为你的结果有多可靠?

en: We had a lot of colonies containing a lot of ants , and wherever possible we conducted the experiment blind .
zh: 我们有大量的 kolonies containing a lot of ants, and wherever possible we conducted the experiment blind 。

en: This means the experimenter does n't know which ants belong to which treatment , so it 's impossible to influence the results with ' observer bias ' .
zh: 这意味着实验者不知道哪些蚂蚁属于哪种治疗,因此不可能用观察者偏见来影响结果。

en: However , of course this is proof in just one species .
zh: 当然,这只是一种物种的证明。

en: It is hard to extrapolate to other ants , as different species lead very different lives .
zh: 很难对其他蚂蚁进行推测,因为不同的物种生活非常不同。

en: Wikinews spoke with William Evans , president of the International Brotherhood of Magicians , about the current state of magic and what its future looks like in the world of entertainment .
zh: 维基新闻与国际魔术师兄弟会主席威廉·埃文斯(William Evans)谈谈了魔术的现状和未来在娱乐界如何。

en: For how long have you been involved in performing / studying magic ?
zh: 你在表演/学习魔术方面有多久了?

en: I am 61 now so I really started when I was about 10 years old even though I had seen and worked with some basic tricks a few years earlier .
zh: 现在我61岁,所以我真正开始的时候,我大约10岁,尽管我看到和工作一些基本的技巧几年前。

en: I remember going into Hollywood Magic and wanting that big red box with the dragons on it and I did n't even know what it did .
zh: 我记得我去好莱坞魔术馆,想要那块大红色的盒子,上面有龙,我甚至不知道它做了什么。

en: The magician behind the counter was wise enough not to sell it to me , but instead sold me two books which I still own today - " Scarne on Card Tricks " and " Scarne on Magic Tricks " .
zh: 柜台后面的魔术师很聪明,不肯卖给我,而是给我卖了两个我至今仍拥有的书——“ Scarne on Card Tricks ”和“ Scarne on Magic Tricks ”。

en: That started me out on books and I have amassed quite a few since then .
zh: 那让我开始写书,从那时起我积累了好多书。

en: Do you think magic is alive as a viable form of entertainment today ?
zh: 你认为魔术是当今一种可行的娱乐形式吗?

en: There are more magicians working today than ever before .
zh: 现在有比以往任何时候都更多的魔术师工作。

en: I think it has helped draw younger people to magic as a hobby , but I think it has hurt the ability of young magicians to think because so many rely on the internet for everything and they are n't reading the books .
zh: 我认为这有助于吸引年轻人从事魔术业的兴趣,但我认为这伤害了年轻的魔术师的思考能力,因为许多人依靠互联网来做任何事情,而且他们不读书。

en: We have to have knowledge of the history of magic and what has been done before .
zh: 我们必须了解魔术的历史和以前所做的事。

en: Moreover , seeing someone perform on the internet takes away the use of our senses , originality and imagination that reading and thinking about magic can produce .
zh: 此外,看到某人在互联网上表演,会使我们失去阅读和思考魔术所产生的感官、独创性和想象力。

en: Anyone can become a monkey ; it takes serious study to become a magician .
zh: 任何人都可以成为猴子,成为魔术师需要认真学习。

en: Do you travel much in your current role ?
zh: 你在目前的职务上旅行多 吗?

en: Yes , I am traveling quite a bit .
zh: 是的,我旅行得相当多。

en: After I was inducted as International President in Phoenix in July , I have been to the Jeff McBride Experience in Eureka Springs , Arkansas , Magic Live in Las Vegas , The Midwest Magic Jubilee in St. Louis , the TAOM in Dallas , the British Ring Convention in Buxton , England and the Magic Circle in London .
zh: 在我7月被任命为国际主席后,我在阿肯色州尤里卡斯普林斯的杰夫·麦克布里德体验,拉斯维加斯的魔术生活,圣路易斯的中西部魔术纪念日,达拉斯的塔姆,英国布克斯顿的英国环大会和伦敦的魔术圈。

en: I am going to Las Vegas and Los Angeles next month , Italy in November , back to Las Vegas in December , Mexico in January , Magi - Fest in February , the Winter Carnival of Magic in Tennessee in March , Eureka Springs Cavalcade of Magic in March , and the FFFF in April .
zh: 我下个月要去拉斯维加斯和洛杉矶,11月到意大利,12月回到拉斯维加斯,1月到墨西哥,2月到魔术节,3月到田纳西州的冬季魔术节,3月到尤里卡泉的魔术骑士团,4月到FFFF。

en: At the age of 40 he was credited with revolutionizing the field of modern linguistics .
zh: 在40岁时,他被誉为近代语言学领域的革命者。

en: At age 80 he continues to write books ; his latest book , Hegemony or Survival , was a bestseller in non-fiction .
zh: 在80岁时,他继续写书;他的最新书《霸权或生存》是非小说的畅销书。

en: On March 13 , Professor Chomsky sat down with Michael Dranove for an interview in his MIT office in Cambridge , Massachusetts .
zh: 3月13日,乔姆斯基教授与迈克尔·德拉诺夫(Michael Dranove)在马萨诸塞州剑桥的MIT办公室进行了一次采访。

en: I just wanted to know if you had any thoughts on recent NATO actions and the protests coming up at the 60th NATO conference , I know you ’re speaking at the counter-conference .
zh: 我只是想知道你对最近的北约行动和即将举行的第60届北约会议的抗议有什么想法,我知道你在反会议上发言。

en: Could be I give so many talks I ca n’t remember .
zh: 也许我能讲这么多话,我记不起。

en: On the NATO conference , well I mean the obvious question is why should NATO exist ?
zh: 关于北约会议, 我的意思是, 很明显的问题是为什么北约应该存在?

en: In fact you can ask questions about why it should ever have existed , but now why should it exist .
zh: 事实上,你可以问为什么它应该存在,但现在为什么它应该存在。

en: I mean the theory was , whether you believe it or not , that it would be a defensive alliance against potential Soviet aggression , that ’s the basic doctrine .
zh: 我是说,理论是,不管你相信还是不相信,它将是对抗潜在的苏联侵略的防御联盟,这是基本的理论。

en: Well there ’s no defense against Soviet aggression , so whether you believe that doctrine or not that ’s gone .
zh: 没有对苏联侵略的防御,所以不管你相信那条教条还是不相信它已经消失了。

en: When the Soviet Union collapsed there had been an agreement , a recent agreement , between Gorbachev and the U.S government and the first Bush administration .
zh: 苏联解体时,戈尔巴乔夫和美国政府和布什政府之间达成了一项协议,最近达成了一项协议。

en: The agreement was that Gorbachev agreed to a quite remarkable concession : he agreed to let a united Germany join the NATO military alliance .
zh: 协议是戈尔巴乔夫同意一个相当显著的让步:他同意让一个统一的德国加入北约军事联盟。

en: Now it is remarkable in the light of history , the history of the past century , Germany alone had virtually destroyed Russia , twice , and Germany backed by a hostile military alliance , centered in the most phenomenal military power in history , that ’s a real threat .
zh: 现在,在历史的视角上,是值得注意的,过去的世纪的历史,仅德国几乎摧毁了俄罗斯,两次,德国由敌对的军事联盟支持,集中于历史上最突出的军事力量,这是真正的威胁。

en: Nevertheless he agreed , but there was a quid pro quo , namely that NATO should not expand to the east , so Russia would at least have a kind of security zone .
zh: 尽管如此,他还是同意了,但还有一种 quid pro quo,即北约不应该向东扩散,因此俄罗斯至少应该有某种安全区。

en: And George Bush and James Baker , secretary of state , agreed that NATO would not expand one inch to the east .
zh: 美国国务卿乔治·布什和詹姆斯·贝克同意北约不会向东延伸一英寸。

en: Gorbachev also proposed a nuclear free weapons zone in the region , but the U.S would n’t consider that .
zh: 戈尔巴乔夫还提议在该地区建立一个无核武器区,但美国不会考虑这一点。

en: Okay , so that was the basis on which then shortly after the Soviet Union collapsed .
zh: 好吧,这就是苏联解体后不久的基础。

en: Well one of the first things he did was to back down on the promise of not expanding NATO to the east .
zh: 他说的第一件事就是放弃不向东扩建北约的承诺。

en: Well that ’s a significant threat to the Soviet Union , to Russia now that there was no longer any Soviet Union , it was a significant threat to Russia and not surprisingly they responded by beefing up their offensive capacity , not much but some .
zh: 这是对苏联的严重威胁,对俄罗斯现在不再存在苏联,这是对俄罗斯的严重威胁,毫不奇怪,他们采取了加强进攻能力的行动。

en: So they rescinded their pledge not to use nuclear weapons on first strike , NATO had never rescinded it , but they had and started some remilitarization .
zh: 因此他们撤销了他们第一次袭击时不使用核武器的承诺,北约从未撤销过这一承诺,但他们已经开始重新军事化。

en: With Bush , the aggressive militarism of the Bush administration , as predicted , induced Russia to extend further its offensive military capacity ; it ’s still going on right now .
zh: 布什总统的侵略性军事主义,正如预言的那样,促使俄罗斯进一步扩大其进攻性军事能力。

en: When Bush proposed the missile defense systems in Eastern Europe , Poland and Czechoslovakia , it was a real provocation to the Soviet Union .
zh: 当布什提议东欧、波兰和捷克斯洛伐克的导弹防御系统时,这是对苏联的真正挑衅。

en: I mean that was discussed in U.S arms control journals , that they would have to regard as a potential threat to their strategic deterrent , meaning as a first strike weapon .
zh: 我的意思是,这在美国军备控制期刊上被讨论,他们将不得不将其视为对战略威慑的潜在威胁,即作为第一枚打击武器。

en: And the claim was that it had to do with Iranian missiles , but forget about that .
zh: 还有说它与伊朗导弹有关,但别忘了。

en: Take say on Obama , Obama ’s national security advisor James Jones former Marine commandant is on record of favoring expansion of NATO to the south and the east , further expansion of NATO , and also making it an intervention force .
zh: 就奥巴马而言,奥巴马国家安全顾问詹姆斯·琼斯(James Jones)曾任海军指挥官表示支持北约向南和东扩充,进一步扩大北约,并使其成为干预部队。

en: And the head of NATO , Hoop Scheffer , he has explained that NATO must take on responsibility for ensuring the security of pipelines and sea lanes , that is NATO must be a guarantor of energy supplies for the West .
zh: 北约领导人胡普·谢弗(Hoop Scheffer)解释说,北约必须承担确保管道和航线的安全的责任,即北约必须是西方能源供应的保证者。

en: Well that ’s kind of an unending war , so do we want NATO to exist , do we want there to be a Western military alliance that carries out these activities , with no pretense of defense ?
zh: 那是一种无休止的战争,所以我们是否希望北约存在,我们是否希望有一个西方军事联盟来进行这些活动,而不以防卫为借口?

en: Well I think that ’s a pretty good question ; I do n’t see why it should , I mean there happens to be no other military alliance remotely comparable — if there happened to be one I ’d be opposed to that too .
zh: 我认为这是一个相当好的问题;我不明白为什么应该这样,我的意思是,没有其他类似的军事联盟——如果真的有,我也会反对。

en: So I think the first question is , what is this all about , why should we even be debating NATO , is there any reason why it should exist ?
zh: 我想第一个问题是,这到底是怎么回事,为什么我们还要讨论北约,为什么它应该存在呢?

en: We ’ve seen mass strikes all around the world , in countries that we would n’t expect it .
zh: 我们已经看到世界各地的大规模罢工,在我们无法预料的国家的罢工。

en: Do you think this is a revival of the Left in the West ?
zh: 你认为这是西方左翼的复苏吗?

en: Or do you think it ’s nothing ?
zh: 或者你认为这没什么?

en: It ’s really hard to tell .
zh: 很难说。

en: I mean there ’s certainly signs of it , and in the United States too , in fact we had a sit down strike in the United States not long ago , which is a very militant labor action .
zh: 我的意思是,肯定有迹象,而且在美国也是,事实上我们不久前在美国发生了 sit down strike, 这是一个非常激进的劳动行动。

en: Sit down strikes which began at a significant level in the 1930’s were very threatening to management and ownership , because the sit down strike is one step before workers taking over the factory and running it and kicking out the management , and probably doing a better job .
zh: 在1930年代开始的 sit down 罢工对管理层和所有者构成了很大的威胁,因为 sit down 罢工是工人接管工厂并管理并解散管理层的一个步骤,并且可能做得更好。

en: So that ’s a frightening idea , and police were called in and so on .
zh: 这是一个可怕的想法,警察被召唤进来等等。

en: Well we just had one in the United States at the Republic Windows and Doors Factory , it ’s hard to know , I mean these things are just hard to predict , they may take off , and they may take on a broader scope , they may fizzle away or be diverted .
zh: 我们刚刚在美国共和国的窗户和门厂有一个,很难知道,我是说这些东西很难预料的,它们可能飞起来,它们可能采取更广泛的范围,它们可能飞散或被转移。

en: Wikinews interviewed one of the owners of a New York City bar about a popular new politically - themed cocktail drink called Santorum .
zh: 维基新闻采访了纽约一家酒吧的老板,他们谈到了一种新流行的政治主题的鸡尾酒 Santorum.

en: The beverage was inspired by the santorum neologism coined in advice columnist Dan Savage 's column Savage Love in response to comments made by former Pennsylvania Senator Rick Santorum about homosexuality ;
zh: 该饮料的灵感源于参议院前参议员里克·参议院关于同性恋的评论,参议院的建议专栏作家丹·萨维奇(Dan Savage)对参议院前专栏作家萨维奇·爱(S Savage Love)的专栏文章中提出的参议院新词汇;

en: Savage 's readers voted to define santorum as ; " the frothy mixture of lube and fecal matter that is sometimes the byproduct of anal sex . "
zh: 萨维奇的读者投票将圣经定义为: “ 润滑剂和粪便的 frothy混合物,有时是肛交的副产物. ”

en: The santorum neologism has inspired satirical forms of parody , including this political cartoon by Saturday Morning Breakfast Cereal webcomic artist Zach Weiner .
zh: 圣经新词汇激发了讽刺的讽刺形式的讽刺,包括这幅政治漫画由周六早上早餐的谷物网络喜剧艺术家扎克·韦纳创作的。

en: Stan commented on the creation of the Santorum cocktail , " When he was winning in the polls , I thought , ' OK , I 'll do a Santorum ' . "
zh: 斯坦对《圣orum》鸡尾酒的创作作了评论: “ 当他在选举中获胜时,我以为, ‘ 好吧, 我会做圣orum’ 。

en: Regarding how long the beverage will be made available , Stan remarked to The Brooklyn Paper , " We 'll keep it around until he ’s irrelevant . I hope he ’s there the whole way " .
zh: 关于该饮料将提供多久,斯坦对布鲁克林报纸说:“我们将留它,直到他不在乎。我希望他一直在那里。”

en: The main ingredients of the Santorum drink include vodka of an orange citrus variety , Baileys Irish Cream , and Angostura bitters .
zh: Santorum饮料的主要成分包括橙色柑橘类的伏特加、贝利斯爱尔兰奶油和安哥斯图拉苦味。

en: It is served in a cocktail glass and topped with Godiva chocolate flakes .
zh: 它在鸡尾酒杯中提供,并配上戈迪瓦巧克力片。

en: The beverage is priced at US $ 8.00 , and upon an order for it , the bartender will recount for the customer the definition of the santorum neologism .
zh: 这个饮料的售价为8.00美元,在订购时,酒吧服务员会为顾客重新计算圣orum词义的定义。

en: Troy Patterson of Slate Magazine ventured over to Pacific Standard to sample the new santorum cocktail at the bar .
zh: 斯莱特杂志的特洛伊·帕特森(Troy Patterson)来到了太平洋标准,在酒吧里品尝了新的桑托穆酒。

en: After tasting the beverage , Patterson observed , " My Santorum was sweet but balanced , with a subtle citrus pucker " .
zh: 品尝完酒后, 帕特森观察到, “ 我的 Santorum 是甜的,但平衡的, 有细微的柑橘汁 “ 。

en: offensive beyond , you know , anything that any public figure or anybody in America should tolerate , and the mainstream media laughs about it . — Rick Santorum
zh: 任何公众人物或美国任何人都应该容忍的,而且主流媒体都嘲笑它。 — 里克·桑托姆

en: In a 2003 interview with the Associated Press , Rick Santorum compared legalizing same - sex marriage in the United States to supporting bestiality .
zh: 在2003年与美国联合新闻社的采访中, 里克·桑托尔姆将美国同性婚姻的合法化与支持牲畜的合法化进行了比较.

en: Readers of the Savage Love advice column selected a new definition for the Senator ’s last name , and Savage created a website SpreadingSantorum.com to promulgate the spread of the phenomenon .
zh: Savage Love 的读者选择了一个新定义参议员的姓氏, Savage 创建了一个网站 SpreadingSantorum.com 来宣传这一现象的传播。

en: The term became a prominent result in searches online , and gained dominance on Web search engines including Google , Bing , and Yahoo! .
zh: 这个词在在线搜索中成为一个突出的结果,并在包括谷歌、彬格格莱、雅虎在内的网络搜索引擎中占主导地位。

en: Rick Santorum himself has acknowledged and discussed the existence and prevalence of the santorum neologism phenomenon ; he was quoted by The Canadian Press on his assessment of Google 's response ;
zh: 里克·桑托尔姆本人承认并讨论了桑托尔姆语学现象的存在和普遍性;他被《加拿大新闻报》援引在其对谷歌的回应的评价中;

en: " To have a business allow that type of filth to be purveyed through their website or through their system is something that they say they ca n't handle .
zh: 让这类垃圾通过他们的网站或系统传播是他们说他们不能处理的事情。

en: I suspect that 's not true . "
zh: 我怀疑这是不对的。

en: Santorum criticized the response of the press to the phenomenon in a 2011 radio interview , saying , " It 's offensive beyond , you know , anything that any public figure or anybody in America should tolerate , and the mainstream media laughs about it . "
zh: Santorum在2011年的电台采访中批评了媒体对这一现象的反应,说:“它超出任何公众人物或美国任何人都应该容忍的范围,而且主流媒体都嘲笑它。”

en: Pacific Standard owner , Jonathan M. Stan , displays the Santorum cocktail drink as a finished product at the bar .  .
zh: 太平洋标准的老板乔纳森·M·斯坦在酒吧展示了桑托鲁姆鸡尾酒作为成品。

en: Image ; Pacific Standard , provided by the owners .
zh: 图片:太平洋标准,由业主提供。

en: What inspired you to create a cocktail after the santorum neologism ?
zh: 什么是让你在圣经新词之后创造一个鸡尾酒的灵感?

en: Santorum the person has been in the news throughout the primary season , and we thought it would be interesting to try to create a delicious drink that mimicked the appearance of the Dan Savage meaning of " santorum . "
zh: 圣orum这个人已经在新闻中度过了第一季,我们认为创造一个模仿丹·萨维奇“圣orum”的意思美味的饮料是很有意思的。

en: How did you first hear about the definition of the santorum neologism that grew out of the contest from the Savage Love advice column ?
zh: 你从 Savage Love 的建议栏中第一次听到了来自比赛的圣orum 语义的定义 吗?

en: We do n't really remember .
zh: 我们实在记不起。

en: It 's been around forever .
zh: 它一直存在着。

en: Probably read about it somewhere .
zh: 也许在某个地方读过。

en: What are your thoughts about Rick Santorum ’s views on gay rights ?
zh: 你对里克·桑托尔姆关于同性恋权利的观点有什么看法?

en: It 's not for us to take a stand on any political issues .
zh: 我们不能就任何政治问题采取立场。

en: We 'll leave that to the professionals .
zh: 我们将把这交给专业人员。

en: Do you think it was an appropriate form of satire for Dan Savage to popularize the definition of the santorum neologism created in his advice column ?
zh: 你认为丹·萨维奇(Dan Savage) popularizing the definition of the santorum neologism created in his advice column was an appropriate form of satire 吗?

en: We thought it was funny .
zh: 我们觉得这很有趣。

en: Whether it is appropriate or not is another thing we leave to the pros to decide .
zh: 是否恰当是另一个问题,我们留给专业人士决定。

en: When was the Santorum cocktail first created ?
zh: Santorum鸡尾酒是什么时候发明的?

en: What ingredients go in the Santorum cocktail ?
zh: Santorum鸡尾酒中有哪些成分?

en: The ingredients are shaken and / or poured into a cocktail glass .
zh: 材料搅拌并/或倒入鸡尾酒杯中。

en: See the pictures .
zh: 看照片。

en: Your Santorum cocktail creation has already received media coverage from publications including ; The Brooklyn Paper , The New York Times , Jezebel , Metro.us , EDGE on the Net , and Instinct Magazine .
zh: Your Santorum cocktail creation has already received media coverage from publications including ; The Brooklyn Paper, The New York Times, Jezebel, Metro.us, EDGE on the Net, and Instinct Magazine.

en: Did you think when you created it that the Santorum cocktail would receive this news coverage ?
zh: 当你创建它时,你是否认为 Santorum的鸡尾酒会收到这个新闻报道?

en: What culinary dishes would you recommend that go well with the Santorum cocktail ?
zh: 你能推荐哪些烹饪菜能和桑托鲁姆鸡尾酒搭配 吗?

en: You 'd probably be having the cocktail at dessert time , so something sweet ; ice cream or pie .
zh: 你可能在甜点时喝鸡尾酒, 因此要吃点甜点; 冰淇淋或蛋糕.

en: Is the drink popular ?
zh: 这个饮料很受欢迎 吗?

en: How many times do you suppose you ’ve served it at your establishment since its creation ?
zh: 你认为自创建以来,在你的机构里你多少次服务过它?

en: The drink was mildly popular for the last few months , but of course has become a great deal more popular since getting all this publicity .
zh: 这个饮料在过去几个月里很受欢迎,但从获得所有这些宣传以来,它已经变得更加受欢迎了。

en: We have no way to estimate how many times we 've served it overall , but we 're now pouring around ten a night .
zh: 我们没有办法估算我们总共服务了多少次,但现在我们正在晚上喝十杯左右。

en: Cyclone Phailin has winds that have been measured at 200 km / h , as it surges over land will it begin to lose strength ?
zh: 气旋菲林的风速已测定为每小时200公里,当它在陆地上 surges时,它会开始失去强度 吗?

en: Yes , all tropical cyclones are driven by high heat content waters .
zh: 是的, 所有热带气旋都是由高热量水驱动的.

en: Once a storm moves over any appreciably sized piece of land , the moisture source is removed and the storm begins to dissipate .
zh: 一旦暴风雨在任何相当大的土地上移动,水分源就会被除去,暴风雨便开始消散。

en: As of the last advisory , T C Phailin has winds of 190 kilometers per hour and has moved inland , headed on a northwest track .
zh: 截至最近的公告,TC法林风速每小时190公里,并已进入内陆,朝西北方向前进。

en: The forecast is for a continued decline in strength to a tropical storm within 24 hours and a tropical depression within 36 hours .
zh: 预计热带风暴强度在24小时内持续下降,热带低气压在36小时内下降。

en: However , there will be very heavy rains and flooding along its path .
zh: 然而,沿着这条路将会有大雨和洪水。

en: Yes , it will loose strength steadily as more and more of this swirling system moves from being over ocean to being over land .
zh: 是的,随着这个旋转系统越过海洋越过陆地越过,它会逐渐失去力量。

en: As it moves over land , it is cut off from the source of energy driving the storm  the evaporation of water from the warm sea surface ;
zh: 风暴在陆地上移动时,它被切断于驱动风暴的能量源,使水从温暖的海面蒸发;

en: Tropical cyclones are sustained by a form of energy called latent heat , which is released by moisture evaporated from the ocean that condenses to form rain .
zh: 热带气旋由一种叫做潜热的能量维持,由海洋蒸发的湿气释放出来并凝结成雨。

en: As tropical cyclones make landfall , this energy source is cut - off and they rapidly lose strength as they move over land .
zh: 当热带气旋登陆时, 这种能量源被切断了,并且随着它们在陆地上移动而迅速失去强度.

en: Yes , the Cyclone is almost certain to lose strength as it surges over land .
zh: 是的, 气旋几乎肯定会失去强度,当它在陆地上 surges.

en: Cyclones gather their strength through scraping moisture and heat from warm ocean water that it is not the case over land .
zh: 气旋通过从温暖的海洋水中吸收水分和热量来积累力量,而陆上的情况则并非如此。

en: In the mean time , much stronger friction over land quickly reduces their strength .
zh: 同时, 陆上较强的摩擦力迅速降低了它们的强度.

en: All tropical cyclones lose strength once they make landfall .
zh: 所有热带气旋一旦登陆就失去强度。

en: However , they can remain dangerous storms due to very heavy rains and subsequent landslides , and river flooding .
zh: 然而,由于大雨和随后的滑坡以及河流洪水,它们仍可能成为危险的暴风雨。

en: Phailin 's winds will rapidly weaken as it pushes inland .
zh: 菲林的风速会迅速减弱,当它推向内陆时。

en: Once Cyclone Phailin comes on shore it will immediately begin to lose strength .
zh: 一旦气旋菲林登陆,它就会立刻开始失去力量。

en: However , and this is important , it still will contain lots of rainfall making flooding an almost certainty .
zh: 然而,这是很重要的,它仍会包含大量降雨,使得洪水几乎是确定的。

en: A previous cyclone in 1999 in the Bay of Bengal area of India left 10,000 people dead .
zh: 1999年,印度孟加拉湾地区发生了一场前一次气旋,造成10万人死亡。

en: Is the Indian government well prepared to deal with this cyclone ?
zh: 印度政府是否做好应对这场气旋的准备?

en: I have not followed that aspect of the societal response for the present storm .
zh: 我没有注意到社会对当前风暴的反应的这一方面。

en: However , historically , there have been several events that should cause a societal response .
zh: 然而,从历史上来看,有几个事件应该引起社会反应。

en: Hopefully , we all learn from past mistakes .
zh: 希望我们都能从过去的错误中吸取教训。

en: The history of strong cyclones and death in the region is notable , with at least 5 large cyclone events in the past 35 years with 10,000 and as many as 300,000 people killed , millions left homeless and estimated damages as high as US $ 10 billion .
zh: 该地区的强烈气旋和死亡历史是值得注意的,在过去35年中至少发生了5场大型气旋事件,有10,000人死亡,有300,000人丧生,数百万人无家可归,估计损失高达10亿美元。

en: I do n't have enough information to answer this question , one way or the other .
zh: 我没有足够的资料来回答这个问题,无论如何。

en: From all the press reports that I have read , the Indian government appears to have taken the threat of Cyclone Phailin very seriously indeed .
zh: 从我所读的所有新闻报道中,印度政府似乎非常认真地对待了菲林气旋的威胁。

en: The government has been much more pro-active in preparing for this cyclone than in the past .
zh: 政府对这场气旋的筹备工作比过去更加积极。

en: The forecasts of cyclone track and intensity have been fairly accurate .
zh: 气旋轨迹和强度的预测相当准确。

en: Mandatory mass evacuations have been carried out , which is essential to minimize loss of life in these situations .
zh: 已进行强制性的大规模撤离,这是在这些情况下尽量减少人员伤亡的必要条件。

en: My knowledge of the responsiveness of the Indian government to this storm is purely from the cyber space .
zh: 我对印度政府对这场风暴的反应的了解完全来自网络空间。

en: I heard that they orchestrated the largest people evacuation to a natural disaster in Indian history .
zh: 我听说他们组织了印度历史上最大的自然灾害人员撤离行动。

en: This shall be applauded given the size and strength of Phailin .
zh: 鉴于菲林的大小和强度,这值得称赞。

en: I visited the damaged area of the 1999 storm near Bhubaneshwar in the summer of 2012 for an invited symposium and summer school on tropical cyclones  sponsored by the Indian government .
zh: 我在2012年夏天访问了1999年风暴在布班什瓦尔附近的受损地区,参加由印度政府赞助的热带气旋专题讨论会和夏季学校。

en: Given the living standard and residence of people living near the coastal areas in this region , the evacuation is certainly necessary and essential to save lives .
zh: 鉴于该地区的沿海地区居民的生活水平和居住条件,撤离当然是挽救生命的重要措施。

en: I can not comment directly on how the Indian government was prepared for this cyclone .
zh: 我不能直接评论印度政府如何为这场气旋做好准备。

en: However , the news reports  were very encouraging in that the authorities were reportedly making strenuous efforts to evacuate the population from near the coast and areas that are prone to flooding .
zh: 然而, 报道 显示 当局 正在 作出 艰苦 的 努力, 以便 从 海岸 附近 和 易受 洪水 的 地区 疏散 居民 。 这些 消息 令人 鼓舞 。

en: Water is the main killer in these storms .
zh: 水是这些暴风雨的主要杀手。

en: From all reports that I have seen , the government was well prepared for this cyclone .
zh: 从我所看到的报告来看,政府对这场气旋做好了充分准备。

en: For this question I do n't know the ' preparedness ' of the Indian gov't to deal with this .
zh: 关于这个问题,我不知道印度政府对此是否做好准备。

en: How did you come to be involved with this discovery
zh: 你是怎么参与这项发现的?

en: Frank Rack got in touch after they returned from Antarctica in hopes that I could help with an identification on the anemone .
zh: 他们从南极回来后,弗兰克·拉克联系了我,希望我能帮助查明这只无血鬼的身分。

en: What was your first reaction upon learning there was an undiscovered ecosystem under the ice in the Ross Sea ?
zh: 当你得知罗斯海冰层下没有发现的生态系统时,你的第一反应是什么?

en: I think to say it was unexpected is inaccurate , because it implies that there was a well - founded expectation of something .
zh: 我认为说它是意外的是不准确的, 因为它暗示了人们对某事的期望是有道理的.

en: The technology that Frank and his colleagues are using to explore the ice is so important because , given our lack of data , we have no reasonable expectation of what it should be like , or what it should n't be like .
zh: 弗兰克和他的同事正在利用技术来研究冰是如此重要的,因为,考虑到我们缺乏数据,我们没有合理的期望它应该如何,或者它不应该如何。

en: There 's a return trip planned hopefully for 2015 , with both biologists and ANDRILL geologists .
zh: 有计划在2015年,与生物学家和安德里尔地质学家一起返回旅行。

en: Are you intending to go there yourself ?
zh: 你打算亲自去那里吗?

en: I would love to .
zh: 我很想。

en: But I am also happy to not go , as long as someone collects more animals on my behalf !
zh: 但我也很高兴不去,只要有人为我收集更多的动物!

en: What I want to do with the animals requires new material preserved in diverse ways , but it does n't require me to be there .
zh: 我想要与动物做的事需要以不同的方式保存新的材料,但这并不要求我在那里。

en: Although I am sure that being there would enhance my understanding of the animals and the system in which they live , and would help me formulate more and better questions about the anemones , ship time is expensive , especially in Antarctica , and if there are biologists whose contribution is predicated on being there , they should have priority to be there .
zh: 虽然我确信那里的存在会提高我对动物和它们生活的系统的认识,并帮助我 formulate更多和更好的关于天鹅的问题,船只时间是昂贵的,特别是在南极洲,如果有生物学家的贡献是基于存在那里,他们应该优先存在那里。

en: These animals are shrouded in mystery .
zh: 这些动物被隐藏在神秘之中。

en: Some of the most intriguing questions are chemical ; do they produce some kind of antifreeze , and is that orange glow in the ROV lights their own ?
zh: 其中一些最引人注目的问题是化学; 它们是否产生某种抗冻剂, 还有这种橙色在ROV灯上闪烁是他们自己的吗?

en: Talk us through the difficulties encountered when trying to find answers with the specimens on hand .
zh: 用手提样品找到答案时遇到的困难,告诉我们。

en: The samples we have are small in terms of numbers and they are all preserved in formalin  .
zh: 我们的样品数目很小,而且它们都保存在formalin中。

en: The formalin is great for preserving structures , but for anemones , it prevents study of DNA or of the chemistry of the body .
zh: 甲醛对于保存结构是很好的,但对于无机化合物来说,它阻止了对DNA或人体化学的研究。

en: This means we ca n't look at the issue you raise with these animals .
zh: 这意味着我们不能考虑你对这些动物提出的问题。

en: What we could do , however , was to study anatomy and figure out what it is , so that when we have samples preserved for studying e.g. , the genome , transcriptome , or metabolome , or conduct tests of the fluid in the burrows or in the animals themselves , we can make precise comparisons , and figure out what these animals have or do  that lets them live where they live .
zh: 然而,我们能够做的是研究解剖学,找出解剖学是什么,以便当我们保存的样本进行研究,例如基因组、转录体或代谢体,或者在洞穴或动物体内进行液体测试时,我们可以作出精确的比较,并找出这些动物有什么或做什么,让它们生活在它们居住的地方。

en: Just knowing a whole lot about a single species is n't very useful , even if that animal is as special as these clearly are - we need to know what about them is different and thus related to living in this strange way .
zh: 仅仅知道一类物种的全部情况并不十分有用,即使那类物种是如此特别的,我们需要知道它们有什么不同,从而与这种奇怪的方式生活有关。

en: We can start that side of the work now , anticipating having more beasts in the future .
zh: 我们现在可以开始这项工作,预料将来会有更多的野兽。

en: In terms of their glow , I suspect that it 's not theirs - although luminescence is common in anemone relatives , they do n't usually make light themselves .
zh: 至于它们的发光,我怀疑这不是它们的发光,虽然灯光在阿尼蒙的亲属中很常见,但它们通常不会自己发光。

en: They do make a host of florescent proteins , and these may interact with the light of the ROV to give that gorgeous glow .
zh: 它们确实制造了大量的荧光蛋白,这些可能与ROV的光线相互作用,以给予那灿烂的光芒。

en: What analysis did you perform on the specimens and what equipment was used ?
zh: 你对样品做了什么分析,并使用了什么设备?

en: I used a dissecting scope to look at the animal 's external anatomy and overall body organization  .
zh: 我用切除镜子观察动物的外部解剖和整体身体组织。

en: I embedded a few of the animals in wax and then cut them into very thin slices using a microtome , mounted the slices on microscope slides , stained the slices to enhance contrast , and then looked at those slides under a compound microscope
zh: 我把一些动物埋在蜡上,然后用微粒子把它们切成很薄的片子,然后把片子安装在显微镜上的片子上,把片子染色以增加对比度,然后在复合显微镜下观察这些片子

en: I used that same compound scope to look at squashed bits of tissue to see the stinging capsules  .
zh: 我用同样的复合镜子观察粉碎的组织片,观察刺痛的胶囊。

en: I compared the things I saw under the 'scopes to what had been published on other species in this group .
zh: 我把我在“范围”下看到的事物与这组其他物种的出版物比较起来。

en: This step seems trivial , but it is really the most important part !
zh: 这个步骤看起来很小, 但实际上是最重要的部分!

en: By comparing my observations to what my colleagues and predecessors had found , I figured out what group it belongs to , and was able to determine that within that group , it was a new species .
zh: 通过与我的同事和前辈们所发现的观察,我查明它属于哪个群体,并能够确定在该群体内,它是新的物种。

en: It was three years between recovery of specimens and final publication , why did it take so long ?
zh: 标本的回收和最终出版时间是三年, 为什么要这么久?

en: You mean , how did we manage to make it all happen so quickly , right ? :)
zh: 你的意思是,我们怎么设法让这一切发生得这么快,对吗?

en: It was about two years from when Frank sent me specimens to when we got the paper out .
zh: 大约两年后,弗兰克给我送样品,然后我们才把那张纸发出来。

en: Some of that time was just lost time - I had other projects in the queue that I needed to finish .
zh: 那段时间里,我只是浪费了时间--在队列里还有其他项目我需要完成。

en: Once we figured out what it was , we played a lot of manuscript email tag , which can be challenging and time consuming given the differing schedules that folks keep in terms of travel , field work , etc.
zh: 一旦我们明白了它是什么,我们玩了很多手稿电子邮件标签,因为人们在旅行、野外工作等方面保持不同的日程表,这可能很困难和耗时。

en: Manuscript review and processing took about four months .
zh: 手稿审查和处理大约花了四个月。

en: What sort of difficulties were posed by the unorthodox preservatives used , and what additional work might be possible on a specimen with intact DNA ?
zh: 使用不正统的防腐剂造成了什么困难,并且在无损DNA样本上可能进行哪些额外工作?

en: The preservation was not unorthodox - they followed best practices for anatomical preservation .
zh: 他们遵循了最佳的解剖学保存方法。

en: Having DNA - suitable material will let us see whether there are new genes , or genes turned on in different ways and at different times that help explain how these animals burrow into hard ice and then survive in the cold .
zh: 有合适的DNA材料可以让我们知道是否有新的基因,或者有不同的方式和不同的时间启动的基因,这有助于解释这些动物如何钻进硬冰,然后在寒冷中生存。

en: I am curious about the population structure of the " fields " of anemones - the group to which Edwardsiella andrillae belongs includes many species that reproduce asexually , and it 's possible that the fields are " clones " produced asexually rather than the result of sexual reproduction .
zh: 我对“ 野生动物 ” 的人口结构感到好奇 - Edwardsiella andrillae 属于许多非性生殖的物种的群体,可能这些野生动物是非性生殖产生的“ 克隆 ” 而不是性生殖的结果。

en: DNA is the only way to test this .
zh: 只有DNA才能证明这一点。

en: This map shows the location of the Ross Ice Shelf in the Antarctic , and the two known localities for E. andrillae relative to McMurdo Station
zh: 这张地图显示了南极的罗斯冰架的位置,以及与麦默多站有关的E. andrillae的两个已知地点

en: Daly explained how she obtained these images of the anemone 's anatomy .
zh: 达利解释了她如何获得这些阿尼蒙的解剖图。

en: There 's a misconception in this industry .
zh: 在这个行业有一个误解。

en: Your exposure to this is probably primarily what you see in movies , scanning magazines , scanning the Internet , just snippets everywhere .
zh: 你的暴露主要是你在电影中看到的,扫描杂志,扫描互联网,到处都是片段。

en: I do wear a lot of black .
zh: 我穿很多黑衣服。

en: If you look at the rooms , there 's all the accouterments you 'd find in these types of places -- but more than anything , there 's a lot of good feeling around here .
zh: 如果你看看房间,你会发现在这些地方里所有的隔离,但是比任何地方都多,这里有很多美好的感觉。

en: We hire the opposite of what you 'd think we would hire , what the average person would think we would hire .
zh: 我们雇佣的是与你所认为的相反的雇佣人,而一般人所认为的雇佣人。

en: We hire educated , nice people .
zh: 我们雇佣了受过良好教育的人。

en: I remember one of our ads that I had put in said , " If you think nice girls do n't do S&M , " -- I forgot what the rest of it said --
zh: 我记得我曾经在广告中说,"如果你认为漂亮的女孩不会做S&M,"--我忘记了那段广告的其余内容--

en: " -- think again . "
zh: 再想想。

en: And that ad had pulled so many girls , because they -- I think they all thought that nice girls do n't do this .
zh: 那张广告吸引了那么多女孩,因为我想他们都以为漂亮的女孩不会这么做。

en: And a bunch of them had called and they said , " Wow . "
zh: 他们中有几个人打电话说, “ 哇 ”.

en: And I think I remember , a bunch of guys called because of that also .
zh: 我想我记得,因为这,一群家伙也打电话了。

en: Do you remember ?
zh: 你还记得吗?

en: I sure do , I sure do .
zh: 我肯定会,我肯定会。

en: It varies ; look around Manhattan , look around rents , look around build-outs , look around hiring , look around advertising ...
zh: 看一下曼哈顿,看一下租金,看一下建筑物,看一下雇佣,看一下广告。

en: The single most costly thing we spend on is rent and advertising , those two together make up the bulk of what we spend .
zh: 我们花费的最昂贵的单一东西是租金和广告,这两个东西共同构成了我们花费的大部分。

en: There 's supplies , and there 's wear and tear and maintenance , and bookkeeping and things like that that you have to do .
zh: 有用品,有磨损和维护,还有会计和类似的事情你必须做。

en: That 's about it .
zh: 就够了。

en: The hardest thing in running this business , which is why people ca n't do it , is the relationship that my wife has with the gals and with the customers .
zh: 经营这个生意最难的事情,这就是为什么人们不能这样做的原因,就是我的妻子和女士和顾客的关系。

en: A lot on the web , we 've used most of the local city papers , New York Press , things like that , L Magazine .
zh: 在网络上很多,我们都使用了当地的报纸,纽约报, 诸如L杂志.

en: In the back of the paper ?
zh: 在纸的后面?

en: Magazines constantly change their policy on it ; they want it , they do n't want it ...
zh: 杂志不断改变其政策,他们想要,他们不想...

en: Who 's buying the paper , who 's selling the paper .
zh: 谁买报纸,谁卖报纸。

en: So it changes , so one year we got to be in the Press , but they have now stopped adult ads .
zh: 所以它改变了,所以一年我们得在新闻界工作,但现在他们已经停止了成人广告。

en: We 're moving more towards the Internet at this point , because the Internet is a much easier , safer way for a person to look at sensitive material and not get caught with it .
zh: 现在我们正向互联网迈进,因为互联网对于一个人来说,更容易、更安全地看懂敏感材料而不被抓住。

en: Pursuant to your business question : we only hire nice people .
zh: 根据贵公司的业务问题: 我们只聘用好人.

en: I do n't care if a girl is absolutely exquisite looking --
zh: 我不在乎一个女孩看起来多么优雅--

en: My husband has met beautiful , beautiful girls --
zh: 我的丈夫见过漂亮的女孩--

en: -- and he 's in the end , he would say , " Well , I wo n't hire them . "
zh: 最后他会说, “ 嗯, 我不会雇他们. ”

en: I wo n't hire them .
zh: 我不会雇他们。

en: I hire --
zh: 我雇佣了...

en: How can you tell whether they will or will not ?
zh: 你怎么知道他们会还是不会?

en: Having been a psychologist for a number of years gives me a leg up on it .
zh: 多年来担任心理学家,我对此感到十分满意。

en: And I have made him hire these girls , and ultimately he 's been right
zh: 我让他雇佣这些女孩,最终他是对的

en: I also have a profile they fill out for me , a mini-MMPI that I developed , so that I have an idea -- Rebecca and I put it together
zh: 我也有一个他们为我填充的个人资料,一个我开发的小型MPI,这样我有一个想法--我和Rebecca一起把它拼在一起

en: I do n't know if you 'd like to see one .
zh: 我不知道你是否想看。

en: I could show you .
zh: 我能给你看看。

en: So I have a mini-MMPI that I --
zh: 我有一个小型MMPI,我...

en: Could I have a sample , not necessarily one that 's filled out , but just one that you --
zh: 我能拿个样品吗,不一定是填满的样品,而是你--

en: I 'll show you .
zh: 我给你看。

en: He 'll make you fill one out .
zh: 他会让你填一个。

en: You 'd be scared .
zh: 你会害怕的。

en: You would n't hire me .
zh: 你不会雇我。

en: Is it only girls you hire ?
zh: 你雇佣的只是女孩吗?

en: No question would reveal anything independently of all the questions together --
zh: 任何问题都无法独立地揭示所有问题--

en: -- but I have a chart that I 'll go through ; the MMPI .
zh: --但是我有一个图表,我将通过;MMPI。

en: How did you originate these questions ?
zh: 你是怎么提出这些问题的?

en: Where did I make them ?
zh: 我在哪里制造的?

en: You get a baseline from asking girls and refining profiles --
zh: 你从问问女孩和精细的简历中得到一个基本线 --

en: And it 's an amalgamation of questions .
zh: 这是一个问题的合并。

en: What 's your favorite question ?
zh: 你最喜欢的问题是什么?

en: I do n't know , the O.J. Simpson ….
zh: 我不知道,奥.J.辛普森...。

en: Yeah , I see O.J. Simpson .
zh: 是的,我看见了O.J.辛普森。

en: What would that be an indicator of ?
zh: 那是什么指标呢?

en: I 'm not sure which one you gave him , but there 's a brief , brief , brief IQ test there .
zh: 我不知道你给了他哪一个,但有一个简短的,简短的 IQ测试。

en: Do you ask for references ?
zh: 你要求参考 吗?

en: No , because I really ca n't call and tell them I 'm yeah , so - and - so 's applying here for a position .
zh: 不, 因为我真的不能打电话告诉他们我是的, 因此--所以在这里申请职位.

en: Wikinews interviews Mario J. Lucero and Isabel Ruiz of Heaven Sent Gaming
zh: 维基新闻采访马里奥·J·卢塞罗和伊莎贝尔·鲁伊斯(Isabel Ruiz of Heaven Sent Gaming)

en: And , I 'm Isabel Ruiz .
zh: 我叫伊莎贝·鲁伊斯。

en: And , together we formed this thing , it 's sort of like an entertainment team .
zh: 和我们一起组成了这个东西, 有点像娱乐队.

en: We started it basically , because I wanted to - I wanted to work with Isabel on a lot of projects that we had going on together .
zh: 我们基本上开始了,因为我想-我想和伊莎贝尔一起做很多项目。

en: We were coming with comics , like , left and right , we were coming up with things like Karis , in high school she came up with that one , I came up with an individual story called Thad 's World Destruction and , she wanted to illustrate it , and so , that 's the way we ended up doing it .
zh: 我们正在创作漫画,比如,左和右,我们正在创作像卡里斯那样的东西,她在高中的时候她写了那个,我写了一个名为“泰德世界毁灭”的个人故事,她想说明它,所以,这就是我们最终完成的。

en: We met back in high school .
zh: 我们在高中的时候见过面。

en: But , before hand in middle school , I kept on hearing about this guy named Mario , and he kept on hearing about me , this girl named Isabel .
zh: 但是,在中学之前,我一直听说这个名叫马里奥的家伙,他一直听说我这个名叫伊莎贝尔的女孩。

en: And , everyone , all of our friends and all of our acquaintances would say , " Hey , you 'd get along with him really well . "
zh: 而且, 我们所有的朋友和熟人都会说, “ 嘿, 你和他相处得很好. ”

en: So before hand I kinda knew about him , but I never met him .
zh: 因此,我早先知道他,但从来没有见过他。

en: And one of our friends , our common friends , he introduced us during study hall , and we just kind of hit it off from there .
zh: 我们的一位朋友,我们的普通朋友,在书房里介绍我们,我们只是从那儿开始了。

en: Who else is involved in this project ?
zh: 还有谁参与这个项目?

en: There 's Jeff  , who is behind the camera .
zh: 这是杰夫, 他在摄像机后面.

en: Right now , yeah , he 's helping us right now .
zh: 现在,他正在帮助我们。

en: We 're talking about doing some individual web series , video series .
zh: 我们正在谈论做一些单独的网络系列,视频系列。

en: Josh Kindig , he 's coming on board , he has some ideas for that too , he wants to take over " aywv " and do more gaming news .
zh: 乔什·金迪格, 他即将上台, 他也有一些想法, 他想接管 “ aywv ” 并做更多的游戏新闻 。

en: There 's of course Jason , who is our editor and he 's the one who writes dD .
zh: 当然还有杰森, 他是我们的编辑,他就是写D的.

en: What is your purpose behind this venture ?
zh: 这个事业背后的目的是 什么?

en: Well , back in college , back in Collins College , Isabel and I , we had met like she said at Sandia View Academy , and we went off to college together in Arizona ;
zh: 回到科林斯学院,我和伊莎贝尔,我们就像她在桑迪亚视角学院所说的那样相遇,然后我们一起去亚利桑那州的大学;

en: Basically , she came up with a few class projects , and I came up with a few class projects ;
zh: 基本上,她提出了一些课堂项目,我提出了一些课堂项目;

en: we started working with a few of our friends , and colleagues and whatnot .
zh: 我们开始和一些朋友、同事和其他人一起工作。

en: Those included Drew Cass , Devin Thurlow , people like that .
zh: 他们包括德鲁·卡斯、德文·瑟洛、这样的人。

en: She had several ideas , and she used to draw a lot in the sketchbook , she used to have this thick sketchbook that she used to carry around with her everywhere , where she 'd draw these different characters and whatnot ;
zh: 她有几点想法,经常在草图书里画很多,她经常有这张厚厚的草图书,她常随身携带,在草图书里画这些不同的人物和其它的东西;

en: and she was always really shy to show that off to people , and I wanted to help her show that stuff , and I wanted to bring it out to the world .
zh: 她总是很害羞地向别人展示这些东西,我想帮助她展示这些东西,我想把它们带到世上。

en: I was a writer , and she always liked my writings , so I was like , let 's just get both of our things together , and let 's get this done .
zh: 我是个作家,她总是喜欢我的作品,所以我就说, 让我们把这两个东西都搞好, 让我们做这件事吧.

en: To bring a little more light to the world is what I want , out of all of this .
zh: 为世界带来更多的光是我要的,从这一切中。

en: We just want to be able to bring , like she said , bring light into the entertainment and into the media industry , specifically is what we do .
zh: 我们只是想能够带来,正如她所说,带来娱乐和媒体产业的光线,这正是我们做的。

en: It recently published its 50,000th article , and to discuss what the site has achieved since its creation , Wikinews interviewed the site 's founder , Jack Herrick .
zh: 它最近发表了第50,000条文章,并讨论该网站自创建以来所取得的成就,维基新闻采访了该网站的创始人杰克·赫里克。

en: In the interview , Herrick explains what wikiHow is , why he decided to create it , how he grew it in size , and why he chose to use a Creative Commons license  for his site .
zh: 在采访中,赫里克解释了维基如何,为什么他决定创建它,他如何在大小上发展它,以及为什么他选择为自己的网站使用Creative Commons许可证。

en: Read below for more of the interview in full .
zh: 全文见下文。

en: For our readers who are unaware of your site , could you briefly explain what wikiHow is ?
zh: 对于那些不了解你的网站的读者, 你能简单地解释一下维基如何 吗?

en: Our long term goal is to produce practical instructions on almost every topic in every language .
zh: 我们的长期目标是在每个语言中制作几乎所有主题的实际指导。

en: We 're quite far from our goals currently , but we take comfort in the fact that every month wikiHow gets noticeably better and larger
zh: 我们目前离目标还很远,但我们感到安慰的是,每个月维基如何变得明显更好和更大

en: We currently have just under 50000 articles and over 1000 featured articles .
zh: 我们目前只有50000条和1000条以上的特色条目。

en: We hope that in time , we will have millions of articles with many of them having featured status .
zh: 我们希望随着时间的推移,我们将拥有数百万条条目,其中许多条目具有特色。

en: That said , we are realistic enough to realize that this goal will take decades to achieve .
zh: 尽管如此,我们还是十分现实的,认为实现这一目标需要几十年的时间。

en: However , in terms of readership , we are probably the most popular single subject wiki after Wikipedia .
zh: 然而,从读者的角度来看,我们可能是在维基百科之后最受欢迎的单一主题维基。

en: We get over 14 million unique visitors per month  , which makes us the 135th most popular site according to Quantcast .
zh: 每个月我们有超过14百万的独一无二的访问者,这使我们成为Quantcast的第135位最受欢迎的网站。

en: Our community is full of volunteers from all over the world .
zh: 我们的社区里有来自世界各地的志愿者。

en: The English wikiHow has only 60 admins , compared to the 1000 + on English Wikipedia .
zh: 英语维基百科只有60个管理员,与英语维基百科的1000+相比。

en: As a result , wikiHow is still at the size that every editor eventually gets to know other editors .
zh: 结果,维基如何仍然是每个编辑最终了解其他编辑的大小。

en: This has several advantages and disadvantages when compared to the non-profit structure at the Wikimedia Foundation .
zh: 与维基百科基金会的非营利结构相比,这有许多优点和缺点。

en: Our advertising revenue funds community meetups and has even allowed us to donate over $ 60,000 to charities such as the Wikimedia Foundation and Creative Commons .
zh: 我们的广告收入资助社区聚会,甚至允许我们捐赠超过60,000美元给像维基媒体基金会和Creative Commons这样的慈善机构。

en: In addition , we 've used our revenue on things like buying carbon offsets to become carbon neutral .
zh: 此外,我们把收入用于购买碳补偿品,以使碳中性化。

en: Our community culture is focused on wikiLove and civility .
zh: 我们的社区文化集中于维基爱和文明。

en: As a result some folks believe wikiHow is a more humane and enjoyable place to work than other places online .
zh: 因此,一些人认为维基如何比其他在线网站更加人道和愉快的工作场所。

en: Why did you decide to create wikiHow ?
zh: 你为什么决定创建wikiHow?

en: I think that providing people with a practical education is one of the most empowering things you can offer a person .
zh: 我认为,为人们提供实用教育是给予一个人最有能力的东西之一。

en: Imagine having detailed step - by - step instructions on how to do any activity you could imagine .
zh: 想象一下有详细的步骤步骤说明如何做任何活动你能想象的.

en: How much more could you accomplish as an individual if you could learn any activity ?
zh: 如果你能学到任何一项活动,你作为个人能取得多少成就呢?

en: I think that building a universal how - to manual would be a tremendous gift for the world .
zh: 我认为,建立一个通用的手册将是一个巨大的礼物给世界。

en: Knowledge is power and wikiHow has the potential to make all of us a bit more powerful .
zh: 知识是力量,维基如何有潜力让我们变得更有力量。

en: I 've been interested in building a comprehensive how - to manual long before I first envisioned wikiHow .
zh: 我对建立一个全面如何手册感兴趣很久以前我第一次想象的维基如何。

en: My first attempt at building this resource was a website I used to run called eHow .
zh: 我第一次尝试建立这个资源是一个我曾经运行的网站,叫eHow。

en: eHow contains copyrighted content run on proprietary software .
zh: eHow包含在专有软件上运行的著作权内容。

en: This business model worked for producing content on topics that appeal to advertisers in languages like English that have large advertising markets .
zh: 这种商业模式用于制作内容,以吸引具有大型广告市场英语等语言的广告商。

en: However , paying people to write and edit articles ultimately means that you have to make one of two sacrifices .
zh: 然而,付钱给人们写和编辑文章最终意味着你必须做出两种牺牲之一。

en: You either 1) sacrifice on breadth and do n't produce the topics that wo n't interest advertisers , or 2) you sacrifice on quality and produce content that does n't cost much to write .
zh: 你要么 1) 牺牲宽度,并不能产生那些不会引起广告商兴趣的话题,要么 2) 你牺牲质量,并产生没有花费太多的内容。

en: I was n't interested in making either of these sacrifices , as I think the world 's how to manual needs to be high quality AND comprehensive .
zh: 我不想做出这些牺牲,因为我认为世界如何手动需要高质量和全面。

en: So ultimately I decided that eHow 's model would not build the resource I envisioned .
zh: 所以最终我决定eHow的模型不会建立我所设想的资源。

en: When I discovered Wikipedia , I recognized that the wiki model had the potential to build the how - to resource the world really needs .
zh: 当我发现维基百科时, 我认识到维基模型有潜力建设世界真正需要的资源.

en: So I decided to sell eHow and use the proceeds to build wikiHow .
zh: 因此,我决定出售eHow并使用收益来创建wikiHow。

en: Why did you decide to use a Creative Commons license ?
zh: 你为什么决定使用Creative Commons许可证?

en: We use a Creative Commons license to give our community the right to fork  .
zh: 我们使用一个Creative Commons许可证,让我们的社区有权叉。

en: In my opinion , people should be hesitant to contribute to websites where you only have the " right to leave . "
zh: 在我看来, 人们应该犹豫不决地参与那些只有你有权离开的网站.

en: If wikiHow volunteers think our site is going in the wrong direction , they can take all the content and all the software and move the project elsewhere .
zh: 如果维基如何志愿者认为我们的网站走错了方向,他们可以把所有内容和软件转移到其他地方。

en: This is possible because we release all of our software under the Open Source GPL license and release our content under a Creative Commons license .
zh: 这是可能的,因为我们发布所有我们的软件在开放源代码GPL许可证下,并且发布我们的内容在Creative Commons许可证下。

en: This right to fork guarantees that wikiHow , the company , will always serve the goal of the mission and our volunteer community .
zh: 这个权限保证了wikiHow公司将永远服务于使命和我们的志愿者社区的目标。

en: I believe that offering this right to fork has been a key element of our success thus far .
zh: 我认为,我们迄今取得成功的关键因素是提供这个叉子的权限。

en: My hope is that over time , internet users will demand this of any site where they invest their time in a way that creates value for others .
zh: 我希望,随着时间的推移,互联网用户将要求任何他们为他人创造价值的投资网站这样做。

en: That said , when we started out I did n't know the difference between the GNU Free Document License and my California Driver 's license .
zh: 也就是说,当我们开始的时候,我不知道GNU自由文档许可证和我的加州驱动程序许可证之间的区别。

en: As a result , we made some mistakes along the path .
zh: 结果,我们沿着这条路犯了一些错误。

en: In retrospect , I think we probably should have selected the CC BY - SA license instead of CC - BY - SA - NC .
zh: 回顾一下, 我想我们应该选择CC BY - SA牌照而不是CC - BY - SA - NC牌照.

en: At a minimum this would provide a helpful compatibility with other wikis and free culture projects .
zh: 这至少能提供与其他维基和自由文化项目有用的兼容性。

en: wikiHow now has millions of visitors per month .
zh: wikiHow现在每月有数百万访问者。

en: How did you grow the site to the size it is today ?
zh: 你如何使这个网站达到目前的大小?

en: In December 2008 , wikiHow had over 14 million unique visitors according to Google Analytics  .
zh: 在2008年12月,WikiHow拥有超过14百万独特的访问者,根据Google Analytics。

en: Quantcast ranks wikiHow as the 135th most popular site in the US .
zh: Quantcast将WikiHow评为美国第135位最受欢迎的网站。

en: wikiHow achieved this popularity for a few reasons .
zh: 维基如何为几个原因获得这个受欢迎。

en: First , people around the world are desperate for high quality how - to information .
zh: 首先, 全世界的人们都渴望得到高质量的信息.

en: People want to learn more practical skills , and for the most part the internet does n't provide enough quality information yet .
zh: 人们想学习更多的实际技能,而大部分情况下,互联网还没有提供足够的质量信息。

en: Second , we attracted millions of readers via the virtuous circle of wiki editing : We had some articles of mixed quality , and editors joined to improve those articles , which in turn attracted more readers .
zh: 其次,我们通过 virtuous circle的维基编辑吸引了数百万读者:我们有一些混合质量的文章,编辑加入改进这些文章,这反过来吸引了更多的读者。
