en: We continue to depend on this same virtuous cycle : More readers , means more editors , which creates better instructions , leading again to more readers .
zh: 我们继续依靠同样的良性循环:更多的读者,意味着更多的编辑,这创造出更好的指导,再次导致更多的读者。

en: What qualifications do you have that will assist you in executing the duties of president ?
zh: 你具备哪些资格能帮助你履行总统职务?

en: My Presidential qualifications are rooted in my service as an Officer in the United States Air Force .
zh: 我的总统资格根源于我担任美国空军军官的工作。

en: I took the Oath to our Constitution at 22 years old .
zh: 我22岁就向宪法宣誓。

en: I understood it was an Oath to ALL of our people .
zh: 我明白这是对我们所有人的誓言。

en: Politicians profess an Oath to this nation but once in office pursue their party agenda and reward their voters .
zh: 政客们向这个国家宣誓,但当他们掌权后,他们会追求党议程并奖励选民。

en: As President , I will serve ALL of the people in America , guided by the Constitution .
zh: 作为总统,我将奉行宪法指导的全美人民。

en: When I was a young man in Air Force ROTC I was chosen to attend a unique Pilot Training Program called Euro- NATO Joint Jet Pilot Training .
zh: 当我年轻时,我被选中参加欧洲-北约联合喷气飞行员训练的独一无二的飞行员训练计划。

en: The Air Force only selected 180 Officers a year from the Academy , Squadron Officer School and ROTC to attend .
zh: 空军每年只选出180名军官从学院、分舰队军官学校和特遣队军官学校参加。

en: I volunteered for that program because I knew I wanted to be a Fighter Pilot and at the " Top of the Spear . "
zh: 我自愿参加那个项目,因为我知道我想成为一名战斗机飞行员,并且在“ 飞船的顶部 ”.

en: In those days it was all or nothing .
zh: 那些时候,一切都是无关紧要的。

en: If you graduated you were assigned a fighter , if you were not quite fighter pilot material you had no response to fly another aircraft , you were washed out .
zh: 如果你毕业,你被任命为战斗机,如果你不是战斗机飞行员的材料,你没有反应飞行另一架飞机,你被洗掉。

en: Congress has proven itself ineffective as a body .
zh: 国会已经证明自己作为一个机构是无效的。

en: To make a difference in America you must have the " Bully Pulpit " and speak to the People .
zh: 要使美国发生变化,你必须拥有“ Bully Pulpit ”,并与人民讲话。

en: The President has that pulpit .
zh: 总统有这个讲台。

en: I never wanted to make politics a career .
zh: 我从来没想过把政治当成事业。

en: Why did you choose to run in the Republican Party ?
zh: 你为什么选择参加共和党?

en: My ties to the Republican party date back to 1979 , when I volunteered for Ronald Reagan and his campaign in New Hampshire .
zh: 我与共和党的关系可以追溯到1979年,当时我为罗纳德·里根和他在新罕布什尔州竞选时的志愿者。

en: In those days I believed there was a difference in the parties .
zh: 那时,我认为党派之间存在分歧。

en: Today , like many Americans , I am skeptical .
zh: 今天,像许多美国人一样,我也很怀疑。

en: I understand third party candidates have no success .
zh: 我知道第三方候选人没有成功。

en: I hope to lead the Republican party in a new direction for working class Americans .
zh: 我希望领导共和党向工人阶级美国人迈向新的方向。

en: How do you plan to get into the Republican debates and make an impact on polls ?
zh: 你打算如何进入共和党的辩论并对民意调查产生影响?

en: In order to be invited to the debates , we must raise money and poll nationally .
zh: 为了被邀请参加辩论,我们必须筹集资金并进行全国性投票。

en: Recently we were listed in New Hampshire and nationally with Politics1 .
zh: 我们最近在新罕布什尔州和全国有“政治”的名单。

en: If you do not receive the Republican nomination , would you consider running as a third party candidate ?
zh: 如果你没有得到共和党提名, 你会考虑当第三党候选人 吗?

en: No , I will back the nominee of the Republican party in 2016 .
zh: 不,我将在2016年支持共和党候选人。

en: After that , I may reconsider .
zh: 之后,我再考虑一下。

en: Other than yourself , which candidates have you supported for president in previous campaigns ?
zh: 除了你自己之外,你以前的竞选中支持哪些候选人?

en: What are your thoughts on the job Barack Obama has done as president ?
zh: 你对巴拉克·奥巴马作为总统所做的工作有什么看法?

en: President Obama has an agenda that represents the far left wing of his party .
zh: 奥巴马总统的议程代表他的政党的极左翼。

en: His use of the Presidency to further this agenda has in many ways been unconstitutional .
zh: 他利用总统任期来推动这一议程在许多方面都是违宪的。

en: Specifically , altering law once it is passed to accommodate his voting blocs .
zh: 具体说来, 修改法律一旦通过,才能适应他的选区.

en: His direction to Eric Holder to enforce some laws and not others is another example .
zh: 他向埃里克·霍德尔指示执行某些法律而不是其他法律是另一个例子。

en: If elected , what would constitute a successful presidency for you ?
zh: 如果当选, 你们的总统任期会是什么?

en: Term Limits for Congress and the Courts returning government to the People .
zh: 国会和法院的任期限制,将政府归还人民。

en: Implementing a Tax System that allows working Americans making under $ 250,000 to keep all of their money .
zh: 实施一个允许250,000美元以下的美国工人保持所有他们的钱的税收制度。

en: Closing Loopholes and putting in place a system that is transparent and works .
zh: 关闭漏洞并建立一个透明和有效的系统。

en: Passing a Living Wage program lifting people out of poverty .
zh: 通过一项生活工资计划,使人们摆脱贫困。

en: Returning America to a state of Peace and Security .
zh: 使美国回到和平与安全的状态。

en: What individuals would you like to see in a Hill administration ?
zh: 你希望在希尔政府中看到哪些人?

en: I would like to bring People from the heartland of America that make this nation work .
zh: 我想带出让这个国家运转的美国人。

en: We have had too many decades of Ivy League elites and Professors immersed in theory .
zh: 我们已经拥有太多的几十年的精英和教授沉浸于理论之中。

en: I believe it is our responsibility to pass on the same opportunities to future generations that were promised to us .
zh: 我认为,我们的责任是把我们所承诺的同样的机会传递给下一代。

en: As President , I intend to keep that promise !
zh: 作为主席, 我打算兑现这个承诺!

en: Attorney Robert Sarvis , the Libertarian Party 's nominee for Governor of Virginia , answered five questions submitted via e-mail by accredited Wikinews reporter William Saturn .
zh: 自由党提名弗吉尼亚州长的检察官罗伯特·萨维斯(Robert Sarvis)通过电子邮件回答了经认可的维基新闻记者威廉·萨丁(William Saturn)提出的五个问题。

en: Sarvis has garnered double digits in opinion polls for the 2013 Virginia gubernatorial election , an unusual feat for a third party candidate .
zh: 萨尔维斯在2013年弗吉尼亚州州长选举的民意调查中获得了两位数,这对于第三党候选人来说是个不寻常的成就。

en: The latest Newsmax / Zogby poll from late September placed him at 13 percent , 14 points behind Republican Party nominee Ken Cuccinelli , Virginia 's Attorney General , and 19 points behind Democratic Party nominee Terry McAuliffe , the former Democratic National Committee chairman , with 24 percent undecided .
zh: 9月下旬的《新闻max/佐格比》民意调查显示,他位居共和党候选人肯·库齐内利(Ken Cuccinelli)的14分后,是弗吉尼亚州检察长,他位居民主党候选人特里·麦克奥利夫(Terry McAuliffe)的19分后,他位居民主党全国委员会前主席,他位居共和党候选人肯·库齐内利(Ken Cuccinelli)的14分后,他位居民主党候选人特里·麦克奥利夫(Terry McAuliffe)的19分后,他位居民主党全国委员会前主席。

en: Whoever wins election on November 5 , 2013 , would replace outgoing governor Bob McDonnell .
zh: 谁在2013年11月5日赢得选举, 将取代即将卸任的州长鲍勃·麦克唐纳尔.

en: On his campaign website , Sarvis notes he favors parental school choice through student vouchers , simplification of Virginia 's Tax Code , US Second Amendment - gun - rights , same - sex marriage , and reform of the state 's drug laws .
zh: 在竞选网站上,萨尔维斯指出,他赞成通过学生凭证选择家长学校, 简化弗吉尼亚州税法, 美国第二修正案 - - 枪支权利, 同性婚姻, 以及州的毒品法改革.

en: With Wikinews , Sarvis discusses his background , views on McDonnell 's tenure , keys to campaign success , plan to implement his agenda , and the former Virginia governor he most admires .
zh: 与维基新闻一起,萨维斯讨论了他的背景、麦克唐纳的任期、竞选成功的关键、计划实施他的议程、以及他最钦佩的前弗吉尼亚州长。

en: What is the most important aspect of your background that voters should know about ?
zh: 选民应该知道你的背景最重要的方面是什么?

en: I am the only candidate born and raised in Virginia , but also the only candidate who embodies both physically and philosophically the growing diversity of the commonwealth .
zh: 我在弗吉尼亚州出生和长大的唯一候选人,同时也是联邦日益多样化的唯一候选人。

en: Because of my academic and professional background , I understand the issues and challenges facing Virginia much better than the other candidates , and I am offering real solutions that can be appreciated across the political spectrum .
zh: 由于我的学术和专业背景,我比其他候选人更清楚地了解弗吉尼亚面临的问题和挑战,并提供能够在政治领域得到认同的真正解决方案。

en: I am the only candidate who believes in both economic freedom and personal liberty and the only candidate who stands on principle against cronyism and corporatism and in favor of the rule of law .
zh: 我是唯一一个相信经济自由和个人自由的候选人,也是唯一一个原则上反对族裔主义和企业主义的候选人,支持法治的候选人。

en: What are your thoughts on the job Bob McDonnell has done as Governor of Virginia ?
zh: 你对鲍勃·麦克唐纳担任弗吉尼亚州州长的工作有什么看法?

en: What would you have done differently than him ?
zh: 你跟他有什么不同?

en: McDonnell did well early in his term pushing back against Senate Democrats who wanted huge tax increases in response to major revenue shortfalls during the recession .
zh: 麦克唐纳在任期初期表现良好,反对参议院民主党人,他们希望在经济衰退期间大幅增加税收来应对主要收入短缺。

en: Those early budget efforts are his highest achievements as Governor .
zh: 这些早期的预算努力是他作为州长所取得的最高成就。

en: More recently , he erred in accepting a transportation bill that had huge flaws and huge tax increases , rather than prioritizing spending and seeking more rational , efficient , decentralized transportation decision - making .
zh: 最近, 他错误地接受了一项有巨大缺陷和巨额税收增加的运输法案,而不是优先考虑支出和寻求更理性、更高效、更分散的运输决策.

en: He could have shown much greater leadership in pushing for tax reform , regulatory reform , and school choice .
zh: 他在推动税收改革、监管改革和学校选择方面可以表现出更大的领导力。

en: Of course , he showed ethical lapses in judgment .
zh: 当然, 他在判断中表现出道德上的缺陷.

en: Compared to previous third party candidates at the gubernatorial level , you have done exceptionally well in opinion polling .
zh: 与以前的第三党候选人相比,你在民意调查中表现得非常出色。

en: What do you attribute that success to ?
zh: 你认为成功的原因是什么?

en: They are sick of the partisanship and nonsense and the total lack of substance in modern campaigns .
zh: 他们厌恶党派主义和荒谬,厌恶现代运动的根本性缺乏。

en: Voters see the two major party nominees as exemplifying what is worst about their respective parties , and they want something better .
zh: 选民们认为两位主要政党提名者 exemplify what is worst about their respective parties, and they want something better 。

en: Voters who meet me and hear me speak know that I am sincere , know that I understand the issues deeply and have workable solutions , and know that I stand on principle against cronyism and corporatism and in favor of the rule of law and the public interest .
zh: 与我见面并听到我讲话的选民知道我诚实,知道我深切地理解问题,有切实可行的解决办法,并知道我坚持反对共产主义和企业主义的原则,支持法治和公共利益。

en: People like the fact that I stand for a Virginia that is both Open - minded and Open for Business .
zh: 人们喜欢我为一个开放思想和开放商业的弗吉尼亚而站立的事实.

en: If elected governor , how will you be able to implement your agenda while dealing with a hostile legislature ?
zh: 如果当选州长, 如何才能在处理敌对的立法机构时实施自己的议程?

en: Libertarians share many policy positions with each of the major parties .
zh: 自由主义者与各主要政党有着不同的政策立场。

en: Working together with both Republicans and Democrats , we can get the good aspects of each party while rejecting the bad parts of both .
zh: 与共和党人和民主党人一起合作,我们可以获得每个党派的优点,同时拒绝它们的缺点。

en: Moreover , electing a third - party governor represents a repudiation of politics as usual , and the major party legislators will face changed constraints and incentives , meaning that much more is possible than many people assume , especially with strong leadership .
zh: 而且, 选举一个 第三方 州长代表了对政治的厌恶,主要政党的立法者将面临改变的约束和激励,这意味着比许多人想象的要多得多,特别是在强大的领导下。

en: Which previous Virginia Governor do you most admire and why ?
zh: 你最欣赏的前弗吉尼亚州长是什么,为什么?

en: He was incredibly learned and was a strong advocate for freedom and the rule of law .
zh: 他非常受教养,是自由和法治的坚定拥护者。

en: On Thursday , with 110 days until the start of the 2014 Winter Paralympics in Sochi , Russia , Wikinews interviewed Assistant Professor in Educational Leadership , Sport Studies and Educational / Counseling Psychology at Washington State University Simon Ličen about attitudes in United States towards the Paralympics .
zh: 2014年冬季殘疾人奧林匹克運動會(英语:2014 Winter Paralympics in Sochi, Russia)於俄羅斯索契舉行。

en: Ličen has recently joined the Sport Management Program at Washington State University to develop its sport media and communication research and teaching contents .
zh: Ličen最近加入了华盛顿州立大学体育管理项目,发展其体育媒体和通讯研究和教学内容。

en: Originally from Slovenia , he served as the Director of Media and Communications of a WTA Tour event and was a member of the UNESCO Slovenian National Commission .
zh: 他最初来自斯洛文尼亚,曾担任WTA旅游项目的媒体和通讯总监,并是教科文组织斯洛文尼亚国家委员会的成员。

en: He was also the Team Manager of the Slovenian wheelchair basketball national team .
zh: 他也是斯洛文尼亚轮椅篮球国家队的球队经理。

en: Why do you think the Paralympic movement has so little visibility in the US compared to other countries like Australia , the United Kingdom and even Canada ?
zh: 为什么你认为美国残奥会运动在澳大利亚、英国甚至加拿大等其他国家中几乎没有 visibility 呢?

en: Sports in the United States largely reaffirm existing relations of power in society .
zh: 美国体育在很大程度上重申了社会中的权力关系。

en: It emphasizes consumerism , the belief that success always goes to people who merit it due to their abilities , dedication and qualifications , and reinforces , rather than changes , existing ideas related to gender , ethnicity and nationality .
zh: 它强调消费主义,认为成功总是归功于能力、奉献和资格的人们,并且加强了与性别、种族和国籍有关的现有观念,而不是改变。

en: Paralympic sport brings attention to athletes who are typically overlooked in American society because the majority of the population does not want to identify with people who are disabled .
zh: 残疾运动会把注意力集中在运动员身上,这些运动员在美国社会中通常被忽视,因为大多数人不想与残疾人同化。

en: Although disability is not contagious , interest in disabled sports might put into question the masculinity of the males following it .
zh: 尽管残疾并非传染性,但对残疾运动的兴趣可能会质疑其后男性的男性性。

en: Disabled athletes also challenge existing relations of power by displaying dedication , hard work and perseverance in different contexts than those most sports fans are accustomed to .
zh: 残疾运动员也挑战现有的权力关系,表现出比大多数体育爱好者所习惯的奉献 、 艰苦工作和毅力。

en: Other countries , including the ones you mention , have stronger social orientations in all aspects of society .
zh: 其他国家,包括你提到的国家,在社会各个方面都有较强的社会倾向。

en: Even though legislative support may be less strong than the one provided by the Americans with Disabilities Act , many social institutions including the media are more receptive to this form of diversity .
zh: 尽管立法支持可能比美国残疾人法提供的更弱,但许多社会机构,包括媒体,对这种多样性更加敏感。

en: What do you think the impact will be for the Paralympic movement will be with the Games being televised live in the United States for first time ?
zh: 你认为奥运会将对残疾人运动产生什么影响,因为奥运会将首次在美国现场直播?

en: The impact depends on a number of aspects .
zh: 影响取决于若干方面。

en: One of them is the channels that NBC as the broadcasting rights owner for the United States will use to air the Paralympic Games on .
zh: 其中一个是NBC作为美国广播权拥有者将使用以播放残疾运动会的频道。

en: Will they be shown nationally or regionally , on NBC or on any of the company ’s multiple cable networks ?
zh: 他们会在美国或地区,在NBC或该公司的多个电缆网络上播出吗?

en: A second aspect is the parts or hours of the day the Paralympics will be shown .
zh: 第二个方面是比赛的日期或时间。

en: Remember that there is a nine - hour difference between Sochi and New York , and a 12 - hour difference between Sochi and the US West Coast .
zh: 记住,索契和纽约之间有九小时的差异, 索契和美国西海岸之间有12小时的差异.

en: So daytime events will be shown live in the United States in the middle of the night , and evening prime - time events will be shown — indeed live — in the morning U.S. time .
zh: 因此,白天的事件将在美国在夜中直播, 晚上的首播时间的事件将在早上的美国时间播放 — — 确实是现场直播.

en: So showing the Paralympics live on United States television might turn out to be less glamorous than it appears .
zh: 因此,在美国电视上直播残疾运动会可能不像看上去那么华丽。

en: A third important factor is the way the event will be mediated : will NBC have its best sports broadcasters following the event after having worked the Winter Olympics ?
zh: 第三个重要因素是比赛将如何进行调解: NBC在冬季奥林匹克运动会后会有最好的体育广播机构吗?

en: Will they treat and announce the competitions as they do all others — for better and worse ?
zh: 他们会像其他人一样对待和宣布比赛 — — 更好还是坏呢?

en: Will they take it as an opportunity to educate viewers about disability and diversity while showing superb athletic performances without engaging in a discourse of pity ?
zh: 他们将把它当作一个机会教育观众关于残疾和多样性,同时展示卓越的体育表现,而不进行同情的对话吗?

en: The LibriVox website features a catalog of about a hundred completed books , including books in other languages like German , Hebrew , and Japanese .
zh: LibriVox网站提供了大约100本完整的书籍的目录,包括其他语言如德语、希伯来语和日语的书籍。

en: Why did you decide to take the acoustic fate of public domain works into your own hands , and how did you go about it ?
zh: 你为什么决定把公共领域作品的音响命运掌握在自己的手中?

en: I think that a vibrant public domain is very important to a healthy world , and so I thought : here 's a way to help the cause .
zh: 我认为一个充满活力的公共领域对于一个健康的世界是十分重要的,因此我想:这里是帮助这个事业的办法。

en: I launched LibriVox , emailed some friends and some podcasters who where doing literary stuff , and invited them to record a chapter of Joseph Conrad 's Secret Agent .
zh: 我启动了LibriVox,发了电子邮件给一些朋友和一些播音员,他们在那里做文学工作,并邀请他们录制约瑟夫·康拉德的秘密代理的一章。

en: Things have grown steadily since .
zh: 自从那以后,事情一直在稳步增长。

en: By the way , AKMA was the first guy I know of to do something like this , with Lawrence Lessig 's Free Culture .
zh: 顺便说一下, AKMA是我认识的第一个做这种事情的人,与劳伦斯·莱西格的自由文化。

en: That , I think , started my thinking about this , but it took a while for the idea to crystallize .
zh: 这,我想,开始了我的思考,但是这个想法花了一段时间才结晶。

en: Do you personally record audiobooks , and did you already do so before LibriVox ?
zh: 你是否亲自录制音频书,并且你已经在利比里沃克斯之前这样做 吗?

en: LibriVox was my first experience recording audiobooks .
zh: LibriVox是我第一次体验录音书。

en: I still do the odd chapter , but i am a bit delinquent in finishing some of them these days !
zh: 我仍然做奇怪的章节,但是我最近在完成一些章节时有点不礼貌!

en: Is there a particular LibriVox book which you think stands out because of the quality , the overall effort involved , its popularity , or for some other reason ?
zh: 有没有专门的LibriVox书,你认为因为它的质量、所涉及的整体努力、其流行程度、或其他原因而突出?

en: My personal favourite is Notes from the Underground  .
zh: 我个人最喜欢的是地下的笔记。

en: Ed. : See the LibriVox catalog for a full index .
zh: 参见LibriVox目录的完整索引。

en: Browsing the catalog , I find that the quality of the spoken audio varies greatly from text to text or even from chapter to chapter .
zh: 在浏览目录时,我发现口音的质量从文本到文本或甚至从章节到章节都有很大的差异。

en: If someone wanted to re-record a chapter because they did n't like the speaker , would you then offer two versions ?
zh: 如果有人想重新录制一个章节,因为他们不喜欢演讲者,你会提供两个版本吗?

en: We take the Wikipedia approach : if you think it should be better , please help it be so .
zh: 我们采用维基百科的方法:如果你认为应该更好,请帮助它这样。

en: You 'll note we offer a couple of versions of some books .
zh: 你会注意到我们提供一些版本的书籍。

en: Indeed our weekly poetry project celebrates this diversity of voice : each week a new short poem is chosen and as many readers as wish to record a version , so you get 20 + versions of the same poem , a very interesting audio experience .
zh: 事实上,我们的每周的诗歌项目庆祝了这种声音的多样性:每个星期一个新短诗被选定,并尽可能多的读者希望录制一个版本,所以你得到20+版本的同一个诗歌,一个非常有趣的听觉体验。

en: Besides works whose copyright has expired , there is an increasing number of modern books available under Creative Commons and similar licenses .
zh: 除了著作权过期的作品外,还有越来越多的现代书籍在Creative Commons和类似的许可证下获得。

en: You mentioned Larry Lessig 's Free Culture , but it also includes some out of print titles by publishers who are open to the concept , such as O'Reilly .
zh: 你提到了拉里·莱西格的自由文化,但它还包括一些对这个概念开放的出版商的印刷作品,例如O’Reilly。

en: Do you want to limit the scope of LibriVox strictly to old public domain works , or do you have plans to include recent works under reasonably permissive licenses as well ?
zh: 您是否想严格限制 LibriVox的范围,只限于旧的公共域名作品,或您是否计划在合理许可的许可证下包括最近的作品?

en: We are only doing public domain works , for a number of reasons , partly to keep simplicity in our copyright situation -- public domain means it s as simple as can be .
zh: 我们只是做公有领域作品,因为一些原因,部分是为了保持我们的著作权状况的简单性--公有领域意味着它尽可能简单。

en: CC makes things more complex .
zh: CC使事情更加复杂。

en: Also , there are other sites , notably podiobooks.com , which are better suited to CC works than LibriVox .
zh: 还有其他网站,特别是 podiobooks.com,比 LibriVox更适合CC作品。

en: we find it makes things clear and easy to say : published works , public domain , and leave it at that .
zh: 我们发现它使事情清晰易言:出版作品,公有领域,并把它放在那儿。

en: As far as I can tell , podiobooks.com features " free as in beer " content — material which you can download , but which is n't under a free content license .
zh: 据我所知, podiobooks.com有“像啤酒一样免费”的内容 — — 你可以下载的材料,但没有免费内容许可证。

en: We do n't want to have to give anyone permission to use our recordings , we want anyone to use them for whatever they want .
zh: 我们不想让任何人使用我们的录音,我们想让任何人用它们做他们想要的东西。

en: Also , for the thing to work you need to have many dedicated volunteers willing to do the management  and many willing to do the reading .
zh: 还有,为了工作你需要有许多献身的志愿者愿意做管理和许多愿意做阅读。

en: While Pride and Prejudice will attract many readers , I do n't know about O'Reilly 's latest tome on XML ... though I might be wrong .
zh: 虽然傲慢和偏见会吸引很多读者,但我不知道O'Reilly在XML上的最新册子...虽然我可能错了。

en: McKenzie , a silver and bronze Paralympic medalist in wheelchair basketball , retired from the game after the 2012 Summer Paralympics in London .
zh: 在2012年伦敦夏季殘疾人奧林匹克運動會(英语:2012 Summer Paralympics in London)結束後,麥肯齊(英语:McKenzie)是車椅子籃球的銀牌和銅牌殘疾人奧林匹克運動會獎牌得主。

en: Wikinews caught up with her in a cafe in the leafy Melbourne suburb of Preston .
zh: 维基新闻在墨尔本郊区普雷斯顿的咖啡馆里发现了她。

en: It was a tournament that I wish we 'd actually gone back to more often .
zh: 我真希望我们能经常去参加这个比赛。

en: Who plays in that one ?
zh: 谁在那个剧中扮演?

en: So we were trying to get as many international games as possible .
zh: 所以我们想尽可能多地参加国际比赛。

en: It costs us so much money to for us to travel overseas and to compete internationally .
zh: 我们的海外旅行和国际竞争花费了我们很多钱。

en: No , it 's really not , so it 's really important to be able to get as a many international trips throughout the year to continue our improvement .
zh: 不,真的不是,所以很重要的是能够获得一年中许多国际旅行来继续我们的进步。

en: Also see where all the other teams are at as well .
zh: 还有其他球队在哪。

en: We took quite a few new girls over there back then in 2005 , leading into the World Cup in the Netherlands .
zh: 在2005年,我们带了一些新女孩到那儿去参加荷兰世界杯。

en: Was that the one where you were the captain of the team , in 2005 ?
zh: 那是2005年你担任球队队长的那场吗?

en: No , I captained in 2010 .
zh: 不,我于2010年成为队长。

en: And then I had a bit of some time off in 2011 .
zh: 然后在2011年我有点休假。

en: The Gliders have never won the World Championship .
zh: 滑翔机从来没有赢得世界锦标赛。

en: I do n't know why .
zh: 我不知道为什么。

en: 2002 World Cup , we won bronze .
zh: 2002年世界杯,我们获得铜牌。

en: Then in 2006 we ended up fourth .
zh: 然后在2006年,我们最终排名第四。

en: And then in 2010 we just ... I do n't know what happened .
zh: 然后在2010年我们只是...我不知道发生了什么。

en: Came fourth .
zh: 第四来。

en: But you know what ?
zh: 但你知道吗?

en: Fired us up for the actual Paralympics .
zh: 为真正的残疾人运动会开火了。

en: So the World Cup is ... it 's good to be able to do well at the World Cup , to be placed , but it also means that you get a really good opportunity to know where you 're at in that two year gap between the Paralympics .
zh: 因此,世界杯是......在世界杯上表现得很好,能被评为冠军,但它也意味着你有机会知道你在两年间的残奥会间的差距上在哪里。

en: So you can come back home and revisit what you need to do and , you know , where the team 's at .
zh: 这样你就可以回家,再看看你需要做什么,你知道,球队在哪儿。

en: Unfortunately , they are talking about moving it so it will be on the year before the Paralympics .
zh: 不幸的是,他们正在谈论移动它,所以它将是在残疾人运动会前一年。

en: Frank Messina : An Interview with the ' Mets Poet '
zh: 弗兰克·梅西纳:与“ 梅特斯诗人”的采访

en: You have received a good deal of attention recently .
zh: 你最近得到了相当多的关注。

en: Even though I 'm not Michael Jackson or somebody , when people come up to me and introduce themselves and say , ' Hey Frank , my name is John , ' I say , ' Hey John , my name is Frank ' and they laugh .
zh: 尽管我不是迈克尔·杰克逊或其他人,但当人们到我面前介绍自己说: 嘿,弗兰克,我叫约翰,我说: 嘿,约翰,我叫弗兰克,他们笑。

en: What goes through your head when that happens ?
zh: 当那件事发生时,你脑子里想些什么?

en: I understand it .
zh: 我明白了。

en: I 've gone to readings and concerts .
zh: 我去了读书和音乐会。

en: I look at it as human interaction .
zh: 我把它看作是人类的互动。

en: Over the years I have performed in 32 countries and 40 states .
zh: 多年来,我在32个国家和40个州演出。

en: I 've been doing this professionally since I was in my twenties , and before that since I was sixteen doing little tidbit poetry readings in coffeehouses .
zh: 我从二十岁就开始做这种专业工作,从十六岁开始,在咖啡馆里做些小点儿的诗歌阅读。

en: The band I started in 1993 , Spoken Motion , received a lot of recognition as a spoken word band born out of the New York spoken word scene .
zh: 我于1993年开始的乐队,Spoken Motion,作为来自纽约的口语乐队的口语乐队得到了广泛的认可。

en: I worked with some great musicians and performed around the world .
zh: 我和一些伟大的音乐家合作,并在世界各地演出。

en: I remember signing my first autograph to a kid when I was 25 years old .
zh: 我记得我25岁时第一次给一个孩子签了签名。

en: As time went on , I came out with books and CDs , and I became used to that kind of thing .
zh: 随着时间的推移,我拿出书和CD,我习惯了这种东西。

en: To me , the ultimate feeling of success as an artist , is to move somebody enough where they thank you .
zh: 对我来说,作为一名艺术家的终极成就感,就是让别人有足够的动力去感谢你。

en: When someone comes up and says , ' Frank , thank you , your work is great . "
zh: 当有人上台说, “ 弗兰克, 谢谢, 你的工作很棒. ”

en: You have a long career in poetry , but as of late the attention you have garnered is for the Mets - inspired work .
zh: 你的诗歌生涯很长, 但最近你所获得的注意力是为梅特斯的灵感作品.

en: How do you feel about having a lot of your work overshadowed by the Mets work ?
zh: 你觉得你的很多工作被地铁工作掩盖了 吗?

en: Walt Whitman , the first great American poet , wrote about the Civil War .
zh: 美国第一位伟大的诗人沃尔特·惠特曼(Walt Whitman)对内战作了文章。

en: He went looking for his brother , George Whitman , after he a telegram telling him his brother was injured in the South .
zh: 他去找他的弟弟乔治·惠特曼,他接到电报告诉他他的弟弟在南方受伤了。

en: Then he started to see the real horrors of war .
zh: 然后他开始看到战争的真正恐怖。

en: He was able to tap into the human condition and the situation at that time .
zh: 他能够利用当时的人类状况和形势。

en: Eventually when he found his brother he had resolution .
zh: 最后,当他找到了他的弟弟时,他有了决心。

en: I experienced that kind of adversity during 9/11 being a civilian volunteer .
zh: 作为一名志愿人员,我经历过9/11期间的那种困难。

en: I loaded ferry boats in Jersey City across the river to deliver goods to Ground Zero .
zh: 我在泽西城装船过河运货物到地面零号。

en: I turned to Whitman to find some understanding of what is happening in the world right now .
zh: 我转向惠特曼,想了解目前世界上发生的事情。

en: When I wrote my 9/11 - related poems , that was true adversity .
zh: 当我写我的9/11相关诗时, 那是真正的逆境.

en: I realize baseball is just a game .
zh: 我知道棒球只是一场游戏。

en: Can you recite a stanza that expresses how you feel right now ?
zh: 你能朗诵一段表达你现在的感受的诗歌 吗?

en: This was a piece that the Times only quoted one stanza , but it 's about preparation for a battle , and being prepared to either rise to the occasion , or go down :
zh: 这是《泰晤士报》所引用的一篇短文,但该短文是关于为一场战斗做好准备,并做好准备,要么应付场合,要么下台:

en: Do you know what it 's like to be chased by the Ghost of Failure while staring through Victory 's door ?
zh: 你知道在胜利的门边凝视着被失败的幽灵追赶的感觉 吗?

en: Of course you do , you 're a Mets fan caught in a do - or - die moment in late September at Shea
zh: 当然是的,你是一个梅特斯的粉丝,在9月下旬在谢亚的一场“不死不活”时刻被抓住了

en: As one that 's battled hard through many a broken dream Let me say , " in order to rise to the occasion you must be willing to go down with the ship " ,
zh: 作为一个经过许多失败的梦的苦战的人,让我说, “ 为了应付这个机会,你必须愿意和船下去,

en: Have no fear , no hesitation , for Winning shall be it's reward !
zh: 不要害怕, 不要犹豫, 因为胜利就是回报!

en: Do n't let them get in your head !
zh: 别让他们进入你的脑子!

en: you 've kept it up this long
zh: 你一直坚持这么久了

en: You 're a Mets fan in late September and you ll fight til the glorious end
zh: 你9月下旬是梅特斯的粉丝,你将一直战斗到光荣的结局

en: Cheer the team today ;  Let them hear you shout as they fight for what 's mightily due
zh: 祝贺球队今天;让他们听到你喊叫,因为他们为应付的巨大事情而战斗

en: Sports fans are n't known as patrons of poetry .
zh: 体育爱好者并不被认为是诗歌的赞助者。

en: Have you had interaction with " new readers ' through your Mets work ?
zh: 你有没有通过你Mets的工作与“新读者”进行交流?

en: This one person who I never met took a picture of me and sent it to me in an e-mail .
zh: 一个我从未见过的人把我的照片给我发了一封电子邮件。

en: The e-mail said , ' Frank , I have never bothered you during the game , but I just wanted to say thank you for your work and thank you for making some sense of the successes and failures and I wish you much success with your work . '
zh: 电子邮件说:“弗兰克,我从来没在比赛期间打扰你,只是想说谢谢你所做的工作,谢谢你对成功和失败的理解,并祝你工作成功。

en: Last year in my section at the stadium I had a banner that read We Know ' .
zh: 去年我在体育场的分区上挂了一张标牌,上面写着: “ 我们知道 ”.

en: That 's all it said .
zh: 这就是它说的。

en: Then earlier this year these shirts started to come out that said , " Poet says We Know " .
zh: 今年早些时候, 这些衬衫开始推出, 上面写着: “ 诗人说我们知道 ”.

en: We did n't use the banner this year , though , because we did n't know .
zh: 不过,我们今年没有使用旗帜,因为我们不知道。

en: The team was n't so far ahead that we knew .
zh: 这个队没有我们所知道的那么远。

en: This year we were n't sure .
zh: 今年我们还不太确定。

en: We were walking on eggshells .
zh: 我们走在蛋壳上。

en: There was a woman , a season ticket holder and a die hard fan .
zh: 有一个女人,一个赛季票持有人,一个死硬的粉丝。

en: She was staggered by the loss last year to the Cardinals .
zh: 她因去年输给红军而感到震惊。

en: Last year she came up to me during one of the games late in the season ; she was so happy we were going to the post season .
zh: 去年,她在赛季末的一场比赛中来看我,她很高兴我们能进入后赛季。

en: By that point we had clinched it .
zh: 到那个时候,我们已经把它钉好了。

en: She handed me a shirt she bought at the stadium and she gave me a big hug .
zh: 她给了我她在体育场买的一件衬衫,并拥抱了我。

en: With tears in her eyes she said , " Thank you , Mets Poet , thank you . "
zh: 她的眼睛里流泪, “ 谢谢你, 梅特斯诗人, 谢谢你. ”

en: It 's cool ... it 's like another family .
zh: 酷极了,就像另一个家庭一样。

en: Moments like that must make you realize you have touched people who are n't normally touched by poetry .
zh: 这样的时刻一定让你意识到你已经触摸了那些通常不被诗歌所触摸的人。

en: It 's opened up a new fan base , so to speak .
zh: 它开辟了一个新的粉丝基础, 就这么说.

en: For the last year SNY has broadcast footage of me with my poems , so quite a few fans known about the " Mets Poet ' .
zh: 去年,纽约广播了我的诗歌,所以很多粉丝都知道“ 梅特斯诗人 ” 。

en: I have never called myself that , by the way .
zh: 顺便说一下,我从来没这么称呼自己。

en: The back of my jersey says " The Poet ' because growing up that was my nickname .
zh: 我的背上写着“ 诗人 ”,因为长大后,那是我的绰号。

en: My brother was a runner and they used to call him The Birdman -- Birdie -- and they called me The Poet .
zh: 我的弟弟是个跑步者,他们常叫他鸟人--Birdie,他们叫我诗人。

en: It was a natural thing , but I never coined myself as ' The Mets Poet . '
zh: 这是自然的事情, 但我从来没把自己当作“ 梅特斯诗人 ”.

en: This exclusive interview features first - hand journalism by a Wikinews reporter .
zh: 这次独家采访 feature first - hand journalism by a Wikinews reporter.

en: See the collaboration page for more details .
zh: 更详细的资料请参阅合作页面。

en: How do you decide on the stories ?
zh: 你如何决定这些故事?

en: We do everything backwards here .
zh: 这里我们做的一切都是逆转的。

en: We start with a joke .
zh: 我们从一个笑话开始。

en: We read about six hundred to eight hundred headline ideas on a Monday coming from our staff and a small group of writers outside — a contributing core .
zh: 我们星期一读了大约六百到八百个主意,来自我们的工作人员和外面的一群作家 — — 是贡献核心的。

en: We whittle that down on a Monday to about a hundred , come in Tuesday and pick an issue and brainstorm with the whole editorial staff ; all fifteen of us .
zh: 星期一我们把这笔钱调到大约一百英镑,星期二来,和编辑人员一起挑选一个问题,进行 brainstorm,我们共十五人。

en: Then we assign a headline to a specific writer to execute .
zh: 然后我们分配一个标题给一个特定的作者执行。

en: We go through a number of drafts and then have the editors pick it up and assign the photojournalism aspect of it to our graphic design team , who adds the visual aspect to it .
zh: 我们通过了一些草稿,然后让编辑拿它来,并分配它的摄影新闻方面给我们的图形设计团队,他们将视觉方面添加到它。

en: The editors punch it up over the last couple of days and then it goes out over the Internet and into the print edition .
zh: 编辑们在过去几天里把这张专辑弄出来,然后它通过互联网进入印刷版。

en: Writers will occasionally write their own headlines , but we come up with a list of 15 or 20 headline ideas , what we think will make a good story and then we assign it based upon what people ’s writing strengths are .
zh: 作家们偶尔会写自己的头条,但我们拿出15个或20个头条想法的清单,我们认为这会成为一个好故事,然后根据人们写作的优点来分配它。

en: We have some people who are great at politics ; some people we give all the war stuff to ; someone who is in charge of the Britney Spears story of the week — the entertainment stories .
zh: 我们有一些在政治方面非常出色的人;一些我们给所有战争的东西的人;有人负责本周的布莱妮·斯皮尔斯新闻 — — 娱乐新闻。

en: It seems like some publications , like AM New York , always have a Britney Spears story ;
zh: 似乎有些出版物,如纽约广播公司,总是有布兰妮·斯皮尔斯的故事;

en: is there anything similar with The Onion where they continually revisit a topic or person ?
zh: 有与《洋葱》类似的事情吗,他们经常重访某一话题或人物?

en: We are a little less reactionary .
zh: 我们有点不太反应。

en: We tend to target the zeitgeist more than anything .
zh: 我们比任何东西都倾向于关注时代精神。

en: We ’ll hit the mainstream media ’s portrayal of the entertainment world as much as we ’ll hit characters in the entertainment world .
zh: 我们将像娱乐界中的人物一样关注主流媒体对娱乐界的描绘。

en: We ’ll attack People Magazine ’s coverage of Britney as much as Britney .
zh: 我们将像布兰妮一样攻击《人民杂志》的布兰妮报道。

en: In an interview with Terry Gross , Stephen Colbert said of his time at Second City that they had decided on not doing political humor and , in particular , hackneyed political humor such as Ted Kennedy drinking jokes .
zh: 在一次与特里·格罗斯的采访中,斯蒂芬·科尔伯特(Stephen Colbert)说他曾在第二城工作时,他们决定不做政治幽默,特别是胡闹的政治幽默,比如特德·肯尼迪喝笑话。

en: They felt it was overdone , mean - spirited and not funny .
zh: 他们觉得这话太过夸张了, 太过失调, 太不有趣了.

en: Do your writers have similar rules of thumb ?
zh: 你的作家有类似的拇指规则吗?

en: We do n’t have any rules or known lines we wo n’t cross .
zh: 我们没有任何规则或我们不会跨越的既知线。

en: We have an understanding based upon having the same writers in the back room for years , and those writers training the new writers as they come in .
zh: 我们有一个基于在后面的房间里有同样的作家多年的了解,这些作家在他们进来时训练新作家。

en: There is an understanding in the room .
zh: 房间里有一种谅解。

en: If it makes the room laugh , it probably ends up in the paper .
zh: 如果它使房间笑起来,那么它很可能在报纸上。

en: That was our reaction to all of the J - Lo stuff .
zh: 这就是我们对所有J - Lo的事情的反应.

en: We were n’t going to touch on her dress , or who she was dating .
zh: 我们不会碰她的衣服,也不会碰她约会的人。

en: I think it ’s important we have an original take on those things .
zh: 我认为我们必须对这些事情采取一种原始的态度是很重要的。

en: I think it ’s similar to what Colbert said to Terry Gross .
zh: 我认为这与科尔伯特对特里·格罗斯所说的类似。

en: We do n’t want to just traffic in the same 24 hour news cycle .
zh: 我们不想只在同一24小时新闻周期中进行交通。

en: There ’s a 24 hour comedy news cycle that exists on all the late night talk shows .
zh: 有24小时的喜剧新闻周期,在所有晚间的谈话节目中都有。

en: The Onion has a different creative process where we are not trying to hit everything in the 24 hours and on the same notes .
zh: 洋葱有一个不同的创造过程,我们不试图在24小时内和同样的音调中击中所有东西。

en: If we choose to do something on J - Lo , it ’s going to be something like that , something less obvious .
zh: 如果我们选择在J-Lo上做某事, 那将是这样的事情, 一点也不那么明显.

en: When you are going through the headlines , is it just you guys sitting around trying to crack each other up ?
zh: 当你读过头条新闻时, 是不是只是你们俩坐在一起互相打架 呢?

en: Nah , I ’m kidding .
zh: 不,我开玩笑。

en: It ’s actually more businesslike than you ’d imagine .
zh: 事实上,这比你想象的更有商业意义。

en: It ’s very much like you are trying to make the room laugh , but the room has been a sort of captive audience for many many years now , so it takes a lot to make the room laugh .
zh: 就像你试图让房间笑起来一样,但房间已经是一个被囚禁的观众了好多年了,所以要让房间笑起来需要很多时间。

en: The best analogy I ’ve heard is when Rob Siegel , former editor - in - chief , likened it to wine tasting .
zh: 我所听到的最好的比喻是,前编辑罗伯·西格尔(Rob Siegel)把这个比作葡萄酒尝尝。

en: It ’s this quiet experience where you are trying to soak in what the joke is , have we done anything like this , is it a unique take , what are other people doing .
zh: 这是这种安静的经历,你正试图浸透笑话的含义,我们做过类似的事情,这是独特的,别人正在做什么。

en: It ’s sort of like , " Hmmm ... that ’s hilarious . That ’s really really funny " rather than people falling off their chairs .
zh: 这有点像, “ 嗯... 这可笑, 这可真可笑, ” 而不是人们从椅子上掉下来。

en: It ’s more analytical and clinical ?
zh: 它更具有分析性和临床意义吗?

en: Not all the time , but it ca n’t be a laugh a minute .
zh: 不是所有的时候,但那可不是一分钟的笑。

en: Yeah , what you see on Studio 60 and 30 Rock , those are scripted writers rooms .
zh: 是的,你在60和30 Rock的工作室里看到的都是编剧室。

en: Everything is funny there .
zh: 那里的一切都很有趣。

en: There 's a lot of unfunny jokes that are told in a back room , that 's why they stay and die in that back room and do n’t go out in The Onion .
zh: 在后面的房间里讲的笑话很多,这就是为什么他们呆在后面的房间里死去,不出去吃洋葱的原因。

en: If someone is continually telling unfunny jokes , do you eventually fire them ?
zh: 如果有人不停地讲不有趣的笑话, 你最终会解雇他们 吗?

en: That ’s why we are on the 10th floor to make sure they die when they get kicked out .
zh: 这就是为什么我们站在第十层,确保他们被踢出时死亡。

en: By the time you get to be a writer for The Onion , though , the odds are you are going to succeed because we make it pretty challenging .
zh: 到你成为《洋葱》的作家的时候,你有可能成功,因为我们把它当作相当的挑战。

en: You go through quite a bit .
zh: 你经历了相当长一段时间。

en: You will already have demonstrated a pretty long successful record of writing stuff for us before you will be in that room on a daily basis .
zh: 在你每天呆在那个房间之前,你已经为我们展示了写东西的长久的成功记录。

en: But if somebody wakes up one morning and suddenly no longer is funny , then yeah , head first , out the door as quickly as possible , and as sadistically as possible .
zh: 但是,如果某人一早上醒来,突然不再有趣,那么,先头,尽快走出门,并且尽可能有节制。

en: The future of the peace process in Israel
zh: 以色列和平进程的未来

en: " The future is only peace . The problem is how long will it take and how many victims will it call for . "
zh: 未来只有和平,问题在于需要多长时间,需要多少受害者。

en: Mr. President , as a Nobel Peace Prize recipient and as one of the fathers of the modern peace process in Israel , do you still think that there is a future to the peace process ?
zh: 主席先生,作为诺贝尔和平奖得主和以色列现代和平进程的始祖之一,您是否仍然认为和平进程有前途?

en: The future is only peace .
zh: 未来只有和平。

en: The problem is how long will it take and how many victims will it call for .
zh: 问题在于需要多长时间,需要多少受害者。

en: Why do I say peace ?
zh: 我为什么说和平?

en: Because when you look historically , at the development of humanity , most of our lives we are living on the land .
zh: 因为当你从历史角度来看,人类的发展,我们大部分生活都在陆地上。

en: The history is written with red ink .
zh: 历史是用红色的墨水写的。

en: The reason for it is because people were fighting for our land , either defending it or extending it , because that was the main source .
zh: 原因在于人们为了我们的土地而战斗,要么为它辩护,要么为它扩展,因为那是主要的来源。

en: The land , the natural resources , the markets , all these go together .
zh: 土地 、 自然资源 、 市场, 所有这些都是一起的.

en: The minute the land was replaced by science , what is there to fight about ?
zh: 地球被科学所取代的那一刻, 有什么事要解决 呢?

en: Armies can not conquer science .
zh: 军队不能征服科学。

en: Customs can not check what a scientist has in his mind , they can see what he has in his pocket but not what he has in his mind so it ’s uncontrolled ; it means that borders are n’t important and distances are n’t important .
zh: 海关不能检查一个科学家的脑子,他们可以看到他口袋里的东西,但不能检查他脑子里的东西,所以没有控制;这意味着边界并不重要,距离也不重要。

en: How do you approach the difficult challenge of talking to the Palestinians when , in the end , they do n’t want Israel to exist .
zh: 如何面对与巴勒斯坦人交谈的困难挑战呢? 最后,他们不想以色列存在。

en: How do you come to an understanding to make peace possible ?
zh: 你如何才能达成一种让和平成为可能的谅解?

en: I mean , is the problem national , say between Jews and Arabs ; or is it a matter of generations between an old age and a new age ?
zh: 我是说, 犹太人和阿拉伯人之间的问题是国家问题, 还是老龄和新龄之间的代人问题?

en: You see , the terrorists are protesting against modernity .
zh: 你看,恐怖分子正在抗议现代性。

en: They think that modernity may endanger their tradition .
zh: 他们认为现代性可能危及他们的传统。

en: They consider modernity as their enemy , but then they have two problems .
zh: 他们把现代性当作敌人,但他们却有两个问题。

en: Sooner or later they will have to enter the new age .
zh: 早晚他们将不得不进入新的时代。

en: All the talks about nationalities , etcetera , well , the new age has very little patience for history .
zh: 所有关于国籍的谈论,等等,新世纪对历史缺乏耐心。

en: History is becoming more and more irrelevant .
zh: 历史变得越来越无关紧要。

en: How do you feel about that ?
zh: 你觉得怎么样?

en: Well , I distinguish between two histories , the spiritual and the material .
zh: 嗯, 我区分了两个历史, 精神和物质.

en: The history of values is okay because wisdom is ageless ; it does n’t grow old , like material .
zh: 价值的历史是好的,因为智慧是永恒的;它不会像物质一样老去。

en: Tell me , what events is today important such as how many elephants Hannibal had on the Alps , when you can have helicopters ?
zh: 告诉我,今天发生了什么大事,比如汉尼拔在阿尔卑斯山上有多少象,什么时候可以有直升机?

en: Why should I bother my children with all this nonsense ?
zh: 我为什么要用这些胡言乱语烦我的孩子 呢?

en: What sort of a nose did Cleopatra have ?
zh: 克利奥帕特拉有什么样的鼻子?

en: You can invite people to war over noses , but nobody will go to fight for noses any more .
zh: 你可以邀请人们为鼻子而进行战争,但没有人再去为鼻子而战斗。

en: On the other hand , there are already machines that can replace our memory .
zh: 另一方面,已有机器可以取代我们的记忆力。

en: Why should I bother my child with memory when he can buy a computer that will remember everything you asked him to remember ?
zh: 当他能买一台能记住你要求他记住的一切电脑时,为什么我该打扰他记忆力呢?

en: Although a computer can have …
zh: 尽管计算机可以有......

en: Forget memory .
zh: 忘记记忆。

en: Look , the new age is unprecedented .
zh: 看,新世纪是前所未有的。

en: When something is unprecedented , it means it does n’t have a past , does n’t have a history .
zh: 当某事无前例时,它意味着它没有过去,没有历史。

en: It ’s totally oriented on the future .
zh: 它完全面向未来。

en: And whoever dwells in the past , does n’t understand the future because the past is full of prejudices , of commitments .
zh: 任何住在过去的人,都不会理解未来,因为过去充满了偏见,有承诺。

en: It arrests us .
zh: 它逮捕我们。

en: And then you say you wo n’t commit a mistake , so you ’ll commit new mistakes .
zh: 然后你说你不会犯错,所以你会犯新的错误。

en: It does n’t matter .
zh: 没关系。

en: `` I say brains is the greater producer of wealth , not oil .
zh: 我说,大脑是财富的生产者,而不是石油的生产者。

en: It ’s limitless , and you ’ll see that the GNP of Israel is very close to the Saudis ’ .
zh: 它无穷无尽,你会看到以色列的国民生产总值非常接近沙特。

en: So they are 3 times larger than us and they have all the oil in the world .
zh: 他们比我们大3倍,而且他们拥有全世界所有的石油。

en: We have brains . "
zh: 我们有头脑。

en: — Peres , on whether the Arab states ' oil wealth will eclipse Israel 's prominence in the region .
zh: —佩雷斯,关于阿拉伯国家石油财富是否会掩盖以色列在该地区的地位。

en: But you can not repeat mistakes because the world is not built on repetition ; it ’s built on mutation .
zh: 但你不能重复错误,因为世界不是建立在重复上,而是建立在突变上。

en: Do n’t you think Darfur is repetition ?
zh: 你难道不认为达尔富尔是重复吗?

en: I think Darfur is , again , the last , or among the last battles between old and new .
zh: 我认为达尔富尔是最后一次,还是旧与新之间的最后一场战争。

en: What are they fighting for ?
zh: 他们为什麽战斗?

en: What are they killing killing killing over ?
zh: 他们杀了什么,杀了什么,杀了什么?

en: They do n’t carry futures .
zh: 他们不带未来。

en: It belongs to a past .
zh: 它属于过去。

en: It does n’t have a moment .
zh: 它没有时间。

en: I am sure that the reasons for war are over , even though still there are wars which are an inertia from the past , a continuation that does n’t make sense .
zh: 我相信战争的理由已经结束,尽管仍然有战争,这些战争是过去的惯性,是没有意义的延续。

en: I ’m answering your question .
zh: 我正在回答你的问题。

en: The problem is how to enable the whole world to enter the new future , including the Arabs .
zh: 问题在于如何使整个世界,包括阿拉伯人,进入新的未来。

en: And there are already Arabs who did it .
zh: 还有阿拉伯人已经这样做了。

en: Look at Turkey , who is knocking on the doors of the united Europe .
zh: 看看土耳其,它正在敲击统一欧洲的门。

en: It ’s not a geographic endeavor , it is an intellectual endeavor .
zh: 这不是地理上的尝试, 而是一项知识的尝试.

en: They say you can be Muslim and modern .
zh: 他们说你可以成为穆斯林和现代。

en: Wikinews interviews Israeli mathematician and writer Aner Shalev
zh: 以色列数学家和作家Aner Shalev的访谈

en: Aner Shalev is an Israeli mathematician and writer born in 1958 in Kibbutz Kinneret , Tiberias .
zh: 阿纳·沙勒夫(英语:Aner Shalev)是一位以色列数学家和作家,出生于1958年在蒂比里亚斯基布茨基纳雷特。

en: Currently Shalev is a Professor at Hebrew University of Jerusalem 's Einstein Institute of Mathematics .
zh: 目前沙勒夫是耶路撒冷希伯来大学爱因斯坦数学研究所的教授。

en: At the moment Shalev is in Levico Terme , Trento , Italy for a conference .
zh: 目前沙勒夫在意大利特伦托的利维科 Terme 举行会议。

en: He was interviewed by Wikinews .
zh: 他被维基新闻采访。

en: What are you going to talk about here in Levico ?
zh: 你打算在这利维科谈些什么?

en: I called it Character , walks and words .
zh: 我把它叫做“性格”,“走路”和“言语”。

en: There is a whole topic which is called asymptotic groups theory .
zh: 有一种叫做渐近群论的主题。

en: There are groups which express the symmetry of some structures .
zh: 有群表示某些结构的对称性。

en: Studying groups is a bit like studying symmetry .
zh: 研究群体有点像研究对称性。

en: It 's very beautiful I think .
zh: 我觉得很漂亮。

en: And then when you do it in an asymptotic way is like you do n't look at the small details .
zh: 然后,当你以无症状的方式做这件事时,就好像你没有看那些细微的细节。

en: It 's like from the sky .
zh: 就像从天空中来的。

en: You look at the general patterns .
zh: 你看看一般的模式。

en: And there is another topic which is very important in mathematics which is called representation theory .
zh: 还有另一个在数学中非常重要的主题,叫做表示理论。

en: So I will mainly talk about how to use a representation theory to solve all kind of problems and conjectures in asymptotic groups theory .
zh: 因此,我主要讨论如何使用表示理论来解决无症状群理论中的各种问题和假设。

en: Why did you choose to study mathematics ?
zh: 你为什么选择学习数学?

en: I also like the freedom in mathematics .
zh: 我也喜欢数学的自由。

en: If you study physics or chemistry then you should describe the real world .
zh: 如果你学习物理或化学,那么你应该描述现实世界。

en: But in mathematics you can build your own structures .
zh: 但在数学中,你可以自己建构结构。

en: You can walk in worlds created by the imagination of people .
zh: 你可以在人们想象中创造的世界里散步。

en: You 're not committed to the real world .
zh: 你对现实世界没有承诺。

en: It 's almost like God to some extent .
zh: 它几乎有点像上帝。

en: You can create worlds , you can study them .
zh: 你可以创造世界,你可以研究它们。

en: I think it 's a combination of the beauty , of the imagination , of the freedom .
zh: 我认为这是美、想象力、自由的结合。

en: Why do you think it is so ?
zh: 你为什么这么认为?

en: You have to have very good teachers in mathematics if you really want to enjoy and to succeed in it .
zh: 如果你真的想享受和成功的话,就必须有很好的数学老师。

en: Probably some people mainly think about the scientific part of it – you have to be accurate - and they see less these elements of the freedom , and the imagination , and creation .
zh: 也许一些人主要考虑它的科学部分 — — 你必须精确 — — 他们看到这些自由、想象力、创造力要素的减少。

en: Maybe they do n't like the precise nature of mathematics .
zh: 也许他们不喜欢数学的精确性质。

en: Also when I talk mathematics I notice the language is very important in mathematics and I actually notice that many times people fail in mathematics because they do n't know how to write a composition .
zh: 而且,当我讲数学的时候,我注意到语言在数学中非常重要,而且我确实注意到许多人在数学上失败,因为他们不知道如何写一篇作品。

en: They have ideas but they can not formulate them in the right way .
zh: 他们有想法,但不能正确地制定。

en: Actually I find many connections between mathematics and literature because almost all the thing I told about mathematics are also seen in literature and in writing because when you write you can describe the real world , but you can also create worlds of fiction .
zh: 事实上,我发现数学与文学之间有许多联系,因为几乎所有我所说的数学都是在文学和写作中被发现的,因为当你写的时候,你可以描述真实世界,但是你也可以创造虚构世界。

en: So you have imagination , you have total freedom , you can invent characters , you can invent all kind of development and surprises and this kind of end of story or another .
zh: 所以你有想象力,你有完全的自由,你可以创造出人物,你可以创造出各种发展和惊喜,还有这种故事的结局等等。

en: So in a way people often do n't know how to combine the two fields .
zh: 因此,人们往往不知道如何将这两个领域结合起来。

en: It could look like almost the opposite : literature is kind of arts and mathematics is science but they also see a lot in common and there where mathematician who were writers .
zh: 它看起来几乎是相反的:文学是艺术的,数学是科学的,但是他们也看到了许多共同之处,那里的数学家是作家。

en: For example the most famous is Lewis Carrol , author of Alice in Wonderland .
zh: 例如,最著名的是路易斯·卡罗尔(Lewis Carrol),《爱丽丝在奇境》的作者。

en: You also wrote two collections of short stories and a novel .
zh: 你还写了两个短篇小说和一本小说。

en: Why did you begin to write ?
zh: 你为什么开始写?

en: When I was quite young I was interested in psychoanalysis and in dreams .
zh: 当我年轻的时候,我对心理分析和梦想感兴趣。

en: I was trying to interpret my dreams .
zh: 我在想解释我的梦。

en: I started to write down my dreams .
zh: 我开始写下我的梦想。

en: And then I noticed that I cheat a little bit when I write them down .
zh: 然后我注意到,当我写下来的时候,我有点欺骗。

en: Sometimes I make them more pretty then they were actually .
zh: 有时候我比他们更漂亮。

en: So instead of documenting the dreams it gradually became also like adding creational elements , and I think that somehow through writing my dreams I gradually came to writing , also poems , but mainly stories .
zh: 因此,而不是记录梦想,它逐渐变得像添加创造元素一样,我想通过写我的梦想,我逐渐开始写诗,但主要是故事。

en: I 'm a little bit inspired by dreams but when eventually I started to write more seriously I was more interested in structure which also .. a bit like mathematics in a way .. for example my first book is called Opus 1 .. a collection of four long stories with musical structures .
zh: 我有点受到梦想的启发,但当我开始更认真地写的时候,我更感兴趣的结构也..有点像数学的方式..例如我的第一本书叫做Opus1..一个由四个长篇故事组成的音乐结构的集合。

en: The first part is called Legato and the second part was called Staccato .
zh: 第一部分叫做 Legato,第二部分叫做Staccato。

en: In the staccato part it 's like a music : a lot of break , very very short sentences .
zh: 在斯塔卡托部分,它就像音乐:大量的休息,非常非常短的句子。

en: It was a bit experimenting connections between the language and the music and the psychology of people .
zh: 它对语言和音乐以及人们心理之间的联系进行了一些实验。

en: In the second book I made another experiment .
zh: 在第二本书里,我做了另一个实验。

en: It 's a book of opening , Overtures I called it , and there is no end to the stories .
zh: 这是一本开头书,我把它叫做《启示录》,故事没有结束。

en: There are seventy beginning of stories without ends .
zh: 有七十个故事的开头没有结束。

en: In the novel Dark Matters I think what interested me in the structure was two thing : simple narrative and email .
zh: 在小说《黑暗问题》(Dark Matters)中,我认为我对结构感兴趣的是两个东西:简单的叙事和电子邮件。

en: It keeps changing between narrative and email .
zh: 叙事与电子邮件之间不断变化。

en: Another thing was two different time scapes : one goes very slow and one goes very fast and they almost kind of meet in the end .
zh: 另一件事是两个不同的时间景象:一个非常慢,另一个非常快,它们几乎在最后相遇。

en: It 's a little bit like Achilles and the turtle .
zh: 有点像阿希尔斯和乌龟。

en: ... love story and romance and surprises and tragedies and all this but also this structure interested me a lot .
zh: ...爱情故事和浪漫和惊喜和悲剧以及所有这些,而且这个结构也使我非常感兴趣。

en: Why did you choose this particular structure ?
zh: 你为什么选择这个特殊的结构?

en: When I tell stories I do n't like that everything will be clear from the beginning .
zh: 当我讲故事时,我不喜欢从一开始就一切都清楚。

en: I like that something will be a bit of secret , or even unreliable narrator : someone tells something and first you trust him but then you read more and you become thrilled by everything .
zh: 我喜欢那东西会有点秘密,甚至不可靠的叙述者:某人说某事,你先相信他,然后你读得更多,然后你对一切都感到兴奋。

en: I think by using emails on the one hand which are more the voice of the woman Eva and narrative which is more the perspective of the man Adam , I kind of confront them , their different perspective and then kind somehow you can see the distortions in the way the story is told .
zh: 我认为通过使用电子邮件,一方面是更多的女性艾娃的声音,另一方面是更多的男人亚当的视角的叙述,我有点面对他们,他们不同的视角,然后你从某种程度上可以看到故事叙述的方式的扭曲。

en: I think that in this kind of structure there is a very gradual clarification of the relationship and the forth going on .
zh: 我认为,在这种结构中,对关系和未来进行的逐步澄清。

en: Stardust is a NASA space capsule that collected samples from comet 81P/Wild  in deep space and landed back on Earth on January 15 , 2006 .
zh: 星尘是一个NASA太空舱,从深层空间中收集了81P/Wild彗星的样品,并于2006年1月15日返回地球。

en: The project is called Stardust @ home .
zh: 这个项目叫做Stardust @ home 。

en: Unlike distributed computing projects like SETI @ home , Stardust @ home relies entirely on human intelligence .
zh: 与SETI @ home等分布式计算项目不同,Stardust @ home完全依赖于人类的智力。

en: Andrew Westphal is the director of Stardust @ home .
zh: 安德鲁·韦斯特法尔(Andrew Westphal)是Stardust @ home的董事。

en: Wikinews interviewed him for May 's Interview of the Month  on May 18 , 2006 .
zh: 维基新闻于2006年5月18日采访他。

en: As always , the interview was conducted on IRC , with multiple people asking questions .
zh: 与以往一样,这次采访是通过IRC进行的,有许多人问问题。

en: Some may not know exactly what Stardust or Stardust @ home is .
zh: 有些人可能不知道 exactly what Stardust or Stardust @ home 是。

en: The primary science goal of the mission was to collect a sample from a known primitive solar - system body , a comet called Wild 2  .
zh: 该任务的主要科学目标是从一个已知的原始太阳系体,一个叫做“野生2”的彗星收集样品。

en: This gives a little context .
zh: 这给人了一个小小的背景。

en: I should have said above that this is the first " solid " sample return mission —
zh: 我应该上面说过,这是第一个“ 固体 ” 样品返回任务 —

en: Genesis brought back a sample from the Sun almost two years ago , but Stardust is also bringing back the first solid samples from the local interstellar medium —
zh: 《创世记》几乎两年前从太阳中提取了一个样本,但《星尘》还从当地的星际介质中提取了第一个固体样本 —

en: This is absolutely unprecedented , and we 're obviously incredibly excited .
zh: 这绝对是前所未有的,我们显然非常兴奋。

en: I should mention parenthetically that there is a fantastic launch video — taken from the POV of the rocket on the JPL Stardust website — highly recommended — best I 've ever seen — all the way from the launch pad , too .
zh: 我应该用括号来指出,有一个很棒的发射视频 — — 从JPL星尘网站上的火箭的 POV — — 非常推荐 — — 是我见过最好的 — — 从发射台的整个方向, 也。

en: Is the video available to the public ?
zh: 这个视频是供公众看吗?

en: OK , I digress .
zh: 好吧,我退缩了。

en: The first challenge that we have before can do any kind of analysis of these interstellar dust particles is simply to find them .
zh: 我们以前面临的第一个挑战是能够对这些星际尘粒进行任何分析,就是简单地找到它们。

en: This is a big challenge because they are very small  and are somewhere  on a HUGE collector — at least on the scale of the particle size — about a tenth of a square meter .
zh: 这是一个巨大的挑战,因为它们非常小,并且在某个巨大的收集器上 — — 至少在粒子大小的尺度上 — — 大约是平方米的十分之一。

en: We 're right now using an automated microscope that we developed several years ago for nuclear astrophysics work to scan the collector in the Cosmic Dust Lab in Building 31 at Johnson Space Center .
zh: 我们现在使用了我们几年前开发的自动显微镜,用于核天体物理工作,在约翰逊空间中心31号大楼的宇宙尘埃实验室扫描收集器。

en: The microscope collects stacks of digital images of the aerogel collectors in the array .
zh: 该显微镜收集在阵列中的气凝胶收集器的数码图像。

en: These images are sent to us — we compress them and convert them into a format appropriate for Stardust @ home .
zh: 这些图像被发送给我们 — 我们压缩它们并将其转换成适合Stardust @ home的格式。

en: Stardust @ home is a highly distributed project using a " Virtual Microscope " that is written in html and javascript and runs on most browsers — no downloads are required .
zh: Stardust @ home是一个高度分布的项目,使用一个"虚拟显微镜 ",它在html和JavaScript中写,并且运行在大多数浏览器 — 不需要下载。

en: Using the Virtual Microscope volunteers can search over the collector for the tracks of the interstellar dust particles .
zh: 利用虚拟显微镜,志愿者可以通过收集器搜索星际尘粒的轨迹。

en: How many samples do you anticipate being found during the course of the project ?
zh: 你预计在项目过程中能找到多少样品?

en: The short answer is that we do n't know .
zh: 简言之,我们不知道。

en: The Galileo and Ulysses spacecraft carried dust detectors onboard that Eberhard Gruen and his colleagues used to first detect and them measure the flux of interstellar dust particles streaming into the solar system .
zh: 伽利略号和尤利西斯号的太空船载有埃尘探测器,埃伯哈德·格鲁恩和他的同事首先使用这些探测器来测量星际尘粒流入太阳系的流动。

en: Markus Landgraf has estimated the number of interstellar dust particles that should have been captured by Stardust during two periods of the " cruise " phase of the interplanetary orbit in which the spacecraft was moving with this wind .
zh: 马库斯·兰德格拉夫(Markus Landgraf)估算了星际尘埃粒子的数量,该粒子应该在星际轨道的“巡航 ” 阶段的两个时期被星际尘埃捕获。

en: He estimated that there should be around 45 particles , but this number is very uncertain — I would n't be surprised if it is quite different from that .
zh: 他估计应该有大约45个粒子,但这个数目非常不确定 — 如果它与那完全不同,我就不会感到惊讶。

en: One thing that I should say ... is that like all research , the outcome of what we are doing is highly uncertain .
zh: 我要说的一件事是...就像所有的研究一样,我们所做的结果非常不确定。

en: There is a wonderful quote attributed to Einstein — " If we knew what we were doing , it would n't be called " research " , would it ? "
zh: 爱因斯坦有一个很好的引言 — “ 如果我们知道我们正在做什么, 就不会称之为 “ 研究 ”, 是 吗? ”

en: We expect that the particles will be of order a micron in size .
zh: 我们预计粒子大小为一微米。

en: When people are searching using the virtual microscope , they will be looking not for the particles , but for the tracks that the particles make , which are much larger — several microns in diameter .
zh: 当人们使用虚拟显微镜搜索时,他们将不寻找粒子,而是寻找粒子制造的轨迹,这些轨迹是更大的 — 直径为几微米。

en: Just yesterday we switched over to a new site which has a demo of the VM  I invite you to check it out .
zh: 就在昨天我们转到一个新的网站,它有一个VM的示例我请您检查它。

en: The tracks in the demo are from submicron carbonyl iron particles that were shot into aerogel using a particle accelerator modified to accelerate dust particles to very high speeds , to simulate the interstellar dust impacts that we 're looking for .
zh: 演示中的轨迹来自亚微粒子碳基铁粒子,用粒子加速器加速尘埃粒子到非常高速,模拟我们正在寻找的星际尘埃撞击。

en: We are back from Europe , having been to London then to Mallorca and back to London .
zh: 我们从欧洲回来了,曾经去过伦敦,然后去马可拉和回到伦敦。

en: It was hot , as you yourself will know from your stay in Switzerland and the newspapers -- London was sweltering and the parks are not green , probably for the first time in two hundred years .
zh: 天气很热,正如你自己从瑞士和报纸上所知道的那样,伦敦很潮湿,公园没有绿色,这可能是两年来第一次。

en: Martha greatly enjoyed our stay in Mallorca at the villa of our friend Vane Ivanovic .
zh: 玛莎对我们的朋友范伊万诺维奇(Vane Ivanovic)的别墅在马可拉的逗留非常愉快。

en: Luncheons and dinners were crowded with guests , but in the evenings she played bridge constantly and gossiped with our hostess .
zh: 午餐和晚餐都挤满了客人,但晚上她不停地打桥牌,和我们的女主人闲聊。

en: Vane himself presented me with five hundred pages of his memoirs when I arrived and , between sleeping and talking , I cut and edited the work : I am on holiday the inveterate and proverbial busman .
zh: 范本人向我展示了五百页的回忆录,当我到达时,在睡觉和谈话之间,我剪切和编辑了这幅作品:我正在度假,这位老实老实的公共汽车司机。

en: I wrote only about 2000 words on my novel , but I 've finished now five chapters .
zh: 我只写了大约2000字的小说,但我已经完成了五章。

en: At Vane 's villa I met the Prince of Spain , Alphonso , who is the son of King Alphonso 's deaf and mute son  .
zh: 在瓦恩的别墅里,我遇到了西班牙王子阿尔福索,阿尔福索是阿尔福索国王的聋哑儿子。

en: The Prince is married to Franco 's granddaughter , a marvelously beautiful and seriously educated girl of twenty - six who is quite wasted on this royalist .
zh: 王子与弗朗哥的孙女结婚, 一个二十六岁的非常美丽的和认真受过教育的女孩,她完全被这个王室主义者遗弃了.

en: I thought that in Mallorca I had at least escaped my duties as Regent , but Alphonso asked me about bilingual education for Puerto Ricans and beraded the Americans for suppressing their " fourteen million Latins . "
zh: 我认为在马可拉多我至少逃脱了 Regent 的职责,但Alphonso问我关于波多黎各人双语教育的问题,并指责美国人压制他们“ 14 百万 拉丁人 ” 。

en: He told me that Dean Acheson told him that Harry Truman denied Spain Marshall Plan aid because Truman was a Protestant .
zh: 他告诉我,迪安·阿切森告诉他,哈利·特鲁门否认了西班牙马歇尔计划的援助,因为特鲁门是个新教徒。

en: When I argued that a lot of American felt deeply about the Spanish Civil War , and that the Marshall Plan was devised to help countries ravaged by the war , whereas Spain did not fight , he replied that this was a superficial answer .
zh: 当我辩论说许多美国人对西班牙内战深感悲伤,马歇尔计划是为帮助被战争摧毁的国家而设计的,而西班牙没有战斗时,他回答说这是表面的答案。

en: Is n't it marvelous how wars , even when they are not fought , are found to betray everyone ?
zh: 即使战争没有进行, 却发现战争竟背叛了所有人, 难道不是太妙 吗?

en: It is a quiet summer in New York , especially as there is n't such news except that of the city 's financial troubles .
zh: 这是纽约的一个平静的夏天,尤其因为除了纽约金融危机之外,没有这样的新闻。

en: Odd , though , that there is none of the hectic spending and living here that seems to obtain amongst moneyed people and even the middle classes in London , where I was amazed to discover that the shops are full and places of entertainment are crowed .
zh: 然而,奇怪的是,这里没有任何奢侈的消费和生活,这似乎在伦敦的有钱人甚至中产阶级中得到的,在那里我惊奇地发现商店都满了,娱乐的场所也挤满了。

en: I do n't know what to make of it -- the idea that it shows the last days of Rome does n't quite strike me as right .
zh: 我不知道该怎么说--它显示罗马的最后几天的想法对我来说并不完全是正确的。

en: The pound will surely fall to $ 2.00 -- I 've already started to discount our assets in London , although the operating revenues and profits there on our scientific books and journals are holding up quite apart from inflation in prices .
zh: 英镑肯定会下跌到2.00美元 -- 我已经开始在伦敦的资产减价了,尽管在我们的科学书籍和期刊上的营业收入和利润与价格的通货膨胀完全不同。

en: What 's happening in New York will happen in some other cities around the world , I am convinced : Milan or Rome , Paris , Jakarta , and so forth .
zh: 我确信,纽约发生的事情将发生在世界各地的其他城市:米兰、罗马、巴黎、雅加达等。

en: We miss you , Hannah , but we know that you must be getting some real rest .
zh: 我们想念你,汉娜,但我们知道你一定得到真正的休息。

en: Will you go to Israel at the end of your stay ?
zh: 到旅馆结束时你会去以色列 吗?

en: What are the dates of Aberdeen ?
zh: 阿伯丁的日期是什么?

en: Is there anything you need ?
zh: 你需要什么吗?

en: I 've seen the doctor twice since I 've been back , and he 's convinced that I just missed an " episode , " which means that I suffered what is always called , rather badly I think , a " coronary insufficiency . "
zh: 自从我回来以来,我曾两次去看医生,他确信我刚刚错过了一次“病例”,这意味着我遭受了所谓的“冠状动脉衰竭 ” 。

en: I feel quite well now and I am watching myself .
zh: 我现在感觉很好,我正在看着自己。

en: I lost twelve pounds .
zh: 我减肥了十二磅。

en: I 've promised Dr. Steiner that I will not travel at all , and on humid days I stay at home and work and read .
zh: 我答应了史蒂纳医生,我决不会旅行,湿天我呆在家里,工作,读书。

en: I 'm rereading Johnson 's Lives of The Poets , a splendid work that proves that the best criticism is based on sensibility to art and prejudice to behavior .
zh: 我正在重新读约翰逊的《诗人的生活》,这部杰出的作品证明最好的批评是基于对艺术的敏感性和对行为的偏见。

en: Mary is working away on her novel .
zh: 玛丽正在写她的小说。

en: I 've been in touch with her briefly -- of course I saw her when she arrived in New York -- about reissuing Stones of Florence .
zh: 我曾和她短暂联系过--当然在她抵达纽约时,我见过她--关于重新发行佛罗伦萨的石头。

en: I am publishing the Chiaramonte book in the Spring .
zh: 我正在春天出版卡拉蒙特书。

en: Mary has provided a preface .
zh: 玛丽提供了序言。

en: I look forward to going over manuscript with you when you return .
zh: 我期待着你回来时和你一起复习手稿。

en: We were , as you will recall , interrupted when we were working at Aberdeen .
zh: 正如你所记得的,我们在阿伯丁工作时被打断了。

en: Hannah , Martha and I send you love and greetings and we hope that the summer ends with lazy leisurely days for you .
zh: 汉娜,玛莎和我一起给你送爱和问候,我们希望夏天能为你带来懒散的日子。

en: We shall be seeing you soon .
zh: 我们很快就会见你。

en: This has been a sad time in my life , and in the lives of all of us .
zh: 这是我一生中最悲伤的时刻,也是我们每个人一生中最悲伤的时刻。

en: We have lost much -- too much , really , to list .
zh: 我们已经损失了太多——太多了,实在是太多了。

en: The task that lies ahead -- to put Rapid City and the area back together -- will not be done for years .
zh: 接下来的任务 — — 把快速城和地区重新统一起来 — — 将不会在几年内完成。

en: But it must be done .
zh: 但必须做到。

en: I think of the letter from a lady which said , " It is only as the days pass that we are beginning to realize what we have lost .
zh: 我想起一位女士的信,她写道:“随着时间的推移,我们才开始意识到我们已经失去的。

en: Estimates to make our home livable range around $ 10,000 , and this does not include such items as furniture , antiques , and loving work we have done steadily since buying the house .
zh: 估计我们的住宅可居住范围为$10,000左右,这并不包括家具、古董和我们从购买房子以来一直做的爱好工作。

en: Also , we still have approximately $ 17,100 left on our mortgage .
zh: 此外,我们还剩余约17100美元的抵押贷款。

en: For a family as young as ours , this is an overwhelming situation . "
zh: 对于我们这个年轻的家庭来说, 这是一个压倒性的局面. ”

en: Unfortunately , the present Disaster Relief Act does not do the job for private homeowners and businessmen who saw their property destroyed by the flood .
zh: 不幸的是,目前的《救灾法》对那些被洪水摧毁财产的私家业主和商人没有作用。

en: For those facing this situation all the present law offers is a loan at 5 1/8 % interest to try to rebuild .
zh: 对面临这种状况的人来说,现行法律所提供的贷款是以5/8 % 的利息来尝试重建。

en: The best way , and I believe the fairest way , to help families and businesses who lost everything in the flood is to give them flat cash grants to rebuild .
zh: 我认为最公平的方式,帮助那些在洪水中失去一切的家庭和企业,是给予他们平整的现金补贴来重建。

en: I investigated this possibility carefully and found the unanimous feeling that legislation to give flat cash grants could never pass the Congress .
zh: 我仔细地研究了这一可能性,并发现一致意见认为给予现金补助的立法决不能通过国会。

en: I could have introduced a bill to provide grants even though it could not have passed , but I feel very strongly that to have done this would have simply raised false hopes where real help is what is needed .
zh: 我本来可以提出一项拨款法案,虽然不能通过,但我深信这样做会引起错误的希望,因为真正的帮助是需要的。

en: For this reason I decided to introduce legislation that would lower interest rates on rebuilding loans and provide that a major portion of these loans would not have to be repaid .
zh: 为此,我决定通过立法,降低重建贷款的利率,并规定这些贷款的大部分不必偿还。

en: Very frankly , winning passage of the entire package of flood relief bills I have sponsored will be an extremely difficult task .
zh: 坦率地说,我所赞助的整套洪灾救济法案的通过将是一个非常困难的任务。

en: On the other hand , when these bills were introduced most Congressmen felt that no new legislation could be passed .
zh: 另一方面,当这些法案被引入时,大多数国会议员都觉得没有新的立法可以通过。

en: As of today , the House has passed one of my bills , and prospects for at least some helpful new legislation are good .
zh: 到今天为止,众议院已经通过了我的一项法案,而且至少有一些有帮助的新立法的前景是好的。

en: Because it is important that people affected by the flood disaster know exactly what new laws have been proposed , how these would affect them , and what the chances for getting these new laws really is , I would like to give you a hard , realistic appraisal of what we are trying to do , and how likely it is that we will succeed .
zh: 因为重要的是受洪灾影响的人们知道已经提议的新法律是什么,这些法律将如何影响他们,这些新法律获得的机会是什么,我想给你一个硬的、现实的评估我们正在努力做的事,以及我们成功的可能性。

en: SBA loans are presently available to businessmen and homeowners affected by the flood .
zh: SBA贷款现已向受洪灾影响的商人和房主提供。

en: They are given at 5 1/8 % interest .
zh: 他们按5/8 % 的利息支付。

en: The person making the loan must repay all but $ 2,500 of the loan and pay the 5 1/8 % interest rate as well .
zh: 贷款人必须偿还贷款的全部款项,除2,500美元外,还必须偿还5 1/8 % 的利息。

en: I introduced a bill to lower the interest rate on these loans to 1 % .
zh: 我提出了降低这些贷款利率到1%的法案。

en: The House Committee rewrote my bill to provide for 3 % interest if the person repays the full loan , or 1 % interest if he chooses to not repay $ 2,500 of the loan .
zh: 众议院委员会重新编写了我的法案,规定如果人偿还全部贷款的利息为3%,或者如果他选择不偿还贷款的2,500美元的利息为1%。

en: The bill then passed the House in this slightly weakened form .
zh: 然后,该法案以这种略微削弱的形式通过了众议院。

en: The bill would be retroactive to before the flood and would permit people who have made SBA loans at 5 1/8 % interest to renegotiate those loans at the new lower interest rate .
zh: 该法案将追溯到洪灾前,并允许那些以5/8 % 利率贷款的银行贷款人以新的较低利率重新谈判这些贷款。

en: The chances that the Senate will pass this bill this summer are good .
zh: 参议院今年夏天将通过这项法案的机会很好。

en: Disaster loans must presently be fully repaid except for $ 2,500 which is forgiven .
zh: 灾害贷款目前必须全部偿还,除原谅2,500美元外。

en: Thus , if you take a $ 20,000 loan to rebuild , you must repay $ 17,500 of that loan .
zh: 因此,如果你要借20万美元重建,你必须偿还该贷款的17500美元。

en: I have introduced a bill which would forgive 90 % of the amount of any disaster loan .
zh: 我提出了一项法案,该法案将宽恕任何灾难贷款的百分之九十。

en: Thus , if this bill passes , a person making a $ 20,000 loan to rebuild would have to repay only $2,000 of that amount .
zh: 因此,如果这个法案通过, 一个人借20万美元重建会只得偿还2000美元的款项。

en: Again , the provisions of this bill , if it passes , will be available to people who have made loans under the present law .
zh: 再次,这项法案的条款,如果通过,将向根据现行法律发放贷款的人士提供。

en: It would provide loans on such generous terms that nearly everyone could afford to rebuild .
zh: 它将以如此慷慨的条件提供贷款,几乎每个人都能够负担重建。

en: The House Public Works Subcommittee will open hearings on this bill in July .
zh: 众议院公共工程小组委员会将于7月开始就该法案进行听证。

en: I am hopeful that some legislation increasing the amount of a disaster loan which will not have to be repaid  can pass .
zh: 我希望能够通过一些增加无需偿还的灾难贷款金额的立法。

en: But I would rate the chances of passing my 90 % forgiveness bill as poor .
zh: 但是,我将把通过我的90%的宽恕法案的几率评为很差。

en: The chances of passing some increases in the amount to be forgiven on a loan are probably fair to good .
zh: 通过某些增加贷款被宽恕金额的几率很可能是公平的到好的。

en: Under the present law all public facilities except recreation areas will be restored by the Federal Government .
zh: 根据本法,除康乐区外,所有公共设施均由联邦政府修复。

en: I feel that recreation facilities , which are vital to our tourist oriented economy , should also be restored with Federal help .
zh: 我认为,对旅游经济至关重要的康乐设施也应该得到联邦的帮助。

en: I have introduced a bill that would permit this restoration .
zh: 我已提出一项法案,将允许这项修复。

en: I would rate chances for its passage as fair to good .
zh: 我将评判其通过的几率为公平至好。

en: This , then , is the most realistic assessment I can give of my legislative efforts to help .
zh: 因此,这是我能给出的最现实的评估我的立法努力帮助。

en: I wish I could be more optimistic , but , in fairness , I can not .
zh: 我希望我能更加乐观,但公平地说,我不能。

en: All I can promise is that I will push just as hard as I know how for new laws to help in every way possible .
zh: 我所能保证的只是,我会尽我所能努力为新的法律提供一切可能的帮助。

en: One way you might help me is to look over the laws I have proposed and write me explaining in detail how they would help you or people you know .
zh: 你可以帮我看看我提出的法律,然后给我写信,详细说明它们会如何帮助你或你认识的人。

en: We need specific examples of what these laws would mean to the people of Rapid City .
zh: 我们需要具体例子说明这些法律对快速城的居民意味着什么。

en: These examples will be our best argument when we go before the Committees and the Congress .
zh: 在委员会和国会面前,这些例子将是我们最好的论点。

en: In return for your help I would like to remind you that my job , and that of my office , is to help .
zh: 为了回报你的帮助,我谨提醒你,我的工作和我的办公室的工作是帮助。

en: Many of you have already written describing problems you are having with Federal agencies as a result of the flood .
zh: 你们中的许多人已经写了文章,描述了由于洪水而与联邦机构发生的问题。

en: I can not urge you too strongly to let me know whenever you feel there is anything at all I might do to assist .
zh: 我不能强烈地敦促你告诉我,当你觉得我能帮助你有什么事情时。

en: You can reach me at : 508 Cannon Office Building , Washington , D.C. 20515 .
zh: 你可以致电我: 508 Cannon Office Building, Washington, D.C. 20515 。

en: The things we build -- homes , businesses , communities -- can be destroyed , true , but the human spirit is indomitable .
zh: 我们所建造的东西--房子,生意,社区--可以被摧毁,是的,但人类的精神是不可磨灭的。

en: The people hit by this flood have shown that spirit , and shown it high and wide .
zh: 受这场洪水影响的人们已经显示出这种精神,并显示出它高而广阔。

en: The movement of the Soviet Union to a market economy will greatly enhance the prosperity of your citizens .
zh: 苏联走向市场经济将极大地提高你们公民的繁荣。

en: Your economists have learned much from the experience of nations with economies based in varying degrees on free markets .
zh: 你们的经济学家从各国以自由市场为基础的经济经验中学到了很多。

en: Your plans for freely convertible currency , free trade , and enterprises undertaken and managed by individuals who receive the profit or bear the losses that result from their decisions are all highly commendable .
zh: 你的自由兑换货币计划、自由贸易计划和由个人获得利润或承受其决定造成的损失的企业计划都是值得赞扬的。

en: But there is a danger that you will adopt features of our economies that keep us from being as prosperous as we might be .
zh: 但有危险的是,你们会采用我们经济的特征,使我们不能像我们那样繁荣。

en: It is important that the rent of land be retained as a source of government revenue .
zh: 土地租金作为政府收入的来源,是重要的。

en: While the governments of developed nations with market economies collect some of the rent of land in taxes , they do not collect nearly as much as they could , and they therefore make unnecessarily great use of taxes that impede their economies -- taxes on such things as incomes , sales and the value of capital .
zh: 市场经济发达国家的政府在税收上征收土地租金的一部分,但它们却没能征收得那么多,因此他们不必要地大量使用阻碍其经济的税收——诸如收入、销售和资本价值的税收。

en: Social collection of the rent of land and natural resources serves three purposes .
zh: 土地和自然资源租金的社会征收有三个目的。

en: First , it guarantees that no one dispossesses fellow citizens by obtaining a disproportionate share of what nature provides for humanity .
zh: 首先,它保证没有人通过获得自然为人类提供的不相称的份额来剥夺同胞。

en: Second , it provides revenue with which governments can pay for socially valuable activities without discouraging capital formation or work effort , or interfering in other ways with the efficient allocation of resources .
zh: 第二,它提供了政府支付社会价值活动的收入,而不阻碍资本形成或工作努力,或以其他方式干涉资源的有效分配。

en: Third , the resulting revenue permits utility and other services that have marked economies of scale or density to be priced at levels conducive to their efficient use .
zh: 第三,所得收入允许有显著规模或密度效益的公用事业和其他服务以有利于其有效利用的水平定价。

en: The rental value of land arises from three sources .
zh: 土地的租金价值来自三个来源。

en: The first is the inherent natural productivity of land , combined with the fact that land is limited .
zh: 首先是土地的自然生产力,加上土地的有限性。

en: The second source of land value is the growth of communities ; the third is the provision of public services .
zh: 土地价值的第二个来源是社区的增长;第三个来源是公共服务的提供。

en: All citizens have equal claims on the component of land value that arises from nature .
zh: 所有公民都有对自然产生的土地价值组成部分的平等权利。

en: These services include roads , urban transit networks , parks , and public utility networks for such services as electricity , telephones , water and sewers .
zh: 这些服务包括公路、城市交通网、公园和公共服务网,供电、电话、水和污水等服务。

en: A public revenue system should strive to collect as much of the rent of land as possible , allocating the part of rent derived from nature to all citizens equally , and the part derived from public services to the governmental units that provide those services .
zh: 公共收入制度应尽力征集土地租金的尽可能多,把自然资源的租金部分分配给所有公民,公共服务的租金部分分配给提供这些服务的政府部门。

en: When governments collect the increase in land value that results from the provision of services , they are able to offer services at prices that represent the marginal social cost of these services , promoting efficient use of the services and enhancing the rental value of the land where the services are available .
zh: 当政府收集服务提供所带来的土地价值的增加时,它们可以提供服务以代表这些服务的边际社会成本的价格,促进服务的有效利用和提高提供服务的土地的租金价值。

en: Government agencies that use land should be charged the same rentals as others for the land they use , or services will not be adequately financed and agencies will not have adequate incentive or guidance for economizing on their use of land .
zh: 使用土地的政府机构应按使用土地的其他机构收取相同的租金,否则服务将不得到充分的资助,政府机构将没有足够的鼓励或指导以节约使用土地。

en: Some economists might be tempted to suggest that the rent can be collected publicly simply by selling land outright at auction .
zh: 一些经济学家可能被诱惑说,租税可以通过直接在拍卖中出售土地来公开征集。

en: There are a number of reasons why this is not a good idea .
zh: 这不是一个好主意的原因有很多。

en: First , there is so much land to be turned over to private management that any effort to dispose of all of it in a short period would result in an extreme depression in prices offered .
zh: 首先,有太多的土地要转交给私人管理部门,因此任何试图在短期内把所有土地处置都会导致价格极度下降。

en: Second , some persons who could make excellent use of land would be unable to raise money for the purchase price .
zh: 其次,那些能很好地利用土地的人无法为购买价格筹集资金。

en: Collecting rent annually provides access to land for persons with limited access to credit .
zh: 每年征收租金,让有限制信贷的人士获得土地。

en: Third , subsequent resale of land would enable speculators to make large profits unrelated to any productive services they offer , resulting in needless inequity and dissatisfaction .
zh: 第三,随后的土地再出售将使投机者获得与他们提供的一切生产性服务无关的大利润,从而造成不必要的不平等和不满。

en: Fourth , concern about future political conditions would tend to depress offers .
zh: 第四, 对未来政治状况的担忧将倾向于降低 offers 。

en: Collecting rent annually permits the citizens of future years to capture the benefits of good future public policies .
zh: 每年征收租金,可以让未来几年的公民抓住良好未来公共政策的好处。

en: Fifth , because investors tend to be averse to risk , general uncertainty about the future will tend to depress offers .
zh: 第五,由于投资者倾向于对风险的厌恶,对未来普遍的不确定性将倾向于降低 offers 。

en: This risk aversion is sidestepped by allowing future rental payments to be determined by future conditions .
zh: 这种风险厌恶被排除在一边,允许未来租金的支付由未来条件决定。

en: Finally , the future rent of land can more justly be claimed by future generations than by today 's citizens .
zh: 最后, 未来代人可以更公正地要求土地的租金,而不是今天的公民.

en: Requiring annual payments from the users of land allows each year 's population to claim that year 's rent .
zh: 要求土地使用者每年缴付的费用,使得每年的人口可以要求该年租金。

en: While the proceeds of sales could be invested for the benefit of future generations , not collecting the money in advance guarantees the heritage of the future against political excesses .
zh: 虽然销售收益可以用于未来代人的利益,但没有提前筹集资金就保证未来遗产不受政治过分的影响。

en: The attached Appendix provides a brief technical discussion of issues of the duration of rights to use land , the transfer of land , the assessment of land , social protection against the abuse and subsequent abandonment of run - down property , and redistribution among localities to adjust for differences in natural per capita endowments .
zh: 附录说明了土地使用权的期限、土地转让、土地评估、社会保护,对土地的滥用和随后的放弃,以及地方间的再分配,以适应人均自然资源的差异。

en: While these issues need to be addressed , none of them present any insoluble problems .
zh: 虽然这些问题需要解决,但没有一个问题是无法解决的。

en: A balance should be kept between allowing the managers of property to retain value derived from their own efforts to maintain and improve property , and securing for public use the naturally inherent and socially created value of land .
zh: 应当在让物业管理人保留其本身为维护和改善物业而作出的努力所产生的价值和确保土地的自然内在和社会创造价值为公众使用之间保持平衡。

en: Users of land should not be allowed to acquire rights of indefinite duration for single payments .
zh: 土地使用者不应被允许取得单一付款的无限期权利。

en: For efficiency , for adequate revenue and for justice , every user of land should be required to make an annual payment to the local government , equal to the current rental value of the land that he or she prevents others from using .
zh: 为了提高效率、获得足够的收入和实现正义,所有土地使用者应向地方政府支付每年的费用,相当于他或她阻止他人使用土地的现时租金价值。

en: In one week 's time , the Verwoerd Government intends to inaugurate its Republic .
zh: 在一周内, 维尔沃德政府打算开办自己的共和国.

en: It is unnecessary to state that this intention has never been endorsed by the non-white majority of this country .
zh: 不必要说这个意图从未得到这个国家的非白人多数的支持。

en: The decision has been taken by little over half of the White community ; it is opposed by every articulate group amongst the African , Coloured and Indian communities , who constitute the majority of this country .
zh: 这一决定被白人社区的一半人所采纳,而非洲、白人和印第安人社区中的每一个有说服力的群体都反对,他们构成了这个国家的多数。

en: The Government 's intentions to proceed , under these circumstances , has created conditions bordering on crisis .
zh: 在这些情况下,政府采取行动的意图创造了与危机相近的条件。

en: We have been excluded from the Commonwealth , and condemned 95 to 1 at the United Nations .
zh: 我们被排除在英联邦之外,被联合国谴责95比1。

en: Our trade is being boycotted , and foreign capital is being withdrawn .
zh: 我们的贸易被抵制,外国资本被撤出。

en: The country is becoming an armed camp , the Government preparing for civil war with increasingly heavy police and military apparatus , the non-white population for a general strike and long - term non-cooperation with the Government .
zh: 这个国家正成为一个武装营地,政府正准备进行内战,警察和军事设备越来越重,非白人民众则准备进行全面罢工,长期不与政府合作。

en: None of us can draw any satisfaction from this developing crisis .
zh: 我们中没有人能从这场不断发展的危机中得到任何满足。

en: We , on our part , in the name of the African people - a majority of South Africans - and on the authority given us by 1 400 elected African representatives at the Pietermaritzburg Conference of 25 and 26 March , have put forward serious proposals for a way out of the crisis .
zh: 我们 代表 非洲 人民 - - 南非 人民 的 多数 - - 以及 在 3月 25日 和 26日 的 皮特马里茨堡 会议 上 1 400 名 当选 非洲 代表 给予 我们 的 权威, 提出 了 解决 危机 的 严肃 建议 。

en: We have called on the Government to convene an elected National Convention of representatives of all races without delay , and to charge that Convention with the task of drawing up a new Constitution for this country which would be acceptable to all racial groups .
zh: 我们呼吁政府立即召开一个由所有种族代表组成的全国代表大会,并责成该大会为该国制订一项能够接受所有种族群体的新宪法的任务。

en: We can see no workable alternative to this proposal , except that the Nationalist Government proceeds to enforce a minority decision on all of us , with the certain consequence of still deeper crisis , and a continuing period of strife and disaster ahead .
zh: 除了民族主义政府继续对我们所有人实施少数派的决定之外,我们无法看到这个建议的可行的替代方案,这会带来更深的危机和持续的争斗和灾难的某些后果。

en: Outside of the Nationalist Party , most of the important and influential bodies of public opinion have clearly decided to talk it out .
zh: 除了民族主义党外,公众舆论的大部分重要和有影响力的机构都明确决定对此进行辩论。

en: The South African Indian Congress , the only substantial Indian community organisation , has welcomed and endorsed the call for a National Convention .
zh: 南非印度议会(South African Indian Congress)是唯一重要的印度社区组织,欢迎并支持召开全国大会的呼吁。

en: So , too have the Coloured people , through the Coloured Convention movement which has the backing of the main bodies of Coloured opinion .
zh: 因此, 也通过有色人权运动,通过有色人权大会运动,得到色人权主要机构的支持.

en: A substantial European body of opinion , represented by both the Progressive and the Liberal Parties , has endorsed our call .
zh: 一个重要的欧洲舆论机构,由进步党和自由党代表,支持我们的呼吁。

en: Support for a National Convention has come also from the bulk of the English language press , from several national church organisations , and from many others .
zh: 对全国大会的支持也来自大部分英语新闻界、几个国家教会组织和许多其他组织。

en: But where , Sir , does the United Party stand ?
