en: The rate of unemployment and idle capacity has been cut , and our economy of the United States will shortly pass the $ 600 billion mark , for a record rise -- for a record rise in 3 years of $ 100 billion -- the largest peacetime rise in the history of the United States .
zh: 失业率和闲置能力已经降低,美国经济将很快超过600亿美元的水平,成为美国历史上最大的和平时期增长。

en: And if we can obtain the early passage of an effective tax cut which the House of Representatives has already passed -- and which the Ways and Means Committee , on which Bill Green serves , wrote -- we shall be sailing this country next year on the longest and strongest peacetime expansion of our economy in the history of the United States .
zh: 如果我们能够早日通过了众议院已经通过的有效减税措施--以及由比尔·格林担任的道路和措施委员会的报告--那么我们明年将航行到美国历史上最长的和最强壮的和平时期扩大我们的经济。

en: It is well within our reach .
zh: 它很接近我们。

en: It gives me great pleasure to be here today as the Chief Guest during the launch of School of Open – Africa .
zh: 今天,我非常高兴地作为开办非洲开放学校的首席嘉宾来到这里。

en: I would like to begin by sincerely thanking Creative Commons Africa community and under the able coordination of Alex Gakuru and Tobias Schonwetter , and the global Creative Commons Community for inviting me to preside over this launch .
zh: 首先,我要衷心感谢非洲的Creative Commons社区,并由Alex Gakuru和Tobias Schonwetter能够协调,以及全球的Creative Commons社区邀请我主持这项启动。

en: I am happy to note the enthusiasm demonstrated by School of Open Africa in transforming education along Sustainable Development Goals proposed for post - 2015  and in line with the Kenya Vision 2030 which seeks to transform Kenya into a middle - income country that offers high quality of life to all citizens by the year 2030 .
zh: 我很高兴地注意到开放非洲学校在2015年后拟议的可持续发展目标和为2030年实现所有公民提供高生活质量的中等收入国家转变教育方面所表现出的热情。

en: I am happy to note how much School of Open Africa has grown in Kenya and embraced in countries like Senegal , Nigeria , and South Africa among other African countries in the last few years .
zh: 我很高兴地注意到在肯尼亚的开放非洲学校在过去几年中在塞内加尔 、 尼日利亚和南非等非洲国家中成长了多少,并接受了多少。

en: I am informed that School of Open by Creative Commons is highly reputed around the world for addressing universal access to education .
zh: 我得知 Creative Commons的开放式学校在全球范围内为解决普遍教育机会而享有很高的声誉。

en: Kenya is a signatory to the UNESCO ’s 2012 Paris Declaration on Open Education Resources licensed under Creative Commons open licenses .
zh: 肯尼亚是联合国教科文组织(UNESCO)2012年巴黎宣言关于开放教育资源的签署国, license under Creative Commons open licenses 。

en: The use of open education resources improves the quality of teaching and learning , including by accelerating student comprehension and by providing more opportunities for the realisation of universal access to education .
zh: 开放教育资源的利用改善了教学和学习的质量,包括通过加速学生理解并提供更多机会实现普遍接受教育的机会。

en: Open Educational Resources  are teaching , learning , and research materials in any medium that reside in the public domain or have been released under an open license that permits their free use and re-purposing by others .
zh: 开放教育资源(Open Educational Resources)是任何在公共领域内或在允许他人自由使用和重新用途的开放许可证下发布的教学、学习和研究材料。

en: Fully aware of the role of education in a country ’s development agenda , I am sure that the new initiatives being undertaken by School of Open Africa , the Creative Commons and UNESCO are making their contribution towards the social , economic , and political pillars which are the three fundamental cornerstones of our country , and indeed for our great continent .
zh: 充分认识到教育在国家发展议程中的作用,我相信开放非洲学校(School of Open Africa)、Creative Commons和教科文组织(UNESCO)所采取的新倡议正在为社会、经济和政治的支柱作出贡献,这些支柱是我国的三个基本的基石,也是我们的伟大大陆的基石。

en: Ladies and gentlemen , as you may be aware , the Country ’s development blue print is being implemented through successive five - year Medium Term Plans  that will finally enable the country to achieve the long - term goals .
zh: 女士们和先生们, 如您所知, 该国的发展蓝图正在通过连续的五年中期计划执行,最终将使该国实现 长期 目标。

en: We are now in the second medium term plan cycle  whose theme is “ Transforming Kenya : Pathways to Devolution , Socio-economic Development , Equity and National Unity ” .
zh: 我们现在处于第二个中期计划周期,其主题是“ 转变肯尼亚 : 走向革命 、 社会经济发展 、 平等和民族团结 ” 。

en: As you may be aware , the ICT Authority rolled out the National ICT Master plan that will set the pace for progression of the country in ICT for the next five years .
zh: 如您所知,资讯及通讯科技署已推出国家资讯及通讯科技总计划,将为今后五年的资讯及通讯科技进步提供依据。

en: The Master plan – once fully rolled out – will completely transform government processes , services and management , and make information access and service delivery more efficient .
zh: 一旦全面实施,总计划将彻底改变政府流程、服务和管理,并使信息访问和服务提供更加有效。

en: Again , the Master plan , with the flagship projects to pilot its implementation , will steer the march towards the digital future that will transform the country to a regional technical hub , raise the country ’s competitiveness and align the country in line with vision 2030 ’s ICT goals .
zh: 再次,《总计划》与其实施的 flagship 项目将引导朝着数字未来迈进,将该国转变为区域技术枢纽,提高该国的竞争力,并使该国符合2030年资讯及通讯科技目标。

en: By launching the Kenya ICT Master Plan , the government revealed its commitment towards the enhancement of access to quality education and training through ICT in line with the Millennium Development Goals  .
zh: 政府通过启动肯尼亚资讯及通讯科技总计划,表明承诺按照千年发展目标,通过资讯及通讯科技促进优质教育和培训的机会。

en: We are reviewing the National ICT Policy Guidelines to ensure alignment with proposed Sustainable Development Goals .
zh: 我们正在审查国家资讯及通讯科技政策准则,以确保与拟议的可持续发展目标相符。

en: As a country , we are also privileged to have a National ICT Policy whose goal is to create a prosperous ICT - driven Kenyan society .
zh: 作为一个国家, 我们还享有一个国家资讯科技政策的特权,其目标是创造一个繁荣的资讯科技驱动的肯尼亚社会。

en: With a well mainstreamed ICT society , we are assured of better livelihoods of Kenyans attainable through the availability of accessible , efficient , reliable and affordable ICT services .
zh: 有了良好的资讯及通讯科技社会,我们能够确保肯尼亚人的生活水平能够提高,因为我们有可利用、高效、可靠和廉价的资讯及通讯科技服务。

en: ICT provides a platform that enables the realization of these goals .
zh: 资讯科技为实现这些目标提供了一个平台。

en: I must emphasize that Creative Commons through the School of Open Africa has provided a good example of innovative use of ICT in education that resonates well with the Kenya National ICT Master Plan .
zh: 我必须强调,通过开放非洲学校的创造性共同体提供了教育中创新利用ICT的良好例子,这与肯尼亚国家ICT总计划有很好的共鸣。

en: The integration of ICT into educational programmes places both the teaching staff and students at the forefront in the utilization of ICT for the enhancement of lives .
zh: 将资讯科技纳入教育方案,使教师和学生在利用资讯科技促进生活方面处于领先地位。

en: I note with great pleasure the freedom to re-purpose offered by openly licensed educational resources , the convenience online access to learners as alternative courses delivery and certification methods .
zh: 我非常高兴地注意到开放许可的教育资源提供的重新用途自由、方便的在线学习者作为替代课程提供和认证方法。

en: At this juncture , ladies and gentlemen , I thank William Fisher III , Professor of Intellectual Property and his staff at the Berkman Centre for Internet and Society at Harvard Law School for providing a free copyright law course taught to graduands present today to receive their certificates .
zh: 在这一时刻,女士们,我感谢哈佛法学院的互联网与社会伯克曼中心教授威廉·费舍尔三世(William Fisher III)及其职员提供免费的著作权法课程。

en: I also thank Michael Murungi  and Alex Gakuru for successfully conducting the course in Nairobi .
zh: 我还要感谢迈克尔·穆伦吉和亚历克斯·加库鲁成功地在内罗毕举办了这个课程。

en: I must congratulate the former students and ask to make the very best use of the copyright law knowledge they acquired while also challenging all universities represented here to consider emulating the highly successfully CopyrightX initiative .
zh: 我必须祝贺前学生,并请他们充分利用他们所获得的著作权法知识,同时要求所有在这里代表的大学考虑仿效《著作权X》倡议。

en: As the government continues to work on modalities of ensuring universal access to education and increasing the internet penetration in all parts of the country , we are pleased to witness this mode of study that will definitely translate to affordable education .
zh: 随着政府继续为确保全民接受教育和提高全国各地的互联网普及工作,我们很高兴地见证了这一模式的研究,它必将转化为可负担得起的教育。

en: Open Education Resources coupled with innovative use of ICT in education will accelerate realization of a modern Kenya that will be a knowledge - based economy .
zh: 开放教育资源与创新利用资讯科技在教育中相结合,将加速实现一个以知识为基础的经济的现代肯尼亚。

en: By using Open Educational Resources , OER , School of Open is opening up to many students who would have otherwise missed the opportunity of accessing education , especially in the marginalized areas which could not adequately access quality education .
zh: 通过使用开放教育资源,开放学校向许多学生开放,否则他们将错过机会获得教育,特别是在那些无法充分获得优质教育的边缘地区。

en: Ongoing , voluntary , and self - motivated pursuit of knowledge for either personal or professional reasons is one of the characteristics of the 21st Century .
zh: 持续 、 自愿 、 自我 动机的个人或专业知识追求是21世纪的特征之一.

en: One of the major ways of promoting life - long learning is the continuous use of ICT innovations in education .
zh: 持续利用资讯科技创新在教育中是促进终身学习的重要途径之一。

en: I congratulate School of Open teams across Africa for the innovative and transformative mode of teaching and learning that we are launching today .
zh: 我祝贺全非洲的开放学校团队为我们今天启动的创新和转变的教学和学习模式。

en: This African initiative is a worthy model for other regions of the world to emulate .
zh: 这项非洲倡议是全世界其他地区值得仿效的榜样。

en: As I conclude I take this opportunity to applaud UNESCO ’s efforts and contribution in the development and growth of the country through this noble initiative that enables the primary , secondary and universities to optimize the use of Information and Communication Technology  in learning .
zh: 最后,我借此机会赞扬教科文组织为国家发展和增长作出的努力和贡献,通过这一崇高倡议,使小学、中学和大学能够优化信息和通信技术在学习中的应用。

en: I acknowledge the generous financial support from the Hewlett Foundation and SOO Africa teams support by Google .
zh: 我感谢惠普基金会和谷歌的SOO非洲团队提供的慷慨的财政支持。

en: With those remarks , it is now my pleasure to declare the School of Open Africa officially opened .
zh: 有了这些评论,现在我很高兴宣布开放非洲学校正式开办。

en: Thank you .
zh: 谢谢你。

en: Thank you .
zh: 谢谢你。

en: Thank you .
zh: 谢谢你。

en: President Joe Biden and I talk often about our mutual passion for everything you all do .
zh: 我和乔·比登总统经常谈论我们对你们所做的一切的共同热情。

en: So , to our President , Joe Biden , thank you for your leadership around all of these issues .
zh: 因此, 向我们的总统, 乔·比登, 感谢你对所有这些问题的领导.

en: Thank you also to our colleagues from across the White House and NASA and everyone else joining us from home .
zh: 我们也感谢来自白宫和NASA的同事以及从家里来的其他人。

en: So , yes , as Chair of the National Space Council , I know that today represents an exciting new chapter in the exploration of our universe .
zh: 因此,是的,作为国家空间理事会主席,我知道今天是探索我们的宇宙的一个令人兴奋的新章节。

en: From the beginning of history , humans have looked up to the night sky with wonder .
zh: 从历史的开始,人类一直带着惊奇地仰望着夜空。

en: And thanks to dedicated people who have been working for decades in engineering and on scientific marvels , we can look to the sky with new understanding .
zh: 感谢多年来在工程和科学奇迹领域工作献身的人们,我们能够以新的理解看待天空。

en: When NASA launched the Hubble Space Telescope in 1990 , we were able to see the stars unobstructed by the Earth ’s atmosphere and understand the universe in ways we could have never imagined even a few decades earlier .
zh: 当NASA于1990年发射哈勃太空望远镜时,我们能够看到没有受到地球大气阻挡的恒星,并理解宇宙的方式,我们甚至几十年前也无法想象的。

en: And now we enter a new phase of scientific discovery .
zh: 现在我们进入了科学发现的新阶段。

en: Building on the legacy of Hubble , the James Webb Space Telescope allows us to see deeper into space than ever before and in stunning clarity .
zh: 基于哈勃的遗产,詹姆斯·韦伯太空望远镜使我们能够比以往更深入地看到太空,并以惊人的清晰度。

en: It will enhance what we know about the origins of our universe , our solar system , and possibly life itself .
zh: 它将增强我们对宇宙的起源、太阳系和可能生命的了解。

en: This was made possible by partnership among nations .
zh: 这是通过各国之间的伙伴关系来实现的。

en: This telescope is one of humanity ’s great engineering achievements .
zh: 这个望远镜是人类伟大的工程成就之一。

en: And the images we will see today are a testament to the amazing work done by the thousands of workers across our nation who dedicated years to this project .
zh: 我们今天看到的这些照片证明了我们全国的数以千计的工人为这项项目献身的伟大工作。

en: They embarked on this complex endeavor for the benefit of humankind , and in the process , accelerated American innovation , strengthened partnerships with our allies , and will undoubtedly inspire generations to look to the heavens with excitement and ambition .
zh: 他们为人类的利益而展开了这一复杂的努力,并在此过程中,加速了美国创新,加强了与我们的盟友的伙伴关系,无疑将激励一代以热情和雄心向天望。

en: With that , it is my great honor to introduce a leader who has always believed in the power of American innovation and international cooperation to achieve the remarkable : our President , the President of the United States , Joe Biden .
zh: 为此,我非常荣幸地介绍一位一直相信美国创新和国际合作的力量领导者:我们的总统,美国总统,乔·比登。

en: And I was going to say “ good afternoon , ” but we ’re starting this meeting late because I was engaged in preparing for a trip to the Middle East .
zh: 我本来打算说“下午好 ”, 但我们开会晚了,因为我正准备去中东旅行。

en: And thank you , my dear friend and our outstanding NASA Administrator and the guy — the only guy here who ’s been in space , Bill Nelson .
zh: 谢谢你,我亲爱的朋友,我们的杰出NASA行政长官和这里唯一在太空的家伙,比尔·纳尔逊。

en: Thank you very much for what you ’re doing .
zh: 非常感谢你所做的事。

en: And — and , Dr. Nelson , you ’re doing a great job leading this Office of Science and Technology Policy .
zh: 而且,纳尔逊博士,你在领导科学和技术政策办公室方面做得很好。

en: It really is a matter — it really is amazing .
zh: 这真是个问题,真令人惊奇。

en: Six and a half months ago , a rocket launched from Earth carrying the world ’s newest , most powerful deep - space telescope on a journey one million miles into the cosmos — first of all , that blows my mind : a million miles into the cosmos — along the way unfolding itself , deploying a mirror 21 feet wide , a sunshield the size of a tennis court , and 250,000 tiny shutters , each one smaller than a grain of sand .
zh: 六个月前,一枚从地球发射的火箭载着世界上最新的 、 最强大的深层空间望远镜在航行100万英里进入宇宙 — — 首先,这使我大吃一惊:100万英里进入宇宙 — — 沿途展开自己,部署了一个21英尺宽的镜子,一个像网球场大小的遮阳镜,还有250,000个小镜子,每个镜子都比砂粒小。

en: And today , we ’re going to get a glimpse of the first light to shine through that window — light from other worlds , orbiting stars far beyond our own .
zh: 而且今天,我们将会看到第一颗透过那扇窗子闪耀的光线 — — 来自其他世界的光线,绕着离我们自己远的恒星。

en: It ’s astounding to me when I read this and saw the — I mean , it really is .
zh: 当我读到这篇文章时,我感到惊奇 — 我是说,这确实是。

en: It ’s — it ’s — anyway , I do n’t want to — I ’ll see what they think when we see this .
zh: 不管怎样,我不想,我看看他们会怎么看。

en: The oldest documented light in the history of the universe from over 13 billion — let me say that again : 13 billion years ago .
zh: 宇宙历史上最古老的记录光源来自超过13亿 — — 让我再说一遍: 13亿年前。

en: It ’s hard to even fathom .
zh: 甚至很难理解。

en: Tomorrow , when this image is shared with the world , it will be a historic moment for science and technology , for astronomy and space exploration , for America and all of humanity .
zh: 明天,当这一形象被全世界分享时,将是科学和技术、天文学和太空探索、美国和整个人类的史诗时刻。

en: You know , as an international collaboration , this telescope embodies how America leads the world not by the example of our power , but the power of our example .
zh: 你知道,作为国际合作,这个望远镜体现了美国如何领导世界,不是以我们的力量为榜样,而是以我们的力量为榜样。

en: A partnership with others , it symbolizes the relentless spirit of American ingenuity .
zh: 与他人的伙伴关系, 象征着美国 ingenuity的不懈精神.

en: And it shows what we can achieve , what more we can discover , not just about distant places , but about our very own planet and climate , like NASA ’s Earth System Observatory that we launched last year .
zh: 它展示了我们能够取得的成就,我们还能发现的更多,不仅仅是关于遥远的地点,而是关于我们自己的星球和气候,比如我们去年发射的NASA的地球系统观测站。

en: These images are going to remind the world that America can do big things .
zh: 这些照片将提醒世界,美国可以做大的事情。

en: And they ’ll remind the American people , especially our children , that there ’s nothing beyond our capacity — nothing beyond our capacity .
zh: 他们会提醒美国人民,尤其是我们的孩子们,我们的能力是超越的,我们的能力是超越的。

en: We can see possibilities no one has ever seen before .
zh: 我们可以看到从未见过的可能性。

en: We can go places no one has ever gone before .
zh: 我们可以去以前没有人去过的地方。

en: You know , you ’ve — you ’ve heard me say it over and over again .
zh: 你知道,你听到我一遍又一遍地说。

en: America is defined by one single word : possibilities .
zh: 美国被定义为一个单词:可能性。

en: I want to thank the team at NASA for once again showing that that ’s who we are — that ’s who we are as a nation : a nation of possibilities .
zh: 我要感谢NASA的团队再次证明我们是这样的 — 我们是这样的国家:一个充满可能性的国家。

en: And now let ’s take a look at the very first image from this miraculous telescope .
zh: 现在让我们看看这个神奇的望远镜的第一张照片。

en: So nice , thank you very much .
zh: 太好了,非常感谢。

en: Thank you .
zh: 谢谢你。

en: It 's great to be in a wonderful city , New York .
zh: 住在纽约这个美丽的城市真是太棒了。

en: And it 's an honor to have everybody here .
zh: 有这么多人来这儿,真是荣幸。

en: This is beyond anybody 's expectations .
zh: 这超出了任何人的期望。

en: There 's been no crowd like this .
zh: 没有这样的人群。

en: And , I can tell you , some of the candidates , they went in .
zh: 而且,我能告诉你,一些候选人,他们进入了。

en: They did n't know the air - conditioner did n't work .
zh: 他们不知道空调坏了.

en: They sweated like dogs .
zh: 他们像狗一样发汗。

en: They did n't know the room was too big , because they did n't have anybody there .
zh: 他们不知道这个房间太大了,因为他们没有谁在那里。

en: How are they going to beat ISIS ?
zh: 他们将如何击败伊斯兰国?

en: I do n't think it 's gon na happen .
zh: 我并不认为这会发生。

en: Our country is in serious trouble .
zh: 我国正处在严重的困境中。

en: We do n't have victories anymore .
zh: 我们不再有胜利了。

en: We used to have victories , but we do n't have them .
zh: 我们过去曾有胜利,但现在却没有。

en: When was the last time anybody saw us beating , let 's say , China in a trade deal ?
zh: 上次有人看见我们打, 让我们说, 中国在贸易交易中打的时候是什么时候?

en: They kill us .
zh: 他们杀了我们。

en: We want Trump .
zh: 我们想要特朗普。

en: We want Trump .
zh: 我们想要特朗普。

en: When did we beat Japan at anything ?
zh: 我们什么时候击败了日本?

en: They send their cars over by the millions , and what do we do ?
zh: 他们把汽车送上数百万人, 我们怎么办?

en: When was the last time you saw a Chevrolet in Tokyo ?
zh: 你在东京 last time you saw a Chevrolet 是什么时候?

en: It does n't exist , folks .
zh: 它不存在,伙计们。

en: They beat us all the time .
zh: 他们老是打我们。

en: When do we beat Mexico at the border ?
zh: 我们什么时候在边界击败墨西哥?

en: They 're laughing at us , at our stupidity .
zh: 他们嘲笑我们,嘲笑我们的愚蠢。

en: And now they are beating us economically .
zh: 现在他们正在经济上打我们。

en: They are not our friend , believe me .
zh: 他们不是我们的朋友,相信我。

en: But they 're killing us economically .
zh: 但他们正在经济上杀害我们。

en: The U.S. has become a dumping ground for everybody else 's problems .
zh: 美国已经成为其他人的问题的倾销地。

en: Thank you .
zh: 谢谢你。

en: They 're not sending you .
zh: 他们不会派你去。

en: They 're not sending you .
zh: 他们不会派你去。

en: They 're sending people that have lots of problems , and they 're bringing those problems with us .
zh: 他们正派人解决许多问题,并把这些问题带到我们身边。

en: They 're bringing drugs .
zh: 他们带来了毒品。

en: They 're bringing crime .
zh: 他们带来了犯罪。

en: And some , I assume , are good people .
zh: 有些人,我猜,是好人。

en: But I speak to border guards and they tell us what we 're getting .
zh: 但是我与边境警卫交谈,他们告诉我们我们正在得到什么。

en: They 're sending us not the right people .
zh: 他们送我们不是合适的人。

en: It 's coming from more than Mexico .
zh: 它来自比墨西哥更远的地方。

en: It 's coming from all over South and Latin America , and it 's coming probably — probably — from the Middle East .
zh: 它来自整个南美洲和拉丁美洲,而且它可能来自中东。

en: But we do n't know .
zh: 但我们不知道。

en: Because we have no protection and we have no competence , we do n't know what 's happening .
zh: 因为我们没有保护,我们没有管辖权,我们不知道发生什么事。

en: And it 's got to stop and it 's got to stop fast .
zh: 它必须停止,并且必须停止快速。

en: Islamic terrorism is eating up large portions of the Middle East .
zh: 伊斯兰恐怖主义正在吞噬中东大部分地区。

en: They 've become rich .
zh: 他们已经变得富有了。

en: I 'm in competition with them .
zh: 我与他们竞争。

en: They just built a hotel in Syria .
zh: 他们刚在叙利亚建了一个旅馆。

en: Can you believe this ?
zh: 你能相信吗?

en: They built a hotel .
zh: 他们建了一个旅馆。

en: When I have to build a hotel , I pay interest .
zh: 当我建造旅馆时,我支付利息。

en: They do n't have to pay interest , because they took the oil that , when we left Iraq , I said we should 've taken .
zh: 他们不需要支付利息,因为他们拿了石油,当我们离开伊拉克时,我说过我们应该拿了。

en: So now ISIS has the oil , and what they do n't have , Iran has .
zh: 现在 ISIS 拥有石油, 而他们没有石油, 伊朗拥有石油.

en: And in 19 — and I will tell you this , and I said it very strongly , years ago , I said — and I love the military , and I want to have the strongest military that we 've ever had , and we need it more now than ever .
zh: 而且19年 — — 我会告诉你的,我非常强烈地说,几年前,我说过 — — 我喜欢军队,我想拥有我们曾经拥有的最强的军队,我们现在需要它比以往任何时候都多。

en: But I said , " Do n't hit Iraq , " because you 're going to totally destabilize the Middle East .
zh: 但我说, “ 别打伊拉克, ” 因为你将完全破坏中东的稳定.

en: Iran is going to take over the Middle East , Iran and somebody else will get the oil , and it turned out that Iran is now taking over Iraq .
zh: 伊朗将占领中东,伊朗和其他人将占领石油,现在伊朗正在占领伊拉克。

en: Iran is taking over Iraq , and they 're taking it over big league .
zh: 伊朗正在接管伊拉克, 他们正在接管大联盟.

en: We spent $ 2 trillion in Iraq , $ 2 trillion .
zh: 我们在伊拉克花费了2万亿美元, 2万亿美元。

en: We lost thousands of lives , thousands in Iraq .
zh: 我们在伊拉克失去了数千人的生命。

en: We have wounded soldiers , who I love , I love — they 're great — all over the place , thousands and thousands of wounded soldiers .
zh: 我们有受伤的士兵,我爱他们,我爱他们,他们太棒了,到处都有成千上万的受伤的士兵。

en: And we have nothing .
zh: 我们什么也没有。

en: We ca n't even go there .
zh: 我们甚至不能去那里。

en: We have nothing .
zh: 我们什么都没有。

en: And every time we give Iraq equipment , the first time a bullet goes off in the air , they leave it .
zh: 每次我们给伊拉克装备时,当第一次弹在空中爆炸时,他们就离开它。

en: Last week , I read 2,300 Humvees — these are big vehicles — were left behind for the enemy .
zh: 上周,我读到2,300辆 Humvees — — 这些是大型的车辆 — — 被遗留给敌人。

en: 2,300 sophisticated vehicles , they ran , and the enemy took them .
zh: 2,300辆精巧的车辆, 他们跑了, 敌人夺走了它们.

en: We need Trump now .
zh: 我们现在需要特朗普。

en: We need Trump now .
zh: 我们现在需要特朗普。

en: Last quarter , it was just announced our gross domestic product — a sign of strength , right ?
zh: 上个季度, 刚刚宣布了我们的国内生产总值 — — 是力量的迹象, 对 吗?

en: Whoever heard of this ?
zh: 谁听说过这个?

en: Our labor participation rate was the worst since 1978 .
zh: 我们的劳动参与率是1978年以来的最低。

en: Do n't believe the 5.6 .
zh: 不要相信5.6。

en: Do n't believe it .
zh: 别相信。

en: That 's right .
zh: 没错。

en: A lot of people up there ca n't get jobs .
zh: 那里有很多人找不到工作。

en: They ca n't get jobs , because there are no jobs , because China has our jobs and Mexico has our jobs .
zh: 他们不能找到工作,因为没有工作,因为中国有我们的工作,墨西哥也有我们的工作。

en: They all have jobs .
zh: 他们都有工作。

en: We want Trump now .
zh: 我们现在需要特朗普。

en: Our enemies are getting stronger and stronger by the way , and we as a country are getting weaker .
zh: 顺便说一下,我们的敌人越来越强大,我们作为一个国家越来越软弱。

en: Even our nuclear arsenal does n't work .
zh: 连我们的核武库都不起作用。

en: It came out recently they have equipment that is 30 years old .
zh: 他们最近拿出了30年前的设备。

en: They do n't know if it worked .
zh: 他们不知道它是否有效。

en: And I thought it was horrible when it was broadcast on television , because boy , does that send signals to Putin and all of the other people that look at us and they say ,
zh: 我以为这在电视上播出时很可怕,因为这会给普京和其他那些看着我们的人发出信号,他们说,

en: They do n't know what they 're doing .
zh: 他们不知道他们正在做什么。

en: They do n't know what they 're doing . "
zh: 他们不知道他们正在干什么. ”

en: Many Americans who migrated to Texas at the invitation of the Mexican government did not completely shed their identity or loyalty to the United States .
zh: 在墨西哥政府的邀请下移民到德克萨斯的许多美国人并没有完全放弃对美国的身份或忠诚。

en: They brought American traditions and expectations with them  .
zh: 他们带来了美国传统和期望。

en: For instance , the majority of these new settlers were Protestant , and though they were not required to attend the Catholic mass , Mexico 's prohibition on the public practice of other religions upset them and they routinely ignored it .
zh: 例如,这些新移民的大多数是新教徒,尽管他们没有被要求参加天主教会,墨西哥对其他宗教的公共做法的禁令使他们感到沮丧,而且他们经常忽略了它。

en: Accustomed to representative democracy , jury trials , and the defendant ’s right to appear before a judge , the Anglo - American settlers in Texas also disliked the Mexican legal system , which provided for an initial hearing by an alcalde , an administrator who often combined the duties of mayor , judge , and law enforcement officer .
zh: 他们习惯了代表性民主 、 陪审团审判和被告在法官面前出庭的权利, 德克萨斯州的盎格鲁 - 美洲移民也不喜欢墨西哥的法律制度,该制度规定了一个市长的初审,一个管理员经常兼顾市长、法官和执法官员的职责.

en: The alcalde sent a written record of the proceeding to a judge in Saltillo , the state capital , who decided the outcome .
zh: 市长把诉讼案的书面记录送到州首府萨利洛的法官那里,法官决定结果。

en: Settlers also resented that at most two Texas representatives were allowed in the state legislature .
zh: 移民们也厌恶至少有两个德克萨斯州代表被允许进入州议会。

en: Most American settlers were from southern states , and many had brought slaves with them .
zh: 大多数美国移民来自南方的州,许多人带着奴隶。

en: Mexico tried to accommodate them by maintaining the fiction that the slaves were indentured servants .
zh: 墨西哥试图通过维持奴隶是雇佣奴隶的虚构来适应他们。

en: But American slaveholders in Texas distrusted the Mexican government and wanted Texas to be a new U.S. slave state .
zh: 但德克萨斯州的奴隶主们蔑视墨西哥政府,希望德克萨斯州成为新的美国奴隶国。

en: The dislike of most for Roman Catholicism  and a widely held belief in American racial superiority led them generally to regard Mexicans as dishonest , ignorant , and backward .
zh: 大多数人对罗马天主教的厌恶和对美国种族优势的广泛信仰导致他们普遍认为墨西哥人不诚实、无知和落后。

en: This 1833 map shows the extent of land grants made by Mexico to American settlers in Texas .
zh: 这张1833年地图显示墨西哥向德克萨斯州的美国移民提供的土地赠款的范围。

en: Nearly all are in the eastern portion of the state , one factor that led to war with Mexico in 1846 .
zh: 几乎所有都位于该州东部,这是导致1846年与墨西哥爆发战争的一个因素。

en: Belief in their own superiority inspired some Texans to try to undermine the power of the Mexican government .
zh: 相信自己的优越感使一些 Texans 试图破坏墨西哥政府的权力。

en: When empresario Haden Edwards attempted to evict people who had settled his land grant before he gained title to it , the Mexican government nullified its agreement with him .
zh: 当哈登·爱德华兹(Haden Edwards)试图驱逐那些在他获得土地权之前定居的居民时,墨西哥政府取消了同他达成的协议。

en: Outraged , Edwards and a small party of men took prisoner the alcalde of Nacogdoches .
zh: 爱德华兹和一小伙人愤怒地俘虏了纳科格多奇市长。

en: The Mexican army marched to the town , and Edwards and his troops then declared the formation of the Republic of Fredonia between the Sabine and Rio Grande Rivers .
zh: 墨西哥军队进城,爱德华兹和他的军队宣布在萨宾河和里奥格兰德河之间成立弗雷多尼亚共和国。

en: To demonstrate loyalty to their adopted country , a force led by Stephen Austin hastened to Nacogdoches to support the Mexican army .
zh: 为了表示对他们的 adopted 国家忠诚,由斯蒂芬·奥斯汀领导的一支部队加速前往纳科格多奇支持墨西哥军队。

en: Edwards ’s revolt collapsed , and the revolutionaries fled Texas .
zh: 爱德华的叛乱倒塌,革命者逃往德克萨斯州。

en: The growing presence of American settlers in Texas , their reluctance to abide by Mexican law , and their desire for independence caused the Mexican government to grow wary .
zh: 美国移民在德克萨斯的日益增多,他们不愿遵守墨西哥法律,以及他们对独立的愿望使墨西哥政府变得更加谨慎。

en: In 1830 , it forbade future U.S. immigration and increased its military presence in Texas .
zh: 在1830年,它禁止未来的美国移民,并增加其在德克萨斯的军事存在。

en: Fifty - five delegates from the Anglo - American settlements gathered in 1831 to demand the suspension of customs duties , the resumption of immigration from the United States , better protection from Indian tribes , the granting of promised land titles , and the creation of an independent state of Texas separate from Coahuila .
zh: 1831年,来自英美殖民地的五十五名代表聚集起来,要求暂停关税,恢复从美国移民,更好地保护印第安部落,给予承诺的土地所有权,并建立独立的德克萨斯州,独立于科阿胡拉州。

en: Ordered to disband , the delegates reconvened in early April 1833 to write a constitution for an independent Texas .
zh: 被命令解散,1833年4月初各代表重新召集,为独立的德克萨斯制定宪法。

en: Surprisingly , General Antonio Lopez de Santa Anna , Mexico ’s new president , agreed to all demands , except the call for statehood .
zh: 令人惊讶的是,墨西哥新总统安东尼奥·洛佩斯·德·圣安娜将军同意所有要求,除了要求成为国家的要求。

en: Coahuila y Texas made provisions for jury trials , increased Texas ’s representation in the state legislature , and removed restrictions on commerce .
zh: 科阿维拉和德克萨斯州为陪审团审判作出了规定,增加了德克萨斯州议会的代表性,并取消了对商业的限制。

en: This portrait of General Antonio Lopez de Santa Anna depicts the Mexican president and general in full military regalia .
zh: 这幅安东尼奥·洛佩斯·德·圣安娜将军的肖像描绘了墨西哥总统和将军在全面军事礼仪。

en: Texans ' hopes for independence were quashed in 1834 , however , when Santa Anna dismissed the Mexican Congress and abolished all state governments , including that of Coahuila y Texas .
zh: 1834年,圣安娜解散墨西哥国会并废除了所有州政府,包括科阿维拉和德克萨斯州政府。

en: In January 1835 , reneging on earlier promises , he dispatched troops to the town of Anahuac to collect customs duties .
zh: 1835年1月,他放弃了先前的承诺,派兵到阿纳胡阿克镇收税。

en: Lawyer and soldier William B. Travis and a small force marched on Anahuac in June , and the fort surrendered .
zh: 律师和士兵威廉·B·特拉维斯和一支小部队在6月在阿纳胡阿克上游行,堡垒投降。

en: Now more cautious , delegates to the Consultation of 1835 at San Felipe de Austin voted against declaring independence , instead drafting a statement , which became known as the Declaration of Causes , promising continued loyalty if Mexico returned to a constitutional form of government .
zh: 现在更谨慎的是,1835年在圣费利佩德奥斯汀举行的协商会议的代表投票反对宣布独立,而是草拟了一份声明,该声明被称为“原因声明”,承诺如果墨西哥重返宪法形式的政府,将继续忠诚。

en: They selected Henry Smith , leader of the Independence Party , as governor of Texas and placed Sam Houston , a former soldier who had been a congressman and governor of Tennessee , in charge of its small military force .
zh: 他们选出独立党领袖亨利·史密斯为德克萨斯州州长,并任命前参议院议员和田纳西州州长萨姆·休斯顿(Sam Houston)为其小军事力量的负责人。

en: The Consultation delegates met again in March 1836 .
zh: 协商代表于1836年3月再次开会。

en: They declared their independence from Mexico and drafted a constitution calling for an American - style judicial system and an elected president and legislature .
zh: 他们宣布脱离墨西哥独立,并起草了一项宪法,要求建立美国式司法制度,选举总统和立法机构。

en: Significantly , they also established that slavery would not be prohibited in Texas .
zh: 他们还规定,德克萨斯州不会禁止奴隶制。

en: Many wealthy Tejanos supported the push for independence , hoping for liberal governmental reforms and economic benefits .
zh: 许多富裕的泰雅诺支持独立运动,希望实现自由政府改革和经济利益。

en: Mexico had no intention of losing its northern province .
zh: 墨西哥没有打算失去其北部的省份。

en: Santa Anna and his army of four thousand had besieged San Antonio in February 1836 .
zh: 1836年2月,圣安娜和他的四千人军队包围了圣安东尼奥。

en: Hopelessly outnumbered , its two hundred defenders , under Travis , fought fiercely from their refuge in an old mission known as the Alamo .
zh: 特拉维斯率领的两百名卫兵在阿拉莫号的旧特派团中从避难所中猛烈战斗。

en: After ten days , however , the mission was taken and all but a few of the defenders were dead , including Travis and James Bowie , the famed frontiersman who was also a land speculator and slave trader .
zh: 然而,在十天后,任务被执行,除了少数的守卫者外,还有特拉维斯和詹姆斯·鲍维(英语:James Bowie)在内的著名边境人,他们也是土地投机商和奴隶贩子。

en: A few male survivors , possibly including the frontier legend and former Tennessee congressman Davy Crockett , were led outside the walls and executed .
zh: 一些男性幸存者,可能包括边界传奇和前田纳西州国会议员达维·克罗克特,被带到墙外并处决。

en: The few women and children inside the mission were allowed to leave with the only adult male survivor , a slave owned by Travis who was then freed by the Mexican Army .
zh: 特拉维斯所拥有的奴隶,后来被墨西哥军队释放,只有一个成人男性幸存者能够离开特拉维斯。

en: Terrified , they fled .
zh: 他们吓坏了, 逃走了.

en: The Fall of the Alamo , painted by Theodore Gentilz fewer than ten years after this pivotal moment in the Texas Revolution , depicts the 1836 assault on the Alamo complex .
zh: 在德克萨斯革命的这一关键时刻不到十年后,由西奥多·盖尼兹描绘的《阿拉莫山的倒塌》,描绘了1836年对阿拉莫山的袭击。

en: Consider this scenario .
zh: 考虑一下这个场景。

en: A student comes to class one day , and the instructor says , “ I ’ve decided that you ’re all a bunch of failures and I ’m flunking the entire class . ”
zh: 一天,一位学生到教室,老师说:“我决定你们都是一群失败者,我要把整个班都搞砸了。 ”

en: Imagine then that the instructor simply stands there after that announcement , blinking calmly as the class erupts in protest .
zh: 然后想象一下,老师在宣布之后站在那里,平静地眨眼,当教室爆发抗议。

en: Now imagine that same scenario with one very slight difference .
zh: 现在想象一下同样的场景,有一个很小的区别。

en: The instructor announces , “ I ’ve decided that you ’re all a bunch of failures and I ’m flunking the entire class . ”
zh: 老师宣布, “ 我决定你们都是一群失败者,我将把整个班子弄得糟透了。 ”

en: Then , as the class erupts in protest , the instructor calmly blinks one eye , leaving the other eye open .
zh: 然后,当教室爆发抗议时,老师平静地眨眼,让另一只眼睛敞开。

en: Would you take this woman seriously ?
zh: 你会认真对待这个女人吗?

en: In American culture , winking , related to the normal biological function of blinking , takes on special meaning in social interactions .
zh: 在美国文化中,闪烁与闪烁的正常生物功能有关,在社交互动中具有特殊意义。

en: What just happened there ?
zh: 刚才发生了什么事?

en: Humans blink to keep eyes hydrated and clear of debris .
zh: 人类闪烁以保持眼睛的水分和清除碎片。

en: Humans are born knowing how to blink ; nobody has to teach us .
zh: 人类是天生的,知道如何闪烁;没有人需要教我们。

en: On average , humans blink 15 to 20 times every minute .
zh: 人类平均每分钟闪烁15到20次。

en: Without realizing it , people are necessarily blinking throughout every conversation , every social interaction , every activity during the day .
zh: 没有意识到这一点,人们在每天的每一个对话、社交互动、活动中都会闪烁。

en: The people we talk to and interact with are also blinking constantly , so often that everyone is accustomed to ignoring it .
zh: 我们谈话和交流的人也不停地闪烁着,如此频繁,每个人都习惯于忽略它。

en: Blinking does not affect the perceived meaning of speech or actions .
zh: 闪烁并不影响语言或行动所感知的含义。

en: But if someone deliberately blinks one eye , leaving the other one open , that ’s a completely different matter .
zh: 但是如果有人故意眨眼,留下另一只眼睛打开,那是一个完全不同的问题。

en: In fact , leaving one eye open makes a blink a wink .
zh: 事实上,让一只眼睛睁开就使一眨眼一眨眼。

en: Humans are not born knowing to how to wink , and it takes some practice to learn how to do it .
zh: 人类不是生来知道如何微笑的,而学习如何微笑需要一些实践。

en: Because it requires deliberate effort and people are not constantly doing it , winking can acquire special meaning in social interactions .
zh: 因为它需要有意识的努力,而人们并不经常这样做,因此微笑在社交互动中具有特殊意义。

en: In American culture  , a wink often indicates that someone is joking around and that whatever they ’ve just said or done should not be taken seriously .
zh: 在美国文化中,微笑往往意味着有人在开玩笑,而且他们刚才所说的或所做的任何事情都不应该被认真对待。

en: Of course , a wink can mean different things in different societies .
zh: 当然,微笑在不同的社会中意味着不同的东西。

en: Moreover , a wink can mean different things in the same society .
zh: 而且,一个微笑在同一个社会中可能意味着不同的东西。

en: If someone on a date takes their companion ’s hand and gives a cute little wink , the person may have reason to hope the winker is not just joking around .
zh: 约会时,如果某人握住同伴的手,给对方一个可爱的小眨眼,那人可能有理由希望小眨眼不是只是开玩笑。

en: American cultural anthropologist Clifford Geertz  used the example of winking to illustrate two important aspects of culture .
zh: 美国文化人类学家克利福德·盖茨(Clifford Geertz)用 winking 的例子说明了文化中的两个重要方面。

en: Innate human behaviors — that is , behaviors that people are born with — are biological , not cultural .
zh: 人类的本能行为 — — 即人们与之生来的行为 — — 是生物的,而不是文化的。

en: Acquired human behaviors — that is , behaviors that people are taught — are cultural .
zh: 获得的人类行为 — — 即人们被教导的行为 — — 是文化行为。

en: This means that cultural behaviors are not genetically inherited from generation to generation but must be passed down from older members of a society to younger members .
zh: 这意味着文化行为不是由一代人遗传下来的,而是必须由社会中年龄较大的成员传给年轻的成员。

en: This process , as you ’ll recall from What is Anthropology ? is called enculturation .
zh: 这个过程,正如你从人类学学中所记得的,叫做文化化。

en: Some aspects of enculturation are deliberate and systematic , such as learning the rules of written punctuation in a language .
zh: 文法学的某些方面是有意识的和系统性的,例如学习语言的书面标注规则。

en: At some point in an English speaker ’s childhood , someone explicitly told them the difference between a question mark and an exclamation point .
zh: 在一个英语口语的孩子童年时期,有人明确地告诉他们一个问号和一个尖叫点之间的区别。

en: Most likely , they learned this distinction in school , a fundamental institution of enculturation in many societies .
zh: 他们很可能在学校学习了这种区别,这是许多社会内培养的根本制度。

en: Religious institutions are another common force of enculturation , providing explicit instruction in cultural rules of morality and social interaction .
zh: 宗教机构是文化融合的另一个共同力量,提供了明确的道德和社会互动文化规则的指导。

en: While a great deal of very important cultural content is deliberately conveyed in these systematic contexts , the greater part of culture is acquired unconsciously by happenstance — that is , nobody planned to teach it , and no one made an effort to consciously try to learn it .
zh: 尽管大量重要的文化内容在这些系统环境中被蓄意传达,但大部分文化都是通过偶然获得的 — — 也就是说,没有人打算教它,也没有作出努力去自觉地尝试学习它。

en: By virtue of growing up in a culture , children learn what certain actions and objects mean , how their society operates , and what the rules are for appropriate behavior .
zh: 通过成长在一个文化中,孩子们学会了某些行为和事物的含义,学会了他们的社会如何运作,学会了适当的行为规则。

en: Going back to the cultural notion of home , did anyone ever explain to you why your childhood home was structured in a certain way ?
zh: 回到家庭文化的观念上,有没有人解释过为什么你童年的家有某种结构?

en: Now , imagine that you were taken away from your parents as a baby and adopted by a family far away , with a very different way of life situated in a very different environment .
zh: 现在,想象一下你被从父母身边带走,被远处的一家人收养,生活方式非常不同,环境非常不同。

en: With your adoptive family , you might have been raised in a very different kind of home .
zh: 与你的 adoptive家庭一起,你可能在不同的家庭里长大。

en: Growing up , your everyday habits , activities , and expectations would have been shaped by the setup of that home .
zh: 长大后,你的生活习惯、活动和期望都会受到那家房子的设置的影响。

en: Living in that house , you would have wordlessly absorbed a set of assumptions about family , gender , work , leisure , hospitality , and property .
zh: 在那个房子里生活,你会无言地吸收一组关于家庭、性别、工作、休闲、接待和财产的假设。

en: And all of it would seem quite natural to you .
zh: 这一切对你来说都是很自然的。

en: Many forms of culture are passed down through a combination of deliberate and unconscious processes .
zh: 许多文化形式通过有意识和无意识的进程的结合传下来。

en: Geertz pointed out that there are two important aspects to winking : the meaning and the action .
zh: 盖茨指出,微笑有两个重要方面:意义和行动。

en: But perhaps more importantly , both the standardized action of winking and the assumed meaning of this action are commonly known among members of a group .
zh: 但也许更重要的是,在一群成员中,人们都普遍知道了眨眼的标准动作和这个动作的假设意义。

en: A relevant question to our concern might be , would this artistic excellence in the Chinese tradition be the same as beauty ?
zh: 我们关心的一个问题可能是, 这种中国传统艺术的卓越性与美是一样的 吗?

en: Arguably , beauty is regarded as the keyword in Western art tradition since antiquity .
zh: 自古以来, 美观被认为是西方艺术传统的关键字.

en: If we browse Chinese classical writings on art criticism , a striking difference manifests — there the category of mei or beauty does not have a dominant presence .
zh: 如果我们浏览中国古典艺术批评的著作,就会发现明显的不同 — — 那就是美与美的范畴没有占主导地位。

en: For instance , among the 24 aesthetic categories of poetry listed by Sikong Tu 司空 图  in his celebrated treatise  , only three or four categories can be regarded as related to the Western notion of beauty .
zh: 例如,在诗歌的24个审美类别中,只有三个或四个类别可以被视为与西方的美观有关。

en: Moreover , according to Xu Hong ’s  Xishan Qinkuang 谿山 琴况  , the most influential treatise on the aesthetics of guqin  music , the category of li  is merely the 10th of the 24 aesthetic categories , and the top six were harmony , tranquillity , clarity , profundity , antiquity , subtlety .
zh: 此外,根据徐宏的《Xishan Qinkuang》——《山琴况》——关于古琴音乐的审美学最有影响力的著作,李的类别仅是24个审美类别中的第十个,而上六个类别是和谐、宁静、清晰、深远、古老、微妙。

en: Overall , one also finds that the comparison between the beautiful and the sublime — which defined the influential aesthetics of Edmund Burke  and Immanuel Kant , and consequently became an iconic discourse in Western aesthetics — is also missing in the Chinese history of aesthetics .
zh: 总的来说,人们也发现美与崇高之间的比较 — — 它定义了爱德蒙·伯克和伊曼努尔·坎特影响的审美学,并因此成为西方审美学的标志性话语 — — 在中国审美史中也缺失。

en: To conclude , in a cross-cultural comparative context , it is fair to say that an inquiry on what makes an artwork beautiful may turn out to be even less productive than in the contemporary artworld .
zh: 最后,在跨文化比较的背景下,可以 fair to say that an inquiry on what makes an artwork beautiful may turn out to be even less productive than in the contemporary artworld 。

en: The Hegelian definition of aesthetics as the philosophy of art that considers the issue of artistic beauty as its core concern is no more enchanting in our time .
zh: 以美学为艺术哲学的希格里亚定义,把艺术美问题视为其核心问题,在当代已经不再具有魅力了。

en: Two factors might contribute to this situation .
zh: 两个因素可能导致这种情况。

en: Firstly , it is not a coincidence that the loss of interest in the inquiry into artistic beauty coincides with a sea change in the artworld , transformed by new art movements as well as struggles in defining art .
zh: 首先,对艺术美学研究的兴趣的丧失与艺术界发生了巨大的变化,这些变化是由于新的艺术运动以及艺术界定的斗争而改变的,这并不是巧合。

en: Being beautiful is no longer a defining feature of art .
zh: 美丽不再是艺术的 defining feature 。

en: Also , when the representationalism , the expression theories , formalism , neoformalism , aesthetic theories in defining art all fail to offer an account that is capable of coping with the dynamic scenes of the artworld , and when the anti-essentialist movement in philosophical aesthetics then paves a way to functionalism , institutionalism and various versions of historicism , the question of artistic beauty as such not only loses its limelight , but also is , to some extent , abandoned for its strong Hegelian colour .
zh: 同时,当表现主义、表达理论、形式主义、新形式主义、审美理论在艺术的定义中都未能提供能够应付艺术世界的动态场景的解释,以及当哲学审美中的反本质主义运动为功能主义、制度主义和历史主义的各种版本铺平了道路时,艺术美问题本身不仅失去其声望,而且也在一定程度上被放弃了其强烈的黑格利亚色彩。

en: Now if “ art ” itself becomes an open concept or a socially , historically , culturally sensitive notion , then whatever makes an artwork beautiful is unlikely to be something homogeneous and unitary .
zh: 如果“艺术”本身成为一个开放的概念或一种社会、历史、文化敏感的概念,那么任何让艺术作品美丽的东西都不太可能成为同质和统一的东西。

en: Secondly , the inquiry into “ beauty ” experienced a shift of focus from the emphasis on aesthetic properties of the objects to the subjective experience involved in aesthetic appreciation .
zh: 其次,对“美”的研究经历了从对对象的审美特性的强调转向对审美欣赏所涉及的主观经验的转移。

en: The contemporary inquiry into beauty in general is often classified in light of the framework of realism vs non-realism .
zh: 当代对美观的普遍研究往往以现实主义与非现实主义的框架来分类。

en: Realism regards artistic beauty as a property of artworks which is independent of the subject , while non-realism holds that artistic beauty is not an independent property of artworks .
zh: 现实主义认为艺术美是独立于主体的艺术品的财产,而非现实主义则认为艺术美不是独立于主体的艺术品的财产。

en: This shift has a long historical preparation , contributed especially by the British empiricists such as Francis Hutcheson  and David Hume  .
zh: 这一转变具有悠久的历史准备,尤其是英国经验学家弗朗西斯·哈切森和戴维·休姆(David Hume)的贡献。

en: Hutcheson thinks that beauty lies in both the object and the subject , and artistic beauty comes from the quality of “ uniformity amidst variety ” in the object and the involvement of an “ internal sense ” in the subject .
zh: 赫切森认为美在于物体和主体,而艺术美源于物体中的“一致性与多样性 ” 以及“ 内在感 ” 的参与。

en: Hume argues that “ beauty is no quality in things themselves , ” but a “ sentiment ” in “ the mind that contemplates them ” and “ to seek the real beauty … is … fruitless . ”
zh: 休姆认为“ 美不是事物本身的品质 ”, 而是“ 思考事物的心灵 ” 的“ 情感 ” 和“ 寻求真正的美... 是... 毫无结果 ” 。

en: In contemporary aesthetics , from the study of empathy to Freud ’s libido , to the evolutionary theory of beauty , to the focus on perception in aesthetic experience , more and more philosophers seek to answer the question of what makes an artwork beautiful in light of human physiology and psychology .
zh: 在当代美学中,从同情学到弗洛伊德的性欲学,到美学的进化理论,到审美经验中对感知的关注,越来越多的哲学家试图回答人们生理学和心理学的视角下,什么是艺术作品的美丽。

en: For instance , the evolutionary theory regards artistic beauty as “ fitness signal ” that displays desirable personal qualities that strengthen reproductive advantage , and our pleasant feeling caused by something beautiful , like sexual pleasure , is engraved in our minds by the process of evolution , assisting us to make the “ the most adaptive decisions for survival and reproduction . ”
zh: 例如,进化理论认为艺术美是“适应性信号 ”, 它显示出可望的个人品质,加强生殖优势,而我们所产生的美感,如性愉悦,被进化过程刻在我们的脑海中,帮助我们作出“生存和繁殖的最适应性决定 ” 。

en: “ The internal Sense is , a passive Power of receiving Ideas of Beauty from all Objects in which there is Uniformity amidst Variety ”  .
zh: “ 内在的感官是, 从所有物体中接受美观的消极力量,在多样性中存在一致性 ”.

en: 40. “ Beauty is no quality in things themselves : it exists merely in the mind which contemplates them ; and each mind perceives a different beauty … every individual ought to acquiesce in his own sentiment , without pretending to regulate those of others .
zh: 40. “ 美是事物本身的品质 : 它只是存在于思考事物的头脑中; 每个头脑都觉察到不同的美... 每个个体都应该在自己的情感中接受,而不假装是调节他人的情感。

en: To seek the real beauty , or real deformity , is as fruitless an inquiry , as to pretend to ascertain the real sweet or real bitter ”  .
zh: 寻找真正的美丽,或者真正的变形,就像伪装确定真正的甜味或真正的苦味一样毫无结果的调查。

en: 41. Denis Dutton  provides such an account in his TED talk , “ A Darwinian Theory of Beauty . ”
zh: 41. 丹尼斯·杜顿在他的TED演讲中给出了这样的解释, “ 达尔文的美丽理论 ”.

en: State the postulates of Dalton ’s atomic theory
zh: 达尔顿原子理论的假设

en: Use postulates of Dalton ’s atomic theory to explain the laws of definite and multiple proportions
zh: 用达尔顿原子理论的假设来解释确定和多比例的规律

en: The earliest recorded discussion of the basic structure of matter comes from ancient Greek philosophers , the scientists of their day .
zh: 最早记录的关于物质的基本结构的讨论来自古代希腊哲学家,当时的科学家。

en: In the fifth century BC , Leucippus and Democritus argued that all matter was composed of small , finite particles that they called atomos , a term derived from the Greek word for “ indivisible . ”
zh: 在公元前五世纪,卢西普斯和德莫克里图斯认为所有物质都是由小、有限的粒子组成的,他们称之为原子,这个词源于希腊语“不可分割 ”的词汇。

en: They thought of atoms as moving particles that differed in shape and size , and which could join together .
zh: 他们认为原子是运动的粒子,它们的形状和大小不同,并且可以结合在一起。

en: Later , Aristotle and others came to the conclusion that matter consisted of various combinations of the four “ elements ” — fire , earth , air , and water — and could be infinitely divided .
zh: 后来,亚里士多德和其他人得出结论,物质是由四个“元素” — — 火, 地球, 空气, 水 — — 的多种组合组成的,并且可以无限地分开.

en: Interestingly , these philosophers thought about atoms and “ elements ” as philosophical concepts , but apparently never considered performing experiments to test their ideas .
zh: 有趣的是,这些哲学家把原子和“元素”当作哲学概念,但显然从未考虑进行实验来测试他们的想法。

en: The Aristotelian view of the composition of matter held sway for over two thousand years , until English schoolteacher John Dalton helped to revolutionize chemistry with his hypothesis that the behavior of matter could be explained using an atomic theory .
zh: 亚里士多德对物质的组成的观点影响了超过2000年,直到英国学校教师约翰·达尔顿(John Dalton)通过他的假设,利用原子理论来解释物质的行为,帮助了化学的革命。

en: First published in 1807 , many of Dalton ’s hypotheses about the microscopic features of matter are still valid in modern atomic theory .
zh: 1807年首次发表,达尔顿关于物质微观特征的许多假设在现代原子理论中仍然有效。

en: Here are the postulates of Dalton ’s atomic theory .
zh: 这是达尔顿原子理论的假设。

en: An atom is the smallest unit of an element that can participate in a chemical change .
zh: 原子是元素最小的单位,可以参与化学变化。

en: 2. An element consists of only one type of atom , which has a mass that is characteristic of the element and is the same for all atoms of that element  .
zh: 2.一个元素只有一个类型的原子,它的质量是元素的特征,并且对于所有原子的质量是相同的。

en: A macroscopic sample of an element contains an incredibly large number of atoms , all of which have identical chemical properties .
zh: 一个元素的宏观样本包含大量的原子,所有原子都有相同的化学性质。

en: A pre-1982 copper penny  contains approximately 3 ×× 10 22 copper atoms  , each of which has the same chemical properties .
zh: 1982年前的铜笔含有大约3××1022个铜原子,每个原子都有相同的化学性质。

en: 3. Atoms of one element differ in properties from atoms of all other elements .
zh: 3.一个元素的原子在性质上与所有其他元素的原子不同。

en: In a given compound , the numbers of atoms of each of its elements are always present in the same ratio  .
zh: 在给定的化合物中,每个元素的原子数总是存在于相同的比率中。

en: 5. Atoms are neither created nor destroyed during a chemical change , but are instead rearranged to yield substances that are different from those present before the change  .
zh: 5.在化学变化中,原子既不是被创造,也不是被摧毁,而是被重新安排以产生与变化前存在不同物质的物质。

en: When the elements copper  and oxygen  react , their atoms rearrange to form a compound containing copper and oxygen  .
zh: 当元素铜和氧反应时,它们的原子重新排列成含有铜和氧的化合物。

en: Dalton ’s atomic theory provides a microscopic explanation of the many macroscopic properties of matter that you ’ve learned about .
zh: 达尔顿的原子理论提供了关于物质的许多宏观性质的微观解释。

en: For example , if an element such as copper consists of only one kind of atom , then it can not be broken down into simpler substances , that is , into substances composed of fewer types of atoms .
zh: 例如,如果一个元素如铜只有一个类型的原子,那么它不能被分解为更简单的物质,即由较少类型的原子组成的物质。

en: And if atoms are neither created nor destroyed during a chemical change , then the total mass of matter present when matter changes from one type to another will remain constant  .
zh: 如果在化学变化中原子没有被创造或摧毁,那么当物质从一种类型转变到另一种类型时,物质的总质量将保持不变。

en: Testing Dalton ’s Atomic Theory
zh: 达尔顿原子理论的测试

en: In the following drawing , the green spheres represent atoms of a certain element .
zh: 在下图中,绿色球体代表某一元素的原子。

en: The purple spheres represent atoms of another element .
zh: 紫球代表另一个元素的原子。

en: Does the following chemical change represented by these symbols violate any of the ideas of Dalton ’s atomic theory ?
zh: 这些符号所代表的下列化学变化是否违反了达尔顿原子理论的任何想法?

en: The starting materials consist of two green spheres and two purple spheres .
zh: 开始材料包括两个绿色球和两个紫色球。

en: The products consist of only one green sphere and one purple sphere .
zh: 产品只有一个绿色球和一个紫球。

en: This violates Dalton ’s postulate that atoms are neither created nor destroyed during a chemical change , but are merely redistributed .
zh: 这违反了达尔顿的假设,即原子在化学变化中既不是被创造,也不是被摧毁,而是被重新分配。

en: Check Your Learning
zh: 检查你的学习

en: In the following drawing , the green spheres represent atoms of a certain element .
zh: 在下图中,绿色球体代表某一元素的原子。

en: The purple spheres represent atoms of another element .
zh: 紫球代表另一个元素的原子。

en: Does the following chemical change represented by these symbols violate any of the ideas of Dalton ’s atomic theory ?
zh: 这些符号所代表的下列化学变化是否违反了达尔顿原子理论的任何想法?

en: The starting materials consist of four green spheres and two purple spheres .
zh: 起始材料包括四个绿色球和两个紫色球。

en: The products consist of four green spheres and two purple spheres .
zh: 产品由四个绿色球和两个紫色球组成。

en: This does not violate any of Dalton ’s postulates :
zh: 这并不违反达尔顿的任何假设:

en: Explain the difference between natural and artificial concepts
zh: 解释自然概念与人工概念之间的区别

en: Imagine all of your thoughts as if they were physical entities , swirling rapidly inside your mind .
zh: 想象一下你所有的思想都好像是物质实体,在你的脑子里迅速旋转。

en: How is it possible that the brain is able to move from one thought to the next in an organized , orderly fashion ?
zh: 大脑如何能够组织、有序地从一个思想转变到另一个思想呢?

en: The brain is endlessly perceiving , processing , planning , organizing , and remembering — it is always active .
zh: 大脑是无穷地感知、处理、规划、组织和记忆 — — 它总是积极的。

en: Yet , you do n’t notice most of your brain ’s activity as you move throughout your daily routine .
zh: 然而,当你在日常活动时,你并没有注意到大脑的大部分活动。

en: Simply put , cognition is thinking , and it encompasses the processes associated with perception , knowledge , problem solving , judgment , language , and memory .
zh: 简单地说,认知是思考,它包含与感知、知识、解决问题、判断、语言和记忆有关的过程。

en: Scientists who study cognition are searching for ways to understand how we integrate , organize , and utilize our conscious cognitive experiences without being aware of all of the unconscious work that our brains are doing  .
zh: 研究认知的科学家正在寻找理解我们如何结合、组织和利用我们自觉的认知经验的方法,而不意识到我们的大脑正在做的所有无意识工作。

en: Upon waking each morning , you begin thinking — contemplating the tasks that you must complete that day .
zh: 每天早晨醒来时,你开始思考 — — 思考你必须完成的任务。

en: In what order should you run your errands ?
zh: 你应该按什么顺序办事 呢?

en: Should you go to the bank , the cleaners , or the grocery store first ?
zh: 你应该先去银行 、 清洁工或杂货店 吗?

en: Can you get these things done before you head to class or will they need to wait until school is done ?
zh: 你能在上课前把这些事情做好 吗 或者他们需要等到学校结束 吗?

en: These thoughts are one example of cognition at work .
zh: 这些想法是认知在工作中的一个例子。

en: Exceptionally complex , cognition is an essential feature of human consciousness , yet not all aspects of cognition are consciously experienced .
zh: 认知是人类意识的一个基本特征,但并非所有认知的方面都自觉地经历。

en: It attempts to explain how and why we think the way we do by studying the interactions among human thinking , emotion , creativity , language , and problem solving , in addition to other cognitive processes .
zh: 它试图通过研究人类思维、情感、创造力、语言和解决问题之间的相互作用,以及其他认知过程来解释我们如何和为什么这样思考。

en: Cognitive psychologists strive to determine and measure different types of intelligence , why some people are better at problem solving than others , and how emotional intelligence affects success in the workplace , among countless other topics .
zh: 认知心理学家致力于确定和衡量不同类型的智力,为什么某些人比其他人更擅长解决问题,以及情感智力如何影响工作场所的成功。

en: They also sometimes focus on how we organize thoughts and information gathered from our environments into meaningful categories of thought , which will be discussed later .
zh: 他们有时也关注我们如何将从环境中收集的思想和信息组织成有意义的思维类别,这将进一步讨论。

en: The human nervous system is capable of handling endless streams of information .
zh: 人类神经系统能够处理无穷的信息流。

en: The senses serve as the interface between the mind and the external environment , receiving stimuli and translating it into nervous impulses that are transmitted to the brain .
zh: 感官是心灵与外部环境之间的接口,接收刺激并将其转化为神经冲动,然后传送到大脑。

en: The brain then processes this information and uses the relevant pieces to create thoughts , which can then be expressed through language or stored in memory for future use .
zh: 大脑然后处理这些信息,并利用相关部分来创造思想,然后通过语言表达或存储在记忆中,以便将来使用。

en: To make this process more complex , the brain does not gather information from external environments only .
zh: 为了使这一过程更加复杂,大脑不仅仅从外部环境中收集信息。

en: When thoughts are formed , the brain also pulls information from emotions and memories  .
zh: 当思想形成时,大脑也从情绪和记忆中提取信息。

en: Emotion and memory are powerful influences on both our thoughts and behaviors .
zh: 情感和记忆对我们的思想和行为都有强大的影响。

en: Sensations and information are received by our brains , filtered through emotions and memories , and processed to become thoughts .
zh: 感觉和信息被我们的大脑接收,通过情绪和记忆过滤,然后被处理成思想。

en: In order to organize this staggering amount of information , the brain has developed a file cabinet of sorts in the mind .
zh: 为了组织这一惊人的数量的信息,大脑在脑子里发展出各种文件柜。

en: The different files stored in the file cabinet are called concepts .
zh: 文件柜里存储的不同的文件叫做概念。

en: Concepts are categories or groupings of linguistic information , images , ideas , or memories , such as life experiences .
zh: 概念是语言信息 、 图像 、 思想 、 或记忆的类别或组分,如生活经历.

en: Concepts are , in many ways , big ideas that are generated by observing details , and categorizing and combining these details into cognitive structures .
zh: 概念是通过观察细节,将这些细节归类并结合起来形成认知结构的伟大思想。

en: You use concepts to see the relationships among the different elements of your experiences and to keep the information in your mind organized and accessible .
zh: 你使用概念来了解你的经验的不同元素之间的关系,并保持你脑中的信息有组织和易于访问。

en: Concepts are informed by our semantic memory  and are present in every aspect of our lives ; however , one of the easiest places to notice concepts is inside a classroom , where they are discussed explicitly .
zh: 概念是由我们的语义记忆所知,并且存在于我们生活的各个方面;然而,最容易注意到概念的地方之一是教室内,在那里它们被明确讨论。

en: When you study United States history , for example , you learn about more than just individual events that have happened in America ’s past .
zh: 比如,当你研究美国历史时,你会了解美国过去发生的不仅仅是个人事件。

en: You absorb a large quantity of information by listening to and participating in discussions , examining maps , and reading first - hand accounts of people ’s lives .
zh: 你通过倾听和参与讨论、检查地图和阅读人的生活实情来吸收大量的信息。

en: Your brain analyzes these details and develops an overall understanding of American history .
zh: 你的大脑对这些细节进行分析,并发展出对美国历史的全面理解。

en: In the process , your brain gathers details that inform and refine your understanding of related concepts like democracy , power , and freedom .
zh: 在这一过程中,你的大脑会收集信息,并精确地了解诸如民主、权力、自由等相关概念。

en: In psychology , for example , Piaget ’s stages of development are abstract concepts .
zh: 在心理学中, 例如, 皮雅格的发展阶段是抽象的概念.

en: Some concepts , like tolerance , are agreed upon by many people , because they have been used in various ways over many years .
zh: 一些概念,如容忍,是许多人同意的,因为它们在许多年中被用以不同的方式。

en: Other concepts , like the characteristics of your ideal friend or your family ’s birthday traditions , are personal and individualized .
zh: 其他概念,如理想朋友的特征或家庭的生日传统,都是个人的和个性化的。

en: In this way , concepts touch every aspect of our lives , from our many daily routines to the guiding principles behind the way governments function .
zh: 通过这种方式,概念涉及我们生活的各个方面,从我们许多日常的日常活动到政府运作背后的指导原则。

en: Another technique used by your brain to organize information is the identification of prototypes for the concepts you have developed .
zh: 你的大脑用来组织信息的另一个技术是识别你所开发的概念的原型。

en: For example , for the category of civil disobedience , your prototype could be Rosa Parks .
zh: 例如,对于公民不服从的类别,你的原型可以是罗莎公园。

en: Her peaceful resistance to segregation on a city bus in Montgomery , Alabama , is a recognizable example of civil disobedience .
zh: 在阿拉巴马州蒙哥马里市的公共汽车上,她和平地反对种族隔离,这是明显的公民不服从的例子。

en: Or your prototype could be Mohandas Gandhi , sometimes called Mahatma Gandhi   .
zh: 或者你的原型可能是莫哈纳达斯·甘地, 有时被称为马哈特马·甘地.

en: In 1930 , Mohandas Gandhi led a group in peaceful protest against a British tax on salt in India .
zh: 1930年,莫哈纳达斯·甘地领导了一个和平抗议英国对印度盐税的团体。

en: Mohandas Gandhi served as a nonviolent force for independence for India while simultaneously demanding that Buddhist , Hindu , Muslim , and Christian leaders — both Indian and British — collaborate peacefully .
zh: 穆罕默德·甘地作为印度独立的非暴力力量,同时要求印度和英国的佛教、印度教、穆斯林和基督教领导人和平合作。

en: Although he was not always successful in preventing violence around him , his life provides a steadfast example of the civil disobedience prototype  .
zh: 尽管他并不总是成功地防止他周围的暴力,但他的生活为公民不服从的原型提供了坚定的例子。

en: Just as concepts can be abstract or concrete , we can make a distinction between concepts that are functions of our direct experience with the world and those that are more artificial in nature .
zh: 正如概念可以抽象或具体一样,我们可以区分那些是我们与世界直接经验的函数的概念和那些在自然中更人工的概念。

en: Earlier in this chapter , we discussed Evernote , a company that focuses on expanding our memories by storing and organizing information .
zh: 在这个章节之前,我们讨论了Evernote公司,该公司致力于通过存储和组织信息来扩展我们的记忆。

en: Let ’s look at some other examples of entrepreneurial endeavors in specific industries to help you plan your own venture in your own industry .
zh: 让我们看看其他一些在特定行业内创业的例子,帮助您规划自己的事业。

en: In the agriculture industry , insects , weeds , weather conditions , and the challenges of harvesting crops are all ripe for entrepreneurial activities .
zh: 在农业行业中, 昆虫 、 杂草 、 气候条件以及收割作物的挑战都已成熟为企业活动.

en: The move toward organic produce has also affected this industry .
zh: 对有机产品的发展也影响到这个行业。

en: From an entrepreneurial perspective , what products could you invent to support both organic farming and the problems of insects that damage or destroy crops ?
zh: 从企业的角度来看,您能发明哪些产品来支持有机农业和破坏或破坏作物的昆虫问题?

en: The old method was to use chemical sprays to kill the insects , but today , the growing demand for organic foods and increased awareness of the impact of chemical sprays on our environment are changing this scenario .
zh: 传统的方法是用化学喷雾杀死昆虫,但如今,对有机食品的需求日益增加,对化学喷雾对环境的影响的意识日益增强,正在改变这一状况。

en: One new idea to solve this problem combines a vacuum cleaner with an agriculture product .
zh: 解决这一问题的一个新思路是将真空清洗器和农业产品结合起来。

en: Watch this video on the creation of a crop vacuum that sucks up insects and bugs to learn more .
zh: 看这个视频创建一个作物真空吸取昆虫和虫子学习更多。

en: A bug vacuum is an example of how using divergent thinking contributed to the solution of removing bugs from crops without using chemicals .
zh: 虫子真空是使用不同的思维如何有助于解决除虫子从作物中而不使用化学品的解决的一个例子。

en: In the group activity of creating divergent ideas , this idea may not have been received well .
zh: 在创造不同思想的集体活动中,这个想法可能没有得到很好的接受。

en: However , in the incubation stage , the idea must have come forward as a viable solution .
zh: 然而,在孵化阶段,这个想法必须成为可行的解决办法。

en: Entrepreneurs frequently face the challenge of pressure to conform to established habits and patterns within industries .
zh: 企业家经常面临着适应行业内既定的习惯和模式的压力。

en: Often , the entrepreneurial mindset includes futuristic ideas that shake up the normal , conventional processes that are grounded in experience over time .
zh: 企业家精神往往包括未来主义的观念,这些观念摇动了传统的传统过程,这些过程是基于时间的经历。

en: Tried - and - tested processes and products that have a proven history of success can be a formidable obstacle to new ideas .
zh: 经过考验的工艺和产品具有证明成功的历史,可以成为新思想的巨大障碍。

en: A new idea may even appear as impossible or outlandish , perhaps even an embarrassment to the steady and predictable practices established within an industry .
zh: 一种新想法甚至可能看起来是不可能的或异乎寻常的,甚至可能对行业内建立的稳固和可预见的惯例感到尴尬。

en: Sometimes , we must disregard our past successes and research to be open to new possibilities for success and failure .
zh: 有时,我们必须不顾过去的成功和研究,才能面对新的成功和失败的可能性。

en: An entrepreneurial mindset includes creativity , problem - solving skills , and a propensity to innovation . 23
zh: 企业家精神包括创造力 、 解决问题技巧和创新的倾向.

en: Open - mindedness is one characteristic that supports creativity , problem solving , and innovation .
zh: 开放精神是支持创造力 、 解决问题和创新的特征之一.

en: Taking the time to explore new ideas , dream , reflect , and view situations from a new perspective contribute to the entrepreneurial mindset .
zh: 花时间去探索新想法、梦想、反思、从新的角度看待情况,有助于企业精神。

en: Some innovations can lead to disruptions within the industry , or even create a new industry .
zh: 一些创新可以导致行业内部的混乱,甚至创造一个新的行业。

en: The innovator ’s dilemma was presented by Clayton Christensen to explain disruptive technology , which are technologies that , once introduced , displace established patterns , processes , and systems previously accepted as normal or accepted .
zh: 创新者困境由克莱顿·克里斯滕森(Clayton Christensen)提出,以解释 disruptive technology,即一旦引入,取代已确立的模式、过程和以前被接受为正常或接受的系统的技术。

en: One example of a disruptive technology is Airbnb , a company that threatens the established hotel industry by connecting personal resources to people who desire those resources .
zh: disruptive 技术的一个例子是 Airbnb, 它通过将个人资源连接到那些想要这些资源的人来威胁已建立的酒店行业。

en: If you have a spare bedroom that you are n’t using , why not sell that space to someone who wants and needs the space ?
zh: 如果你有一个没有用的备用卧室,为什么不把那个空间卖给需要和想要那个空间的人呢?

en: Airbnb has become a significant threat to the established hotel industry ’s business model of building large hotels and renting rooms within those hotels to their customers .
zh: Airbnb已成为对已建立的酒店行业建立大型酒店和在这些酒店内租客房间的商业模式的一个重大威胁。

en: Airbnb has reconfigured that model , and since its 2008 launch , 150 million travelers have taken advantage of 3 million Airbnb listings in more than 191 countries .
zh: Airbnb重新配置了这一模式,自其2008年推出以来,150亿游客已经利用了超过191个国家的300万Airbnb名单。

en: Airbnb has raised more than $ 3 billion  and is considering selling stocks to support significant expansion .
zh: Airbnb筹集了超过300亿美元,并正在考虑出售股票以支持大幅扩张。

en: The value of Airbnb is approximately $ 30 billion .
zh: Airbnb的价值约为30亿美元。

en: Compare this market value to Hilton ’s market capitalization of $ 19 billion and Marriott ’s of $ 35 billion .
zh: 这个市场价值与希尔顿的19亿美元市场资本化和 Marriott的35亿美元市场资本化相比。

en: If you were the CEO of Hilton or Marriott , would you be worried ?
zh: 如果你是希尔顿或 Marriott的首席执行官, 你会担心 吗?

en: The hotel industry recognized Airbnb as a threat , and in 2016 , began a campaign to create legislation to rein in Airbnb ’s growth and popularity .
zh: 酒店业认识到Airbnb是一个威胁,2016年,开始制定立法来遏制Airbnb的增长和普及。

en: From the hotel industry ’s perspective , Airbnb is not playing by the same rules .
zh: 从酒店业的角度来看, Airbnb并不是按照同样的规则进行游戏。

en: This is the definition of disruptive technology , the focus on creating a new idea or process that negates or challenges established process or products . 24
zh: 这就是 disruptive technology 的定义,重点在于创造一种否定或挑战已建立的过程或产品的新观念或过程。

en: Sometimes disruptive technologies result from not listening to customers .
zh: 有时候 disruptive技术是由于不倾听顾客的结果。

en: Customers do n’t always know what they want .
zh: 顾客并不总是知道他们想要什么。

en: Customer groups might need to be redefined by the entrepreneurial team on the basis of better models , knowing when to invest in developing lower - performance products that promise lower margins while still satisfying the need , and knowing when to pursue small markets at the expense of larger or established markets .
zh: 企业团队可能需要根据更好的模式重新定义客户群,知道什么时候投资开发低性能产品,保证较低的利润率,同时满足需求,以及知道什么时候以较大或已建立的市场为代价追求小市场。

en: Basically , disruptive technologies occur through identifying new and valuable processes and products .
zh: 从根本上讲, disruptive技术通过识别新的和有价值的工艺和产品来产生。

en: The founders of Airbnb recognized that some people have unused resources , bedrooms , that other people need .
zh: Airbnb的创始人认识到一些人没有使用资源,有卧室,其他人需要。

en: We can apply this idea to other unused resources such as vehicles and motor homes .
zh: 我们可以把这个想法应用到其他未使用的资源,如汽车和摩托车。

en: We see this model reproduced in short - term car rental and bike - sharing programs .
zh: 我们看到这种模式在短期的汽车租赁和自行车共享方案中得到复制.

en: So far , we have covered how evolutionary ethics relates to the question what we ought to do and why we are moral in the first place .
zh: 迄今为止,我们已经论述了进化伦理如何与我们应该做什么和为什么我们首先是道德的有关的问题。

en: A related set of questions about ethics are metaethical questions , which concern the meaning of moral terms , our ways of gaining knowledge of moral facts , and the nature of the moral facts .
zh: 有关伦理的一系列问题是关于道德术语的含义、我们如何获取道德事实的知识以及道德事实的性质的非伦理问题。

en: Many books and articles in moral philosophy start with the observation that moral judgments seem to be objectively true and the assumption that this is how non-philosophers also think about morality .
zh: 许多道德哲学的书籍和文章从道德判断似乎是客观的事实和非哲学者对道德的看法的假设开始。

en: But as we have seen above , evolutionary theory explains why we would think that moral judgments are objective .
zh: 但正如我们上面所看到的,进化理论解释了为什么我们认为道德判断是客观的。

en: The philosopher Michael Ruse takes this to show that the apparent objectivity of morality is something like an “ illusion ” foisted on us by our genes  .
zh: 哲学家迈克尔·鲁斯(Michael Ruse)认为,这表明道德的表面客观性是某种“幻觉 ”,这种幻觉被我们的基因所摧毁。

en: Of course , even if Ruse is correct , this does not show that moral judgments are not objective , but it can make us think whether the objectivity of morality really has to be explained , as many philosophers assume .
zh: 当然,即使鲁斯是对的,这并不表明道德判断不是客观的,但它可以让我们思考道德的客观性是否真的需要解释,正如许多哲学家所假设的。

en: Ruse has also argued that an evolutionary account of morality suggests that there are no moral facts in the first place .
zh: 鲁斯还指出,一个进化论的道德论证表明,从一开始就不存在道德事实。

en: Anything we want to explain about morality can be explained without mentioning moral facts , or so Ruse argues .
zh: 任何我们想解释道德的事物都可以解释,而不提及道德事实,或者是鲁斯认为的。

en: If moral facts are explanatorily redundant , indeed , moral realists  need to say why we should still suppose that moral facts do exist .
zh: 如果道德事实是显而易见的冗余,事实上,道德现实主义者需要说为什么我们仍应该假设道德事实确实存在。

en: Interestingly , Ruse ’s methodological naturalism leads him to embrace a view that goes against the metaphysical naturalist position that moral facts exist .
zh: 有趣的是,鲁斯的方法论自然主义使他接受了反对道德事实的隐形自然主义立场的观点。

en: Relatedly , Sharon Street , for example , argues that evolutionary explanations of morality show that moral realism is probably false .
zh: 类似地, 例如, 沙龙街认为,道德的进化解释表明道德现实主义可能是错误的.

en: The kind of moral realism that Street has in mind is the view that moral properties exist as objective features of the world  .
zh: 街头思想中的道德现实主义是认为道德属性的存在是世界客观特征。

en: Street starts with the premise that our moral judgments are influenced by evolutionary forces .
zh: 街头始于我们道德判断受到进化力量的影响的前提。

en: This fact , Street claims , gives rise to a dilemma for moral realists concerning the relation of the evolutionary forces that influenced our moral judgments and the moral facts claimed to exist by moral realists .
zh: 史特里特(Street)称,这一事实给道德现实主义者造成了一个困境,即影响我们道德判断的进化力量与道德现实主义者声称存在的道德事实的关系。

en: If there is no relation between the evolutionary forces and the moral facts , then it would be an astonishing coincidence if many of our moral judgments were true .
zh: 如果进化力量与道德事实之间没有关系,那么如果我们的许多道德判断是正确的,那将是一个令人惊奇的巧合。

en: In light of the coincidence , we have no reason to assume that our moral judgments are true — an unpalatable conclusion for realists .
zh: 鉴于这一巧合,我们没有理由假定我们的道德判断是正确的 — — 对于现实主义者来说,这是一个令人厌恶的结论。

en: Claiming that there is a relation , however , is empirically dubious , according to Street .
zh: 然而,根据史特里特的说法,声称存在关系是经验上令人怀疑的。

en: Mirroring Ruse ’s claim , moral facts could be purged from what we assume to exist because they do not perform an important explanatory function .
zh: 按照鲁斯的说法,道德事实可以从我们认为存在的东西中除去,因为它们没有发挥重要的解释作用。

en: So , we should reject moral realism .
zh: 因此,我们应该拒绝道德现实主义。

en: Street ’s argument illustrates how evolutionary theory can be used to make a case about which metaethical theories we should adopt .
zh: 斯特里特的论点说明了如何利用进化理论来论证我们应该采用哪种神学理论。

en: Both Ruse ’s and Street ’s arguments rely on the idea that we should only accept that something exists if it plays an indispensable explanatory role and there are means to resist these arguments .
zh: 鲁斯和斯特里特的论点都是基于我们只应该接受某物的存在,如果它发挥了不可缺少的解释作用,并且有办法抵制这些论点。

en: Both arguments , as presented here , rely on the correctness of the evolutionary explanation of morality they convey .
zh: 这两个论点,正如这里所提出的,都依赖于它们所传达的道德的进化解释的正确性。

en: In the next section , we turn to the relevance of evolutionary ethics for moral epistemology .
zh: 接下来,我们讨论了进化伦理对道德认识学的关联性。

en: The evolutionary argument by Sharon Street can also be interpreted as an argument about moral justification and moral knowledge .
zh: 沙龙街的演化论点也可以解释为关于道德合理性和道德知识的论点。

en: Suppose that moral realists assume that there is no relation between our moral judgments and the moral facts .
zh: 假设道德现实主义者认为我们的道德判断与道德事实之间没有关系。

en: It would seem like an incredible coincidence if the realists were right that our moral judgments are nonetheless true .
zh: 如果现实主义者正确地认为我们的道德判断是正确的,那似乎是一个不可思议的巧合。

en: There are just too many possible moral truths and too many ways in which evolution could have “ pushed ” our moral beliefs .
zh: 只有太多的可能的道德真理和太多的进化方法可以“推”我们的道德信念。

en: Street claims that such a coincidence would be too much to believe .
zh: 街头声称这样的巧合是难以置信的。

en: Depending on how we understand “ coincidence , ” my belief that there is a bird outside my window is coincidentally true because had I looked a little later , the bird would have flown away already .
zh: 取决于我们如何理解“巧合 ”, 我相信我的窗外有一只鸟是巧合的,因为如果我稍后看看,那只鸟已经飞走了。

en: Accidentally true beliefs do not seem problematic in every case .
zh: 巧合的真信在每一个情况下都不显得有问题。

en: The question for proponents of Street ’s argument is to show why the evolutionary influence on human moral beliefs makes for a particularly problematic case of coincidence .
zh: 史特里特的论点的支持者们的问题是,为什么进化对人类道德信仰的影响使得一个特别棘手的巧合案例。

en: The philosopher Richard Joyce argues that the problem has to do with the sensitivity of our moral beliefs to the moral facts  .
zh: 哲学家理查德·乔伊斯(Richard Joyce)认为这个问题与我们道德信仰对道德事实的敏感性有关。

en: Given that our moral beliefs are influenced by evolutionary forces , and not by the moral facts , our moral beliefs would be the same even if the moral facts would change .
zh: 鉴于我们的道德信念受到进化力量的影响,而不是道德事实的影响,即使道德事实改变,我们的道德信念也会保持不变。

en: But because we should not hold on to such insensitive beliefs , evolutionary explanations of morality show that our moral beliefs are unjustified  .
zh: 但由于我们不应该坚持这种不敏感的信念,进化解释道德表明我们的道德信念是不正当的。

en: It is not clear , however , whether and why evolutionary explanations of morality reveal something about our moral beliefs that is particularly troubling from an epistemological perspective .
zh: 然而,对于道德的进化解释是否和为什么揭示了我们道德信仰的某些问题,从认识论的角度来看,这并不明确。

en: The impact of evolutionary ethics on epistemological questions depends on these deeper questions about epistemology .
zh: 进化伦理对认识论问题的影响取决于认识论的这些更深的问题。

en: Evolutionary explanations of morality , however , provide us with a useful starting point for thinking about these questions .
zh: 然而,道德的进化解释为我们思考这些问题提供了有益的起点。

en: See Klenk  .
zh: 参见克伦克。

en: Evolutionary ethics has helped us to get a much clearer sense of where the human moral sense is coming from .
zh: 进化伦理学帮助我们更清楚地了解人类道德观念的起源。

en: While this is a far cry from revealing to us what we ought to do , the research program seems full of promise nonetheless .
zh: 尽管这远远没有告诉我们应该做什么,但这项研究计划似乎充满希望。

en: Once we get into the details , we can see that it also raises deep theoretical questions about evolutionary explanations , the relation of descriptive and normative claims , the epistemology of justification and truth , and the general viability of naturalism in ethics .
zh: 一旦进入细节,我们可以看到它也引发了关于进化解释、描述性和规范性主张的关系、正当性和真理的认识论以及自然主义在伦理学中普遍的可行性的深层次理论问题。

en: Much left to wonder , then , but with some ideas about where to get our answers .
zh: 还有许多值得怀疑的问题,但还有一些关于如何得到答案的想法。

en: The government of the United States can best be described as a republic , or representative democracy .
zh: 美国政府最适合形容为共和国或代表民主。

en: A democracy is a government in which political power — influence over institutions , leaders , and policies — rests in the hands of the people .
zh: 民主是政治权力 — — 对机构、领导人和政策的影响 — — 在人民手中的政府。

en: In a representative democracy , however , the citizens do not govern directly .
zh: 然而,在代表性民主国家里,公民并不直接治理。

en: Instead , they elect representatives to make decisions and pass laws on behalf of all the people .
zh: 相反,他们选出代表以代表全体人民作出决定和通过法律。

en: Thus , U.S. citizens vote for members of Congress , the president and vice president , members of state legislatures , governors , mayors , and members of town councils and school boards to act on their behalf .
zh: 因此,美国公民投票选出国会议员、总统和副总统、州议会议员、州长、市长、市议会和学校委员会成员来代表他们。

en: the opinions of the majority of the people have more influence with government than those of the minority .
zh: 大多数人的意见对政府的影响比少数人的影响更大。

en: If the number of elected representatives who favor a proposed law is greater than those who oppose it , the law will be enacted .
zh: 如果选出的代表赞成拟议的法律人数比反对的人数多,则该法律将被颁布。

en: However , in representative governments like the United States , minority rights are protected : people can not be deprived of certain rights even if an overwhelming number of people think that they should be .
zh: 然而,在像美国这样的代表政府中,少数人的权利受到保护:即使绝大多数人认为他们应该享有某些权利,他们也不能被剥夺。

en: For example , let ’s say American society decided that atheists , people who do not believe that God exists , were evil and should be imprisoned or expelled from the country .
zh: 例如,美国社会认为无神论者,那些不相信上帝的存在的人,是邪恶的,应该被关押或驱逐出美国。

en: Even though atheists only account for about 7 percent of the population , they would be protected due to minority rights . 4
zh: 即使无神论者占人口的约7%,他们也会因少数人的权利而受到保护

en: Even though the number of Americans who believe in God far outweighs the number who do not , the minority is still protected .
zh: 尽管美国人相信上帝的人数远远超过那些不相信上帝的人数,但少数人仍然受到保护。

en: Because decisions are made through majority rule , making your opinions known and voting for those men and women who make decisions that affect all of us are critical and influential forms of civic engagement in a representative democracy such as the United States .
zh: 因为决策是通过多数制作出的,让你的意见得到人们知晓,并为那些影响我们所有人的决策者投票是公民参与美国这样的代表性民主的重要和有影响力的形式。

en: In a direct democracy , unlike representative democracy , people participate directly in making government decisions .
zh: 在直接民主中,与代表民主不同,人民直接参与政府决策。

en: For example , in ancient Athens , the most famous example of a direct democracy , all male citizens were allowed to attend meetings of the Assembly .
zh: 例如,在古代雅典,最著名的直接民主的例子,所有男性公民都允许参加大会的会议。

en: Here they debated and voted for or against all proposed laws .
zh: 他们在这里辩论和投票赞成或反对所有提议的法律。

en: Although neither the federal government nor any of the state governments function as a direct democracy — the Constitution requires the national and state governments to be representative forms of government — some elements of direct democracy do exist in the United States .
zh: 尽管联邦政府和任何州政府都不是直接民主 — — 《宪法》要求国家和州政府是代表性的政府形式 — — 但美国的某些直接民主因素确实存在。

en: While residents of the different states vote for people to represent them and to make laws in their behalf in the state legislatures and in Congress , people may still directly vote on certain issues .
zh: 不同州的居民在州议会和国会中投票代表他们并为他们制定法律时,人们仍然可以直接投票某些问题。

en: For example , a referendum or proposed law might be placed on the ballot for citizens to vote on directly during state or local elections instead of leaving the matter in the hands of the state legislature .
zh: 例如,公民可以在州选举或地方选举中直接投票,而不是把问题交给州议会。

en: At New England town meetings , all residents are allowed to debate decisions affecting the town  .
zh: 在新英格兰的城镇会议上,所有居民都允许讨论影响城镇的决定。

en: Such occasions provide additional opportunities for civic engagement .
zh: 这些 机会 为 公民 参与 提供 更多 机会 。

en: Residents of Boxborough , Massachusetts , gather in a local hotel to discuss issues affecting their town .
zh: 马萨诸塞州的Boxborough居民聚集在一个当地的旅馆讨论影响他们的城市的问题。

en: New England town meetings provide an opportunity for people to experience direct democracy .
zh: 新英格兰的城镇会议为人们体验直接民主提供了机会。

en: This tradition has lasted for hundreds of years .
zh: 这种传统已有数百年了。

en: Most countries now have some form of representative government  . 5
zh: 大多数国家现在都有某种形式的代表政府

en: At the other end of the political spectrum are elite - driven forms of government .
zh: 政治的另一端是精英驱动的政府形式.

en: Although the power of some monarchs is limited by law , and such kings and queens often rule along with an elected legislature that makes laws for the country , this is not always the case .
zh: 尽管某些君主的权力受到法律限制,而且这些国王和王后经常与一个为国家制定法律的选举立法机构一起统治,但这并不总是如此。

en: Many southwest Asian kingdoms , such as Saudi Arabia , Qatar , and the United Arab Emirates , have absolute monarchs whose power is unrestricted .
zh: 许多东南亚的王国,如沙特阿拉伯、卡塔尔和阿拉伯联合酋长国,都有绝对君主,他们的权力不受限制。

en: As discussed earlier , another nondemocratic form of government is oligarchy , in which a handful of elite members of society , often those who belong to a particular political party , hold all political power .
zh: 正如前面所讨论的那样,另一个非民主形式的政府是寡头政权,在寡头政权中,少数社会精英成员,往往属于某一特定政党,拥有全部政治权力。

en: For example , in Cuba , as in China , only members of the Communist Party are allowed to vote or hold public office , and the party ’s most important members make all government decisions .
zh: 例如,古巴和中国一样,只有共产党的成员可以投票或担任公共职务,而党的最重要的成员作出所有政府决策。

en: Some nondemocratic societies are totalitarian in nature .
zh: 有些非民主社会具有极权主义的性质。

en: Under totalitarianism , the government is more important than the citizens , and it controls all aspects of citizens ’ lives .
zh: 在 totalitarianism下,政府比公民更重要,它控制着公民生活的各个方面。

en: Citizens ’ rights are limited , and the government does not allow political criticism or opposition .
zh: 公民的权利有限,政府不允许政治批评或反对。

en: These forms of government are fairly rare .
zh: 这种政府形式相当罕见。

en: North Korea is an example of a totalitarian government .
zh: 朝鲜是一个 totalitarian政府的例子。

en: The map of the world shows the different forms of government that currently exist .
zh: 世界地图显示现存的各种政府形式。

en: Countries that are colored blue have some form of representative democracy , although the people may not have as much political power as they do in the United States .
zh: 蓝色的国有某种形式的代表性民主,尽管人民可能没有像美国那样的政治权力。

en: Countries that are colored red , like China , Vietnam , and Cuba , have an oligarchic form of government .
zh: 红色的国家,如中国、越南和古巴,具有极权形式的政府。

en: Countries that are colored yellow are monarchies where the people play little part in governing .
zh: 黄色的国家是君主制国家,人民在统治中扮演着很小的角色。

en: The CIA website provides information about the types of government across the world .
zh: 中央情报局的网站提供有关世界各地的政府类型的信息。

en: How do different types of motivation affect my learning ?
zh: 不同类型的动机如何影响我的学习?

en: How can I apply the Uses and Gratification Theory to make decisions about my learning ?
zh: 如何应用使用与满意理论来决定我的学习?

en: In this section , you will continue to increase your ability as an informed learner .
zh: 在这一节中,你将继续提高你作为有知识的学习者的能力。

en: Here you will explore how much of an influence motivation has on learning , as well as how to use motivation to purposefully take an active role in any learning activity .
zh: 在这里,你将探索动机对学习的影响有多大,以及如何利用动机以有意地在任何学习活动中发挥积极作用。

en: Rather than passively attempting to absorb new information , you will learn how to make conscious decisions about the methods of learning you will use  , how you will select and use learning materials that are appropriate for your needs , and how persistent you will be in the learning activity .
zh: 而不是被动地尝试吸收新信息,你将学会如何consciously作出关于你所使用的学习方法的决定,如何选择和使用适合你的需要的学习材料,以及你将如何坚持学习活动。

en: There are three main motivation concepts that have been found to directly relate to learning .
zh: 有三个主要的动机概念被发现直接与学习有关。
