en: Each of these has been proven to mean the difference between success and failure .
zh: 这些都证明了成功与失败之间的区别。

en: You will find that each of these is a strong tool that will enable you to engage with learning material in a way that not only suits your needs , but also gives you ownership over your own learning processes .
zh: 你会发现,这些都是一个强有力的工具,它能使你不仅适合你的需要,而且让你拥有自己的学习过程。

en: While much of this chapter will cover very specific aspects about the act of learning , in this section , we will present different information that may at first seem unrelated .
zh: 虽然本章的大部分内容将涉及学习行为的非常具体方面,但在本节中,我们将介绍与学习行为有关的不同信息。

en: Some people would consider it more of a personal outlook than a learning practice , and yet it has a significant influence on the ability to learn .
zh: 有些人会认为这是一种个人的见解,而不是一种学习的实践,然而它对学习的能力有很大影响。

en: Grit can be defined as personal perseverance toward a task or goal .
zh: 毅力可以被定义为个人坚持工作或目标。

en: In learning , it can be thought of as a trait that drives a person to keep trying until they succeed .
zh: 在学习中,它可以被看作是驱使一个人继续努力直到成功的一个特质。

en: It is not tied to talent or ability , but is simply a tendency to not give up until something is finished or accomplished .
zh: 它不是与天赋或能力有关的,而是只是一种不放弃直到完成或完成的事情的倾向。

en: U.S. Army veteran and captain of the U.S. Invictus team , Will Reynolds , races to the finish line .
zh: 美国陆军退役军人和美国Invictus队的队长威尔·雷诺兹 races to the finish line.

en: The study showed that grit and perseverance were better predictors of academic success and achievement than talent or IQ .
zh: 研究表明,毅力和毅力比天赋或智商更能预测学术成功和成就。

en: This personality trait was defined as “ grit ” by the psychologist Angela Duckworth . 1
zh: 心理学家安吉拉·杜克沃思(Angela Duckworth)将这种个性特征定义为“耐力 ”

en: In a 2007 study Duckworth and colleagues found that individuals with high grit were able to maintain motivation in learning tasks despite failures .
zh: 在2007年的一项研究中,杜克沃思和他的同事发现,有很强的毅力的人能够保持学习任务的动机,尽管失败。

en: The study examined a cross section of learning environments , such as GPA scores in Ivy League universities , dropout rates at West Point , rankings in the National Spelling Bee , and general educational attainment for adults .
zh: 该研究研究了不同类型的学习环境,例如Ivy League大学的GPA分数、西点的辍学率、国家拼写 Bee的排名和成人的一般教育成绩。

en: What the results showed was that grit and perseverance were better predictors of academic success and achievement than talent or IQ .
zh: 结果表明,毅力和毅力比天赋或智商更能预测学术成功和成就。

en: The concept of grit is an easy one to dismiss as something taken for granted .
zh: 宽容的观念很容易被当作是理所当然的。

en: In our culture , we have a number of sayings and aphorisms that capture the essence of grit : “ If at first you do not succeed , try , try again , ” or the famous quote by Thomas Edison : “ Genius is one percent inspiration , ninety - nine percent perspiration . ”
zh: 在我们的文化中, 我们有许多说法和寓言,它们抓住了勇气的本质: “ 如果你一开始就失败, 试着, 再试一次, ” 或者托马斯·爱迪生 famous quote by Thomas Edison: “ 天才是百分之一的灵感, 百分之九十的汗水. ”

en: The problem is we all understand the concept , but actually applying it takes work .
zh: 问题是,我们都了解这个概念,但实际应用起来需要工作。

en: If the task we are trying to complete is a difficult one , it can take a lot of work .
zh: 如果我们想完成的任务是困难的,那可能需要很多工作。

en: With this attitude comes an acceptance that you may not succeed on the first attempt — or the nineteenth attempt .
zh: 有了这种态度,人们会接受你可能在第一次尝试 — — 或者十九次尝试 — — 中没有成功。

en: Failed attempts are viewed as merely part of the process and seen as a very useful way to gain knowledge that moves you toward success .
zh: 失败的尝试被看作只是过程的一部分,并且被看作是获得你走向成功的知识的非常有用的途径。

en: In your first attempt at studying you simply reread the chapters of your textbook covered in the exam .
zh: 在你第一次尝试学习时,你只是重新阅读考试所涵盖的课本的章节。

en: You find that while this reinforces some of the knowledge you have gained , it does not ensure you have all the information you will need to do well on the test .
zh: 你会发现,虽然这加强了你所获得的知识,但这并不保证你有所有你需要在测试中做好的信息。

en: You know that if you simply read the chapters yet again , there is no guarantee you are going to be any more successful .
zh: 你知道,如果你只是再读一遍章节,就没有什么保证你将更成功。

en: You determine that you need to find a different approach .
zh: 你确定你需要找到一种不同的方法。

en: In other words , your first attempt was not a complete failure , but it did not achieve the end goal , so you try again with a different method .
zh: 换句话说,你的第一次尝试不是完全失败的,但它没有达到最终目标,所以你再用另一种方法尝试。

en: On your second try , you copy down all of the main points onto a piece of paper using the section headlines from the chapters .
zh: 在第二次尝试时,您将所有主要的点复制到一张纸上,使用各章节的标题。

en: After a short break you come back to your list and write down a summary of what you know about each item on your list .
zh: 在短暂的休息之后,你回到你的清单上,并写下关于你的清单上的每个项目所知道的摘要。

en: This accomplishes two things : first , you are able to immediately spot areas where you need to learn more , and second , you can check your summaries against the text to make certain what you know is correct and adequate .
zh: 这可以完成两件事:首先,你可以立即发现你需要学习的领域,其次,你可以对文本进行总结,以确定你所知道的是对的和恰当的。

en: In this example , while you may not have yet achieved complete success , you will have learned what you need to do next .
zh: 在这个例子中,虽然你还没有取得完全成功,但你已经学会了你下一步需要做的事情。

en: In true grit fashion , for your next try , you study those items on your list where you found you needed a bit more information , and then you go through your list again .
zh: 用真正的勇气的方式,在下一次尝试时,你研究一下你的清单上的那些项目,你发现你需要更多的信息,然后你再看一遍你的清单。

en: This time you are able to write down summaries of all the important points , and you are confident you have the knowledge you need to do well on the exam .
zh: 这次你能够写下所有重要点的总结,并且你自信你掌握了你需要在考试上做好的知识。

en: After this , you still do not stop , but instead you change your approach to use other methods that keep what you have learned fresh in your mind .
zh: 在此之后,你仍然不会停止,而是改变你的方法,使用其他方法来保持你所学到的新鲜感。

en: Locate on a map the major American civilizations before the arrival of the Spanish
zh: 在西班牙人到达之前,在地图上找到主要的美国文明

en: Discuss the cultural achievements of these civilizations
zh: 讨论这些文明的文化成就

en: Discuss the differences and similarities between lifestyles , religious practices , and customs among the native peoples
zh: 讨论土著人民生活方式、宗教习俗和习俗之间的差异和相似之处

en: Some scholars believe that between nine and fifteen thousand years ago , a land bridge existed between Asia and North America that we now call Beringia .
zh: 一些学者认为,九至十五千年前,亚洲和北美洲之间存在着一座陆桥,现在我们称之为伯明尼亚。

en: The first inhabitants of what would be named the Americas migrated across this bridge in search of food .
zh: 最早的美国人迁移过这座桥,寻找食物。

en: Later settlers came by boat across the narrow strait .
zh: 后来,移民们乘船穿过狭窄的海峡。

en: Continually moving southward , the settlers eventually populated both North and South America , creating unique cultures that ranged from the highly complex and urban Aztec civilization in what is now Mexico City to the woodland tribes of eastern North America .
zh: 这些移民不断向南移动,最终居住在北美和南美洲,创造了独特的文化,从现在墨西哥城的高度复杂的城市亚兹特克文明到北美洲东部的森林部落。

en: Recent research along the west coast of South America suggests that migrant populations may have traveled down this coast by water as well as by land .
zh: 最近在南美洲西海岸进行的研究表明,移民可能通过水路和陆路沿着该海岸旅行。

en: Researchers believe that about ten thousand years ago , humans also began the domestication of plants and animals , adding agriculture as a means of sustenance to hunting and gathering techniques .
zh: 研究人员认为,大约一千年前,人类也开始驯化植物和动物,并把农业作为一种供养手段加入了狩猎和采集技术。

en: With this agricultural revolution , and the more abundant and reliable food supplies it brought , populations grew and people were able to develop a more settled way of life , building permanent settlements .
zh: 随着农业革命的发生,粮食供应的日益丰富和可靠,人口的增长,人们得以发展更稳定的生活方式,建立永久性居民点。

en: Nowhere in the Americas was this more obvious than in Mesoamerica  .
zh: 在美国,这比美洲更明显。

en: This map shows the extent of the major civilizations of the Western Hemisphere .
zh: 这个地图显示了西半球主要文明的范围。

en: In South America , early civilizations developed along the coast because the high Andes and the inhospitable Amazon Basin made the interior of the continent less favorable for settlement .
zh: 在南美洲,早期文明沿海岸发展,因为安第斯山脉高处和荒凉的亚马逊盆地使得大陆内部的定居环境不那么有利。

en: Although marked by great topographic , linguistic , and cultural diversity , this region cradled a number of civilizations with similar characteristics .
zh: 这个地区虽然具有巨大的地形 、 语言和文化多样性,但有着相似的特征的许多文明.

en: Mesoamericans were polytheistic ; their gods possessed both male and female traits and demanded blood sacrifices of enemies taken in battle or ritual bloodletting .
zh: 美西亚人是多神论者,他们的神都具有男性和女性的特质,要求敌人在战斗或仪式中献血。

en: Corn , or maize , domesticated by 5000 BCE , formed the basis of their diet .
zh: 玉米是公元前5000年被驯养的,是他们饮食的基础。

en: They developed a mathematical system , built huge edifices , and devised a calendar that accurately predicted eclipses and solstices and that priest - astronomers used to direct the planting and harvesting of crops .
zh: 他们开发了数学系统, 建造了巨大的建筑物, 并设计了一个准确预测日食和日光的日历,使祭司天文学家能够指导作物的种植和收获.

en: Most important for our knowledge of these peoples , they created the only known written language in the Western Hemisphere ; researchers have made much progress in interpreting the inscriptions on their temples and pyramids .
zh: 对这些民族的了解最为重要的是,他们创造了西半球唯一已知的书面语言;研究者在解释他们的寺庙和金字塔上的铭文方面取得了很大的进步。

en: Though the area had no overarching political structure , trade over long distances helped diffuse culture .
zh: 虽然该地区没有全面的政治结构,但远距离贸易有助于传播文化。

en: Weapons made of obsidian , jewelry crafted from jade , feathers woven into clothing and ornaments , and cacao beans that were whipped into a chocolate drink formed the basis of commerce .
zh: 用俄西迪安制成的武器,用玉制成的珠宝,用羽毛织成衣服和装饰品,用巧克力制成的椰子豆构成了商业的基础。

en: The mother of Mesoamerican cultures was the Olmec civilization .
zh: 美洲文化之母是奥尔梅克文明。

en: Flourishing along the hot Gulf Coast of Mexico from about 1200 to about 400 BCE , the Olmec produced a number of major works of art , architecture , pottery , and sculpture .
zh: 从公元前1200年到公元前400年,奥尔梅克沿热带墨西哥湾海岸兴起,产生了许多重要的艺术、建筑、陶器和雕塑作品。

en: Most recognizable are their giant head sculptures  and the pyramid in La Venta .
zh: 最明显的是他们的巨大头像和拉温塔的金字塔。

en: The Olmec built aqueducts to transport water into their cities and irrigate their fields .
zh: 奥尔梅克人建造了水道,将水运到他们的城市和灌溉他们的田地。

en: They grew maize , squash , beans , and tomatoes .
zh: 他们种植玉米 、  squash 、 豆类和番茄.

en: They also bred small domesticated dogs which , along with fish , provided their protein .
zh: 他们还饲养了小型驯养的狗,它们与鱼一起提供蛋白质。

en: Although no one knows what happened to the Olmec after about 400 BCE , in part because the jungle reclaimed many of their cities , their culture was the base upon which the Maya and the Aztec built .
zh: 尽管没有人知道在公元前400年左右,奥尔梅克人发生了什么事,部分原因是丛林夺回了他们的许多城市,他们的文化是玛雅人和亚兹特克人建立的基础。

en: The Olmec also developed a system of trade throughout Mesoamerica , giving rise to an elite class .
zh: 奥尔梅克在整个美索美洲发展了一个贸易体系,形成了精英阶层。

en: The Olmec carved heads from giant boulders that ranged from four to eleven feet in height and could weigh up to fifty tons .
zh: 奥尔梅克雕刻的头来自巨大的岩石,高达4到11英尺,重量可达50吨。

en: All these figures have flat noses , slightly crossed eyes , and large lips .
zh: 这些人物的鼻子平坦,眼睛略有交叉,嘴唇大。

en: These physical features can be seen today in some of the peoples indigenous to the area .
zh: 这些物理特征在今天可以看到一些当地土著人。

en: After the decline of the Olmec , a city rose in the fertile central highlands of Mesoamerica .
zh: 在奥尔梅克山的衰落后, 一个城市在美索美洲的肥沃的中部高原上兴起.

en: One of the largest population centers in pre-Columbian America and home to more than 100,000 people at its height in about 500 CE , Teotihuacan was located about thirty miles northeast of modern Mexico City .
zh: 是哥倫比亞前美洲最大的人口中心之一,在公元前500年高地居住了超過100,000人,位於現代墨西哥城東北約30英里處。

en: The ethnicity of this settlement ’s inhabitants is debated ; some scholars believe it was a multiethnic city .
zh: 这个定居点的居民的种族问题是争论的,一些学者认为它是多种族的城市。

en: Large - scale agriculture and the resultant abundance of food allowed time for people to develop special trades and skills other than farming .
zh: 大规模农业和由此产生的食品的丰富,使人们有时间发展非农业的特殊行业和技能。

en: Among these were the Pyramid of the Sun  and the Pyramid of the Moon  .
zh: 其中有太阳的金字塔和月亮的金字塔。

en: Near the Temple of the Feathered Serpent , graves have been uncovered that suggest humans were sacrificed for religious purposes .
zh: 神庙附近发现有墓穴,显示人类为宗教目的牺牲。

en: The city was also the center for trade , which extended to settlements on Mesoamerica ’s Gulf Coast .
zh: 该市也是贸易中心,扩展到墨西哥湾海岸的居民点。

en: The Maya ’s architectural and mathematical contributions were significant .
zh: 玛雅的建筑和数学贡献是显著的。

en: They devised a written mathematical system to record crop yields and the size of the population , and to assist in trade .
zh: 他们设计了一种书面的数学系统来记录作物产量和人口的大小,并协助贸易。

en: Surrounded by farms relying on primitive agriculture , they built the city - states of Copan , Tikal , and Chichen Itza along their major trade routes , as well as temples , statues of gods , pyramids , and astronomical observatories  .
zh: 他们围绕着依靠原始农业的农场,沿着主要的贸易路线建造了哥本、蒂卡尔和奇琴伊兹,以及庙宇、神像、金字塔和天文台。

en: However , because of poor soil and a drought that lasted nearly two centuries , their civilization declined by about 900 CE and they abandoned their large population centers .
zh: 然而,由于贫穷的土壤和持续近两个世纪的干旱,他们的文明在公元前900年左右衰落,他们放弃了他们庞大的人口中心。

en: El Castillo , located at Chichen Itza in the eastern Yucatán peninsula , served as a temple for the god Kukulkan .
zh: 位于尤卡坦半岛东部的奇钦伊扎(Chichen Itza)的埃尔卡斯蒂奥(El Castillo)是库库尔坎神庙。

en: Each side contains ninety - one steps to the top .
zh: 每个侧面都有九十一步往顶部.

en: When counting the top platform , the total number of stairs is three hundred and sixty - five , the number of days in a year .
zh: 在计算顶台时, 楼梯总数为三百六十五, 一年的日数.

en: The Spanish found little organized resistance among the weakened Maya upon their arrival in the 1520s .
zh: 西班牙人在1520年代到达后,在弱势的玛雅人中间很少有组织抵抗。

en: However , they did find Mayan history , in the form of glyphs , or pictures representing words , recorded in folding books called codices  .
zh: 然而,他们确实发现了玛雅历史,以字体的形式,或代表词的图片,记载在折叠书中,称为代码。

en: In 1562 , Bishop Diego de Landa , who feared the converted natives had reverted to their traditional religious practices , collected and burned every codex he could find .
zh: 在1562年,教宗迪戈·德·兰达(Diego de Landa)担心被皈依的土著人已经回到了他们的传统宗教习俗,他搜集并烧毁了他所能找到的所有典籍。

en: Today only a few survive .
zh: 现在只有少数人幸存。

en: 2. Which culture developed the first writing system in the Western Hemisphere ?
zh: 2.西半球的哪一种文化发展出第一个写字系统?

en: When we divide and subdivide the tasks involved with producing a good or service , workers and businesses can produce a greater quantity of output .
zh: 当我们分担和分担生产商品或服务的任务时,工人和企业可以生产更多的产出。

en: In his observations of pin factories , Smith noticed that one worker alone might make 20 pins in a day , but that a small business of 10 workers  , could make 48,000 pins in a day .
zh: 史密斯在观察针厂时注意到,一个人一天可以制造20个针,而10个工人的小企业一天可以制造48000个针。

en: How can a group of workers , each specializing in certain tasks , produce so much more than the same number of workers who try to produce the entire good or service by themselves ?
zh: 一个专门从事某些任务的工人群体怎么能比自己努力生产整个商品或服务的工人数量多得多呢?

en: Smith offered three reasons .
zh: 史密斯提出了三个理由。

en: First , specialization in a particular small job allows workers to focus on the parts of the production process where they have an advantage .
zh: 首先,在某一特定小工作上专业化,使工人能够集中精力在他们有优势的生产过程中的各个部分。

en: People have different skills , talents , and interests , so they will be better at some jobs than at others .
zh: 人们有不同的技能、才华和兴趣,因此在某些工作上他们会比其他工作更好。

en: The particular advantages may be based on educational choices , which are in turn shaped by interests and talents .
zh: 这些特殊优势可能基于教育选择,而这些选择又由兴趣和才华决定。

en: Only those with medical degrees qualify to become doctors , for instance .
zh: 只有拥有医学学位的人才能成为医生。

en: For some goods , geography affects specialization .
zh: 对某些商品来说,地理影响专业化。

en: If you live in or near a big city , it is easier to attract enough customers to operate a successful dry cleaning business or movie theater than if you live in a sparsely populated rural area .
zh: 如果你住在大城市或附近,你更容易吸引足够多的客户来经营一个成功的干洗业务或电影院,而不是你住在人口稀少的农村地区。

en: Whatever the reason , if people specialize in the production of what they do best , they will be more effective than if they produce a combination of things , some of which they are good at and some of which they are not .
zh: 不管原因是什么,如果人们专心生产他们做的最好的东西,他们会比他们生产一种组合的东西更有效,其中有些是他们擅长的,有些是他们不擅长的。

en: Second , workers who specialize in certain tasks often learn to produce more quickly and with higher quality .
zh: 其次,专门从事某些任务的工人往往学会生产得更快,质量更高。

en: This pattern holds true for many workers , including assembly line laborers who build cars , stylists who cut hair , and doctors who perform heart surgery .
zh: 这个模式适用于许多工人,包括制造汽车的装配线工人、剪头发的设计师和做心脏手术的医生。

en: In fact , specialized workers often know their jobs well enough to suggest innovative ways to do their work faster and better .
zh: 事实上,专业工人往往知道自己的工作,可以提出更快速、更好的创新方法。

en: A similar pattern often operates within businesses .
zh: 类似的模式经常在企业内部运行。

en: In many cases , a business that focuses on one or a few products  is more successful than firms that try to make a wide range of products .
zh: 许多情况下,一个专注于一个或几个产品的企业比那些试图制造广泛的产品的公司更成功。

en: Third , specialization allows businesses to take advantage of economies of scale , which means that for many goods , as the level of production increases , the average cost of producing each individual unit declines .
zh: 第三,专业化允许企业利用规模经济,这意味着许多商品随着生产水平的提高,生产单位的平均成本降低。

en: For example , if a factory produces only 100 cars per year , each car will be quite expensive to make on average .
zh: 例如,如果一家工厂每年只生产100辆汽车,那么每辆汽车的制造成本都会相当高。

en: However , if a factory produces 50,000 cars each year , then it can set up an assembly line with huge machines and workers performing specialized tasks , and the average cost of production per car will be lower .
zh: 然而,如果一家工厂每年生产50万辆汽车,那么它可以建立一个装配线,拥有巨大的机器和从事专门任务的工人,并且每辆汽车的平均生产成本将较低。

en: The ultimate result of workers who can focus on their preferences and talents , learn to do their specialized jobs better , and work in larger organizations is that society as a whole can produce and consume far more than if each person tried to produce all of his or her own goods and services .
zh: 那些能够专注于自己的喜好和才华、学习更好的专业工作和在更大的组织中工作的工人的最终结果是,整个社会能够生产和消费更多,而不是每一个人试图生产所有自己的商品和服务。

en: The division and specialization of labor has been a force against the problem of scarcity .
zh: 劳动的分化和专业化是解决劳动力短缺问题的重要力量。

en: Despite how much humans have in common , cultural differences are far more prevalent than cultural universals .
zh: 尽管人类有多少共同之处,但文化差异比文化普遍性更为普遍。

en: For example , while all cultures have language , analysis of particular language structures and conversational etiquette reveal tremendous differences .
zh: 例如,虽然所有文化都有语言,但对语言结构和对话礼仪的分析却显示出巨大的差异。

en: In some Middle Eastern cultures , it is common to stand close to others in conversation .
zh: 在一些中东文化中,人们通常在对话中站在别人的旁边。

en: North Americans keep more distance and maintain a large “ personal space . ”
zh: 北美洲人保持更远距离并保持“ 个人空间 ” 。

en: Even something as simple as eating and drinking varies greatly from culture to culture .
zh: 即使是简单的东西,如吃喝,在各个文化中都有很大差异。

en: If your professor comes into an early morning class holding a mug of liquid , what do you assume she is drinking ?
zh: 如果你的教授早上来上课,拿着一杯液体,你认为她喝的是什么?

en: In the United States , it ’s most likely filled with coffee , not Earl Grey tea , a favorite in England , or Yak Butter tea , a staple in Tibet .
zh: 在美国,它最有可能是一杯咖啡,而不是英国最受欢迎的厄尔·格雷茶,或者西藏最常用的雅克奶油茶。

en: The way cuisines vary across cultures fascinates many people .
zh: 不同文化的烹饪方式吸引了许多人。

en: Some travelers pride themselves on their willingness to try unfamiliar foods , like celebrated food writer Anthony Bourdain , while others return home expressing gratitude for their native culture ’s fare .
zh: 一些旅行者自称自己愿意尝试陌生的食物,比如著名的食品作家安东尼·博登,而其他旅行者则返回家表示感谢他们本国的文化菜肴。

en: Often , people in the United States express disgust at other cultures ’ cuisine and think that it ’s gross to eat meat from a dog or guinea pig , for example , while they do n’t question their own habit of eating cows or pigs .
zh: 美国人经常对其他文化烹饪感到厌恶,认为吃狗或猪肉是可恶的,但他们并不怀疑自己吃牛或猪的习惯。

en: Such attitudes are an example of ethnocentrism , or evaluating and judging another culture based on how it compares to one ’s own cultural norms .
zh: 这种态度是民族中心主义的例子,或基于它与自己的文化规范如何比较来评价和判断另一个文化。

en: Ethnocentrism , as sociologist William Graham Sumner  described the term , involves a belief or attitude that one ’s own culture is better than all others .
zh: 种族中心主义(英语:Ethnocentrism),正如社会学家威廉·格雷厄姆·苏姆纳(William Graham Sumner)所描述的这个术语,涉及一种信仰或态度,即一个人自己的文化比其他人更好。

en: Almost everyone is a little bit ethnocentric .
zh: 几乎每个人都有点民族中心。

en: Someone from a country where dog meat is standard fare might find it off - putting to see a dog in a French restaurant — not on the menu , but as a pet and patron ’s companion .
zh: 来自一个狗肉是标准菜单的国家的人可能会觉得这太难了 — — 在法国餐馆里去看狗 — — 不是菜单上,而是作为宠物和顾客的同伴。

en: A high level of appreciation for one ’s own culture can be healthy ; a shared sense of community pride , for example , connects people in a society .
zh: 对自己的文化高度的赞赏可以有益于健康;例如,共同的社区自豪感可以使社会中的人们联系起来。

en: But ethnocentrism can lead to disdain or dislike for other cultures and could cause misunderstanding and conflict .
zh: 但民族中心主义可能导致对其他文化的蔑视或厌恶,并可能引起误解和冲突。

en: People with the best intentions sometimes travel to a society to “ help ” its people , because they see them as uneducated or backward - essentially inferior .
zh: 有好意的人有时会到一个社会去“帮助”其人民,因为他们认为他们是没有教育的或落后的 — — 基本上是低劣的。

en: In reality , these travelers are guilty of cultural imperialism , the deliberate imposition of one ’s own cultural values on another culture .
zh: 事实上,这些旅行者是文化帝国主义的罪魁祸首,是故意将自己的文化价值观强加于另一个文化。

en: Europe ’s colonial expansion , begun in the sixteenth century , was often accompanied by a severe cultural imperialism .
zh: 欧洲的殖民扩张,始于16世纪,常常伴随着严重的文化帝国主义。

en: European colonizers often viewed the people in the lands they colonized as uncultured savages who were in need of European governance , dress , religion , and other cultural practices .
zh: 欧洲殖民者常常把他们殖民地的人民看作是没有文化的野蛮人,他们需要欧洲的治理、服装、宗教和其他文化习俗。

en: A more modern example of cultural imperialism may include the work of international aid agencies who introduce agricultural methods and plant species from developed countries while overlooking indigenous varieties and agricultural approaches that are better suited to the particular region .
zh: 更现代的文化帝国主义例子包括国际援助机构的工作,这些机构引进了发达国家的农业方法和植物种类,同时忽视了适合特定区域的土著品种和农业方法。

en: In sociology , we call this culture shock .
zh: 在社会学中,我们称之为文化冲击。

en: A traveler from Chicago might find the nightly silence of rural Montana unsettling , not peaceful .
zh: 来自芝加哥的旅行者可能会发现蒙大拿乡村的夜间寂静令人不安,而不是和平。

en: An exchange student from China might be annoyed by the constant interruptions in class as other students ask questions — a practice that is considered rude in China .
zh: 一位来自中国的学生可能会因为其他学生问问题而经常在课堂中打断,这在中国被认为是不礼貌的习俗。

en: Perhaps the Chicago traveler was initially captivated with Montana ’s quiet beauty and the Chinese student was originally excited to see a U.S. - style classroom firsthand .
zh: 也许芝加哥的旅行者最初被蒙大拿的安静的美丽所吸引,而中国学生最初对美国风格的教室亲眼目睹感到兴奋。

en: But as they experience unanticipated differences from their own culture , their excitement gives way to discomfort and doubts about how to behave appropriately in the new situation .
zh: 但是,当他们经历自己文化中的意外差异时,他们的兴奋会使他们感到不适和怀疑如何在新的环境下适当地行动。

en: Eventually , as people learn more about a culture , they recover from culture shock .
zh: 最后,随着人们对文化的认识,他们从文化冲击中恢复过来。

en: Culture shock may appear because people are n’t always expecting cultural differences .
zh: 文化冲击可能出现,因为人们并不总是期望文化差异。

en: Anthropologist Ken Barger  discovered this when he conducted a participatory observation in an Inuit community in the Canadian Arctic .
zh: 人类学家肯·巴格尔(Ken Barger)在加拿大北极的一个印第安人社区进行参与性观察时发现了这一点。

en: Originally from Indiana , Barger hesitated when invited to join a local snowshoe race .
zh: 原先来自印第安纳州, 巴格被邀请参加当地的雪鞋比赛时犹豫不决.

en: He knew he ’d never hold his own against these experts .
zh: 他知道他永远不会对这些专家采取行动。

en: Sure enough , he finished last , to his mortification .
zh: 当然,他最后一次完成, 使他感到厌恶.

en: In Barger ’s own culture , he had learned to value victory .
zh: 在巴格尔自己的文化中,他学会了珍惜胜利。

en: To the Inuit people , winning was enjoyable , but their culture valued survival skills essential to their environment : how hard someone tried could mean the difference between life and death .
zh: 对印第安人来说,胜利是令人愉快的,但他们的文化重视生存技能,这是对环境至关重要的:一个人努力如何可能意味着生命与死亡之间的区别。

en: Over the course of his stay , Barger participated in caribou hunts , learned how to take shelter in winter storms , and sometimes went days with little or no food to share among tribal members .
zh: 在他逗留期间,巴格尔参与了美洲豹狩猎,学会了如何在冬天的暴风雨中避难,有时甚至连几天都没有食物与部落成员分享。

en: Trying hard and working together , two nonmaterial values , were indeed much more important than winning .
zh: 努力和共同努力,两个非物质的价值,的确比胜利更重要。

en: During his time with the Inuit tribe , Barger learned to engage in cultural relativism .
zh: 在他与印第安人部落生活期间,巴格学会了文化相对论。

en: Cultural relativism is the practice of assessing a culture by its own standards rather than viewing it through the lens of one ’s own culture .
zh: 文化相对论是通过自己的标准来评价一种文化,而不是通过自己的文化来看待它。

en: Practicing cultural relativism requires an open mind and a willingness to consider , and even adapt to , new values and norms .
zh: 实践文化相对论需要开放的头脑和考虑,甚至适应新的价值观和规范的意愿。

en: However , indiscriminately embracing everything about a new culture is not always possible .
zh: 然而,不分青红皂白地接受新文化的一切并不总是可能的。

en: Even the most culturally relativist people from egalitarian societies — ones in which women have political rights and control over their own bodies — would question whether the widespread practice of female genital mutilation in countries such as Ethiopia and Sudan should be accepted as a part of cultural tradition .
zh: 即使来自平等社会 — — 其中妇女有政治权利和控制自己的身体 — — 的最文化相对主义者也会质疑,在埃塞俄比亚和苏丹等国家普遍实行的女性性别变形是否应该被接受为文化传统的一部分。

en: Sociologists attempting to engage in cultural relativism , then , may struggle to reconcile aspects of their own culture with aspects of a culture that they are studying .
zh: 试图从事文化相对论的社会学家,则会努力将自己的文化与他们所研究的文化相协调。

en: Sometimes when people attempt to rectify feelings of ethnocentrism and develop cultural relativism , they swing too far to the other end of the spectrum .
zh: 当人们试图纠正民族中心主义的情绪并发展文化相对主义时,他们往往偏向了谱的另一端。

en: Xenocentrism is the opposite of ethnocentrism , and refers to the belief that another culture is superior to one ’s own .
zh: 种族中心主义是民族中心主义的反面,指另一种文化优于自己的文化。

en: An exchange student who goes home after a semester abroad or a sociologist who returns from the field may find it difficult to associate with the values of their own culture after having experienced what they deem a more upright or nobler way of living .
zh: 留学后回家的交换学生或从外地回来的社会学家,在经历他们认为更正直、更崇高的生活之后,很难与自己的文化价值观联系起来。

en: Describe Einstein ’s view of gravity as the warping of spacetime in the presence of massive objects
zh: 描述爱因斯坦对重力的看法,认为重物的存在是时空的变形

en: Understand that Newton ’s concept of the gravitational force between two massive objects and Einstein ’s concept of warped spacetime are different explanations for the same observed accelerations of one massive object in the presence of another massive object
zh: 了解牛顿关于两个大物之间的重力的概念和爱因斯坦的扭曲空间时间的概念是同一被观察到的一个大物在另一个大物面前的加速度的不同的解释

en: Is light actually bent from its straight - line path by the mass of Earth ?
zh: 光线从它的直线路径上被地球的质量弯曲 吗?

en: How can light , which has no mass , be affected by gravity ?
zh: 没有质量的光如何受到重力的影响?

en: Einstein preferred to think that it is space and time that are affected by the presence of a large mass ; light beams , and everything else that travels through space and time , then find their paths affected .
zh: 爱因斯坦宁愿认为它是空间和时间受到巨大的质量的影响;光束,以及通过空间和时间的其他一切,然后发现它们的路径受到影响。

en: Light always follows the shortest path — but that path may not always be straight .
zh: 光总是沿着最短的路 — — 但这条路不一定总是直的。

en: This idea is true for human travel on the curved surface of planet Earth , as well .
zh: 这个想法也适用于人类在地球曲面上的旅行。

en: Say you want to fly from Chicago to Rome .
zh: 比如你想从芝加哥飞往罗马。

en: Since an airplane ca n’t go through the solid body of the Earth , the shortest distance is not a straight line but the arc of a great circle .
zh: 因为飞机不能穿过地球的固体,最短的距离不是直线,而是大圆的弧线。

en: To show what Einstein ’s insight really means , let ’s first consider how we locate an event in space and time .
zh: 为了展示爱因斯坦的洞察力到底意味着什么,让我们首先考虑如何在空间和时间定位一个事件。

en: For example , imagine you have to describe to worried school officials the fire that broke out in your room when your roommate tried cooking shish kebabs in the fireplace .
zh: 例如,想象你必须向担心的学校官员描述你房间里发生火灾时,你的同室同学在炉子里尝试煮shishkebab。

en: You explain that your dorm is at 6400 College Avenue , a street that runs in the left - right direction on a map of your town ; you are on the fifth floor , which tells where you are in the up - down direction ; and you are the sixth room back from the elevator , which tells where you are in the forward - backward direction .
zh: 你解释说你的宿舍位于大学大道6400号,这是你所在城市的地图上左 - 右方向的街道;你位于第五层,这说明你在上 - 下方向;而你则是从电梯回来的第六个房间,这说明你在往前 - 后方向。

en: Then you explain that the fire broke out at 6:23 p.m.  , which specifies the event in time .
zh: 然后你解释说火在下午6时23分爆发,这说明了时间的事件。

en: Any event in the universe , whether nearby or far away , can be pinpointed using the three dimensions of space and the one dimension of time .
zh: 任何在宇宙中发生的事件,无论是附近的还是遥远的,都可以通过空间的三个维度和时间的一个维度来确定。

en: Newton considered space and time to be completely independent , and that continued to be the accepted view until the beginning of the twentieth century .
zh: 牛顿认为空间和时间是完全独立的,直到20世纪初,这一观点一直被接受。

en: But Einstein showed that there is an intimate connection between space and time , and that only by considering the two together — in what we call spacetime — can we build up a correct picture of the physical world .
zh: 但爱因斯坦表明,空间与时间之间存在着密切的联系,只有考虑到两者 — — 我们称之为空间时间 — — 我们才能建立一个正确的物理世界。

en: We examine spacetime a bit more closely in the next subsection .
zh: 我们将在下一个分段对时空进行更深入的考察。

en: The gist of Einstein ’s general theory is that the presence of matter curves or warps the fabric of spacetime .
zh: 爱因斯坦的一般理论的本质是物质的存在会曲折或扭曲时空的结构。

en: This curving of spacetime is identified with gravity .
zh: 这个时空曲线与重力相符。

en: When something else — a beam of light , an electron , or the starship Enterprise — enters such a region of distorted spacetime , its path will be different from what it would have been in the absence of the matter .
zh: 当其他东西 — — 光束,电子,或星际飞船 — — 进入歪曲时空的这一区域时,其路径将与物质不在时的路径不同。

en: The amount of distortion in spacetime depends on the mass of material that is involved and on how concentrated and compact it is .
zh: 空间时的扭曲量取决于所涉及的物质的质量以及其浓缩和紧凑程度。

en: Terrestrial objects , such as the book you are reading , have far too little mass to introduce any significant distortion .
zh: 地球上的物体,如你正在阅读的书,质量太小,无法引入任何重大的扭曲。

en: Newton ’s view of gravity is just fine for building bridges , skyscrapers , or amusement park rides .
zh: 牛顿的重力观完全适合建造桥梁、摩天大楼或游乐园。

en: General relativity does , however , have some practical applications .
zh: 一般相对论确实有一些实际应用。

en: The GPS  in every smartphone can tell you where you are within 5 to 10 meters only because the effects of general and special relativity on the GPS satellites in orbit around the Earth are taken into account .
zh: 每个智能手机的GPS能告诉你你在5到10米以内的位置,这只是因为考虑到地球轨道上的GPS卫星的一般和特殊相对论的影响。

en: Unlike a book or your roommate , stars produce measurable distortions in spacetime .
zh: 与书或你的室友不同,星体在时空中产生可测量的扭曲。

en: A white dwarf , with its stronger surface gravity , produces more distortion just above its surface than does a red giant with the same mass .
zh: 白矮星具有较强的表面重力,在其表面上产生比具有相同的质量的红巨星更多的扭曲。

en: So , you see , we are eventually going to talk about collapsing stars again , but not before discussing Einstein ’s ideas  in more detail .
zh: 因此,你看到,我们最终将再次谈论崩溃的恒星,但不是在讨论爱因斯坦的更多细节之前。

en: How can we understand the distortion of spacetime by the presence of some  amount of mass ?
zh: 我们如何理解存在一定量质量的空间时间的扭曲?

en: Let ’s try the following analogy .
zh: 让我们试一下下面的比喻。

en: You may have seen maps of New York City that squeeze the full three dimensions of this towering metropolis onto a flat sheet of paper and still have enough information so tourists will not get lost .
zh: 你可能已经看到纽约市的地图,这些地图将这个高耸的大都市的全部三个维度压缩到一张平整的纸张上,并且仍然有足够的信息,以便游客不会迷失。

en: Let ’s do something similar with diagrams of spacetime .
zh: 让我们用时空图做类似的事情。

en: Figure 24.7 , for example , shows the progress of a motorist driving east on a stretch of road in Kansas where the countryside is absolutely flat .
zh: 例如,24.7图显示了一辆汽车在堪萨斯州一带公路以东行驶的进度,那里的乡村完全平坦。

en: Since our motorist is traveling only in the east - west direction and the terrain is flat , we can ignore the other two dimensions of space .
zh: 由于我们的汽车只在东西方向行驶,地形平坦,所以我们可以忽略空间的其他两个维度。

en: The amount of time elapsed since he left home is shown on the y - axis , and the distance traveled eastward is shown on the x - axis .
zh: 自他离开家以来的时间长度在 y - 轴上显示, 向东移动的距离在 x - 轴上显示.

en: From A to B he drove at a uniform speed ; unfortunately , it was too fast a uniform speed and a police car spotted him .
zh: 从A到B,他驾驶着统一的车速;不幸的是, uniform的车速太快,一辆警察车发现了他。

en: From B to C he stopped to receive his ticket and made no progress through space , only through time .
zh: 从B到C,他停下来接受他的机票,没有通过空间前进,只是通过时间。

en: This diagram shows the progress of a motorist traveling east across the flat Kansas landscape .
zh: 图表显示了一辆摩托车在穿越堪萨斯平原东面的道路的进度。

en: Distance traveled is plotted along the horizontal axis .
zh: 沿横轴绘制 traveled 的距离。

en: The time elapsed since the motorist left the starting point is plotted along the vertical axis .
zh: 从驾驶员离开起始点以来的时间沿着垂直轴绘制。

en: Now let ’s try illustrating the distortions of spacetime in two dimensions .
zh: 现在让我们尝试在两个维度的空间时间的扭曲。

en: In this case , we will  use a rubber sheet that can stretch or warp if we put objects on it .
zh: 在这种情况下,我们将使用橡胶板,如果我们将物品放在上面,它可以伸展或变形。

en: Let ’s imagine stretching our rubber sheet taut on four posts .
zh: 让我们想象 stretching our rubber sheet taut on four posts。

en: To complete the analogy , we need something that normally travels in a straight line  .
zh: 为了完成模拟,我们需要一个通常在直线 travel 的物体。

en: We begin with just the rubber sheet and the ant , simulating empty space with no mass in it .
zh: 我们从橡胶板和蚂蚁开始,模拟没有质量的空空间。

en: We put the ant on one side of the sheet and it walks in a beautiful straight line over to the other side  .
zh: 我们把蚂蚁放在一张纸的一边,它沿着美丽的直线走到另一边。

en: We next put a small grain of sand on the rubber sheet .
zh: 我们接着把一块小沙子放在橡胶板上。

en: If we send the ant so it goes close to , but not on top of , the sand grain , it has little trouble continuing to walk in a straight line .
zh: 如果我们把蚂蚁送去,这样它就会接近,但不是在沙粒上,它有一点麻烦继续在一条直线上行走。

en: Now we grab something with a little more mass — say , a small pebble .
zh: 现在我们抓住一些比重小的东西 — 比如小石块。

en: It bends or distorts the sheet just a bit around its position .
zh: 它弯曲或扭曲的纸张只是在其位置周围的一点。

en: If we send the ant into this region , it finds its path slightly altered by the distortion of the sheet .
zh: 如果我们把蚂蚁送进这个区域,它会发现它的路径因纸张的扭曲而略有改变。

en: The distortion is not large , but if we follow the ant ’s path carefully , we notice it deviating slightly from a straight line .
zh: 变形并不大,但如果我们小心地追随蚂蚁的路径,就会注意到它略微偏离直线。

en: The effect gets more noticeable as we increase the mass of the object that we put on the sheet .
zh: 当我们增加我们放在纸张上的物体的质量时,效果就会更加明显。

en: Let ’s say we now use a massive paperweight .
zh: 假设我们现在使用了巨大的纸重。

en: Such a heavy object distorts or warps the rubber sheet very effectively , putting a good sag in it .
zh: 这样重物会使橡胶板变形或变形,使橡胶板非常有效,使橡胶板内有较好的凹陷。

en: From our point of view , we can see that the sheet near the paperweight is no longer straight .
zh: 从我们的角度来看,我们可以看到纸张附近的纸张不再直线。

en: The common measures of location are quartiles and percentiles .
zh: 分布的常量是四分之一和百分之一。

en: The first quartile , Q 1 , is the same as the 25th percentile , and the third quartile , Q 3 , is the same as the 75th percentile .
zh: 第一个四分之一,Q1,与25分之一相同,第三个四分之一,Q3,与75分之一相同。

en: The median , M , is called both the second quartile and the 50th percentile .
zh: 介质 M 被称作第二四分之一和五分之一。

en: To calculate quartiles and percentiles , you must order the data from smallest to largest .
zh: 为了计算四分数和百分数,您必须从最小到最大的数据顺序。

en: Quartiles divide ordered data into quarters .
zh: 四分数将订购数据分成四分数。

en: Percentiles divide ordered data into hundredths .
zh: 百分比将顺序数据分成百分比。

en: So , percentiles mean the data is divided into 100 sections .
zh: 因此,百分比意味着数据被分成100个部分。

en: To score in the 90th percentile of an exam does not mean , necessarily , that you received 90 percent on a test .
zh: 在考试的90%中得分并不意味着你必须在考试中获得90%的分数。

en: It means that 90 percent of test scores are the same as or less than your score and that 10 percent of the test scores are the same as or greater than your test score .
zh: 这意味着90%的考试成绩与你的成绩相同或低于,10%的考试成绩与你的成绩相同或高于。

en: For this reason , universities and colleges use percentiles extensively .
zh: 因此,大学和学院广泛使用百分比。

en: For example , suppose Duke accepts SAT scores at or above the 75th percentile .
zh: 例如,假设杜克接受SAT成绩在75分百分比以上。

en: That translates into a score of at least 1220 .
zh: 这相当于至少1220的分数。

en: Percentiles are mostly used with very large populations .
zh: 奖励通常用于非常大的人口。

en: Therefore , if you were to say that 90 percent of the test scores are less , and not the same or less , than your score , it would be acceptable because removing one particular data value is not significant .
zh: 因此,如果你说90%的考试成绩比你的分数低,不是相同的或者低的,那就可以接受,因为删除一个特定数据值并不重要。

en: The median is a number that measures the center of the data .
zh: 中间数是测量数据中心的数目。

en: You can think of the median as the middle value , but it does not actually have to be one of the observed values .
zh: 你可以把中间值当作中间值,但实际上它不一定是观察到的值之一。

en: Half the values are the same number or smaller than the median , and half the values are the same number or larger .
zh: 一半的值是相同的数目或比中等数小,一半的值是相同的数目或更大。

en: When a data set has an even number of data values , the median is equal to the average of the two middle values when the data are arranged in ascending order  .
zh: 当数据集有偶数数据值时,平均值是两个中间值的平均值,当数据按上升顺序排列时。

en: When a data set has an odd number of data values , the median is equal to the middle value when the data are arranged in ascending order .
zh: 当数据集有奇数的数据值时,当数据排列在上升顺序时,中间值等于中间值。

en: Since there are 14 observations  , the median is between the seventh value , 6.8 , and the eighth value , 7.2 .
zh: 由于有14个观察,介质介于第七值,6.8和第八值,7.2之间。

en: To find the median , add the two values together and divide by two .
zh: 求中等值,将两个值加在一起,并分两个。

en: To find the quartiles , first find the median , or second , quartile .
zh: 找到四分之一,首先找到介质,或者第二,四分之一。

en: The first quartile , Q 1 , is the middle value of the lower half of the data , and the third quartile , Q 3 , is the middle value , or median , of the upper half of the data .
zh: 第一个四分之一,Q1,是数据的下半部分的平均值,第三个四分之一,Q3,是数据的上半部分的平均值。

en: To get the idea , consider the same data set :
zh: 为了得到这个想法,考虑相同的数据集:

en: The data set has an even number of values  , so the median will be the average of the two middle values  , which is calculated as  / 2 and equals 7 .
zh: 数据集有偶数值,所以中间值将是两个中间值的平均值,计算为/2和等于7。

en: The first quartile is the median of the lower half of the data , so if we divide the data into seven values in the lower half and seven values in the upper half , we can see that we have an odd number of values in the lower half .
zh: 第一个四分之一是数据的下半部分的平均值,所以如果我们把数据分成下半部分的七个值和上半部分的七个值,我们可以看到我们有下半部分的奇数值。

en: Thus , the median of the lower half , or the first quartile  will be the middle value , or 2 .
zh: 因此,下半数的介质,或第一个四分之一将是中值,或2。

en: Using the same procedure , we can see that the median of the upper half , or the third quartile  will be the middle value of the upper half , or 9 .
zh: 用同样的程序,我们可以看到上半的介质,或者第三四分之一将是上半的中间值,或者9。

en: The quartiles are illustrated below :
zh: 四分之一的例子如下:

en: The interquartile range is a number that indicates the spread of the middle half , or the middle 50 percent of the data .
zh: 四半期间的范围是指数据中一半的分布,或数据中50%的分布的数字。

en: It is the difference between the third quartile  and the first quartile
zh: 这是第三四分之一和第一四分之一之间的区别

en: The IQR for this data set is calculated as 9 minus 2 , or 7 .
zh: 这个数据集的 IQR 是 9 减 2, 或 7 。

en: The IQR can help to determine potential outliers .
zh: IQR可以帮助确定潜在的异常。

en: A value is suspected to be a potential outlier if it is less than 1.5 × IQR below the first quartile or more than 1.5 × IQR above the third quartile .
zh: 如果一个值低于第一四分之一的1.5 × IQR或超过第三四分之一的1.5 × IQR,那么它被认为是潜在的异常。

en: Potential outliers always require further investigation .
zh: 潜在的异常总是需要进一步调查。

en: A potential outlier is a data point that is significantly different from the other data points .
zh: 潜在异常是一个与其他数据点显著不同的数据点。

en: These special data points may be errors or some kind of abnormality , or they may be a key to understanding the data .
zh: 这些特殊数据点可能是错误或某种异常,或者它们可能是理解数据的关键。

en: For the following 13 real estate prices , calculate the IQR and determine if any prices are potential outliers .
zh: 对下列13个房地产价格,计算 IQR,确定任何价格是潜在异常的。

en: For the 11 salaries , calculate the IQR and determine if any salaries are outliers .
zh: 对11个薪金, 计算 IQR, 确定任何薪金是否异常.

en: The following salaries are in dollars .
zh: 下面的薪金是美元。

en: In the example above , you just saw the calculation of the median , first quartile , and third quartile .
zh: 在上面的例子中,你刚刚看到介质的计算,第一四分之一,第三四分之一。

en: These three values are part of the five number summary .
zh: 这些三个值是五个数字汇总的一部分。

en: The other two values are the minimum value  and the maximum value  .
zh: 其他两个值是最小值和最大值。

en: The five number summary is used to create a box plot .
zh: 使用五个数字汇总来创建一个框图。

en: 15.4 The Union Triumphant
zh: 15.4联盟的胜利

en: Describe the reasons why many Americans doubted that Abraham Lincoln would be reelected
zh: 描述为什么许多美国人怀疑亚伯拉罕·林肯将被重选的原因

en: By the outset of 1864 , after three years of war , the Union had mobilized its resources for the ongoing struggle on a massive scale .
zh: 到1864年初,经过三年的战争后,联盟已经为正在进行的大规模斗争动员了资源。

en: The government had overseen the construction of new railroad lines and for the first time used standardized rail tracks that allowed the North to move men and materials with greater ease .
zh: 政府监督了新的铁路线的建设,并首次使用了标准化的铁路线,使北方能够更轻松地移动人员和物资。

en: The North ’s economy had shifted to a wartime model .
zh: 北方的经济已经转向了战争时期的模式。

en: The Confederacy also mobilized , perhaps to a greater degree than the Union , its efforts to secure independence and maintain slavery .
zh: 联邦也动员起来,也许比欧盟更大程度,努力确保独立和维持奴隶制。

en: Yet the Confederacy experienced ever - greater hardships after years of war .
zh: 然而, 经过多年的战争,南军经历了更大的困难.

en: Without the population of the North , it faced a shortage of manpower .
zh: 没有北方的人口,它面临着劳动力短缺。

en: The lack of industry , compared to the North , undercut the ability to sustain and wage war .
zh: 与北方相比,工业的缺乏削弱了维持和支付战争的能力。

en: Rampant inflation as well as food shortages in the South lowered morale .
zh: 暴涨的通货膨胀以及南方粮食短缺降低了士气。

en: From the beginning of the war , the Confederacy placed great hope in being recognized and supported by Great Britain and France .
zh: 自战争开始以来,联合王国对英国和法国的承认和支持抱有极大的希望。

en: European intervention in the conflict remained a strong possibility , but when it did occur , it was not in a way anticipated by either the Confederacy or the Union .
zh: 欧洲对这场冲突的干预仍然是可能的,但当它发生时,联邦和欧盟都无法预料。

en: Napoleon III of France believed the Civil War presented an opportunity for him to restore a French empire in the Americas .
zh: 拿破仑三世认为内战为他重新建立法国在美洲的帝国提供了机会。

en: With the United States preoccupied , the time seemed ripe for action .
zh: 随着美国的关注, 现在似乎是采取行动的时候了.

en: Napoleon ’s target was Mexico , and in 1861 , a large French fleet took Veracruz .
zh: 拿破仑的目标是墨西哥,在1861年,一支庞大的法国舰队占领了韦拉克鲁斯。

en: The French then moved to capture Mexico City , but the advance came to an end when Mexican forces defeated the French in 1862 .
zh: 随后,法国人动身攻占墨西哥城,但墨西哥军队在1862年击败法国人后,前进的结束。

en: Despite this setback , France eventually did conquer Mexico , establishing a regime that lasted until 1867 .
zh: 尽管如此,法国最终还是征服了墨西哥,建立了直到1867年的政权。

en: Rather than coming to the aid of the Confederacy , France used the Civil War to provide a pretext for efforts to reestablish its former eighteenth - century colonial holdings .
zh: 法国没有向联邦提供援助,而是利用内战作为借口重新建立其18世纪以前的殖民地。

en: Still , the Confederacy had great confidence that it would find an ally in Great Britain despite the antislavery sentiment there .
zh: 尽管英国人反对奴隶制,但南盟仍非常有信心在英国找到盟友。

en: Southerners hoped Britain ’s dependence on cotton for its textile mills would keep the country on their side .
zh: 南方人希望英国对纺织厂的棉花依赖将使英国保持在他们一边。

en: The fact that the British proved willing to build and sell ironclad ships intended to smash through the Union naval blockade further raised Southern hopes .
zh: 英国愿意建造和出售装甲船,以摧毁北约海上封锁,这进一步增加了南方的希望。

en: Both were destroyed during the war .
zh: 双方在战争中被摧毁。

en: The Confederacy ’s staunch commitment to slavery eventually worked against British recognition and support , since Great Britain had abolished slavery in 1833 .
zh: 联合王国对奴隶制的坚定承诺最终反对英国的承认和支持,因为英国在1833年废除了奴隶制。

en: The 1863 Emancipation Proclamation ended any doubts the British had about the goals of the Union cause .
zh: 1863年解放宣言结束了英国对联合事业的目标的任何怀疑。

en: In the aftermath of the proclamation , many in Great Britain cheered for a Union victory .
zh: 在宣布之后, 许多英国人欢呼欧盟的胜利.

en: Ultimately , Great Britain , like France , disappointed the Confederacy ’s hope of an alliance , leaving the outnumbered and out - resourced states that had left the Union to fend for themselves .
zh: 最终, 大不列颠, 像法国一样, 失望了南北联盟的联盟希望, 让已经离开联盟的数目过剩和资源过剩的国家自卫.

en: The Emancipation Proclamation , however , led to the enrollment of African American men as Union soldiers .
zh: 然而,解放宣言导致了非洲裔美国人成为联邦士兵。

en: Huge numbers of formerly enslaved as well as free Black people from the North enlisted , and by the end of the war in 1865 , their numbers had swelled to over 190,000 .
zh: 在1865年战争结束时,黑人人数已增至190,000人。

en: Racism among White people in the Union army ran deep , however , fueling the belief that Black soldiers could never be effective or trustworthy .
zh: 然而,联邦军队中的白人种族主义根深蒂固,助长了人们相信黑人士兵永远无法有效或值得信赖的信念。

en: The Union also feared for the fate of captured Black soldiers .
zh: 联盟也担心被俘的黑人士兵的命运。

en: Although many Black soldiers saw combat duty , these factors affected the types of tasks assigned to them .
zh: 尽管许多黑人士兵看到战斗任务,但这些因素影响到他们所分配的任务类型。

en: Many Black regiments were limited to hauling supplies , serving as cooks , digging trenches , and doing other types of labor , rather than serving on the battlefield  .
zh: 许多黑人团只限于运货、做厨师、挖沟、做其他类型的工作,而不是在战场上工作。

en: This 1865 daguerreotype illustrates three of the Union ’s distinct advantages : African American soldiers , a stream of cannons and supplies , and an extensive railroad grid .
zh: 这个1865年大游击队展示了联盟的三个显著优势:非洲裔美国士兵,一连串的炮弹和补给品,以及广泛的铁路网。

en: African American soldiers also received lower wages than their White counterparts : ten dollars per month , with three dollars deducted for clothing .
zh: 非洲裔美国士兵的工资也比白人士兵要低:每月10美元,衣物费减3美元。

en: Abolitionists and their Republican supporters in Congress worked to correct this discriminatory practice , and in 1864 , Black soldiers began to receive the same pay as White soldiers plus retroactive pay to 1863  .
zh: 废奴主义者及其共和党支持者在国会努力纠正这种歧视性做法,在1864年,黑人士兵开始获得同白人士兵一样的薪酬,加上到1863年后退的薪酬。

en: African American and White soldiers of the Union army pose together in this photograph , although in reality , Black soldiers were often kept separate and given only menial jobs .
zh: 美国联邦陆军的非洲裔和白人士兵在这张照片上一起露面,虽然在现实中,黑人士兵经常被隔离并只得到低薪工作。

en: For their part , African American soldiers welcomed the opportunity to prove themselves .
zh: 对他们来说, 非洲裔美国士兵们欢迎这次证明自己的机会.

en: Some 85 percent were formerly enslaved people who were fighting for the liberation of all of the enslaved and the end of slavery .
zh: 大约85%的人以前是奴隶,他们为解放所有奴隶和结束奴隶制而战斗。

en: They willingly gave their lives for the cause .
zh: 他们愿意为这个事业献身。

en: In April 1864 , Southern forces attempted to take Fort Pillow in Tennessee from the Union forces that had captured it in 1862 .
zh: 1864年4月,南方部队试图从1862年占领的联军手中夺取田纳西州的皮洛堡。

en: Confederate troops under Major General Nathan Bedford Forrest , the future founder of the Ku Klux Klan , quickly overran the fort , and the Union defenders surrendered .
zh: 盟军将军纳森·贝德福德·福雷斯特(Nathan Bedford Forrest)率领,库克卢斯·克兰(Ku Klux Klan)的未来创始人,迅速占领了这座堡垒,联盟的卫兵投降。

en: Instead of taking the African American soldiers prisoner , as they did the White soldiers , the Confederates executed them .
zh: 非裔美国士兵被俘,而不是白人士兵被俘,南北军将他们处决。

en: The massacre outraged the North , and the Union refused to engage in any future exchanges of prisoners with the Confederacy .
zh: 这次屠杀激怒了北方,联盟拒绝与联邦进行任何未来交换的囚犯。

en: Good morning everybody , welcome back to another vlog .
zh: 大家早上好,欢迎回到另一个 vlog。

en: I started out this vlog outside because I really wanted to sit outside in this like beautiful weather and talk to you while I was eating my snack , and like , I just finished filming a main channel video out there , but then my neighbor came outside and like , things got kind of awkward .
zh: 我开始了这个 vlog 外面,因为我真的想坐在外面,就像美丽的天气,和你说话,我正在吃我的零食,而且,我刚完成拍摄一个主频道的视频,然后我的邻居出来,好像,事情变得有点尴尬。

en: I just feel awkward being like " what 's up guys , " like , I do n't know when my neighbors are out in their backyard .
zh: 我只是觉得很尴尬, “ 伙计们怎么了, ” “我不知道邻居们什么时候在他们的后院。

en: So I 'm just gon na let them have their peace and quiet , but I just finished my snack .
zh: 我只是想让他们平静下来,但我刚吃完点心。

en: I have a lot to do today .
zh: 我今天有许多事情要做。

en: But like I said .
zh: 但正如我说的那样。

en: My face is breaking out so badly .
zh: 我的脸色真坏了。

en: I mentioned it in the last vlog .
zh: 我在上次的录影带中提到过。

en: I do n't know , like I washed my makeup brushes .
zh: 我不知道, 就像洗了我的化妆刷一样.

en: I changed my pillowcases once to twice a week .
zh: 我每周一次到两次换药布。

en: So I do n't really know what 's going on .
zh: 所以我真不知道发生了什么事。

en: I think it 's hormonal , but anyways , this is just real life and I 've really been struggling with my appearance lately .
zh: 我想这是荷尔蒙性,但无论如何,这只是真实的生活,我最近一直在挣扎着自己的外表。

en: It 's been a really sore spot for me .
zh: 这对我来说真是个痛点。

en: I 'm just being honest , like , I am not in a good place with the way I look .
zh: 我只是坦率地说,我看起来不太好。

en: And I also think I put way too much emphasis on what I look like , and the fact that I 'm putting this on the internet and that I , like , get like this for the internet , is huge for me , it 's always been huge for me , but also it 's really hard when I 'm editing .
zh: 而且我认为我把太多的重点放在我的样子上,而且我把这张照片放在互联网上,而且我,就像,在互联网上这样,对我来说是巨大的,对我来说一直是巨大的,而且在编辑的时候也是很困难的。

en: I have a really hard time , like just grappling with my appearance at times , and that 's a really toxic thing for your mental health .
zh: 我确实很难过, 有时我只是和自己的外表打架,这对你的心理健康是有害的.

en: And so I 'm trying to break out of that , and I do n't know , maybe some of you are also dealing with the same thing and are struggling with , I do n't know , I just feel ugly .
zh: 因此,我正试图从中脱出,我不知道,也许你们中的有些人也正面临着同样的事情,并正挣扎着,我不知道,我只是感觉丑陋。

en: I feel ugly all the time .
zh: 我总觉得丑陋。

en: And I know that 's not the case and ugly is such a subjective word .
zh: 我知道不是这样,丑是如此主观的词。

en: And also I feel like it 's a word meant to like , oppress people , particularly women , but I 've just been having a hard time with the way I look .
zh: 而且我觉得这是用来形容,压迫人,尤其是女人的词,但我只是对自己的外表感到难过。

en: And I think I 'm zooming out right now in my head and realizing that it 's been two , almost two years of this shit , and that I obviously need to be more gentle with myself and I think I 'm in the process of doing that , and this week , particularly I 've been moving my body a little bit more and it 's been feeling really good .
zh: 我想现在我正从头向外 zoom out, 意识到这事已经过去两年了, 差不多两年了, 而且我显然需要对自己更温柔,我想我正在做这件事的进程中,这个星期, 特别是我开始动身了点儿,感觉真好。

en: And also , I 'm very proud to say that I have actually gone back to therapy , which is something that I have n't done since — I mean the last time I was in therapy , almost I was like 20 .
zh: 而且,我非常自豪地说,我实际上已经回到了治疗,这是我从 — 我是说,上次我在治疗的时候,我差不多20岁了。

en: Your girl 's got trauma like , it 's way past due .
zh: 你的女孩受了这样的创伤, 已经过期了.

en: I think in the past I have really put off therapy because I was n't ready to like open old wounds .
zh: 我想过去我确实推迟了治疗,因为我不想喜欢开创的旧伤。

en: And it takes a lot sometimes when you 're in therapy , like it takes a toll on you mentally .
zh: 当你接受治疗时,有时需要花费很多时间, 就像精神上的损失一样.

en: And so , I knew that things were gon na have to get unearthed and things were definitely gon na have to get worse before they got better .
zh: 因此,我知道事情必须得到解明,而且事情肯定必须变得更糟,才能变得更好。

en: And I 've only just started , but I 'm already feeling really good in that I 'm taking this step towards bettering myself and it makes me really happy .
zh: 我只是刚刚开始了,但我已经感觉很好,我正朝着改善自己迈出这一步,这使我非常快乐。

en: And you know , my therapist , like the very first thing she said was , you know , you doing this takes a lot of courage .
zh: 你知道,我的治疗师,她的第一句话就是,你知道,做这件事需要很多勇气。

en: It 's like a lot of bravery involved to do something like this and to kind of want to better yourself and to take these steps for you and your mental health .
zh: 做这样的事需要大量的勇气,并且想让自己变得更好,并为你和你的心理健康采取这些步骤。

en: So I did bring that up , the whole thing I was talking about before in therapy , where I have a really hard time with my appearance .
zh: 因此,我确实把这点提出来,我以前在治疗中谈论的全部事情,我对自己的外表确实很困难。

en: In fact , it becomes like an obsession and I obsess over little , every angle and thing .
zh: 事实上,它就成了一种迷恋,我对每一个角度和事物都有着迷恋。

en: And it probably does n't seem that way , by the way I feel myself , but it 's always just something that 's in here , do you know what I mean ?
zh: 而且这可能不是这样,因为我感觉自己,但总是有东西在里面,你知道我的意思吗?

en: Conversations for first thing in the morning what the heck , it 's not even 11:00 a.m. , but hi , just coming right out of the gate , just with what 's fresh on my mind .
zh: 早上的第一件事是谈话,这可不是早上11点,不过嗨,我刚从门外出来,刚想起新鲜的东西。

en: I know you all appreciate when I have these talks and you know , just kind of like get real with you .
zh: 我知道你们都赞赏我做这些谈话,你知道,只是有点像和你们谈得真的。

en: And I mean , does n't get much realer than this .
zh: 我的意思是,这比这更真实。

en: So anyways , today I have quite a bit of filming to do .
zh: 不管怎样,我今天有相当多的拍摄要做。

en: I just filmed my like portion of a main channel video that was outside , that was really fun .
zh: 我刚拍了一部主要频道的视频,那是外面的,真有趣。

en: I think maybe in this video , this vlog , I 'm just in the mood to talk , you know , I do n't really have much to show .
zh: 我想 maybe in this video, this vlog, I'm just in the mood to talk, you know, I don't really have much to show。

en: I 'm not really doing anything this week other than like hunkering down and doing as much work as possible .
zh: 这个星期我没有真正做任何事情,除了打猎和尽可能多的工作。

en: I do n't think , maybe in the next vlog I might do some fall things , excuse me .
zh: 我想,也许在下一个 vlog我可能做一些掉落的事情,原谅我。

en: I 'm really just kind of preparing to go out of town next week and I have like a lot of deadlines and stuff before then .
zh: 我真的只是准备下周离开城里,而且我还有很多最后期限和之前的事情。

en: Okay , I 'm gon na try not --
zh: 好吧, 我不想试着...

en: I 'm trying .
zh: 我正在试着。

en: I 'm trying .
zh: 我正在试着。

en: I 'm just being honest , I was just about to say we need to do something about this .
zh: 我只是坦率地说,我只是想说我们需要做点事情。

en: I still feel that way , but I 'm working on it .
zh: 我还是这样感觉,但我正在努力。

en: Let 's reconvene after I 've had a shower .
zh: 我去洗澡后再聚一次。

en: So I 've been planning to vlog today um because I was going to do like a little productive day of my life blah blah blah but then I literally had a mental breakdown at 4 am last night .
zh: 因此,我一直在计划今天拍一个视频,因为我打算像我生命中的一天那样做点活泼的活泼活泼活泼活泼的活泼活泼活泼的活泼活泼活泼的活泼活泼活泼的活泼活泼活泼的活泼活泼活泼的活泼活泼活泼的活泼活泼活泼的活泼活泼活泼的活泼活泼活泼的活泼活泼活泼的活泼活泼活泼的活泼活泼活泼的活泼活泼活泼的活泼活泼活泼的活泼活泼活泼的活泼活泼活泼的活泼活泼活泼的活泼活泼活泼的活泼活泼活泼的活泼活泼活泼的活泼活泼活泼活泼的活泼活泼活泼活泼的活泼活泼活

en: And I was like , I ca n't vlog tomorrow because I 'm just not gon na have the mental energy or the physical energy to do anything productive .
zh: 我想,我明天不会来,因为我只是没有精神能量或者身体能量做任何有成效的事情。

en: Like I did n't even think I would be able to wake up for my 8:15 a.m. yoga class that I signed up for , but I am awake .
zh: 我甚至没想到我能为8点15分的瑜伽课醒来,我报名参加,但我醒来。

en: So I was kind of like , maybe I should vlog today and just see how my day turns around because we 're getting off on a rough start right now .
zh: 所以我有点像,也许我今天应该做个 vlog,看看我的一天如何转过来,因为我们现在正开始一个艰难的开始。

en: But yeah , I will just take you guys through another day in my life .
zh: 但是,我会带你们过我一生的另一个日子。

en: I 'll take you guys to yoga with me and we 'll just see if things improve .
zh: 我带你们去瑜伽,看看情况是否好。

en: I have my glasses on now .
zh: 我戴上眼镜了。

en: And then after that , I have my class , my marketing brand management class .
zh: 然后, 我有我的课, 我的营销品牌管理课.

en: And I have a meeting tonight .
zh: 今晚我有一个会议。

en: I 'm gon na start getting ready for my yoga class soon so let 's start doing that .
zh: 我快要开始准备我的瑜伽课了,让我们开始做吧。

en: I got this workout set from Amazon and it is so good .
zh: 我从亚马逊购买了这套运动套件,非常棒。

en: I guess I 've come to the conclusion that if I wear more workout clothes , like just in my daily life , then I 'll be more inclined to go to the gym because I do n't have to like change OOTD haha .
zh: 我想我已经得出结论,如果我穿更多的运动服,就像我日常生活一样,那么我会更倾向于去健身房,因为我不需要喜欢换OOTD。

en: Alright , I 'm pretty much all ready to go , I just need to like pack my bag because I am basically just not coming home .
zh: 好吧,我差不多都准备好了,我只是想把行李收拾好,因为我基本上不会回家。

en: I 'm going to Saxby 's right after to just do all the work I need to do for the day , so yeah .
zh: 我马上去萨克斯比家做我今天要做的所有工作,所以是的。

en: Alright , I 'm heading out .
zh: 好吧,我要去出去。

en: I 'm actually very excited for this yoga class .
zh: 我对这次瑜伽课感到非常兴奋。

en: But , I 'm running on a lot of coffee and very little sleep today .
zh: 但是, 我今天喝了很多咖啡,睡得很少.

en: So eee wish me luck .
zh: 所以祝我好运。

en: We 're done with yoga .
zh: 我们已经用瑜伽了。

en: She gave me a foot massage .
zh: 她给了我脚部按摩。

en: That one I was kind of like , whoa I 'm being touched now .
zh: 那个我有点像,我正在被触摸了。

en: I usually do n't like massages , but like , this was fine .
zh: 我通常不喜欢按摩,但是,这没关系。

en: But yeah , we 're heading to Saxby 's now to do work .
zh: 但是,我们现在要去萨克斯比做工作。

en: I have a Starbucks bottle with me .
zh: 我带了一瓶Starbucks酒。

en: They 're probably looking at me and being like this bitch .
zh: 他们可能看着我,像这个混蛋一样。

en: I got Starbucks and went to United by Blue one day and I poured it into a different cup .
zh: 一天,我买了星巴克,去了蓝队,然后把它倒进另一个杯子里。

en: Are you fucking kidding me ?
zh: 你在开玩笑吗?

en: That 's just like a local cafe .
zh: 就像当地的咖啡馆一样。

en: I 'm in a much better mood than I was this morning .
zh: 我的心情比今天早上好得多。

en: I literally started the vlog and I was like , " hey ! " .
zh: 我实际上开始了 vlog, “ 嘿! ” 。

en: So now we did yoga .
zh: 现在我们做了瑜伽。

en: Serotonin is coursing through my body and so is a lot of caffeine .
zh: serotonin通过我的身体,还有大量的咖啡因。

en: My co-op hours start in like an hour and I 'm just gon na be doing emails again and again .
zh: 我的合作时间大约在一小时开始,我只是不停地做电子邮件。

en: But that 's okay .
zh: 但没关系。

en: I was a terrible vlogger today because I got home and just completely knocked so .
zh: 我今天是一个可怕的 vlogger,因为我回家,只是完全被撞了。

en: Why is this avocado red ?
zh: 为什么这生酱是红色的?

en: We 're making dinner .
zh: 我们正在做晚餐。

en: As you can see , we 're we 're actively making dinner .
zh: 正如你所看到的,我们正积极做晚餐。

en: And on today 's vlog segment of cooking with Ash , Harry !
zh: 还有今天与阿什一起烹饪的 vlog 部分, 哈利!

en: Both wearing sorority sweatshirts .
zh: 他们都穿着贵族运动衫。

en: One of us needs to change .
zh: 我们当中的一个人需要改变。

en: Well I got this from you and I put it on first .
zh: 嗯,我从你那里得到了这个,我把它放在头上。

en: AKA every vegetarian thing that Ash has in her fridge that will remotely go well together .
zh: AKAAsh在冰箱里的所有素食的东西都会很相配。

en: Gordon Ramsay could never with this technique .
zh: 戈登·拉姆赛不可能用这种技术。

en: You know I 've been cooking a lot more in my vlogs and I 'm starting to think like , what if Gordon Ramsay is watching my vlogs and just absolutely shitting on me .
zh: 你知道,我已经在自己的 vlogs做了很多饭了,我开始想,如果戈登·拉姆赛看我的 vlogs,我简直发疯了。

en: Alright friends we 're back , but now on Harry 's phone because my phone died .
zh: 好,朋友,我们回来了,但现在是哈里的电话,因为我的电话死了。

en: We we love a boyfriend that supports the YouTube hustle .
zh: 我们爱一个支持YouTube的男朋友。

en: Yes it 's a I provide a service .
zh: 是的,我提供了一个服务。

en: Yeah , he does n't watch my videos though .
zh: 是的, 不过他不看我的视频.

en: I like them .
zh: 我喜欢他们。

en: You you like my videos ?
zh: 你喜欢我的视频吗?

en: Oh so you do n't even like , emotionally like them .
zh: 哦,你甚至不喜欢,情绪上也不喜欢他们。

en: Well I 'm there for some of them so I like those .
zh: 嗯,我在那里为其中一些所以我喜欢这些。

en: You only like the ones you 're featured in ?
zh: 你只喜欢那些你被介绍的人吗?

en: That 's not what I — that 's not what I said .
zh: 这不是我—这不是我说的。

en: That 's what you implied .
zh: 这就是你暗示的。

en: You 're taking words out of my mouth .
zh: 你把我的话从嘴里拿出来了。

en: I 'm gon na I 'm gon na I 'm gon na call this vlog first couple fight , not click bait .
zh: 我是gonna,我是gonna,我是gonna,我叫这个 vlog第一对争吵,而不是点击诱饵。

en: Anyways we 're going to chop these bad boys up .
zh: 不管怎么说,我们要把这些坏家伙剪掉。

en: Do you want to use all three of them or just like one of them or ?
zh: 你想用它们的全部三种,还是像它们中的一个,还是?

en: Why do n't we just use a little bit from all three so we get some color in there ?
zh: 为什么我们不把这三个部分都用作一点颜色呢?

en: Yeah , let 's make it colorful .
zh: 是的, 让我们让它充满色彩.

en: My parents are gon na be so proud of me that I 'm cooking .
zh: 我的父母太骄傲了,我正在做饭。

en: I hope so .
zh: 我希望如此。

en: Mom and dad if you 're watching this , I 'm making healthy food .
zh: 妈妈和爸爸,如果你正在看这个,我正在做健康食品。

en: It 's delicious .
zh: 很好吃。

en: Hi guys , I 'm the worst and I forgot to do an outro for this .
zh: 嗨,伙计们,我是最坏的,我忘了做这件 outro。

en: My day really did turn around um and I did n't feel as bad as I used to in the morning .
zh: 我的一天真的转了过来,我不像早上那样感觉不好。

en: So yeah , I hope you guys enjoyed watching !
zh: 是的, 我希望你们都喜欢看!

en: If you made it to this point in the video , you are a very good human , and I 'll see you in my next one !
zh: 如果你在视频中达到这个点,你是一个非常优秀的人,我将在下一个视频中见到你!

en: Welcome back to another video .
zh: 欢迎回到另一个视频。

en: For those of you who are new here and do n't know me , my name is Jasmine , and I 'm so glad you 're here on my channel .
zh: 对于那些不认识我的人来说,我叫贾斯敏,我很高兴你在我的频道上。

en: If you have n't already followed my social media , I 'll link it right here .
zh: 如果你还没有追踪我的社交媒体,我会在这里链接。

en: My socials are @jasthenurse .
zh: 我的朋友是 @jasthenurse 。

en: So , if you have n't watched my other video , I wanted to give you guys an update as to my experience with Covid .
zh: 所以,如果你没看过我的其他视频,我想给你一个关于我与Covid的经验的更新。

en: For those of you who had n't already watched that video , I 'm gon na link that video right here so that you can watch it .
zh: 对于那些还没有看过那部视频的人,我愿意在这里链接那部视频,以便你们能看它。

en: Um , so essentially , on the 16th of December , I tested positive for Covid .
zh: 嗯, 基本上, 12月16日, 我对科维德进行了测试。

en: If I 'm sounding out of breath , my lingering shortness of breath , and then also you know that I always talk fast in these videos .
zh: 如果我发出呼吸的声音,我的持续的呼吸短促,然后你也知道我在这些视频里总是说得快。

en: In this video , I wanted to update you all regarding my symptoms of Covid and just my overall experience with it .
zh: 在这个视频中,我想向大家提供关于科维德的症状和我对科维德的总体经验的更新。

en: For one , it can make people more aware and then hopefully make people feel a little bit less alone .
zh: 首先,它能让人们更觉察,然后希望让人们感觉少一点孤独。

en: So , my first symptom , which was on Monday , was a sore throat .
zh: 我的第一个症状是星期一的喉咙痛。

en: And the thing is , on Sunday night , I had gotten back from work around 9:00 pm , so I took a shower .
zh: 事情是,星期天晚上,我下班后晚上九点左右就回来了,所以我洗澡了。

en: Um I never really dried my hair , which is so awful , but I decided to go straight to bed because I was so exhausted .
zh: 嗯,我从来没干过头发,这太可怕了,但我决定直接睡觉,因为我太累了。

en: But I went to bed with my hair wet .
zh: 但是我睡着了,头发湿了。

en: And you know like when you wake up sometimes you have like a sore throat because of the fact that your hair was wet and you were cold ?
zh: 你知道,当你醒来的时候,因为你的头发湿了,而且你的喉咙很疼吗?

en: So , I assumed oh that like maybe it was just like a sore throat gotten because I did n't bother to you know blow dry my hair .
zh: 因此,我假定,哦,也许这就像喉咙疼一样,因为我不在意你知道吹干我的头发。

en: So , that happened .
zh: 所以,这发生了。

en: Um what about my day Tuesday ?
zh: 我的星期二怎么样?

en: My sister tests positive .
zh: 我妹妹的测试是肯定的。

en: Even though I was wearing a mask , she was n't wearing a mask , and she was like obviously coughing um .
zh: 尽管我戴着面具,她却不戴面具,而且她很明显咳嗽。

en: And so that prolonged period of time , we were probably in the car with each other for like 40 minutes because we drove one way and then drove back .
zh: 那段漫长的时间,我们大概在车里在一起约40分钟,因为我们开着一条路,然后又开回来。

en: That 40 minutes , her coffee in the car , the – all the windows closed , and even though I had a mask on , the virus circulates .
zh: 那40分钟,她在车里喝咖啡,所有的窗子都关上了,尽管我戴上面具,病毒传染了。

en: That Tuesday , I remember I had been getting a little bit more symptomatic .
zh: 那天星期二,我记得我有点发病了。

en: My sore throat did n't go away , um very very mild symptoms .
zh: 我的喉咙痛并没有消失, 嗯,非常轻微的症状.

en: I – all the clinics were closed by the time that she had gotten her results which was around like 6:00 pm .
zh: 我——在她收到结果的时候,所有的诊所都关闭了,大约是下午6点左右。

en: I had booked an appointment or an e-visit with my um insurance to get me tested the next day .
zh: 我已预定预约或以我的保险来访,以便第二天我得到测试。

en: I get tested on Wednesday , and when I 'm tested on Wednesday , I remember that night , um I believe that was the day where I had actually gotten a fever and chills .
zh: 我星期三接受测试,当我星期三接受测试时,我记得那天晚上,我想那天我确实得了感冒。

en: So , at night I was getting really hot then cold then hot and cold .
zh: 因此,晚上我变得非常热,然后又冷,然后又热又冷。

en: And I remember at one point I checked my temperature 's only like 98.7 , but at another point it was like 101 or something really high that was obviously a fever .
zh: 我记得我曾经检查过我的温度,只有98.7度,但另一段温度是101度,或者真高,这显然是发烧。

en: And then around day four , everything started to like stabilize .
zh: 然后四天左右,一切都开始稳定起来。

en: Um day six was when I noticed like the my sinuses were feeling weird .
zh: 第六天,我注意到我的鼻窦感觉很奇怪。

en: It was more like my like congestion like right up here , it was like a weird .
zh: 更像是我这儿的交通堵塞,像是个怪事。

en: Know when it – you ca n't like sneeze ?
zh: 知道什么时候——你不喜欢打喷嚏?

en: That 's what the feeling was .
zh: 这就是那种感觉。

en: It felt like like like there was a sneeze drop in there , and I could n't get it out .
zh: 我觉得好像有一股微风进来,我没法把它弄出来。

en: Um so , day six and seven , I started noticing that my taste buds started to change .
zh: 嗯,第六和第七天,我开始注意到我的味觉开始改变。

en: Oh , let me mention , um nearly day two or three , my senses were like really really heightened .
zh: 哦, 让我说一下, 嗯, 差不多两天或三天, 我的感官好像真的增强了.

en: I do n't know if you remember the clip of when I had been eating those chips .
zh: 我不知道你还记得我吃那些薯条时的片段吗。

en: Chips taste so strong to me .
zh: Chips给我味道很浓。

en: I guess that 's like what happens when you lose your taste buds , I do n't know , olfactory nerves , I do n't know .
zh: 我猜你失去味觉时会发生什么事,我不知道,嗅觉神经,我不知道。

en: So , from there , I had gotten um a complete 180 and went from everything being like really heightened sense of taste and even the smell , because I remember I was gargling apple cider vinegar , and I remember smelling it from across the room , and now I ca n't really .
zh: 因此,从那儿,我已经完全达到180岁了,从所有东西都变成了一种真正高层次的味觉,甚至还有嗅觉,因为我记得我正在提取苹果醋,我记得从房间里闻到它,现在我却不是真的。

en: Well , I would say that I have like 30 percent of my taste and smell .
zh: 嗯,我想说我有百分之三十的口味和气味。

en: So , for example , if you can see my Bath and Body Works candle , I try to smell that every morning to see if my change in smell changes , and I have like maybe 30 percent of my like smelling capabilities .
zh: 比如,如果你能看到我的“浴与身体工作”蜡烛,我会每天早晨试着闻它,看看我的气味是否改变,我大概有30%的喜欢的嗅觉能力。

en: I have to get like this close to be able to smell the candle , which is insane because those candles are so strong , you literally open one up and you can smell it all over your room .
zh: 我得这样接近才能闻到蜡烛,这简直是疯了,因为那些蜡烛太强了,你可以打开蜡烛,闻到整个房间的气味。

en: I can still smell , but not to my like fullest capability .
zh: 我仍能闻到,但不是像我一样完全的能力。

en: I do n't know if you guys have seen those like TikToks where people try and drink different things like pickle juice and water and Gatorade .
zh: 我不知道你们是否见过那些像TikToks那样的人尝试和喝不同的东西,如 pickle juice和水和Gatorade。

en: First of all , that 's like super inaccurate .
zh: 首先, 这就像超级不准确。

en: When you drink , you can still , for example , I took like a ginger shot this morning , and it had cayenne pepper .
zh: 当你喝的时候,你仍然可以,例如,我今天早上吃了一粒姜 shot,里面有Cayenne pepper。

en: I can still that feel that burning sensation .
zh: 我仍能感觉到那灼热的感觉。

en: So , for example , I tested if I could drink alcohol , and I drank a Truly , and I can still taste the alcohol like burning sensation going down .
zh: 例如,我测试了是否能喝酒精,我喝了真酒,我仍然能尝到酒精的滋味,就像燃烧的感觉一样。

en: So , you can kind of distinguish if it 's like sweet or salty or tart um , but you ca n't really taste it to its fullest if that makes any sense .
zh: 所以,你可以区分它是否像甜味或咸味或酸味,但如果你觉得有意义的话,你不可能真正品尝到它的全部。

en: Like like for example , I made mac and cheese , I do n't know if you saw earlier .
zh: 比如,我做了麦当劳和奶酪,我不知道你以前有没有看过。

en: I do n't really know exactly how it tastes because I can only like I can kind of taste the cheese , um the saltiness , but it 's more so um I 'm able to feel the textures .
zh: 我真不知道它味道如何,因为我只能喜欢我能尝到奶酪的味道,嗯,咸味,但更像是嗯,我能感觉到它的纹理。

en: I have a meeting at 10:45 so in a few minutes with one of my TFs about my project .
zh: 我有一个10:45的会议,所以在几分钟内,我和一个我的TFs关于我的项目。

en: I 'm gon na meet with her quickly and see if she has any feedback and then I 'll be working on chem and neuro .
zh: 我快要和她见面,看看她是否有反馈,然后我会在化学和神经方面工作。

en: She 's not here yet .
zh: 她还没到这儿。

en: I 'm so sorry , I went to the section link .
zh: 很抱歉,我去了节链接。

en: I was waiting there , I was like " uhm , did I get the time wrong ? "
zh: 我在那儿等着, “ 嗯, 我把时间弄错了 吗? ”

en: My hair is in a bun .
zh: 我的头发在面包里。

en: I took a shower .
zh: 我洗澡了。

en: I should let it dry but I 'm too lazy to take it out .
zh: 我应该放它干,但我太懒了,不能把它拔出来。

en: It 's a new day , a little rainy outside .
zh: 今天是新的一天,外面有点雨。

en: But I actually like when it 's gloomy for studying because then I feel like there 's nothing else you could be doing , so you might as well just stay inside and work .
zh: 但事实上,我喜欢学习时是阴暗的,因为我觉得没有别的事情可以做,所以你最好呆在里面工作。

en: So I have some coffee and I 'll be focusing entirely on chem and neuro today , I think .
zh: 所以我喝点咖啡,今天我想我将全心全意地关注化疗和神经。

en: I 've just been studying for neuroscience , my neuro exam .
zh: 我刚刚在学习神经科学, 我的神经检查.

en: It 's raining .
zh: 下雨了。

en: I 've been doing a semi - Pomodoro technique but I 've been doing like working from like half an hour to an hour and then taking like 10 minute breaks .
zh: 我一直在做半波莫多罗技术,但是我一直在像从半小时到一个小时的工作,然后像10分钟的休息。

en: I do it based off of what I 'm trying to get done because I have my neuroscience final study schedule .
zh: 我这样做是基于我想要完成的事,因为我有我的神经科学的最后研究日程表。

en: These are the things I 've gotten done , so I got this done , this done , this done .
zh: 这些是我做的,所以我做了这个,这个,这个。

en: I 'm currently working on this and then I 'll try to get to this , but if I ca n't then I can do it tomorrow .
zh: 我现在正在做这个,然后我会设法弄到这个,但是如果我不能的话,我明天就能做。

en: I 'm up very late so I wanted to show that , finals as a college student , you know .
zh: 我起床很晚,所以我想展示一下, 作为一名大学生的决赛, 你知道.

en: So I 'm going to do what I can and then maybe finish like one or two more lectures and then I will start taking a look at chem .
zh: 所以我会尽我所能做,然后也许会完成一个或两个更多的讲座,然后我会开始看一下化学品。

en: I will be up for a little while longer .
zh: 我会上一会儿的。

en: A lot of the notes that I had taken from our last meeting and being more of a cause or like leading to memory 's importance for each of the sources , I — I essentially changed it to um " it 's the one persistent element of our existence that gives meaning to the inheritance of memory " .
zh: 我从我们上次的会议上所取的大量笔记,作为一个原因或类似的导致记忆对于每一个来源的重要性,我 — 我基本上把它改为um “ 它是我们存在的一个持久的元素,它给记忆的继承意义 ” 。

en: I asked this not only as a question of the methods , but also of the circumstances .
zh: 我不仅问到方法问题,也问到情况问题。

en: So now I have to post about it .
zh: 因此现在我必须就这件事发表文章。

en: I like deleted Instagram and like was n't really checking social media too much this week , but now I have to redownload it , so I can post about it .

en: It was a really weird tiring semester , I think , relatively , compared to last semester , so you know , it is what it is .

en: I 'll try my best and am just gon na take the test , move on , it 's just one more test .
zh: 我将尽我最大的努力,我只是想通过考试,继续下去,只是再做一次考试。

en: Wish me luck !
zh: 祝我好运!

en: So it 's Shawntas Way here today , and today I 'm going to be talking to you guys about number one : my new product line .

zh: 我推出新产品,我很高兴今天能向你们展示我将如何使用我的产品,而且我也打算向你们展示这个极端的湿度炸弹的程序,你可以做,um,在冬天,因为外面越来越冷了。

en: Um , it 's not like super cold w- where I am just yet , but it 's getting there , so ignore my hair right now .
zh: 嗯,这不像超级冷的W-我目前的那个地方,但是它已经到那里了,所以现在别看我的头发了。

en: I know it looks kinda crazy .

en: I just now got done washing it .

en: I 'm gon na tell you guys about that process as well , but first let 's go ahead and get into these products !

en: So this product line is the Angelic Coco line , and I have been working on this line since 2019 .
zh: 因此,这个产品系列是安格丽克可可系列,我已从2019年开始在这个系列工作。
