en: When you see the first green tendrils push up through the soil , it 's time to remove the plastic wrap .
zh: 当你看到第一个绿色的树枝在土壤中爬升时,是时候去除塑料包装了。

en: Keep watering the sprouts twice daily , never letting the soil dry out .
zh: 每天两次浇灌芽,不要让土壤干燥。

en: When the plants become a few inches tall and their leaves mature , it 's time to transplant them to a larger container .
zh: 当植物长几英寸,叶子成熟时,是时候将它们移植到更大的容器里。

en: 1 Transplant the basil plants .
zh: 1把盆栽植入。

en: Once two sets of leaves have formed , basil can be planted into the garden or permanent containers .
zh: 一旦两组叶子形成,盆栽可以植入花园或永久容器。

en: Basil does not tolerate frost so do n't plant too early .
zh: Basil不耐霜,所以不要太早种。

en: It 's best to put basil somewhere where it will get a good deal of sunshine and have well - drained soil .
zh: 最好把盆栽放在那里,那里能得到大量的阳光和良好的干旱土壤.

en: To plant the basil in the garden , dig holes spaced at least 6 inches apart .
zh: 把盆栽放在花园里,挖出至少隔6英寸的洞。

en: Place the roots in the holes and place soil around the stems .
zh: 把根放在洞里,把土放在茎周围。

en: Pat down soil around the plants to eliminate air pockets .
zh: 将土壤环绕植物,以消除空气袋。

en: If you want to plant the basil in a container , make sure it 's large enough to accommodate the number of plants you 're growing ;
zh: 如果你想把盆栽放在容器里,要确保它足够大以容纳你正在种植的植物的数量;

en: they need to be planted 6 inches apart , since they grow quite large .
zh: 它们需要分开6英寸,因为它们长得相当大。

en: 2 Keep the soil damp , but not soaked .
zh: 保持土壤湿润,但不要浸透。

en: Basil does best in well - drained soil , and should not be subjected to standing water .
zh: Basil 最好在干净的土壤中进行, 并不应受到 standing water 的污染.

en: Water the mature basil plants once a day , in the morning , so the water has time to soak in and evaporate rather than sitting on the plants overnight .
zh: 每天早晨,把成熟的盆栽灌溉一次,这样水就有时间浸入和蒸发,而不是一夜呆在盆栽上。

en: 3 Pinch off flower heads .
zh: 3把花头松开。

en: When you see flower buds , pinch them and two pairs of leaves under them off .
zh: 当你看到花芽时,把它们和两对叶子放在它们下面。

en: Flowers blooming create a hormone change which dramatically reduces the flavor of the leaves , as well as reducing the amount of foliage which grows .
zh: 花朵开花,产生一种激素变化,大大降低了叶子的香味,减少了生长的叶子的数量。

en: This is called " bolting " and is more likely to happen when there 's extra sunshine .
zh: 这叫做“ 刹车 ”,当有额外的阳光时更有可能发生。

en: You 'll notice that if you leave the flowers , the plant will become lanky and the leaves wo n't be as full or tasty .
zh: 你会注意到,如果你离开花朵,植物就会变得枯燥乏味,叶子就不会那么丰满或美味。

en: 4 Watch for pests and mold .
zh: 注意害虫和霉菌。

en: the best way to control these pests is to pick them off the plants by hand .
zh: 控制这些害虫的最好方法是用手把它们从植物上摘下来。

en: If your plants show signs of mold growth , they may not be getting adequate sunlight , or they may be too close together .
zh: 如果你的植物表现出霉菌生长的迹象,它们可能没有足够的阳光,或者它们可能过于接近。

en: Weed out the smaller plants to give the larger ones more space .
zh: 把较小的植物除去,让较大的植物得到更多的空间。

en: 1 Harvest and prune .
zh: 1收割和剪切。

en: As the plant matures , pinch off the top two pairs of leaves once a stalk reaches a reasonable height .
zh: 当植物成熟时,当茎达到合理的高度时,把顶部两对叶片松开。

en: If you look closely , at the base of every leaf are two tiny little leaves that will grow outwards if the stem growing between them is cut off .
zh: 如果你仔细观察,每个叶子的底部有两个小叶子,如果它们之间生长的茎被切断,它们就会向外生长。

en: Cut close to those tiny leaves , but be sure not to damage them .
zh: 切近那些小叶子,但一定要不伤害它们。

en: Pinching encourages the plant 's energy to be directed into its stronger stems and leaves .
zh: Pinching鼓励植物的能量被引导到其更强的茎和叶子。

en: This helps the plants grow bushy .
zh: 这有助于植物生长肥沃。

en: Do n't pinch on the lower part of the stem , or the basil plants will grow tall and reedy .
zh: 不要把茎的下部钉住,否则盆栽会长得高又苗条。

en: You want them to get bushy , so pinch from the top .
zh: 你希望他们变得忙碌,所以从头上抓紧。

en: 2 Enjoy the basil fresh .
zh: 享受新鲜的盆栽。

en: Rinse off the leaves and use the basil to make pesto or a Caprese salad with tomatoes and fresh mozzarella cheese .
zh: 把叶子洗掉,然后用盆栽制作皮斯托或加普雷斯沙拉,配上番茄和新鲜的蒙特利拉奶酪。

en: 3 Store the basil in the refrigerator .
zh: 3把大蒜放在冰箱里。

en: You 'll probably have more basil than you could possibly eat fresh , so plan on storing some in the fridge .
zh: 你可能吃得比你吃新鲜的食物还要多,所以计划在冰箱里储存一些。

en: Place them in a food storage container with an airtight lid .
zh: 把它们放在密封的容器里。

en: 4 Freeze the basil .
zh: 把盆栽冻结。

en: Freezing the leaves whole does n't work very well , but if you puree it first you can freeze it for months .
zh: 把整个叶子冻结起来并不很好,但是如果你先把叶子清净,你可以冻结几个月。

en: Place the basil in a blender with a little water .
zh: 把大蒜放在搅拌器里,加入少量的水。

en: Puree it until smooth , then put it in a food storage bag and freeze until you need it .
zh: 把它洁净到光滑为止,然后把它放在食品储存袋里,冻结直到你需要它。

en: The Beavertail Cactus  , found primarily in the Mojave Desert and northwest Mexico ; can grow to be about 24 inches  high ; has pads that look like beavertails ; and yields red or purple flowers from spring to early summer .
zh: 贝弗塔伊尔(Beavertail Cactus),主要分布于莫哈维沙漠和墨西哥西北;可生长到24英寸高;有像贝弗塔伊尔(Beavertails)的花瓣;从春天到初夏产出红色或紫色花。

en: Growing Beavertail can be done at any time of year by scattering seeds in a shady bed or , for faster results , planting cuttings in a mix of soil and sand and ensuring that they have a bit of water and plenty of sun .
zh: 生长的贝弗泰尔可以在一年任何时候通过散播种子在阴暗的床或,为了更快的结果,在土壤和沙子混合中种植切片,确保它们有一点水和充足的阳光。

en: Read the following steps to find out how to grow Beavertail cactus .
zh: 阅读下面的步骤来了解如何种植贝弗泰尔 kaktus 。

en: Purchase Beavertail cactus seeds .
zh: 购买贝弗泰尔 kaktus种子。

en: These can be bought at garden centers or purchased online .
zh: 这些可以在花园中心购买或网上购买。

en: Scatter the seeds .
zh: 散播种子。

en: There 's no need to cover them , unless you want to use netting to keep the birds off .
zh: 没有必要遮盖它们,除非你想要用网来防止鸟儿离开。

en: Keep the soil moist until the seeds germinate .
zh: 保持土壤湿润,直到种子发芽。

en: Make sure that the garden bed is in the shade .
zh: 一定要把花园的床放在阴影里。

en: Beavertail cacti seeds need shade to grow , whereas cuttings need plenty of direct sunlight .
zh: 海龟的种子需要阳光才能生长,而切片需要大量的阳光。

en: It can take as long as 4 to 4 years before you get flowers .
zh: 花期可达4年至4年。

en: Obtain Beavertail cuttings .
zh: 获得贝弗泰尔切口。

en: You can purchase them online or at a local garden center .
zh: 你可以在网上或在当地的花园中心购买它们。

en: If you already own a Beavertail cactus , you can make your own cuttings .
zh: 如果你已经拥有一只贝弗泰尔 kaktus,你可以自己做剪切。

en: To do this , choose pads  that are 6 months old or older and cut them at the base .
zh: 为了做到这一点,选择6个月或更老的垫子,在底部切开。

en: In order to form a callous and prevent rot , cure the cuttings by sitting the pad upright in a dry , dark place for 10 to 14 days .
zh: 为了形成毛病并防止腐烂,请在干燥、黑暗的地方坐上垫片10-14天,治愈伤口。

en: Plant the cuttings .
zh: 种植剪切。

en: Prepare a potting mix that is equal parts soil and rough pumice or sand and fill the appropriate number of pots with it .
zh: 准备一个等于土壤和粗糙的泥浆或沙子的灌木混合物,并用它填满适当数量的罐子。

en: Make sure there are holes in the center of the base of each pot to allow for good drainage .
zh: 确保每个锅底中心有孔,以便进行良好的排水。

en: Set the cuttings upright in the potting mix about an inch  deep .
zh: 把刀片放在刀片混合物中直立,深度约1英寸。

en: If you plant the cuttings too deep , they might rot .
zh: 如果你把树枝植得太深,它们可能会腐烂。

en: Put some rocks around the pad to anchor it in place .
zh: 把一些岩石放在垫子周围,以固定它。

en: Choose a spot for your Beavertail cactus cuttings .
zh: 选择你的贝弗泰尔 kaktus切割的地点。

en: If you live in an area with strong summer sun , position the cuttings so that the broad sides of the cuttings face east and west while the slim sides face north and south .
zh: 如果你生活在强烈的夏日地区,把剪切放在宽阔的侧面向东和西面,而瘦小的侧面向北和南面。

en: This will prevent the cuttings from burning during the hottest part of the day .
zh: 这将防止切片在白天最热的时候燃烧。

en: Make sure the spot is sheltered from any cold winter winds .
zh: 确保这个地方免受任何寒冷的冬季风。

en: Wait for a month .
zh: 等一个月。

en: Do not water the cutting for the first month .
zh: 不要在头个月浇水。

en: The moisture in the pad will provide enough nutrients for roots to grow .
zh: 叶片中的水分能提供足够的营养,使根茎生长。

en: Too much water might cause rot .
zh: 太多的水可能会导致腐烂。

en: After 1 month , roots will have sprouted and you can water the cutting for the first time .
zh: 在1个月后,根子发芽了,你可以第一次浇水。

en: Always let the soil dry before you water the cuttings .
zh: 在浇水切片之前,一定要让土壤干燥。

en: Fertilize the plants .
zh: 使植物发酵。

en: Let the cuttings grow .
zh: 让剪切生长。

en: From the first pad , many more will form .
zh: 从第一块垫子开始, 将形成更多的垫子.

en: The second or third pad will bear some flowers , but wait before harvesting them or you might affect the size of future harvests .
zh: 第二个或第三块垫子会带一些花,但要等到收割之前,否则你可能会影响未来收割的大小。

en: Anyone who 's spent a lot of time on a farm with chickens is probably familiar with this trick .
zh: 任何一个在养鸡农场里花了很多时间的人,可能已经熟悉这个技巧了。

en: Those who 've never heard of this will be amazed to see a chicken lie perfectly still after these instructions are followed .
zh: 那些从来没听说过这事的人会惊奇地看到一只鸡在遵循这些指示之后,完全静静地躺着。

en: Biologists think that fear causes this " hypnosis , " which may be an attempt to " play dead " to fool predators .
zh: 生物学家认为恐惧会引起这种“ 催眠 ”, 这可能是一个试图“ 玩死 ” 以欺骗掠食者的行为.

en: Hold the chicken down on a flat surface .
zh: 把鸡放在平坦的表面上。

en: Place it down so that its breast is carrying its weight and rests on the ground .
zh: 把它放在地上,让它的乳房能承受它的重量。

en: Continue to hold its feet so the grand experiment can continue .
zh: 继续保持自己的脚,以便大实验能够继续。

en: You can place the chicken on its breast instead .
zh: 你可以把鸡放在它的乳房上。

en: Press gently down on its back , and gently move its legs back if it tries to stand up .
zh: 如果它想站起来,就轻轻地按背部,然后轻轻地把腿往后移动。

en: Wiggle your finger .
zh: 挥动你的手指。

en: Hold the bird down gently with one hand .
zh: 用一只手轻轻地把鸟抱下来。

en: Put one finger on your other hand just in front of its beak tip , without touching it .
zh: 把一只手指放在另一只手的嘴尖前,不要碰它。

en: Move the finger backward to about 4 inches  away , then back again .
zh: 把手指往后移动,距离约4英寸,然后再往后移动。

en: Repeat until the chicken stops moving or squawking .
zh: 再重复,直到鸡停止移动或叫声。

en: Let go of its legs .
zh: 放开它的腿。

en: It will lie there for anywhere from 30 seconds to several minutes .
zh: 它会在那里停留30秒到几分钟。

en: Draw a line in front of its beak instead .
zh: 相反,在它的嘴前画一条线。

en: If the chicken was n't hypnotized , try this alternative .
zh: 如果鸡没有被催眠,试试这个替代品。

en: Using chalk , a stick , or your finger , draw a line on the ground 12 "  long .
zh: 用 chalk 、 a stick 、 or your finger, draw a line on the ground 12 " long. 用 chalk 、 a stick 、 or your finger 、 draw a line on the ground 12 " long 。

en: Start near the chicken 's beak and draw the line slowly outward , in front of its head .
zh: 开始靠近鸡嘴,慢慢向外拉线,放在鸡头前面。

en: Wake it up by clapping .
zh: 通过鼓掌唤醒它。

en: Be nice to your feathered friend and let it get back to its business .
zh: 对你的羽毛朋友保持友善,让它回到自己的事业上。

en: Clap your hands or give it a gentle shove until it jumps up and walks away .
zh: 拍手或轻轻地拍它,直到它跳起来走开。

en: Understand the hypnotic effect .
zh: 了解催眠效果。

en: Researchers call this effect " tonic immobility " .
zh: 研究者称这种效应是“ 毒性僵化 ”.

en: " When a chicken or another animal with this tendency becomes frightened , its heart rate lowers and it stops moving .
zh: 当一只鸡或其他有这种倾向的动物感到害怕时,它的心跳降低,它停止移动。

en: This may be an attempt to play dead , discouraging predators that prefer live prey .
zh: 这可能是一个试图玩死的, 使那些喜欢活食的掠食者感到沮丧的尝试.

en: Keep the chicken upright or on its side .
zh: 保持鸡直立或侧面。

en: While it 's not uncommon to transport a chicken by its feet , this upside - down hold risks breaking the chicken 's hip .
zh: 虽然用脚把鸡 transport起来并不罕见, 但这种逆转的保持会使鸡的臀部破裂.

en: Hypnosis techniques that involve laying a chicken on its back may " succeed " by cutting off its air supply .
zh: 将鸡放在它的背部的催眠技术可能通过切断其空气供应“成功 ” 。

en: This can cause the chicken significant discomfort , leading to fainting or even , rarely , death .
zh: 这会引起鸡肉的严重不适,导致昏迷甚至,很少,死亡。

en: Keep hypnosis short and infrequent .
zh: 保持催眠短而罕见。

en: It 's not completely clear how much stress this hypnosis causes .
zh: 现在还不清楚这种催眠会造成多少压力。

en: Even if it does , the chicken should n't suffer as long as you let it go soon afterward .
zh: 即使这样,只要你把鸡放走后不久,鸡就不会受到伤害。

en: Hours of stress , or regular exposure to stressful situations , can cause serious health problems .
zh: 长时间的紧张或经常暴露于紧张的环境,会引起严重的健康问题。

en: Get your chickens used to humans and novelty .
zh: 让你的鸡习惯于人类和新事物。

en: Even prolonged eye contact seems to have an effect .
zh: 甚至 prolonged eye contact似乎也有效果。

en: Living in stimulating environments with new objects may also help .
zh: 生活在刺激的环境中,使用新事物也可以帮助。

en: While hypnotizing is unlikely to cause serious harm , any type of stress is more damaging to a chicken in this state .
zh: 虽然催眠不太可能造成严重伤害,但任何类型的压力对鸡来说更有害。

en: Here 's a great vegan cupcake recipe to use as a base for whatever flavored icing you want to add to it .
zh: 这里是一个很棒的素食蛋糕配方使用作为任何口味的冰霜的基准你想要添加到它。

en: They 're guaranteed to be light and fluffy and perfect for any occasion .
zh: 他们保证是轻便、滑润、适合任何场合的。

en: Prepare the muffin tray by adding cupcake holders / cases .
zh: 通过添加蛋糕夹具/箱子来准备蛋糕盘子。

en: Put to one side .
zh: 放在一边。

en: Alternatively , use a silicone cupcake baking sheet with molded holes .
zh: 或者, 使用硅蛋糕烤板和模成的孔.

en: Put the cider vinegar into a small bowl and add the soy milk .
zh: 把柠檬醋放在一个小碗里,加入大豆牛奶。

en: Stir this well and then put to one side .
zh: 搅拌好,然后放在一边。

en: The mixture will now curdle and this is what should be happening .
zh: 这种混合物现在会弯曲,这就是应该发生的事情。

en: If you want chocolate cupcakes , add cocoa  to this stage .
zh: 如果你想要巧克力蛋糕, 加入椰子在这个阶段.

en: Stir the oil and vanilla extract into the bowl containing the soy milk and vinegar .
zh: 把油和瓦尼拉提取物搅拌到包含大豆奶和醋的碗里。

en: Mix together .
zh: 混合在一起。

en: Add the wet ingredients to the dry ingredients and beat together  .
zh: 将湿的成分加入干燥的成分,并搅拌在一起。

en: Fill the muffin pan .
zh: 填满面包盘。

en: Usually fill each paper cupcake holder with about 1/4 cup of batter .
zh: 通常用 1/4 杯泡泡泡填满每个纸杯的容器。

en: If you prefer larger cupcakes , then add a half a cup but make sure the muffin pan is larger and the cupcake holders are bigger .
zh: 如果你喜欢更大的蛋糕,那就再加半杯,但要确保蛋糕的盘子大,蛋糕的托盘大。

en: Bake for 18 - 20 minutes .
If you can smell the cupcakes earlier , check to make sure they are n't browning earlier  .
zh: 如果你能早点闻到蛋糕的味道,请检查一下它们是否早点发褐色。

en: If you are n't certain , turn off the oven earlier and let them sit for a few more minutes rather than bake them into rocks .
zh: 如果你不确定的话,先把烤箱关掉,再让它们坐几分钟,而不是把它们烤成岩石。

en: Wait for the pan to cool down .
zh: 等锅冷却下来。

en: Place cupcakes onto a wire rack to cool .
zh: 把蛋糕放在一个电架上冷却。

en: The flavor of icing or frosting can be improved by adding a little of your favorite juice to it instead of soy milk or water .
zh: 你可以增加一些你最喜欢的果汁,而不是大豆牛奶或水来改善冰冻或霜冻的味道。

en: Finished .
zh: 完毕。

en: Preheat the oven to 160 o C / 315 o F .
zh: 预热烤箱至160oC/ 315oF.

en: If using cupcake cases , arrange on a baking sheet now .
zh: 如果使用蛋糕盒,现在就安排在面包板上。

en: If using a silicone cupcake sheet , simply have it ready .
zh: 如果使用硅饼干纸张, 就把它准备好.

en: Mix to combine .
zh: 混合以组合。

en: Pour the soy milk , vinegar , sugar , oil and vanilla into another bowl .
zh: 将大豆奶 、 醋 、 糖 、 油和香草倒入另一碗.

en: Whisk together well .
zh: 好好擦一下。

en: Pour the liquid mixture into the flour mixture .
zh: 将液体混合物倒入面粉混合物中。

en: Stir to combine thoroughly .
zh: 混合 thoroughly 。

en: Pour into the cupcake cases or cupcake holes .
zh: 倒入蛋糕箱或蛋糕洞里。

en: Place into the oven .
zh: 放在烤箱里。

en: If they smell strongly earlier , test with a wooden skewer ; if it returns clean after sticking into a cupcake , they 're ready .
zh: 如果它们早些时候有强烈的气味,用木质扫帚测试;如果它在粘入蛋糕后恢复干净,它们已经准备好了。

en: Remove from the oven .
zh: 从烤箱里取出。

en: Transfer the cupcakes to a wire cooling rack as quickly as possible when cool enough to handle .
zh: 把蛋糕送到一个电缆冷却架上,尽可能快地冷却。

en: Let cool completely on the rack .
zh: 放在架子上完全冷却。

en: Add standard frosting or make vegan butter cream .
zh: 添加标准霜冻或做素食奶油。

en: You can add pureed fruit for delicious flavor changes .
zh: 你可以添加纯果品来调味美味。

en: One small container of pureed fruit is sufficient for flavoring
zh: 一个小容器的纯果足以作调味品

en: Instead of using vegan sugar , you can replace it with equal parts maple sugar or rice syrup
zh: 不要使用素食糖,你可以用同样的苹果糖或米汁代替它

en: Instead of using vegetable oil , try substituting it for walnut or macadamia nut oils if they are available to you .
zh: 不要使用蔬菜油,如果可用的话,试着用 walnut或 macadamia油代替它。

en: You can replace the plain soy milk with other flavors like chocolate or vanilla if you want to experiment with changing the flavor of the cupcakes .
zh: 如果你想尝试改变蛋糕的口味,你可以用其他口味来代替普通的大豆奶。

en: Experiment with the flavors of either recipe by replacing the vanilla extract with fragrant ingredients like neroli orange oil , rosewater , orange blossom water or coconut extract .
zh: 用香料代替香草提取品来尝试两种配方的风味,如尼罗利橙油、玫瑰水、橙花水或椰子提取品。

en: It ’s easy to annoy people when you are cramped in such a small , tight space .
zh: 在一个如此狭窄的空间里,你很容易惹人生气。

en: Because elevator rides usually last less than a minute , make sure your pranks are quick and have a lot of punch .
zh: 因为电梯的乘车时间通常不到一分钟,所以要确保你的笑话快,而且有足够的弹力。

en: When annoying people on an elevator , keep your pranks lighthearted and fun as opposed to mean - spirited so that everyone leaving the elevator will have a pleasant story to tell .
zh: 当你在电梯上烦人时, 保持你的笑话轻而易举和有趣,而不是有 mean - spirited 的,这样让离开电梯的每一个人都会有一个愉快的故事来讲述.

en: Push all the buttons .
zh: 按所有按钮。

en: When you get into the elevator , push the button for every floor .
zh: 当你进入电梯时,按每一层的按钮。

en: This makes everyone ’s ride on the elevator longer , if only for a few seconds .
zh: 这使得每个人在电梯上乘车的时间更长,哪怕只是几秒钟。

en: If you want to take it a step further , look around questioningly at everyone in the elevator when no one gets off at the floors you pushed .
zh: 如果你想向前迈出一步,当没有人从你推下的地板上掉下来时,就向 elevator里每一个人询问一下。

en: When someone comes in , say , " I 've got this , " before you push all of the buttons .
zh: 当有人进来时, 说, “ 我拿了这个, ” 然后你按一下所有的按钮。

en: You can also push all the buttons as you reach the floor you are getting off at .
zh: 你也可以按所有按钮,当你到达你正在下楼的地板上。

en: If someone asks you why you pushed all the buttons , you can honestly say , " It was just a joke ! "
zh: 如果有人问你为什么按了所有的按钮, 你可以坦率地说, “ 这只是个玩笑! ”

en: Make a dinging noise at each floor .
zh: 在每个楼层里发出喧闹声。

en: Every time the elevator reaches a new floor , say “ ding ! ” very loudly .
zh: 每次电梯到达一个新的楼层, 都大声说 “  ding! ” 。

en: You can even sing the word “ ding ” on each floor like notes in a scale , getting higher as you reach each new floor .
zh: 你甚至可以在每个楼层上唱出“ ding ” 这个词,像尺度上的音符一样,随着你到达每个新楼层的升高。

en: You can make other noises if you prefer , such as a bird cawing or an explosion sound every time a button is pushed .
zh: 如果你喜欢的话,你可以制造其他噪音,比如每次按按钮时的鸟鸣声或爆炸声。

en: Talk to your reflection in the mirror .
zh: 和镜子里的反射说话。

en: Many elevators have mirrors on the walls .
zh: 许多电梯的墙上都有镜子。

en: A great way to be mischievous in an elevator is to carry on a running commentary while you look at yourself in the mirror .
zh: 在电梯里犯规的绝佳方法是当你在镜子里看着自己时,继续进行跑步的评论。

en: You could look at yourself , turning to catch different angles and say “ All right , all right , now we ’re talking , ” very loudly .
zh: 你可以看着自己,转过身来抓住不同的角度,然后大声说“ 好吧, 好吧, 我们现在谈话了 ”。

en: You could also keep adjusting your shirt or your hair , keeping a running dialogue about what look is best for you .
zh: 你可以继续调整你的衬衫或头发,保持一个关于你最适合的外观的对话。

en: Stand in the corner of the elevator facing the wall .
zh: 站在电梯的拐角处,面向墙。

en: Do n't say anything the whole ride .
zh: 整个行程不要说什么。

en: Dance to the elevator music .
zh: 跳舞到电梯音乐。

en: Many elevators play music in the background , usually soft rock or smooth jazz .
zh: 许多电梯在背景里播放音乐, 通常是软摇滚或流畅的爵士乐.

en: If you ’re in an elevator that is playing music , start to dance .
zh: 如果你在电梯里播放音乐,就开始跳舞。

en: Start just bobbing your head and tapping your feet , and then get your whole body into it .
zh: 开始摇摇头,触摸你的脚,然后把你的全身放在里面。

en: Take up as much space as you can to dance until everyone is staring at you .
zh: 尽你所能占的空间去跳舞,直到每个人都盯着你。

en: Announce every floor .
zh: 宣布每个楼层。

en: At every floor , make a loud announcement telling everyone the floor number .
zh: 在每个楼层上,大声宣布每个楼层的号码。

en: You can also pretend to conduct people onto the elevator , saying “ All aboard the elevator train ! ”
zh: 你可以假装把人带上电梯, 说: “ 所有乘客都上电梯! ”

en: Exclaim that you 've lost a beast .
zh: 发声说你丢了一只野兽。

en: When the elevator is going from the bottom floor to the top , as soon as the doors close , exclaim that you lost your tarantula / snake / scorpion but confirm that it is somewhere in the elevator .
zh: 当电梯从底层上往上走时,一门关上,就喊出你丢失的 tarantula / snake / scorpion,但确认它在电梯的某个地方。

en: Most people will probably see that this is a joke .
zh: 大多数人会发现这是个笑话。

en: However , if somebody looks seriously alarmed or is starting to panic , let them know that you were not being serious .
zh: 但是,如果有人看上去很惊慌或开始惊慌,请让他们知道你不是认真的。

en: Build in or add something to the elevator .
zh: 把东西装进电梯里或添加到电梯里。

en: For example , build a Lego city in the middle of the elevator .
zh: 例如,在电梯中间建一座 Lego城。

en: Talk to people .
zh: 与人谈谈。

en: When there are a lot of people , say , " You 're probably wondering why I 've gathered you here today . "
zh: 当有许多人的时候, 说, “ 你可能想知道为什么我今天在这里聚集了你. ”

en: So you want to flirt with a guy or gal on MSN , AIM , Facebook Chat , or any other instant messaging service and you do n't want to look like a creep ?
zh: 所以你想在 MSN 、 AIM 、 Facebook Chat 、 或 任何其他即时通讯服务上与一个男人或女孩交情,而你不想看起来像个小丑?

en: Congratulations — by seeking help , you 've already demonstrated more self - awareness than the vast majority of online flirts .
zh: 祝贺 — 通过寻求帮助, 你已经显示出比大多数在线性交者更具自我意识.

en: See Step 1 below to start flirting smartly and respectfully .
zh: 请参见下文第1步,开始巧妙地和尊重地 flirt 。

en: Start the conversation casually .
zh: 随意开始谈话。

en: The hardest part of flirting is to break through your initial reluctance , so if you 're having a hard time taking the plunge , just remind yourself that no matter how badly it goes , it 'll be less stressful than an equivalent real - world encounter .
zh: flirting 最难的部分就是突破你最初的不情愿, 因此如果你有难于冒险, 只要提醒自己,不管事情如何糟糕, 它会比现实生活中的一次相等的遭遇更少压力.

en: if the person you want to talk to does n't want to talk to you , s/he always has the option of simply not responding to your message , as , from your point of view , this is indistinguishable from him or her simply being away from the computer .
zh: 如果你想和某人说话的人不想和你说话,那么他总是有不响应你的讯息的选项,因为从你的角度来看,这与他或她简单地远离电脑是不可区分的。

en: This being said , if you barely know someone , it can be a good idea to have an excuse for starting a conversation to avoid awkwardness .
zh: 既然如此,如果你很少认识某人,那么找个借口开始谈话是很好的办法,以避免尴尬。

en: Asking for help with a work or school - related problem is almost always a good bet , as is asking a question about something striking about the person .
zh: 求助工作或学校有关的问题几乎总是一个好的赌注,就像问某人关于某事引人注目的问题一样。

en: For instance , if the person has a band - related username , you might say : " Hey , cool name . Did you see those guys when they last came to town ? "
zh: 例如, 如果这个人有一个与乐队有关的用户名, 你可以说: “ 嗨, 酷的名字. 你 last came to town 看到那些家伙 吗? ”

en: Start small talk .
zh: 开始小谈吧。

en: After your initial greeting and exchange of pleasantries , you 'll probably want to ask how the person 's doing  .
zh: 在你最初的问候和交流愉快之后,你可能想问一下那个人的情况。

en: Ask him or her about work or school , his / her interests , or any recent trips , for instance .
zh: 问他或她有关工作或学校,他/她兴趣,或最近的旅行,例如。

en: Rather than asking a question , you can also simply offer your comments on these things .
zh: 而不是问一个问题,你也可以简单地就这些事情提出意见。

en: When s/he responds , add your own comments or ask follow - up questions and proceed from there !
zh: 当他回答时, 添加自己的评论或提出后续问题,然后从那里开始!

en: Do n't pry into his or her personal life — keep things light , fun , and focused on worry - free subjects .
zh: 不要打扰他或她的个人生活 — 保持事情轻快 、 有趣, 并专注于无忧无虑的话题.

en: Do n't dwell too long on small talk .
zh: 不要花太多时间在小谈上。

en: For example , after we 've opened up by asking about this person 's interest in the band in his / her username , it 's logical and reasonable to ask about this person 's musical likes and dislikes .
zh: 例如,当我们问这个人对他/她的用户名对乐队感兴趣后,就理智合理地问这个人喜欢和不喜欢的音乐。

en: You can even offer your own opinions and suggestions .
zh: 你甚至可以提供自己的意见和建议。

en: For instance , you might say something like : " If you like those guys , you might want to check out this band called Manic Albatross - they 're like the Beatles , only darker . What sorts of other bands do you like ? "
zh: 例如, 你可以说: “ 如果你喜欢那些家伙, 你可以看看这个叫Manic Albatross的乐队 - 他们就像披头士, 只是更黑暗的. 你喜欢什么样的乐队? ”

en: Everyone likes a good sense of humor .
zh: 每个人都喜欢幽默感。

en: In the immortal words of Marilyn Monroe , " If you can make a woman laugh , you can make her do anything "
zh: 在玛丽莲·梦露的永恒的话里, “ 如果你能让女人笑, 你可以让她做任何事情 ”

en: Try to be playful and even slightly sarcastic as you respond to the statements of the person you 're talking to .
zh: 当你对正在谈话的人的陈述作出反应时,试着玩得开心,甚至有点讽刺。

en: For instance , if you 're asked what you 're up to , rather than saying , " looking for people to hit on on Facebook " you might find that it 's a better idea to give a sarcastic answer like " writing the great American novel " or " drowning my sorrows " .
zh: 例如,如果你被问到你打算做什么, 而不是说, “ 寻找人在Facebook上”你可能会发现, “ 写伟大的美国小说 ” 或“ 淹没我的悲伤 ” 等讽刺的回答是更好的办法。

en: These responses have the added benefit of being natural launching points for conversations about your hobbies , like the writing you 're doing on the side and the great bourbon you tasted the other day .
zh: 这些反应具有自然的启动点的额外好处,用于谈论你的爱好,比如你正在一边写的书和你昨天尝过的大bourbon。

en: In our example conversation , you might work a joke or two into your music - related small talk .
zh: 在我们的实例对话中, 你可能把一个笑话或两个放在你的音乐相关的小谈话中.

en: For instance , you might say something like , " I do n't know why every song on the radio nowadays has a Texas Flynn feature . Does he even have time to record between rehab stints ? "
zh: 比如, 你可以说, “ 我不知道为什么广播上的每首歌都有德克萨斯·弗林特的特色. 他甚至有时间在康复期间录音 吗? ”

en: Simply put , confidence is sexy .
zh: 简单地说,自信是性感的。

en: This is more true for real - life situations than it is online , but this mantra has some truth in the world of IM flirting as well .
zh: 这对于现实生活中的情况比在线更确切,但这个咒语在IM的 flirting世界也有一些道理。

en: For instance , you 'll want to avoid making lots of jokes at your own expense .
zh: 例如, 你要避免在自己的开支制造许多笑话.

en: Just one is plenty — it should n't be a recurring theme throughout your conversation .
zh: 只有一个是足够的 — 它不应该在你的谈话中成为重复的主题。

en: Doing this too often can quickly turn an otherwise flirtatious conversation into one in which you appear needy and self - loathing .
zh: 这样做太频繁,会迅速将另一场调情的谈话变为一种你看起来很需要和自恨的谈话。

en: On the other hand , this is n't to say that you should necessarily make jokes at other people 's expense , as this can make you seem mean and petty .
zh: 另一方面,这并不是说你必须在别人的开支下开玩笑,因为这样会让你显得卑鄙和小调。

en: Any sort of pointed or caustic remarks about yourself or someone else do n't have a place in flirtatious conversations .
zh: 任何关于自己或别人的尖锐或粗鲁的评论都没有在交情的谈话中的地位。

en: People like flirting to be fun .
zh: 人们喜欢花钱来玩耍。

en: For most people , receiving compliments is only fun up to a point — getting more than one or two can make someone feel embarrassed and self - conscious .
zh: 对大多数人来说, 接受赞美只是在某种程度上很有趣 — — 有两个以上的赞美会使人感到尴尬和自知.

en: It can also make him or her question your motives , leading the person to believe that you may be trying to get something out of him or her .
zh: 它也可以使他或她质疑你的动机,使人相信你可能想从他或她身上得到一些东西。

en: Besides , the wooing power of flowery , gushing compliments is diminished  when the compliments are displayed in a tiny box at the bottom of the screen alongside cartoon smiley faces .
zh: 此外,在屏幕底部的一张小盒子里,附着卡通微笑的面孔时,鲜花的柔和力、流畅的赞美效果会有所减弱。

en: Instead of relying too heavily on compliments , instead , focus on having an engaging , genuine conversation .
zh: 不要过于依赖赞美,而是要集中精力进行有意义、真诚的对话。

en: Follow the mantra " show , do n't tell . "
zh: 遵循“ 表演, 别说 ”的咒语.

en: In other words , show that you 're attracted to this person by giving him or her a great conversation , not by stating it outright .
zh: 换句话说, 展示你被这个人吸引的,就是给他或她一个伟大的谈话,而不是直接说出来.

en: Those glowing Mountain Dew videos with peroxide and baking soda are all hoaxes .
zh: 那些带过氧化物和烤苏打的明亮的山露视频都是骗局。

en: If you 're still curious , read on .
zh: 如果你仍然好奇的话,继续阅读。

en: This is fun for anyone and everyone .
zh: 这对任何人都有乐趣。

en: Put on protective glasses .
zh: 戴上防护眼镜。

en: In addition , wear gloves to protect your skin .
zh: 此外,戴手套保护你的皮肤。

en: Throw on some old clothes or put a smock over clothes you want protected .
zh: 把一些旧衣服扔掉,或者把烟雾放在你想要保护的衣服上。

en: Some of this stuff is dangerous -- this experiment is not meant for children !
zh: 有些东西很危险,这个实验不是针对儿童的!

en: Listen up , kids : You 'll be working with a solution that 's near a 12 on the pH scale .
zh: 听着, 孩子们: 你们将用 pH 尺度上接近 12 的溶液工作.

en: Moving on .
zh: 继续前进。

en: Combine 50 milliliters of hydrogen peroxide and a liter of distilled water in a mixing bowl .
zh: 把50毫升的过氧化氢和一升的蒸馏水混合在一个碗里。

en: Use funnels , measuring tubes , and basters to keep everything well - measured and well away from you .
zh: 使用管子 、 测量管子 、 和盆子来保持所有东西均匀的测量和远离你.

en: Hydrogen peroxide is used to replace the luminol 's nitrogen atoms with oxygen .
zh: 氢过氧化物被用来用氧取代氟化物的氮原子。

en: When that happens , all the substances create a rave and start partying and electrons fly everywhere and what results ?
zh: 当这种事发生时,所有的物质会发生狂欢,开始聚会,电子会到处飞来飞去,结果是什么?

en: Mix .2 grams of luminol , 4 grams of sodium carbonate , .4 grams of copper sulfate , .5 grams of ammonium carbonate and 1 liter  of distilled water in a second bowl .
zh: 将0.2毫克的、0.4毫克的钠碳酸盐、0.4毫克的铜硫酸盐、0.5毫克的铵碳酸盐和1升的蒸馏水混合在第二个碗里。

en: Use a funnel to make everything safe and easy .
zh: 使用烟囱,让一切都安全易行。

en: Unfortunately , these hazardous chemicals will not float freely in mid-air like this graphic suggests .
zh: 不幸的是,这些危险的化学品不会像图所示在空气中自由漂浮。

en: Yep , unless you 're a coroner or some sort of crazy spy / criminologist you probably do n't have this stuff lying around the house  .
zh: 是的,除非你是验尸官或某种疯狂的间谍/犯罪学家,否则你可能不会有这些东西在家里。

en: If you 're dead set on starting your own glowstick business  , try websites like Alfa Aesar  or Sigma Aldrich  for supplies .
zh: 如果你已经准备好开始自己的手套业务了,就试试像AlfaAesar或SigmaAldrich这样的网站来采购。

en: Mix everything well .
zh: 把一切都混合得好。

en: Do n't use your hands -- use a metal or plastic utensil of some sort .
zh: 不要用手--使用某种金属或塑料器皿。

en: The last thing you want is other substances interacting with the reactions you 're depending on to make the substances glow .
zh: 最后你想要的是其他物质与你所依赖的反应相互作用,使物质发光。

en: Set the correct lid next to each container .
zh: 在每个容器旁边设置正确的盖子。

en: This enables you to seal the containers quickly after filling .
zh: 这样,您可以在装填后快速密封容器。

en: It 's not like the glow will get up and run away from you , but still .
zh: 光亮不会起来逃离你,但依然如此。

en: Combine equal amounts of the first and second solution in the container and close the bottles .
zh: 将第一和第二溶液在容器中混合并关闭瓶子。

en: Shake them up once the lids are on tightly .
zh: 紧握盖子后,把它们摇起来。

en: If it 's not already glowing , something went wrong .
zh: 如果它还没有发光,就发生了什么问题。

en: Watch as the chemical compound creates a colorful glow .
zh: 观察化学物质产生一种色彩鲜艳的光泽。

en: Take your glowsticks to the party and charge your friends loads of money for them !
zh: 带你的手套到聚会上,并向你的朋友们收取一大笔钱!

en: the glow wo n't last very long .
zh: 光辉不会持续很长时间。

en: The reaction that the luminol and hydrogen peroxide creates does n't last long at all -- maybe a couple of minutes .
zh: 氟化物和氢氧化物所产生的反应根本没有长久,可能只有几分钟。

en: For something that lasts hours , go to the next method  .
zh: 对于持续数小时的事物,请使用下一个方法。

en: From one - liners to classic three - liners to the one - minute gag you tell your friends , a good joke pleases everyone .
zh: 从单线到经典的三线到你告诉朋友的一分钟的笑话, 一个好的笑话令每个人高兴.

en: That is , of course , if you can get a laugh .
zh: 那是当然的,如果你能得到笑声。

en: Telling good jokes is an art that comes naturally to some people , but for others it takes practice and hard work .
zh: 说好笑话是一种自然而然的艺术,但对于其他人来说,它需要实践和艰苦的工作。

en: Know your audience .
zh: 了解你的听众。

en: All aspects of the joke you tell , from the content to the length , need to be suited to your audience .
zh: 从内容到长度,你所讲的笑话的所有方面都必须适合你的听众。

en: What ’s funny to a group of 20 - year old college students may be very different from what makes your 70 - year old - uncle laugh  .
zh: 对20 岁 的大学生来说,有趣的事情可能与你70 岁 的叔叔的笑话完全不同。

en: Everyone ’s an individual , so there are no hard and fast rules .
zh: 每个人都是个人,所以没有严格而快速的规则。

en: But , unless you personally know the members of your audience , here are some good rules of thumb to follow :
zh: 但是,除非你本人知道你的听众的成员,这里有一些好原则要遵循:

en: stay away from misogynist jokes if you ’ve got an audience full of women ;
zh: 如果你的听众满是女人,就别听那些女权主义的笑话;

en: people of a specific ethnic or racial group wo n’t enjoy jokes making fun of their group ;
zh: 某一特定种族或种族群体的人不会喜欢嘲笑自己的群体的笑话;

en: and jokes requiring specialized knowledge  will only be appreciated by people who possess that knowledge .
zh: 那些需要专门知识的笑话只有那些拥有这些知识的人才会欣赏。

en: The more you know about your audience the better you ’ll be able to tailor your jokes to them .
zh: 你越了解你的听众,你就越能为他们定制你的笑话。

en: Choose great material .
zh: 选择好的材料。

en: You can find fodder lots of places — from your life , joke files online , by repurposing jokes you ’ve heard in the past , and so on .
zh: 你可以找到很多地方的饲料 — 从你的生活中,网络的笑话文件,通过重新利用你过去听到的笑话,等等。

en: You may want to start your own joke file .
zh: 你可以开始自己的笑话文件。

en: You can write your jokes down on index cards to keep them handy or use a document file on your computer .
zh: 你可以在索引卡上写下你的笑话,以便使它们方便,或者使用电脑上的文件文件。

en: The latter option may allow for easier revision .
zh: 后一种选项可以使修改更加容易。

en: Decide on a target .
zh: 决定一个目标。

en: Every joke has a “ target , ” which is what the joke is about .
zh: 每个笑话都有一个 “ 目标 ”, 这就是笑话的主题.

en: It ’s important that the joke ’s target  be suited to your audience .
zh: 重要的是,笑话的目标适合你的听众。

en: Make sure it ’s a target your audience will be interested in and something they ’re likely willing to laugh at .
zh: 确保这是你的观众会感兴趣的对象,并且他们可能愿意笑的。

en: For example , husbands are likely to laugh at jokes about wives and vice versa ;
zh: 例如,丈夫可能会嘲笑妻子的笑话,反之亦然;

en: students will typically find jokes about school and teachers humorous .
zh: 学生通常会发现关于学校和教师的笑话幽默。

en: Have a realistic but exaggerated setup .
zh: 具有现实的,但过分的设置。

en: The opening of the joke — or setup — should have a basis in the real world so your audience can relate to it , but it should also include exaggeration because this is what gives a joke its humorous edge .
zh: 笑话的开头 — — 或者设置 — — 应该有真实世界的基础,以便听众能与它联系,但它也应该包括夸张,因为这是让笑话具有幽默的一面。

en: Think of the setup as the foundation of a story .
zh: 把设置当作故事的基础。

en: if you do n’t lay a good foundation here , then the punchline wo n’t make sense to the audience or they wo n’t find it humorous .
zh: 如果你不在此奠定一个良好的基础,那么剧本对观众来说不会有意义,或者他们不会觉得它幽默。

en: Your setup needs to be both realistic and exaggerated in order to be funny —
zh: 你的设置必须是现实的和夸张的,以便是有趣的 —

en: it ’s placing these two incongruous elements side by side that makes the joke funny .
zh: 它把这两个不合时宜的元素放在一起,这使得笑话很有趣。

en: The ending of the joke is obviously crucial .
zh: 笑话的结尾显然是至关重要的。

en: If you want to make the audience laugh , your punchline needs to be surprising .
zh: 如果你想让观众笑起来,你的结局就得令人吃惊。

en: Some jokes also have what is called a tag or topper , which is an additional punchline .
zh: 一些笑话还带有所谓的标签或头衔,这是额外的笑话。

en: The tag builds on the original punchline or twists back on it in a surprising way .
zh: 标签以原来的 punchline为基础,或者以惊人的方式把它扭转。

en: Make the joke your own .
zh: 让笑话成为自己的笑话。

en: Lots of jokes rehash the same ground and sometimes they retell a story countless other jokes have told .
zh: 许多笑话重现同样的道理,有时他们重述了无数其他笑话所讲的故事。

en: For your joke to be funny , it has to surprise the audience in some way , which means it has to seem original or new .
zh: 为了让你的笑话有趣,它必须以某种方式使听众惊奇,这意味着它必须显得原创或新颖。

en: Another option is to dress the joke up as a story about your own life .
zh: 另一种选择是把这个笑话当作你自己的生活的故事。

en: This will make a familiar joke unrecognizable .
zh: 这将使一个熟悉的笑话无法辨认。

en: It may also make it particularly interesting if your audience is your friend .
zh: 如果你的听众是你的朋友,这也会特别有趣。

en: Know your material .
zh: 了解你的材料。

en: Practicing your joke is crucial .
zh: 练习你的笑话是至关重要的。

en: You do n’t need to have it completely memorized — in fact , you " should n’t " memorize it — but you need to be really comfortable with it , so comfortable that you can continue on with telling it even if you get nervous or sidetracked , which is very possible once you ’re in front of an audience .
zh: 你不需要把它完全记住 — — 事实上,你不应该记住它 — — 但你需要真正舒适地使用它,如此舒适,即使你紧张或偏向,你也可以继续说它,这是非常可能的,一旦你站在观众面前。

en: Memorized jokes sound wooden , like they are being read off a script instead of relayed by a friend or entertainer .
zh: 记忆中的笑话听起来像木头一样,像是被朋友或娱乐者转播的,而不是从剧本中读出来。

en: Good jokes have a lot of details and personality , so do n’t be afraid to embellish .
zh: 好的笑话有许多细节和个性,所以不要害怕装饰。

en: Try different things out and see what feels right , what sounds best .
zh: 尝试不同的事物,看看感觉如何,听起来怎么样。

en: Do n’t use a joke until you ’re completely comfortable with it .
zh: 不要用笑话,直到你完全适应它。

en: Try recording your joke on a tape player and playing it back to yourself .
zh: 试着在磁带播放器上录制你的笑话,然后把它重新播放给自己。

en: If you hear a lot of awkward pauses or “ah”s or “um”s , your joke is n’t ready and you need to practice more .
zh: 如果你听到很多尴尬的停顿或“ah”或“um”的话,你的笑话还没准备好,你需要多练习。

en: You can also try practicing in front of a sympathetic friend or family member once you ’re ready for a “ real ” audience .
zh: 当你准备好“真正的”观众时,也可以试着在同情的朋友或家庭成员面前练习。

en: Name your language .
zh: 把你的语言命名。

en: This is the most fundamental property in all languages .
zh: 这是所有语言中最基本的特性。

en: You have many names to choose from .
zh: 你有很多名字可以选择。

en: You can even use a made up word from your made up language like ' Victory ' or ' Great Language ' .
zh: 你甚至可以从你的编造语言中使用一个编造词,如“胜利”或“伟大语言”。

en: The choice is all yours .
zh: 选择完全属于你。

en: Start off with the highly frequently used words such as ' and ' or ' I ' or ' one ' or ' the ' .
zh: 首先使用非常常用的词汇,例如“和”或“我”或“一个”或“这个”。

en: It is recommend that you use short words since they are commonly used .
zh: 建议你使用短语,因为短语是常用的。

en: An example would be ' ant ' for and or ' es ' or even ' loo ' for the word ' and ' .
zh: 一个例子是" ant " for and or " es ",甚至" loo " for the word " and " 。

en: Start thinking about the grammar rules .
zh: 开始思考语法规则。

en: For example if the word Bird is ' Vogelaviatiolap ' then why not make the word Birds ' Vogelaviatiolaps ' since the suffix ' s ' is added at the end for most languages at plurals .
zh: 例如,如果“鸟”字是“ Vogelaviatiolap ”,那么为什么不做“鸟”字“ Vogelaviatiolaps ” 呢,因为大多数语言的末尾加上“ s ” 。

en: If you want to add complication , you can add genders like most European languages like French and German .
zh: 如果你想增加复杂性,你可以添加大多数欧洲语言如法语和德语的性别。

en: For example , if you want the word ' horse ' to be a boy , you may want ' the horse ' to be ' Mat Fereder ' , but a ' cat ' to be a girl , you may want , ' the cat ' to be ' Fet Kamaow ' .
zh: 例如,如果你想让“马”成为一个男孩,你可能想让“马”成为“马匠”,而“猫”成为一个女孩,你可能想让“猫”成为“ Fet Kamaow”。

en: Consider basing your language on an existing language .
zh: 考虑将你的语言建立在现有的语言上。

en: For example , in my made up language , ' Vogelaviatiolap ' means Bird .
zh: 例如,在我编写的语言中, Vogelaviatiolap的意思是鸟。

en: If you have n't guessed , it comes from the following :
zh: 如果你还没有猜到,就从下面来:

en: ' aviatio ' comes from English .
zh: “飞行员”来自英语。

en: It 's uncompleted though , because the word is part of the term ' aviation '
zh: 因为这个词是“航空”一词的一部分,所以没有完成。

en: ' lap ' comes from Onomatopoeia .
zh: ' lap'来自小野matopoeia。

en: It 's a completed term , but it is supposed to come from ' Flap ! '
zh: 这是一个完成的术语, 但它应该来自'拍拍! '

en: Consider basing some of your words from other words you have invented .
zh: 考虑从你发明的其他词汇中提取一些词汇。

en: For example , if you invented the word ' China ' as ' Khinssa ' , ' Drink ' as ' Bever ' , and the word ' Accident ' as ' Casnondelibreaten ' , why not make the word ' tea ' as ' Khincasnonbever ' or ' Bevernondelibreatekin ' or even ' Khinssacasnondelibreatenibever ' !
zh: 例如,如果你发明了“中国”这个词来称作“金萨”,“喝”这个词来称作“酒”,“意外”这个词来称作“ Casnondelibreaten”,那么为什么不把“茶”这个词来称作“金萨”,或者“Bevernondelibreatekin”或者甚至“金萨casnondelibreatenibever”呢!

en: Get inspiration from existing alphabets and words .
zh: 从现有的字母和单词获得灵感。

en: You can even make the whole language not based on the Latin Alphabet at all like Chinese !
zh: 你甚至可以使整个语言完全没有以拉丁字母为基础,就像汉语一样!

en: You can even take some words of languages , altering them or not .
zh: 你甚至可以拿一些语言的单词,改变它们或不改变它们。

en: You can make the word ' pen ' as ' penn ' or even ' pen ' .
zh: 你可以把“笔”用作“笔”或者“笔”。

en: Using the dictionary can ensure you not missing a single word .
zh: 使用词典可以确保您没有错过单词。

en: Remember to write down your creations !
zh: 记住写下你的创造!

en: Use your language .
zh: 使用你的语言。

en: Get used to using it yourself , and spread it to others .
zh: 习惯用它自己,并把它传给别人。

en: Once you feel confident about your language , experiment and expand :
zh: 一旦你对自己的语言感到自信,尝试并扩展:

en: Teach your friends this new language .
zh: 教你的朋友这门新语言。

en: As soon as your friends understand your language , communicate to them with it .
zh: 一旦你的朋友明白你的语言,就用它与他们交流。

en: Be fluent in your own made up language and start spreading this to your friends , family and strangers !
zh: 掌握自己的语言,开始向朋友、家人和陌生人传播!

en: Write your own poem / novel / story with your own made up language .
zh: 用自己的语言写自己的诗歌/小说/故事。

en: If you 're really ambitious , set a goal of helping others become fluent in the language .
zh: 如果你真有野心, 设法帮助别人掌握语言.

en: One day , maybe you can make it the official language of a country !
zh: 有一天, 也许你会成为一个国家的官方语言!

en: Make sure that it is a language that while speaking , you do n't get a literal knot in your tongue !
zh: 确保它是语言,在说话时,你不会在你的舌头上找到一个字形的结!

en: Remember you should know how to write it .
zh: 记住,你应该知道怎么写。

en: Make sure that you and your friend all follow a systematic language system .
zh: 确保您和您的朋友都遵循一个系统化的语言系统。

en: In other words , make sure that you follow the same guidelines .
zh: 换句话说,一定要遵循同样的指导方针。

en: Do n't use random letters .
zh: 不要使用随机字母。

en: It should make some sense , so that it will be easier to learn and speak with [ Example : Do n't use oh as e , hello as llo , and See ya as c yah ) .
zh: 它应该有一点道理, 以便更容易学习和与人交谈. [ 例: 不要用“哦”来表示“e”, “你好”来表示“ló”, “见你”来表示“c yah”.

en: Make sure you practice saying and spelling out many basic words in your language , English examples : is , who , when , of , why , if , what , where , can , may , etc.
zh: 确保你练习说和拼写你的语言中的许多基本单词,英语例子:是, 谁, 什么时候, 为什么, 如果, 什么, 哪里, 可以, 可能, 等等.

en: This will make grammar much easier to make .
zh: 这将使语法变得更加容易。

en: You must avoid simply copying the grammar rules , however , as this would technically turn your language into a code .
zh: 然而,你必须避免简单地抄袭语法规则,因为这将使你的语言变成代码。

en: Practice your language frequently so that you do n't forget it !
zh: 经常练习你的语言,以免忘记它!

en: As a shortcut , and for a bit of interesting background , add connotation to various letters , preferably vowels .
zh: 作为捷径,并为一些有趣的背景,添加各种字母的内涵,最好是母音。

en: To do this , think of various words that begin with / have a lot of a certain vowel .
zh: 为了做到这一点,想想那些开始的词汇/有很多特定的母音。

en: For example : austere , acrimony , ebullient , embolden ; in this case , the vowel A might carry with it a negative meaning , whereas E would be positive .
zh: 例如 : 冷酷 、 愤慨 、 激怒 、 大胆 ; 在这种情况下,母音A可能带有消极的含义,而E则有积极的含义。

en: Then , even if you forget your own words without the help of your dictionary , you could still make a good guess based on the composition of the letters .
zh: 然后,即使你忘记了字典的帮助,你仍然可以根据字母的组成做出正确的推测。

en: Try not to make your words sound like utter and complete gibberish just add a little extra than our regular English language .
zh: 试着不要让你的词语听起来像完全的胡说八道,只是比我们普通英语的词语多一点。

en: We do n't want a knot in your tongue after speaking to your friends .
zh: 我们不想和你的朋友谈话之后,让你的舌头上有个结。

en: Basing letters on objects  is an easy way to start a writing system .
zh: 基于对象的字母是开始写字系统的一个简单的方法。

en: Try this with a group of friends .
zh: 与一群朋友一起尝试一下。

en: It 's much more fun when there are other people that can understand your language .
zh: 当有其他能理解你的语言的人时,这会更有趣。

en: Email or text your friends the language so that they wo n't be so confused .
zh: 给你的朋友发送电子邮件或短信,这样他们就不会太困惑了。

en: When making a writing system , take a break about every five minutes and come back to it or all your letters will begin to look identical .
zh: 当制作写字系统时,每5分钟就休息一次,然后再回到它,否则你的信件就会开始看起来一样。

en: If you want to make other languages , you can use this language as a model and change some letters or sounds to create a different language .
zh: 如果你想制作其他语言,你可以使用这个语言作为模型,并改变一些字母或声音来创建一个不同的语言。

en: This makes your first language a proto-language — a language that branches off into a family of languages .
zh: 这使得你的第一个语言成为一个原始语言 — — 语言分支成一个语言家族。

en: In addition , repelling and removing rodents from your home can be a hassle if you do n't know what you are doing .
zh: 此外,如果你不知道你在做什么,那么从家里驱除和消灭啮齿动物可能是一个麻烦。

en: It can also be dangerous if you use toxic chemicals and poisons .
zh: 如果你使用有毒的化学品和毒物,它也会很危险。

en: It 's a good thing , then , that there are some simple ways to effectively get mice out of your home without the use of toxic chemicals and poisons .
zh: 那么,有几个简单的方法可以有效地使老鼠离开你家,而不使用有毒的化学品和毒物。

en: Keep your home clean .
zh: 保持你的家清洁。

en: Many times mice are drawn into homes on the search for food .
zh: 老鼠在寻找食物时常被拉进家里。

en: If there is nothing to eat , mice will be less likely to stay .
zh: 如果没有东西吃,老鼠就不太可能留下。

en: Keep all food stored properly in airtight containers or in places that are safe from mouse attack .
zh: 把所有食物妥善储存在密封的容器中或安全于老鼠袭击的地方。

en: Peppermint oil is a natural deterrent .
zh: 辣椒油是一种天然的威慑剂。

en: The smell is simply too intense for rodents and they will not try to go near it .
zh: 这种气味对寄生虫来说太强烈,它们不会去接近它。

en: It also helps to mask the scent of any tasty morsels that have been missed when cleaning .
zh: 它还帮助掩盖在清洁时错过的任何美味的面包的香味。

en: You can get peppermint oil in most health food stores and even some major grocery stores .
zh: 你可以在大多数健康食品店和甚至一些主要的杂货店里得到辣椒油。

en: Place a drop or two on a cotton ball .
zh: 把一两滴放在棉球上。

en: Place a cotton ball under or near your garbage can to deter mice from getting into it .
zh: 将棉球放在垃圾桶下面或附近,以阻止老鼠进入垃圾桶。

en: Place the cotton balls in areas where mice are likely to enter your house , by doorways , or heat vents , etc.
zh: 把棉球放在老鼠可能进入你的家的地方, 通过门道, 或热气孔等.

en: Peppermint oil cotton balls need to be replaced after 5 - 7 days , depending upon the quantity of oil you put on it .
zh: Peppermint油棉球需要在5-7天后更换,这取决于你所戴的油量。

en: Try growing peppermint plants near the entryways .
zh: 试着在入口附近种植辣椒。

en: You can use the mint in cooking , as well as it serving a deterrent purpose .
zh: 你可以在烹饪中使用ミン特, 同时它也能起到威慑作用.

en: Use dried snake feces .
zh: 使用干蛇粪便。

en: Visit a local reptile center , zoo , or pet store and ask for some dried snake poo .
zh: 参观当地的爬行动物中心、动物园或宠物店,并询问一些干的蛇粪。

en: You can also sometimes find someone who owns a pet snake .
zh: 有时你也可以找到拥有宠物蛇的人。

en: This will keep mice away .
zh: 这会使老鼠远离。

en: Be sure to keep the feces out of the reach of children and pets .
zh: 一定要把粪便放在孩子们和宠物的 portée之外。

en: There are electronic units sold that emit an ultrasonic beeping sound that rodents hate .
zh: 有电子装置出售,它们发出一种恶虫讨厌的超声蜂鸣声。

en: They should be available at your local home improvement store or online .
zh: 它们应该在您的本地家庭改善商店或网上。

en: These work only on a single line of sight , so you need to know the exact path the mice are taking .
zh: 这些只在单一的视线上工作,所以你需要知道老鼠正在走的准确路径。

en: The units may only work for a short time because mice can become used to them .
zh: 这些单元只能在很短的时间里运行,因为老鼠会习惯它们。

en: Use a commercial , organic deterrent .
zh: 使用一种商业的、有机的威慑剂。

en: Many companies that specialize in organic garden and home products make mice repellents that are better for the environment than traditional poisons .
zh: 许多专门从事有机园艺和家庭产品的公司制造了比传统的毒物更有利于环境的老鼠杀虫剂。

en: Many of these products use natural ingredients , such as peppermint , that are known to be disagreeable to mice .
zh: 许多这些产品使用天然的成分,如胡椒粉,人们知道这些成分对老鼠很不愉快。

en: They will not kill mice but they should keep them out of areas where the product is applied .
zh: 它们不会杀死老鼠,但应该远离产品应用的地区。

en: These products should be available at your local gardening or home improvement center .
zh: 这些产品应该在当地的园艺或家庭改善中心。

en: If you want a specific product , try doing a online search to see where it is available locally .
zh: 如果你想要某一特定产品,尝试进行在线搜索,看看它在哪里可用的地方。

en: Get a cat .
zh: 找一只猫。

en: A house cat can take care of the problem .
zh: 一只家猫能解决这个问题。

en: Cats that spend time outdoors are more likely to hunt to find their own food and may track down that mouse .
zh: 游在户外的猫会更倾向于狩猎寻找自己的食物,并可能追踪老鼠。

en: Just be aware , not all cats have enough energy , interest or training to hunt mice .
zh: 要知道,并非所有的猫都有足够的能量、兴趣或训练来猎老鼠。

en: Kittens typically have to be taught by the mother to easily become a mouser .
zh: 猫一般要由母亲教养,才能轻易成为一只老鼠。

en: Well - food indoor kitties might just see the mouse as a toy , and grow quickly bored of it after scaring it half witless .
zh: 室内的食品店员们可能只是把老鼠看作玩具, 吓坏它后很快就厌倦了.

en: Shelters and adoption agencies often do not know if a cat is a good mouse hunter , and generally do not test for this .
zh: 避难所和收养机构往往不知道一只猫是一只好老鼠猎人,而且一般不会对它进行测试。

en: Sometimes this information is available , but usually not .
zh: 有时这个信息是可用的,但通常不是。

en: While many mousers are great pets as well , not all are .
zh: 虽然许多老鼠都是伟大的宠物,但并非所有都是。

en: " Barn cats " may not be socialized well with humans , although used to hunting mice for food .
zh: “  Barn cats ” 可能与人类不很好相处, 尽管他们习惯于猎老鼠吃东西.

en: Even if you do not have a cat , you can use used kitty litter to deter mice .
zh: 即使你没有一只猫,你也可以用旧的猫 litter来阻止老鼠。

en: Place tubs of used kitty litter around entrances of the house .
zh: 把旧猫粪的桶放在房子的入口处。

en: The mice will sniff the smell of cat urine and clear off in a jiffy .
zh: 老鼠会嗅到猫尿的气味,然后迅速地脱出。

en: If you have a large infestation , a cat may not be enough to totally get rid of it .
zh: 如果你有大规模的感染,一只猫可能不足以完全摆脱它。

en: However , once you eliminate the infestation , a cat will probably prevent reinfestation .
zh: 然而,一旦你消除了感染,一只猫可能会防止再感染。

en: Put your trash cans far from your home .
zh: 把垃圾桶放在远离你家的地方。

en: Mice smell garbage and get attracted to your house .
zh: 老鼠嗅到垃圾,然后被吸引到你的房子里。

en: If you keep the cans away from the house , they are less likely to take up residence in your home .
zh: 如果你把罐子远离房子,那么他们不太可能在你家里居住。

en: Promote the nesting of birds of prey in your yard .
zh: 在你的院子里促进猎物鸟的巢穴。

en: Build a shelter box in your garden to attract some onto your property .
zh: 在你的花园里建造一个避难箱,吸引一些人进入你的财产。

en: This may take some time , but it 's worth the effort if you can attract a wild mouse eater to your yard .
zh: 这可能需要一些时间,但如果你能吸引一只野生老鼠吃东西到你的院子里,这值得努力。

en: Make sure the shelter box has no nails or safety hazards .
zh: 确保避难箱没有钉子或安全危险。

en: However , you might attract other types of owls or birds of prey with your nesting box .
zh: 但是,你可以用你的窝箱吸引其他类型的燕子或猎鸟。

en: Whether you are a working man or just a little cutie trying to stay cute , those overalls are going to need washing sooner or later .
zh: 无论你是个工作的人还是只是个小宝贝,想要保持可爱,这些裤子都得早晚洗。

en: The straps on adults ’ overalls often get so twisted during the wash that one wishes she had just used an old fashioned washboard instead .
zh: 在洗衣服时,成年人的裤子上的带子经常变得如此扭曲,她只希望用旧式洗面板洗衣服。

en: Your appliances are also murder on the straps , which are almost always the first things to wear out on your overalls .
zh: 你的电器也被杀死在带上,这几乎总是第一件事在你的裤子上磨损。

en: This article will show you how to save time and prevent wear , extending the life of your overalls until they are so soft you could wear them to bed .
zh: 本文将向你展示如何节省时间和防止磨损,延长你的 overalls的寿命,直到它们如此柔软,你就可以穿到床上。

en: However , it is okay to wash just a few items with them , like blue jeans .
zh: 不过,可以用它们洗几件东西,比如蓝色牛仔裤。

en: What you do n’t want to wash with them is anything that can get twisted up with the straps , like women ’s long sleeve shirts or kids ’ blankets .
zh: 你不想用它们洗衣服的是任何东西,比如女人的长袖衬衫或儿童的毛毯。

en: Think similar clothing , minus the twisty-ness .
zh: 考虑相似的服装,减去扭曲的。

en: Just do the denim and canvas stuff together .
zh: 只是把布和帆布做在一起。

en: Fasten the straps to the bib .
zh: 把带子绑在车子上。

en: If you did n’t know already , the bib is the top front part with the breast pockets .
zh: 如果你不知道,那只小狗是胸袋的顶部前部。

en: Go ahead and fasten both straps before you wash .
zh: 先把两条带都系好,然后洗好。

en: This will help keep them from twisting up during the wash .
zh: 这有助于防止它们在洗涤过程中变形。

en: Use twist ties to keep the straps fastened .
zh: 使用旋转的领带保持带紧。

en: This step will reapportion years of your life in the long run .
zh: 这一步将重新分配你一生的岁月。

en: Do n’t skip it .
zh: 不要错过。

en: Take the 20 seconds to use a couple twist ties on the fasteners to make sure they do n’t come loose .
zh: 花20秒使用两个旋转的链子,确保它们不会松散。

en: If your washing machine is worth its salt , it will undo those straps in a heartbeat and tie them in a sheet bend unless you prevent it .
zh: 如果你的洗衣机值得它的盐,它会在心跳中把那些带子脱掉,然后把它们绑在一张张纸上,除非你阻止它。

en: All it takes is two twist ties and a few seconds of patience .
zh: 它只需要两个旋转的纽带和几秒的耐心。

en: Overalls have more pockets than pants .
zh: 总的来说,口袋比裤子多。

en: The bib has a wallet pocket and a watch pocket .
zh: 这只小狗有一只钱包和一只表皮。

en: Kids put rocks , candy , and bugs in these .
zh: 孩子们把石头 、 糖果和虫子放在这些.

en: Men put cell phones and small tools in them .
zh: 男人把手机和小工具放在里面。

en: Move the strap adjusters around .
zh: 把腰带调节器移动。

en: You ’ve probably got them just the way you like them , but if you move the adjusters up or down on the straps occasionally , the straps will last longer .
zh: 你可能只是喜欢它们的方式得到它们,但如果你偶尔把调整器移动到带上或下,带就会长得更长。

en: Depending on the adjusters , you may be able to leave them a little loose too .
zh: 取决于调节器,你可能会让它们有点松散。

en: The straps wear out fastest around the adjusters over the course of numerous wash and dry cycles  .
zh: 在无数的洗涤和干燥周期中,带子在调节器周围最快速地磨损。

en: Moving them distributes the wear and tear of washing .
zh: 移动它们会分散洗涤的磨损。

en: You know about rotating your tires , do n't you ?
zh: 你知道轮胎的转动吗?

en: If you wash your overalls alone or in a light load , use about half the detergent called for and less water .
zh: 如果你单独或在轻重的负荷下洗衣服,使用大约一半的洗涤剂和少量的水。

en: This will cut down on some of the racket , but you 're still going to hear them .
zh: 这会减少一些摇滚,但你还是会听到他们的声音。

en: Plastic - type twist ties will hold up in the wash , but may or may not melt in your dryer .
zh: 塑料型旋转链将保持在洗涤中, 但可能或可能不会在干燥器中融化.

en: Use with caution .
zh: 小心使用。

en: How to Pack Your Possessions When Moving
zh: 移动时如何包装你的财产

en: Even if you ca n't wait to live in your new house , curb your enthusiasm and resist the urge to cram all your possessions any which way into boxes .
zh: 即使你不愿意住在新房子里,你也要抑制你的热情,抵制强迫把所有你的东西都压进箱子里。

en: Pack one room at a time if possible , and start with items that are least often used .
zh: 如果可能,一次装一个房间,然后开始用最不经常使用的物品。

en: Write down a list of everything you are packing , in particular if it 's valuable .
zh: 写下你包装的所有东西的清单,特别是如果它有价值的话。

en: Also , take note of which item is in which box .
zh: 同时,请注意哪个项目在哪个盒子里。

en: Use sturdy boxes .
zh: 使用坚固的箱子。

en: Fill the box to the brim and seal the lid .
zh: 把箱子填到边上并盖上盖子。

en: That way , you can easily stack boxes on top of one another .
zh: 这样,你可以轻易地堆叠箱子。

en: Tape the bottom of the box securely so that it does n't give way .
zh: 把箱子底部牢牢地贴上,这样它就不会变形。

en: Never fill a box until it is so heavy that you ca n't lift it safely .
zh: 永远不要填满一个箱子,直到它太重,你不能安全地举起来。

en: Spread the heavy items over a few boxes .
zh: 把重物品散在几盒上。

en: Balance boxes with lighter items like towels or soft toys .
zh: 平衡箱有较轻的物品,如毛巾或软玩具。

en: Pack the lighter items on top .
zh: 把较轻的物品放在上面。

en: Use bubble wrap or newspapers when packing fragile items .
zh: 包装易碎物品时使用泡沫包装或报纸。

en: Clean paper can be purchased cheaply from moving supply stores .
zh: 清洁纸可以从流动的供应店购买便宜。

en: Boxes should be marked " Fragile " and " This side up " to prevent mishandling .
zh: 箱子应标记“ 脆弱 ” 和“ 上边 ” 以防止误处理.

en: Label each box clearly and which room it belongs to .
zh: 清楚地标明每个箱子和它属于哪个房间。

en: Pack a separate box of essentials you may need for the first night at your new house .
zh: 在你新房子的第一天晚上,你可能需要一个单独的必需品盒。

en: Include items like toiletries , toilet paper , bottled water , snacks and a change of clothes in case you can not unpack everything in time .
zh: 包括卫生用品 、 卫生纸 、 瓶装水 、 零食和换衣服,以防你不能及时包装。

en: Do n't label boxes with contents if the contents are valuable .
zh: 如果内容有价值,请不要将内容标记在框上。

en: Instead of writing " Silver Service - Fragile " you should write something that makes it sound less theft inviting while showing the fragile nature of the contents .
zh: 而不是写 “ 银服务 - 脆弱 ”,你应该写一些使它听起来不像盗窃的邀请,同时显示内容的脆弱性。

en: Use lots of it .
zh: 多用。

en: Get masking tape or packing tape and tape screws and other little things that came out of something back against it .
zh: 带子或包装带子和带子螺丝和其他一些小东西从某物反过来。

en: You 'll want to find the right screw reassemble something without having to pick it out of 100 others when you get there .
zh: 当你到达那里时,你就会想找到正确的螺丝重新组装的东西,而不必从其他100个螺丝中挑选它。

en: Do n't pack one box full of books or paperwork - you might not be able to carry it at all .
zh: 不要装满一盒书或文书的箱子——你可能根本无法携带。

en: Fill it halfway with books , and fill it up with lighter stuff .
zh: 半路上填上书,再填上更轻的东西。

en: National superstores  will let you walk the store for boxes when they are stocking the stores between 11 pm and 1 am .
zh: 国家超级市场会在下午11点到上午1点之间在商店里储存箱子时,让你步行进商店。

en: You can find boxes of all sizes .
zh: 你可以找到所有尺寸的盒子。

en: Cereal , diaper and houseware boxes are a good size and durable .
zh: 谷物 、 尿布和家用用品盒的尺寸好,耐用.

en: Just take a cart and roam the store .
zh: 只要坐车去逛商店。

en: They do check the cart as you leave so do n't try to sneak anything past them .
zh: 你离开时,他们会检查你的车子,所以别想偷偷溜过去。

en: U-haul and other nation companies offer box buy back services .
zh: U-haul和其他国家公司提供复购箱服务。

en: If you buy too many boxes you can return the unused for a full refund .
zh: 如果您购买太多的箱子,您可以退回未使用的全部退款。

en: These boxes are also quite sturdy so you can re-use them or stash in your attic until you move again .
zh: 这些箱子也很坚固,所以你可以再使用它们或在阁楼里储存它们,直到你再次移动。

en: Some national companies even offer free shipping and handling so you can have some delivered or go to the local location .
zh: 一些国家公司甚至提供免费的运送和处理,这样你就可以得到一些运送或去当地的地点。

en: Fill empty spaces with additional paper .
zh: 用额外的纸张填空空间。

en: Throw away or donate junk you do n't want to take to your new place .
zh: 扔掉或捐赠你不想带到新的地方的垃圾。

en: Set aside an area of the house where you can put all the packed boxes .
zh: 把房子的一块地方放在一边,你可以把所有的包装箱放进去。

en: Use a room that is n't used every day such as the formal dining or living room .
zh: 使用非日常使用的房间,如正式的餐厅或客厅。

en: You wo n't be tripping over boxes and you can have a better idea of what you have and where things are .
zh: 你不会越过盒子越过,你就能更好地了解你所拥有的东西和物体的所在。

en: Pack books and heavy items into smaller boxes .
zh: 把书和重物包装成较小的箱子。

en: Digital Photos - use your camera to document the contents of boxes .
zh: 数字照片 - 使用您的相机记录箱子的内容.

en: While skydiving , it is possible  that both your primary and reserve parachutes will malfunction , leaving you with no method of reducing your velocity .
zh: 在跳伞时,你的主降落伞和备用降落伞可能会失效,因此你无法减少速度。

en: In the vast majority of cases , this will not occur ; nevertheless , in this event these coping strategies may assist .
zh: 在绝大多数情况下,这不会发生;然而,在这种情况下,这些应对策略可以帮助。

en: Remain calm .
zh: 保持镇定。

en: This may seem obvious , but deep , even breathing  and controlling your heart - rate are essential to your continued survival .
zh: 这可能显得很明显, 但 深呼吸和控制你的心跳对于你的持续生存至关重要.

en: Entreat assistance .
zh: 提供援助。

en: If both your primary and reserve chutes have malfunctioned , signal immediately to a fellow jumper who has not yet deployed their chute , waving your arms and signalling that your own is not functional .
zh: 如果你的初级和备用滑翔机都故障了,立即向尚未部署滑翔机的其他滑翔者发出信号,挥手示意你自己的滑翔机不正常。

en: If this is a solo jump , then skip to step 6 .
zh: 如果这是独跳,那么跳到第6步。

en: Prepare for deployment .
zh: 准备部署。

en: After linking arms with your fellow jumper , you will need to hook your arms through their chest strap , or through both sides of the front of their harness , as far as you can , then grab onto your own strap .
zh: 将手臂与你的搭档跳跃者联系起来后,你需要通过他们的胸带,或通过他们的护栏的前两边,尽可能,然后抓住自己的胸带。

en: Deploy .
zh: 部署。

en: The shock of the chute deployment will be intense .
zh: 跳伞部署的冲击会很强烈。

en: The G - forces will multiply your body weight , making it impossible to hold on ; this is why hooking your arms through the harness is essential .
zh: G - 力量将使你的体重增加, 使你无法保持; 这就是为什么通过绳索锁住你的手臂是必不可少的.

en: It is likely that the shock will dislocate or break both your arms ; nevertheless this is a small price to pay for your life .
zh: 很有可能你的双臂被震动移动或断裂,但这是你一生付出的很小代价。

en: If your companion 's canopy has successfully opened , then both your chances of survival have dramatically increased .
zh: 如果你的同伴的天花板已经成功打开,那么你的生存机会都大大增加了。

en: The canopy must be steered away from power lines and similar obstructions ; try for a large body of water if you are confident your companion can save you from drowning .
zh: 天花板必须远离电线和类似的障碍;如果你确信你的同伴可以拯救你免于溺水,就试着寻找大量的水。

en: If this is a solo jump , which constitutes the minority of skydivers , your only recourse is to ensure that at least one of your own chutes opens .
zh: 如果这是单人跳伞,这是少数的跳伞者,你唯一的办法是确保至少一个自己的跳伞打开。

en: In this case , the excellent advice offered by your instructors on assisting chute opening may be of assistance to you .
zh: 在这种情况下,指导员在帮助跳伞打开方面所提供的很好的建议可能会对你有所帮助。

en: If it becomes apparent that you can not open either of your two parachutes , or that for some other reason they are fatally non-functional , then the following steps may be of some minor assistance .
zh: 如果你发现你不能打开两架降落伞,或者其他原因导致它们致命失效,那么下面的步骤可以提供一些小帮助。

en: Appeal .
zh: 上诉。

en: If you are of a religious turn of mind , you may wish at this point to offer a prayer to a god , goddess , protective spirit or guardian angel .
zh: 如果你有宗教信仰,你可以在此点向一个神、女神、保护灵或守护天使祈祷。

en: St Jude , the patron saint of Lost Causes , comes to mind .
zh: 圣朱德是遗失原因的守护神。

en: Objectively , this is not likely to help very much ; but it may improve your emotional state .
zh: 客观上来说,这不太可能帮助你;但它可能改善你的情绪状态。

en: If you do not have any religious beliefs , or are for another reason unwilling to appeal to your patron deity , skip this step .
zh: 如果你没有任何宗教信仰,或者由于其他原因不愿向你的守护神求助,请跳过这个步骤。

en: As you approach the Earth at , or close to , terminal velocity , you may wish to contemplate your past existence , and the possibility of a future afterlife .
zh: 当你接近地球时,或接近地球的终极速度时,你可能想考虑一下你过去的存在,以及未来的后生的可能性。

en: A strategy that might prove helpful is to consider how fortunate you are that life has been good to you so far .
zh: 一个可以证明有帮助的策略是考虑你有多幸运,因为迄今为止,生活对你来说都是好的。

en: Alternatively , if life has not been good to you so far ,  consider how lucky you are that it will not be troubling you much longer .
zh: 或者,如果生活对你来说一直不好,考虑一下你有多幸运,它不会让你更难过。

en: Expect impact .
zh: 期望撞击。

en: You are unlikely to have the time or ability to aim for a soft landing - spot , body of water , or other impact site that might improve your chances of survival .
zh: 你不太可能有时间或能力瞄准一个软着陆点、水体或其他可能改善你的生存机会的撞击地点。

en: Some humans who have , for various reasons , become aware of their impending death , develop psychological coping strategies to deal with this ; for instance , the Kubler - Ross phases of grief .
zh: 一些人由于各种原因, 意识到即将死去, 发展心理应对策略来处理这一问题; 例如, 库布勒 - 罗斯的悲伤阶段.

en: Since your own death approaches far more quickly , this is unlikely to be of any use to you .
zh: 因为你自己的死亡比以前快得多,所以这不太可能对你有用。

en: Water landings : if you have successfully attached to a companion whose chute opens , keep in mind that both your arms may be broken or dislocated , and you may be unable to swim or tread water before your chute fills and drags you under .
zh: 水上降落:如果你成功地附着一个搭档,他的跳伞打开,请记住,你的两只胳膊可能会折断或移动,你可能无法在跳伞填满并拖下你之前游泳或游水。

en: If , after total chute failure , you land on something soft , it is possible that instead of being killed outright , you may be permanently paralyzed due to spinal injury .
zh: 如果,在完全跳伞失败后,你落在软体上,有可能因为脊椎损伤而永久瘫痪,而不是直接死亡。

en: If you have a strong aversion to this outcome , aiming head - downward before impact in the manner of an Olympic diver may ensure the destruction of your cranium and your immediate demise .
zh: 如果你对这一结果有强烈的厌恶, 将头朝下瞄准,然后以奥运潜水员的方式撞击,可能会使你的颅骨毁坏,并立即死亡.

en: If you 're a chronic procrastinator , you know the pain and stress that comes with putting things off .
zh: 如果你是一个长期拖延的人,你知道拖延事情带来的痛苦和压力。

en: Although you may have the desire to accomplish something , getting the motivation to do it is a different matter .
zh: 尽管你可能有实现某事的愿望,但 getting the motivation to do it is a different matter。

en: Fortunately , overcoming your procrastination is easy to do when you put your mind to it .
zh: 幸运的是,当你把注意力放在这件事上时,克服拖延是很容易的。

en: Side note : If you have anything due right now , and you have n't finished it , leave this article and complete that work .
zh: 对 side note 的注意: 如果你现在有问题,你还没有完成,请离开这篇文章,完成这项工作。

en: Yes , make yourself an old fashioned to - do list with check boxes and everything .
zh: 是的, 自己做个老式 的 做 清单,用检查框和所有东西.

en: List everything , big and small , that you have to do for your entire day ; break big activities into smaller bits if necessary .
zh: 列出你整天必须做的一切,大和小;必要时把大活动分成小部分。

en: Then , as you work through your day , check off each of the items on your list .
zh: 然后,当你工作一天时,检查一下你的清单上的每个项目。

en: You will feel a growing sense of pride as you visually monitor your ever - diminishing list of projects .
zh: 当你在视觉上监视你的不断减少的项目清单时,你会感到越来越自豪。

en: Focus your list on including the things you typically put off , not the things you are sure to do on a regular basis .
zh: 把你的清单集中放在你通常推迟的事情上,而不是你确定要经常做的事情上。

en: If necessary , set time - frames for your items to be done by .
zh: 必要时, 为你的项目设置时间框架以完成.

en: Re-evaluate your list halfway through your day to rank your items based on highest priority .
zh: 重新评估你的清单在你的一天中一半,根据最高优先次序排序你的项目。

en: Then , tackle the most important ones before looking back at the smaller things to do .
zh: 然后,对最重要的事情进行处理,然后再回顾一些小事情做。

en: Keep a notebook by hand before you start your workday .
zh: 在开始工作之前,要手提笔记本。

en: Write every thought down that comes up during work .
zh: 写下工作中出现的一切想法。

en: Do n't do it , put it on a list and do it later .
zh: 不要这样做,把它放在清单上,然后再去做。

en: This prevents you from getting into the " procrastination zone . "
zh: 这阻止你进入“ 拖延区 ”.

en: Finish the hard stuff .
zh: 把这件硬事做完。

en: When you have a looming project that 's bogging you down and making you unproductive in other areas , tackle it first .
zh: 当你有一个迫在眉睫的项目,它使你陷入困境,使你无法在其他领域产生成果时,首先应付它。

en: Finishing the largest item on your list of things to do will make you feel extra productive and give you the boost to do other things you ’ve been pushing to the side .
zh: 完成你所要做的事情清单上最大的项目会让你觉得更有效率,并给你带来其他事情的动力。

en: If your “ big project ” is something that ca n’t be done in one sitting , make a list of small parts of it that you can accomplish today .
zh: 如果你的“大项目”是不能在一个会议上完成的事情,那么请列出你今天能完成的小部分。

en: Do n’t worry about completing the entire thing , but take steps now so that doing so in the future is a breeze .
zh: 不要担心完成整个事情,但现在采取步骤,以便在将来这样做是件小事。

en: Make an ultimate to - do list for this single project , and have it placed somewhere you will see it on a regular basis .
zh: 为这个单一项目做最后的任务列表, 并把它放在你将经常看到的地方.

en: As you mark things off , you will be motivated to continue doing so , and seeing it on a regular basis will remind you that your project needs to be done .
zh: 当你把事情记下来时,你会有动力继续这样做,并且经常看到它会提醒你,你的项目需要完成。

en: Do two - minute tasks .
zh: 做两分钟的任务.

en: Whenever you are presented with something that you do n’t want to do or would consider putting off , ask yourself , “ will this take me less than two minutes to finish ? ”
zh: 当你遇到你不想做或想推迟的事时,就问自己: “ 这需要我花不到两分钟才能完成 吗? ”

en: For many of us , this includes small chores , like taking out the trash or pulling a few weeds , but can include simple tasks in all areas of life .
zh: 对许多人来说,这包括一些小事,比如去除垃圾或拔掉一些杂草,但它可以包括生活的所有领域中简单的任务。

en: Anything that you want to put off but takes two minutes to do - do it .
zh: 你想拖延的任何事情,但要花两分钟去做 - 做它.

en: Simply force yourself to use the next 120 seconds to be productive and do the duty you normally would push off for hours or days .  .
zh: 简单地迫使自己利用接下来的120秒来生产,并完成你通常要推迟的任务,数小时或几天。

en: Create a timed work frenzy .
zh: 创造一个按时工作狂热。

en: If you find yourself being pulled off into the depths of daydreams , set a period of time to do nothing but work .
zh: 如果你发现自己被拉进梦境的深处,就设定一个时间来做除了工作之外的任何事情。

en: Take ten minutes and remove all distractions - your phone , magazines , or thoughts of your attractive love - and go into a working frenzy .
zh: 花十分钟去消除一切干扰——你的电话 、 杂志 、 或关于你的魅力的爱情的思念——然后进入工作狂热之中.

en: Chances are , you ’ll get into a groove and keep working at a high pace even when your frenzy time is out .
zh: 很有可能,即使你的疯狂时间已经过去了,你也会进入一个沟里并继续以高的速度工作。

en: Working with a timer is generally regarded by most experts as being one of the best ways to develop self - discipline and stop procrastination .
zh: 大多数专家普遍认为使用计时器是发展自我 纪律和停止拖延的最佳方法之一。

en: Each task is then assigned an exact amount of time to complete .
zh: 每个任务需要花费一定时间完成。

en: If you do n't finish the task in the allotted time , then you move on to the next one .
zh: 如果你不能在分配的时间完成任务,那么你就会继续到下一个任务。

en: Using this work arrangement , it forces you to take action , as you ca n't afford to waste any time .  .
zh: 使用这种工作安排,它迫使你采取行动,因为你不能浪费任何时间。

en: Give yourself a break .
zh: 休息一下。

en: If you ca n’t seem to focus and are working half - heartedly at your tasks , give yourself a brief break .
zh: 如果你似乎没有集中精力,并且在做任务时心不在焉,请自己休息一下。

en: Set a timer for ten minutes , and take a nap , read a book , or call your friend .
zh: 设定一个时间表十分钟,然后睡一觉,读一本书,或者打电话给朋友。

en: Do whatever it is you ’ve been daydreaming about so that the temptation is removed once you get back to work .
zh: 做你想做的事吧,这样一旦你回到工作岗位上,诱惑就消除了。

en: Just be sure to follow through with your deadline rather than ignoring it when your alarm finally goes off .
zh: 一定要遵守你的最后期限,而不是在你的警报最后响时忽略它。

en: In the Harry Potter series written by JK Rowling the main wizarding sport is Quidditch .
zh: 哈里·波特系列由 JK Rowling 编写,主要的巫术运动是 Quidditch 。

en: However you do n't have to have magical powers to play .
zh: 但是你不必有魔力来玩。

en: There are many different ways of playing Quidditch , but the most commonly used set of rules are those given by the International Quidditch Association  .
zh: 克维迪奇有许多不同的游戏方式,但最常用的规则是国际克维迪奇协会提供的。

en: In the past Muggle Quidditch has mainly been played at colleges in the US , but over the last few years there has been a dramatic rise in the number of community teams .
zh: 在过去,Muggle Quidditch主要是在美国的大学上进行的,但在过去几年中,社区球队的数量发生了剧烈的增长。

en: Quidditch has also spread outside of America and is now played on 5 continents .
zh: Quidditch也在美国以外传播,现在在5个大陆上进行比赛。

en: Gather all needed materials and players  .
zh: 收集所有必需的材料和玩家。

en: Know that all players can play while riding a broom .
zh: 知道所有玩家在骑扫帚时都可以玩。

en: Brooms can be a hindrance however , so feel free to not use brooms .
zh: 扫帚是障碍,所以不要使用扫帚。

en: Place the quaffle and three bludgers in the middle of the field .
zh: 把夸夫和三块牌放在田中。

en: Ideally the quaffle and bludgers should be slightly deflated so that they are easier to throw and catch .
zh: 理想情况下,夸夫尔和布尔德格尔应该稍微放宽,以便更容易投掷和捕获。

en: Start the game .
zh: 开始游戏。

en: Both teams start from the edges and attempt to obtain the quaffle and bludgers .
zh: 两队都从边缘开始,试图获得夸夫尔和布鲁杰尔。

en: Follow your duty depending what type of player you are :
zh: 依你是什么类型的球员而完成你的职责:

en: Chasers try to score by throwing the quaffle into one of the three goal hoops .
zh: 裁判试图通过投掷夸夫尔进入三个球圈中的一个球得分。

en: Each score is worth 10 points .
zh: 每个分数都值10分。

en: Beaters try to peg players with their bludger .
zh: 打者们试图用他们的投球机扣住球员。

en: If a player is pegged they have to stop what they 're doing and pay a penalty ; i.e.  and run back to and touch their goal post or alternatively sit down for 10 seconds .
zh: 如果一个球员被扣住,他们必须停止他们正在做的事,并支付罚金;即跑回并触摸他们的球柱,或者 alternatively坐下来10秒。

en: Keepers guard the goal posts at each end and attempt to block chasers ' attempts at scoring .
zh: 守门员在每一端都守门,并设法阻止追击者的得分尝试。

en: If Keeper is close to their hoops they are safe from being hit by bludgers .
zh: 如果守门员靠近他们的 hoops,他们就不会被布鲁杰尔击中。

en: Seekers try to tackle the snitch  or obtain an object attached to the snitch such as a sock or flag .
zh: 求职者尝试去解决缝纫或获得附着缝纫的物体,如袜子或旗帜。

en: You can establish you own rules as to how a player catches the snitch .
zh: 你可以建立自己的规则,说明一个球员如何抓到网球。

en: Then the seekers search for the snitch , and attempt to tag the player .
zh: 然后,搜寻者寻找刺刀,并试图标记玩家。

en: Other methods , such as the method adopted in 2005 , makes the snitch a tennis ball in a sock , hanging out of the running shorts of the snitch runner .
zh: 其他方法,如2005年采用的方法,使Snitch在袜子里成为网球,挂在Snitch运动员跑短裤上。

en: Regardless of method , the winning seeker wins 30 points for his or her team , unlike the books , in which the snitch is worth 150 points .
zh: 无论方法如何,胜者为球队赢得30分,与书本不同,在书中划分值150分。

en: The creators of Muggle Quidditch thought that it was worth too many points so changed the value of the snitch for muggle Quidditch .
zh: Muggle Quidditch的创造者认为它值得太多的分数,因此改变了Muggle Quidditch的剪裁的价值。

en: The referee should ensure that rules are being followed .
zh: 仲裁员应确保规则得到遵守。

en: They also keep track of the score .
zh: 他们也跟踪成绩。

en: The object of the game is to score the most points and the game ends when the seeker snatches the snitch .
zh: 比赛的目标是获得最多分,当寻找者抢夺了分数时,比赛结束。

en: Feel free to alter the game rules .
zh: 你可以随意修改游戏规则。

en: See the Tips section for suggestions .
zh: 请参阅建议的提示部分。

en: You do n't need flying broomsticks or magic balls to play this version of the game - it 's tailor - made for muggles like us .
zh: 你不需要飞的扫帚或魔球来玩这个版本的游戏 - 它是定制的 - 为像我们一样的混蛋做的.

en: This video shows a more realistic approach to playing Quidditch .
zh: 这个视频显示了一个更现实的方法来玩 Quidditch.

en: Alternatively the snitch can be a small yellow ball  that is hidden before the game starts by a bystander or referee .
zh: 或者,一个小黄色的球可以被旁观者或裁判隐藏在比赛开始前。

en: Establish boundaries and have the seekers look for the snitch .
zh: 建立界限,让寻求者寻找刺刀。

en: Beaters can try hitting the bludgers around in the air with a shortened hockey sticks or a short bat .
zh: 打者可以尝试用短棍或短棍在空中击球。

en: They could also use regular - length hockey sticks to hit bludgers  on the ground .
zh: 他们还可以使用常规长棍球来击球.

en: It may be easier to play without brooms  .
zh: 没有扫帚可以玩得更轻松。

en: Remember that the snitch runner , if you choose to use one , is not an actual player in the game , therefore , not bound by any of the rules .
zh: 记住,如果你选择使用一个,那是一个在游戏中的实际球员,因此,不受任何规则的约束。

en: If desired , the snitch is able to do whatever he or she wants to avoid capture .
zh: 如果想的话,刺客可以做任何事情来避免被捕。

en: See How to Be a Snitch in Quidditch for more information .
zh: 更多信息,请参阅如何成为一个Snitch在Quidditch。

en: You can play water quidditch in a pool .
zh: 你可以在游泳池里玩水 quidditch。

en: Almost all the same rules apply .
zh: 几乎所有的规则都适用。

en: Have someone throw something  on a line into the pool at regular intervals .
zh: 有谁定期在池塘里乱扔一些东西。

en: They can even use fake snitches .
zh: 他们甚至可以使用假针织物。

en: You can buy authentic looking brooms to make the game more realistic .
zh: 你可以买 autentic看起来的扫帚,使游戏更加现实。

en: There is a very large Quidditch community , have a look at the IQA website to find teams near you .
zh: 这里有一个非常大的Quidditch社区,看看IQA网站,找到你附近的球队。

en: One variation is Quarter Snitch Quidditch .
zh: 其中一个变种是四分之一的Snitch Quidditch。

en: Find a quarter or another small coin .
zh: 找一个四分之一或另一个小硬币。

en: Have both of the teams turn around and have the referee throw it into the grass or pitch while the teams are n't looking .
zh: 让两个球队转过身来,让裁判把球扔到草地或球场上,而球队却不看。

en: Play while the seekers look for the snitch .
zh: 玩 while the seekers look for the snitch 。

en: Another variation is where the referee places the snitch somewhere in the field  .
zh: 另一个变异是裁判在场地的某个地方放球。

en: The seeker has to find the snitch blindfolded , relying only on the coach 's instructions , while the game is still on .
zh: 求职者必须在比赛仍在进行时,只依靠教练的指示,找到扣球的盲人。

en: Stay hydrated and exercise wisely .
zh: 保持适度水分,并明智地锻炼。

en: A ball flying in the air can hurt .
zh: 一个在空中飞行的球会受伤。

en: If you 're playing quidditch you 're probably just having fun so play nicely .
zh: 如果你正在玩Puntditch,你可能只是玩得很开心,所以玩得很好。

en: Quinoa is known as the little rice of Peru .
zh: 奎诺亚被称为秘鲁的小米。

en: The Incas treated the crop as sacred and referred to quinoa as " chisaya mama " or " mother of all grains . "
zh: 印加人把这种作物当作神圣,把奎诺亚称为“ 千代妈妈 ” 或“ 所有谷物的母亲 ” 。

en: Quinoa is rich in protein and much lighter than other grains .
zh: 奎诺是富含蛋白质的,比其他谷物要轻得多。

en: It is much easier to prepare than rice and is rapidly gaining in popularity , especially among vegetarians who value its high protein levels .
zh: 它比稻米更容易作饭,尤其在高蛋白质素的素食者中非常受欢迎。

en: Rinse the grains of quinoa in water .
zh: 把昆士忌的谷物倒入水里。

en: You can skip this step if you have purchased pre-rinsed quinoa in a box .
zh: 如果您已经在一箱中购买了预先浸泡的奎诺,您可以跳过这个步骤。

en: Toast quinoa in a saucepan  .
zh: 在锅里烤昆士忌。

en: Add the quinoa and cook for about 1 minute .
zh: 加入昆士忌,煮大约1分钟。

en: This brings out quinoa 's nutty flavor .
zh: 这就带来了奎诺的坚果味。

en: Place two parts water or stock to one part of quinoa in a saucepan over medium - high heat and bring to a boil .
zh: 将两部分水或罐头放在一部分昆士忌的 saucepan 中加热,使它沸腾。

en: Cover and reduce heat to low .
zh: 盖住并降低热量到低。

en: Try to ensure there is an al dente bite to the germ , in the same way as pasta .
zh: 设法确保细菌有咬伤,就像面包一样。

en: Quinoa will continue cooking for a bit even after you take it off the heat .
zh: 奎诺亚会继续做点饭,即使你把它从热中取下来。

en: Take the quinoa off the heat and let stand , covered , for 5 minutes .
zh: 把昆士忌从热中取出来,让它站起来,盖住,5分钟。

en: This will give it time to absorb any moisture that might still be in the pan .
zh: 这将使它有时间吸收可能仍留在锅里的任何水分。

en: Uncover and fluff with a fork .
zh: 用叉子揭开和擦拭。

en: The quinoa should look light and fluffy , and you should be able to see the germ separating from the seed .
zh: 基诺亚应该看起来光滑,而且你应该能够看到细菌从种子中分离。

en: Serve .
zh: 服役。

en: Freshly cooked quinoa should be served immediately to retain nutritional value and a good flavor .
zh: 新鲜煮的昆士忌应立即提供,以保持营养价值和味道。

en: Rinse 1 cup of quinoa in a fine mesh sieve under cold water .
zh: 在冷水下洗一杯清菜。

en: If you bought packaged quinoa , this step is n't always necessary , but it 's better to be safe than sorry .
zh: 如果你购买了包装的Quinoa,这个步骤并不总是必要的,但最好安全而不是抱歉。

en: Pour quinoa into rice cooker .
zh: 将奎诺浸入米锅里。

en: See Step # 2 in Method One above for directions .
zh: 参见上文方法一第2步的指示。

en: Add 2 cups of liquid and 1/2 teaspoon of salt into the rice cooker .
zh: 将2杯液体和1/2杯盐放入米锅里。

en: Cook for approximately 15 minutes .
zh: 煮大约15分钟。

en: Some rice cooker will have different settings instead of a simple " cook " option .
zh: 有些炊飯器會有不同的設定,而不是一個簡單的 " cook " 選擇。

en: Try the " white rice " option if your rice cooker gives you several options .
zh: 如果您的饭锅给你一些选择,请尝试“白米”选项。

en: Let stand for about 5 minutes .
zh: 等约5分钟。

en: Fluff with a fork and serve .
zh: 用叉子吹风,服务。

en: Preheat oven to 350 ° F  .
zh: 预热烤箱至350°F。

en: Arrange rack in the middle of the oven .
zh: 把架子放在烤箱的中间。

en: Add onions , peppers , mushrooms , or any other type of desired vegetable or herb into the saucepan  .
zh: 加入洋葱 、 胡椒 、 蘑菇或任何其他类型的蔬菜或草料到锅里.

en: Sweat the peppers or vegetables along with the onions .
zh: 将辣椒或蔬菜和洋葱一起吞下去。

en: Add the quinoa and salt to the saucepan , stirring until completely incorporated .
zh: 加入昆士忌和盐,搅拌至完全加入。

en: This should take no longer than 30 seconds .
zh: 这应该花不到30秒。

en: Add one cup of broth and one cup of water to the saucepan and bring to a boil over medium high heat .
zh: 将一杯汤和一杯水加入锅里,在中等高温下煮沸。

en: Once a boil is reached , transfer quinoa to a 8 - by - 8 - inch baking dish .
zh: 一旦沸腾, 把奎诺亚转移到一个8英寸的烤盘上.

en: Spread out quinoa evenly and cover baking dish completely with aluminum foil .
zh: 均匀地散布奎诺,用铝箔完全覆盖面包。

en: Remove the aluminum foil from the baking dish , add cheese or other seasonings , and bake for an additional 5 minutes .
zh: 把铝箔从烤盘中移开,加入奶酪或其他调味料,再烤5分钟。

en: Making Skittles vodka is a fun way to add a splash of fruity flavor and color to regular vodka .
zh: 泡泡 vodka是添加水果味和颜色的流水的有趣的方法。

en: All you need to do is place your favorite combination of Skittles candies into a glass or bottle of vodka and wait for it to infuse .
zh: 你只需要把你最喜欢的Skittles糖果组合放在一杯或一瓶伏特加里,然后等待它注入。

en: You can then use your Skittles vodka to make brightly - colored cocktails or even serve it as a sugary shot !
zh: 然后你可以使用你的Skittles vodka来制作鲜艳的鸡尾酒,甚至作为糖果的 shot!
